title: Great Hotel - should increase security
text:
The staff was great, very friendly.  Just a suggestion, I would feel safer if
the lobby door was locked after 11:00 p.m.. and you needed your key to enter the building.  Same for Elevators, I think you should have to use your key to take the elevator.  Other than that, the Hotel was awesome.

title: Beautiful rooms
text: I loved staying here.  The rooms were super cute and beautiful.  Very artsy and the bed was soooooo comfortable.  Gym downstairs and restaurant/bar.  I know the area very well but i just wanted to relax and stay at a fun hotel.  I hope to go again soon.

title: Keep coming back
text: Excellent pillows, the restaurant is lovely and the food is delicious.  The pastries looked great, but were too sweet for my taste.  I wish they would put in a filtered water station instead of putting water bottles in the room.  I brought my own but had to go down to the gym to fill it up.  We've stayed here a few times, love it and the location.

title: Cool hotel in the middle of Soho
text:
Stylish hotel in the middle of Soho. Room with 08 at the end with a great view of the Empire State. Clean and with an attached restaurant. Cool crowd. Continental breakfast e.g. café latte and croissant for $12.
Reception staff very nice. All special requests fulfilled.

title: Would love a better front desk staff
text: I believe the front desk staff should be more friendly and willing to assist in resolving your issues. The hotel is very well-located and beautiful. I will return, but you definitely need to check on the front desk staff. I hope that the money on hold is returned promptly and correctly. I was left worried since the girl who attended to me was rude.

title: SOHO GREAT EXPERIENCE
text: The hotel is very good. The very connected area. The rooms on the upper floors have beautiful views. The reception staff was very friendly and speaks Spanish. They received packages free of charge. The cleanliness, the shower and the beds were very good. On the ground floor they give you water. I would add some glasses to the pieces to drink water. They offer airport transfer at a good rate.

title: Very nice and comfortable hotel
text:
Very nice hotel, very helpful staff, in soho, next to all soho attractions 
Recommended 
We had 5 nights and enjoyed  
The double bed room is a bit small, no coffe in the rooms, but coffe is available in the lobby at mornings 
If you need a refrigerator, you have to ask for

title: Excellent, across the board
text: The room was terrific (including an amazing view).  The service was wonderful—the staff were helpful and pleasant.  The food and drinks were excellent.  What more could you ask for?  We are definitely going to stay here the next time we are in town.

title: The perfect location for the perfect hotel
text: Loved this hotel! Great service. Clean. Good food. The staff was exceptionally kind & lovely. Location was perfect near lovely shops and restaurants. Rooms were a decent size and bed very comfy. Will definitely be staying here again on our next trip to NYC!

title: Needing a little love
text: This hotel is unique and lovely. Very peaceful blue and white rooms offer a sense of calm. Having stayed before I was looking forward to the well appointed luxuries in the little white aerie with beautiful city views. Room, decoration all the same. But oddly the minibar/fridge, snacks, bottle opener, GLASSES, were all missing. So how does one drink sparkling water from a liter bottle? Hotel felt a little tired like management couldn’t get to painting the hallway or making sure the carpet was vacuumed. There is a competitive downtown hotel market; NOMO needs to invest to stay competitive.

title: Amazing location
text: The location its Amazing! The people at the Front desk not so nice, maybe because of the policies they have to follow, they where tired of the people wanting to make checkinn before 3pm and they asked for a fee to do a 12:00 checkinn where in other hotels you get it if its available, (no extra costs for the hotel and for the guests)

title: LOVE THIS HOTEL!
text: AMAZING HOTEL ! GREAT ROOM! GREAT STAFF! GREAT LOCATION! Would definitely rebook and recommend to friends! Gorgeous interior architecture and fun decor. Really great cafe and restaurant as well. Extra shout out to the staff who were helpful in every way!

title: Last minute booking exceeded expectations
text:
Incredible hotel, room was clean, bed was wonderful, bathroom was great. View was AMAZING and we didn’t really hear any noise at night, which is amazing in NYC.
 Had brunch at the restaurant before leaving and the food was fantastic and the service excellent. 

The whole space was cool and calm and interesting, I’m so glad I found this hotel! Can’t wait to go back.

title: My lovely stay at Nomo!
text:
I stayed on the 19th floor on the corner Premium Queen room and I loved it! The views were incredible, even the shower had an overlook of the city skyline: Empire State Building etc. 

The bed was super comfortable and room service kept everything clean and tidy daily.

The hotel staff were super lovely, really appreciated complimentary water bottles and the location of the hotel was in a perfect location to be able to zip around the entire NYC. Nearby stations and bus stops and main shops. I easily went to watch sunrise was Brooklyn Bridge (highly recommend), visited 911 memorial/museum, walked around nearby Little Italy, went to West Village&Greenwich, visited Central Park.

I really enjoyed my stay and after long exploring days in NYC it was a nice feeling to be excited to get back to my room after a long day and rest and appreciate night city lights from up above!

title: Amazing stay!
text: NoMo SoHo has amazing views from the rooms along with very helpful and accommodating staff! The “tunnel of love” was a cool entrance. The restaurant/bar were fantastic for drinks and breakfast. I highly recommend Nomo SoHo and will be coming back soon!

title: Love this Soho Hotel!
text: whenever i come to Ny for work i love to stay at the NOMO. This cute hotel is in a prime location and walking distance to many great areas. The staff are all very friendly and the hotel is very clean and very well maintained. i love how bright and sunny the rooms are. i highly recommend.

title: Nomo Soho
text: Service persons very nice and efficient. Great location. Room had everything we needed. Would have loved to have coffee in the room though. Also,I recommend giving a TOTAL amount of the stay on the email confirmation- mine just had room rate line items as well as some statements about additional fees. But no total. I called and confirmed that the total was to be the same amount quoted on the booking form BUTit turned out to be $300 more and the desk person just shrugged. Left a bad taste in my mouth.

title: Amazing location helpful staff
text:
It was very pleasant stay with beautiful view specially at night and high levels rooms

 We requested a mini fridge l, a kettle & cups, and they delivered them to our room quickly.

The breakfast was good the Lavazza coffee was very good

The location is amazing you have many restaurants, cafes , markets, shops within walking distance

The only thing is the bathroom is really small.

title: Great location and value
text:
Very good location. 
The room is not big but it is spacious for the price and for NYC. It’s well appointed- comfy bed and pillows. Wish there was a mini fridge. Love the view! When I needed anything it was delivered very quickly. No complaints - very happy at this hotel. Have stayed here 4 times over the last 18 months and it’s consistently good.

title: Beware - Fraud
text: Smoking fee scam!! Do not stay here. They are charging me a $500 smoking fee, I don’t smoke or vape, this is just their way of stealing from people. I’ve read dozens of reviews mentioning the same thing, I only wish I had seen them before booking this hotel. They provided me a “report” that shows smoke detection in my room at 12:50 am, I was ASLEEP.

title: Billing nightmare
text:
On January 19, 2023 we stayed one night .  Room was nice, staff was extremely helpful.
I payed $150. for a deposit.  The hotel mispelled my last name ,( 5 leters corrected them everytime we spoke) lost my deposit.  I finally got conformation. after 6 phone calls, 8 Emails, and a call to my bank AFTER A MONTH  of delays and excuses.  I spend way to much time because of their stupidity.

title: Unjust $500 Smoking Fee!
text: I stayed at NoMo SoHo and was thoroughly disappointed. The bed was uncomfortable, and the bathroom offered little privacy. However what truly soured the experience was the unjust $500 smoking fee they charged us. Despite NEVER smoking in the room, they refuse to refund it, displaying blatant disregard for customer honesty. Avoid this establishment at all costs.

title: A great deal at a great property.
text: Amazing New York hotel at a fair price.  Everything was done right and I would highly recommend NoMo SoHo.  From the excellent clean rooms to the first class service,  quite honestly we were shocked how nice this hotel is.  I have a new favorite hotel in Manhattan and it’s called NoMo SoHo.

title: Great Stay-cation for birthday!
text: We loved our stay. Staff is really lovely! The Location is ideal. We had great shopping and eating options nearby. The room was comfortable with great views! Thank you for the personalized notes in our room, and for early check-jn.We had a great day, and we hope to come back soon.

title: Good address for South Manhattan
text:
Nice hotel very well located in Soho.
Nice views from the rooms which are comfortable and quiet. We fully recommend it for family or friends stays.
We did not try the restaurant or bakery but they seem to be of quality. 
We will come back for sure.

title: Large deposited required
text: We stayed 9 days a large sum of $ was debited equal to the full 9 days plus security deposit of $150x9 . It’s a strange practice that we have never encountered before and it nearly maxed our credit card ! Otherwise than that everything was great

title: Crosby Suite
text: Ive stayed here before and always been pleased with my experience. The only thing I will say is the room is advertised to sleep 4, but comes with no blankets for the pull out couch. Otherwise, it was a good experience. The beds were comfortable with great views.

title: It almost made it!
text: The location of NOMO was great. It was near the yellow (N/R/Q) and red (6) lines, so that was nice. I stayed in the Premium room. The view was spectacular and decorated in beautiful royal blue and white; however, the room was a bit small. The closet was too small for double occupancy, but the shower was very large and had a large window with a gorgeous view. The real negatives were the the sink for the bath, it was just too tiny and just washing your face cause water to go everywhere. I was surprised that NOMO optioned for such a big shower, but a tiny sink. Also, if you need the room to be dark to sleep, bring your night eye mask. There are blackout curtains in the room, but the beautiful window in the shower doesn't have a blackout shade and the door to the bathroom is frosted glass, so you will rise when the sun rises. Finally, NOMO please go the extra mile and get larger bath towels!

title: Over charged
text:
Added charges for breakfasts after I'd checked out and left the country. Then refused to remove even though breakfast was included in my rate!!!

Otherwise the hotel is clean and decent and the food was generally good. Well located for both lower and upper. Lots of food options near by too.

title: Smoking fee scan
text:
I stayed here with my daughter for 2 nights in their suite.  When I received our check out slip under the door they added a $500 smoking fee and this fee was also charged a city and state tax so the total was $573.76 for this bogus charge.  We were having a mother / daughter weekend and neither of us smoke.  The "manager"  at the desk told us that the "machine in the room" detected smoking at 9:37am on Saturday morning for a one hour period of time.  I told her that not only do we not smoke, but we also were not even in the room at this time.  We were at their restaurant having breakfast.  The manager did see this on her computer and said she would remove the charge and talk to her manager.  She said we would receive an email about the charge by the evening.  3 days later we never received an email and they put the charge through to our credit card.  When you call to discuss the matter, they just apologize but tell you there is nothing they can do.
DO NOT EVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!

title: Avoid
text: They are charging me a smoking fee when I DO NOT SMOKE. I was never told of the $573 fee at check out, saw the charge on my credit card a few days later. I called the hotel, they said they would look into it and get back to me, as yet no response, they are avoiding the issue. Steer clear of this place, it seems this is on ongoing practice at this hotel, a way to boost your bill with no recourse. Very disappointing.

title: Pessima esperienza
text: Siamo in 3. Prenotiamo un tavolo per la sera. Le recensioni buone e le immagini di uno splendido locale ci mettono di buonumore. Arriviamo ed il ristorante è semi vuoto. Il cameriere ha l’aria di chi vuole simpatizzare ma i suoi modi sono scortesi, frettolosi e allo stesso tempo di un  invadenza del tutto gratuita. Il menu e’ composto da pochi piatti. Chiediamo un risotto e si complimenta per l’ottima scelta del piatto. Dopo 10 minuti torna e dice di non avere il riso. Chiediamo del pane per accompagnare il pollo con verdure di uno di noi e ci dice che non ha il pane. In due ordiniamo una pizza con i funghi, scelta ormai di ripiego ma ormai abbiamo capito che siamo nel posto sbagliato. La pizza è surgelata. Lasciamo stare pure il conto, N.Y non è a buon mercato, ma averci rovinato la serata con del pessimo cibo, una cucina inesistente e un atteggiamento arrogante e grottesco è ingiustificabile. Lasciate stare, NY ha ben altro da offrire.

title: Very nice, but
text:
The king room is smaller than anticipated based on photos but it is clean, well decorated and quite comfortable with a lovely large tub and powerful shower. 
That said, walls were seemingly paper thin and I felt like we could have joined in on our neighbor's conversations.

title: Home away from home
text: Love the Nomo Soho.  I’ve been staying there for years now when I travel to NyC.  An excellent hotel.  Well located, lovely rooms, wonderful people working there and a very good restaurant on site.  🩷🩷🩷

title: Nomo Soho for the win!
text: Fantastic spot. Stay here or drop in to the beautiful glass bar area.  The restaurant is unrivaled in the SoHo neighborhood. Leyton in the bar/ restaurant is fantastic. Great sense of humor and his wit will make you smile.  Go there often and look forward to going back soon

title: Great combination of location, quallity service and nice amenities.
text: Love staying at the Nomo - 3 big reasons. The location is excellent - on a quiet street but close to everything. Hotel is clean, well ran and the staff is very helpful. Rooms are decent size for New York, and everything felt clean and nice. I've stayed here many times for work over the last decade and will be back.

title: Nomo Soho- best hotel in Soho
text: Nono Soho is the best hotel I’ve been to. The staff was exceptionally welcoming, and the room was very clean. The view from the hotel room was extraordinarily beautiful, with a spectacular view on New York City.

title: Great neighborhood but lots of room for improvement
text: We like the neighborhood and have stayed here a couple of times. But the hotel badly needs some renovation and staff training. They overcharged us at check out - what can happen - but didn’t even apologize or smile. It’s the same issue with disinterested staff like the last time. Contrary to that the staff at breakfast is marvelous. Very attentive and friendly. Next time we will opt for another hotel.

title: HORRIBLE HOTEL
text: This hotel has given me so many problems. I have never dealt with such an awful hotel company in my life. They take advantage of their guests by making the room prices very fair but then will charge you $500 for “smoking”. They have faulty smoke detectors in the rooms that will go off to just about anything. They will not hear you out or even consider giving this money back even if you did not smoke in the room. DO NOT STAY HERE. Awful customer service and bogus charges are in your future if you do. Don’t be like me, don’t let these money grubbers steal your money from you! Horrible hotel. Do not recommend.

title: Bogus charge
text: While the accommodations were excellent, the day i checked out, I received an additional charge of $623.11 to my bank account.  I called the hotel and was told that it was a $500 charge for smoking!  I have never smoked in my life and surely did not smoke!!!

title: Great stay
text: Extremely clean and comfortable hotel, friendly and helpful staff.  Great location.  My only complaint was there was no coffee maker in the room. Although there is a coffee  cafe downstairs it really doesn’t open until 7:30. Too late. Starbucks across street opens at 7. But for early risers it doesn’t work.

title: Great stay
text: Stay was great. Very nice suite, amazing view. Accommodating staff. Everything was pretty much perfect, for out stay with our two toddlers. Would 10/10 recommend. Only thing to mention card was charger twice. So I'm waiting to see if the hold will come off automatically. Overall great trip.

title: Fine but couples only.
text: Nice location and affordable but not enough space for the stated capacity of a family of four. Restaurant staff friendly. Front desk not helpful. We had a broken sofa bed and no remedy was made. Wouldn’t be a big deal had we not been assured we could  sleep four. The option was to fight out a last minute cancel or sleep 3 in a king bed. Front desk answer to any solution {even a cot or cushions) was a blank stare and a “no.”

title: Wonderful stay for a family of four
text:
The beds are very comfortable and they make up your room everyday. The hospitality is warm and service is provided with a sense of urgency. We came as a family of 4 and the setup was very comfortable.

The location is also amazing with tons of restaurants and shopping walking distance. 

They will need to do some upgrades soon, updated bathroom cabinets and maybe new carpet and some cocking in the bathrooms but with all that said, we would still rebook and I’m picky. 

Thank you for a great stay Nomo Soho!

title: NYC Penthouse Stay
text:
This is my fourth stay at NoMo
It’s always incredible
The vibe
The staff
The balcony terrace off the room was outstanding! Best city view!
All of it!  I recommend 10 out of 10!
Thx for a great stay as usual!!

title: WORST EXPERIENCE
text:
WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN.
Had to move rooms twice in under 12 hours. 1st room was never cleaned after previous guests but the hotel was happy to put me in it. 2nd bedroom flooded during the night and maintenance needed to be called, then we were moved again. The flooding soaked our shoes and our bags that were on the floor.
Before leaving I checked my bank account and saw a pending charge of $573.76, I spoke to the front desk and apparently this was a smoking fee for one of the rooms we were in and moved from......The front desk agreed we were not in that room and took it off my invoice but Nomo Soho still took it out of my bank. I have rang the front desk and management multiple times but only get voicemail and no call back......| do have another pending charge for $273.76
which I have no idea why. What an awful experience and not to mention this is 3 days before Christmas!!!!!

title: Bad experience at the Nomo soho.
text: Horrible experience, the room sink has a crack the toilet has a crack, and the internet is not working. The phone is not working either. Never coming back to this hotel. It used to be a good hotel. Sad.

title: Gorgeous hotel! A few missing conveniences
text:
BEAUTIFUL hotel! So unique. The bed was so comfortable. View was immaculate. 

Just a few negatives. There was no refrigerator or microwave in the room, which was difficult because we were in town for 4 days and had no where to store or re-heat leftover food. Also there were no USB plugs, only regular plugs (which was frustrating because I only had one charging base and multiple things to charge) because I’m so used to hotels having USB ports for charging. Just a few little things that were slightly inconvenient. But overall, great experience.

title: TINY rooms in Soho
text: Boutique hotel in Soho with TINY rooms. I booked a room with two queen beds, but they were doubles and there was NO ROOM to walk around the beds. We had to coordinate who was walking in the room so we didn't trip over one another. I would not recommend for more than two people sharing a room.

title: Wonderful and beautiful!
text: Greeted every day by extremely friendly staff I was very impressed and greatly enjoyed the stay! The hotel is beautiful, clean, provides a wonderful experience in a fantastic neighborhood. I will be back!

title: Average
text:
Amazing location but otherwise quite an average experience. Rooms are clean but very sparsely decorated and the public areas are tasteless (lots of street vendor style prints and graffiti). Staff were quite curt and not always entirely accommodating.

Perks are delicious food in the main restaurant and amazing views from rooms on higher floors. Worth it for the central Soho location but I think you could get nicer options for the same price in NY generally.

title: Everything was perfect!
text: LOVED staying at this hotel, rooms are super cute, beds very comfy, staff very friendly and responsive. Called housekeeping for extra bedding and they were at our door in minutes. excellent location- overall loved everything about this place and will definitely come back!

title: A real gem
text:
The Location, the  bedding, the restaurant, the staff, the value for money, and the  view is the best you can get. 
All was AAA for me . 
I rarely write review.  But this time I felt like sharing. 
You are literally by little Italy.  China Town,  and of course SOHO . For downtown there's no better location. And the building is kind of "stand alone" so every room gets an amazing view .

title: Very good experience
text:
Room cleaning good, check-in and check out sufficient.

Quality of breakfast very good but the breakfast staff... Excellent!!!
Professionalism, courtesy, empathy above the norm.  

Compliments to all the Staff.

title: Wonderful
text: The beds were super comfy. The staff was so nice. Love the location . The restaurant was really cool and the food and staff were wonderful. Not really enough storage space in the room. We got there early in the morning and had to wait quite a while for the room but it was a busy time in New York because of Christmas time. Overall, I love the hotel.

title: Selective upgrades?
text:
I’ve stayed here before and enjoyed an upgrade to a higher floor as an I Prefer member, however I was told I didn’t qualify this time. The circumstances were the same, 5 nights bed and breakfast package. The reception staff was not helpful, I’m not an entry level member and was disappointed that they were so un-accommodating, when clearly as member it’s stated that upgrades are a perk. I was promised a call from reception (after I  showed them my status) which didn’t happen, I was totally ignored as was my request. Disappointing!

The breakfast staff and restaurant staff are fantastic and the breakfast is delicious in the lovely bar dining room.

title: Great Hotel
text: Great hotel,  great location,  great staff, fantastic stay, will definitely stay again., went with my daughters for the Macys parade ,loved being next to little Italy and China town...if I could ask for anything it would just be Q-tips in the room😊

title: Great location, perfect for that New York experience
text: Location is great, within easy reach of bars, restaurants, shops and everything else Lower Manhattan has to offer. Entrance to hotel is picture perfect! Staff are friendly, helpful and professional.  We are repeat visitors and always enjoy our stay!

title: Modern and lively hotel in Soho
text: Very lively modern hotel in the heart of Soho, staff are all friendly and polite, Nomo restaurant is great for ambiance and food, cafe serves great pastries and Coffee, rooms have amazing views with floor to ceiling Windows, had a room on the 23rd floor and never got bored of the view, beds were really comfortable, lots of drawers and good size wardrobe. I will be returning

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: Great location, great lounge and restaurant and very nice, stylish rooms with comfortable bed.  Very small but well laid out rooms and the staff was extremely helpful and accommodating.  I would definitely return in the future.

title: Cool stay in a great location!
text: Good size room for NYC, updated and very clean. Nice vibe throughout, love the resto and the entrance! Located in the heart of Soho, close to great shopping, beautiful shops and amazing restaurants. Would redo!

title: Superb Hotel.
text: Great staff, great location, cool vibe. I really enjoyed it. Our first stay at the property and will be our regular moving forward.  We travel to NY often and love Soho, but glad to finally find a place to call home when we are in town

title: Family Vacation
text: View from the 25th floor was great. The whole family enjoyed the room and service. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. The heating system is a bit noisy but bearable. We will come again. Good value.

title: Great location
text: The staff in the check in was rather uninterested. When we had problems with the room they let us change the room which was nice. Also the bell boys were all super friendly. Just the expense at the front desk was disappointing

title: Charming oasis in SOHO
text: Lovely entrance on Crosby Street as you enter through the potted plant arbor.  Charming outdoor seating area.  Very friendly and responsive staff.   Room was petite but comfortable.  Very bright!  Not great if you're a business traveler and want to work in the room.  We had a room on the Lafayette side of the building with a karaoke bar directly across the street.  Not such a peaceful rest before 12:15am. Once it closed it wasn't too bad until there were a few loud cars that went by in the middle of the night.  I would definitely consider staying here again but in a room facing the  quieter Crosby Street.

title: Séjour à New York
text:
L’hôtel est très bien situé. C’est très cher mais tout est ridiculement cher à NY.
La déco est très sympa. L’état général est ok ( en dessous des standards européens pour le prix). C’est un peu bruyant mais il ne faut pas aller à NY si vous recherchez le calme.
Le personnel était très accueillant et pro, les chambres étaient très bien faites.
Nous sommes satisfaits de notre séjour, nous étions 2 adultes et un enfant dans une une chambre double.

title: Mom and Daughter Trip
text: My daughter and I stayed in the King Suite and we had plenty of room.  The room was very clean, quiet and beautiful, and the view was spectacular.  The bathroom was lovely and also had a wonderful view!  Even though the sink and vanity was in the suite living area, it was set back from the sofa and door, and worked out great for us.  The coffee bar downstairs was definitely a plus!  We enjoyed everything about our stay, including the location, service, restaurant, fast elevators and lovely room.

title: Great spot for couples
text: We stayed at the NoMo for our 10th wedding anniversary and were very happy with our choice. Location was great, staff was very friendly and went above and beyond to make our stay special, including a room upgrade. Favorite feature was the view of the Manhattan skyline from our room. We would definitely stay again.

title: Disastrous Customer Service Experience
text: Not sure how this hotel received a 4-star rating because it's clearly a 3-star in need of a renovation and a brand new staff. I had different employees tell me conflicting information about billing. They said the credit card would not be charged until check-in for the full amount over the phone, instead one night was charged the day prior. Trying to refund that card in order to charge the entire amount to the correct card for my business trip has been impossible. I keep getting transferred, placed on hold, being told the manager is unavailable and that a CC auth form will be emailed to me, but I checked out five days ago and that is yet to happen despite daily phone calls. I would NEVER stay here again and recommend you don't either.

title: extremely overpriced for what it offers,
text:
extremely overpriced for what it offers, rooms that don't even qualify as hotel standard, carpet extremely dirty, room smelled of cigarette smoke and air conditioning unit sounded like a generator in the room basically should be described as room to let with prices of a 5* hotel. 
finally location is described as soho but its closer to china town...

title: Great for all things Soho
text: Great location in for everything Soho. The hotel feels very special and unique from the greenhouse entrance to the colorful hallways. I was impressed by the level of soundproofing in the rooms as you never heard any street noise.

title: Great hotel and location
text: Great hotel, good location and atmosphere.  Couple of comments, no glasses or fridge in room which I would have expected.  Nice bar and welcome from reception.  We booked queen room but were upgrade foc to a king.

title: I ♥️ Nomo Soho
text: Super clean rooms, crisp, white, bed sheets and a lightweight duvet, breathtaking views of the city skyline, a fantastic location in Soho, great staff, and amazing shopping and food/drinks only a few steps away on foot in every direction of the hotel.  Have been staying at the Nomo for years and I’m always happy to return.

title: Lovely helpful people, perfect location., and comfortable
text: The people were helpful, friendly and accommodating - especially at the front desk.  The location is perfect for shops and restaurants, and it is a quick trip into Manhattan.  The room and dining areas were comfortable. It was a very enjoyable four day stay.

title: Read reviews
text: Although the pictures on website paint a picture of a luxury hotel.... It is basically just a ton of rooms with nothing else to offer (food is really good!) It shows rooftop options but that is false information. No in house bar or entertainment. Every morning we left ,our rooms were cleaned nice but the air was set back to 80+ degrees.

title: BEST OF THE BEST!
text: EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE AND AMAZING 5 STAR STAFF WHO WENT OVER& BEYOND TO ENSURE I HAD AN AMAZING EXPERIENCEE. THANKS TO MIRIAN, ZAIDA. JEFFREY. JENNIFER & RENE. I CANNOT SAY ENOUGH GREAT THING ABOUT NoMo AND HAVE ALREADY STARTED TELLING OTHER PLANNERS & MY COLLEAGUES ABOUT THIS PLACE. EASY TO GET TO AND THE ROOMS ARE IMMACULATE & VERY COMFORTABLE. I LOOK FORWARD TO MY NEXT STAY. THANK YOU.

title: Good place to stay
text:
Great location, great views from the rooms and very comfortable beds.

Great coffee served by Felipe at Paris Bakery in the lobby.

Hotel restaurant is OK, kind of average.

Gym is good but could do with a couple of yoga mats.

Discounts provided by hotel don’t really work

title: Patis Bakery
text: Hotel is great, wonderful views on the higher floors, but Patis Bakery makes it even better. Tucked in the main lobby, always a smile and a great cup of coffee from Felipe! Open at 7am so go get it early birds!

title: Great views but needs a refresh
text:
Been here one week! Service is excellent and restaurant is very good. Avocado toast and salmon are delicious in morning.
Rooms: well kept but dates rugs, hallways and need refresh of paint in hotel plus restaurant. 
Room rates are about $100/nite less expensive if you book hotel through the Trip Advisor and their connected travel websites!

title: Workshop in SoHo
text: Perfect location for the event and a great restaurant and lounge experience with a beautiful outdoor seating area for a larger group. This is a unique gem in the heart of SoHo, easily accessible and some the best skyline and bridge views anywhere.

title: Gem!
text: Lovely, friendly staff!!! They were incredibly accommodating. Nice rooms. The room service was delicious and fast. GREAT location!! Such close access to incredible restaurants and shopping! I would definitely recommend NoMo.

title: mold smell in room, giant leak in our room
text:
We were so excited to stay at Nomo
Soho during fashion week. Unfortunately the first night we reserved there our flight has mechanical issues and got cancelled until the next day. Nomo soho still charged us AND made our reservation rate higher then when we reserved it. We checked in and the guy at the front was not the friendliest. He said they wouldn’t have charged us for the night we missed if someone else would have taken the room. But since they did not get booked they still charged us . Our first night was good minus the shower water pressure was SO POWERFUL. Wouldn’t even enjoy a nice shower. Water was also everywhere coming out of the shower onto the bathroom floor. The next morning we woke up to an awful moldy smell in our room. We had to change rooms. The new rooms phone did not work at all . They also then had a huge water leak coming from the bathroom ceiling. We then had to move rooms again. No, Bellman helped us. We had to move all of our own stuff. I do not recommend this hotel. They still have not gotten back to us on any reimbursements. Super disappointing.

title: A+
text: We couldn't have been happier with every aspect of our hotel stay here.  The location is fantastic, the decor, cleanliness, staff, even the fragrance in the lobby was excellent. We will definitely stay here again.

title: No amenities
text: Only 2 pillows total for a king bed.  No bottled water.  No refrigerator.  Very bare bones.  the room was small which is normal for NYC.  I was shocked that they did not offer any water, no ice bucket, nothing!

title: I woke up and slept poorly because too much light comes in since the curtains are broken.
text:
The hotel is beautiful from the outside and the lobby is amazing, but the room
Inside is not clean, old, and
"The curtains are useless, all the light comes in, and they are broken.
The bathroom is very tiny
Bed is comfortable and also pillows are very good

title: False $500 “smoking fee” - like many others! Unbelievable!
text: I am shocked to see so many people here reporting the same fraudulent charges that were placed on my credit card for a false “smoking fee” when I was staying here for 2 nights in late June with my 10 yr old. I do not smoke nor does my 10 yr old. Indeed, I never wanted to stay at this hotel but I was forced to because the hotel I booked had an AC problem. I am trying to reach management to challenge this $500 bogus fee. They even sent a document to my credit card company in response to my challenge attaching what must be a false or inaccurate/malfunctioning smoke detector report. I have now seen at least 4 other similar complaints here. Truly outrageous. Will definitely never ever stay here again. Never.

title: What a shame!
text:
I've been staying at the Nomo Soho for what feels like forever, easily 30 times in the last 5 years. But honestly, I'm just done with it. This place used to be fantastic, great service and all, but now? Forget it. TERRIBLE!

Today, on September 8th, 2023, at 12:46, I had the worst encounter with the lady at the front desk. She's like a professional misery distributor. Hates her job. Not accommodating, no social graces. No thank yous, no nothing. I’m pretty sure her name is jazmin. 

And remember when they used to have those mini-bars in the rooms before Covid hit? Well, they pulled the plug on that too. 9/10 times, you don’t have one bottle of water in the room. One night, I came back after some drinks, parched as can be, and called down to the front desk for water. Guess what? They wouldn't bring it up; I had to trek down to get it myself. So, I started using Instacart just to keep myself hydrated during my stays.

But today, I'd had enough. When I called to book another night, the lady at the front desk told me, jazmin I believe is her name, in the rudest tone possible, that they were fully booked. Funny thing is, their website said otherwise. So I pointed it out and she then made up some bogus story about they don’t have access to the rooms and insisted I book online, which I did. She then tells me I can’t have the same room because it wasn’t available. So I had to annoyingly pack all my belongings and I asked over the phone if a bellhop can move my things and she says yes but you have to come downstairs to check into your new room. I go down and she then tells me we don’t have any bellhop available for a while, in her miserable rude condescending tone. I go back up to my room, realize there’s no way I can move all of this on my own and call back down to tell her I would wait. She pauses and is silent, then in her crumby attitude says ok. 

I thought I'd be waiting forever, but then, out of nowhere, a bellhop shows up at my door just two minutes later. I mean, how can they be "swamped" and then magically appear that fast?

Honestly, this place has so many issues, it's not even worth listing them all. I hope someone buys it, cleans house, and starts fresh. Especially that lady at the front desk; she's in the wrong line of work. I used to love it here, Jeffrey at the front desk is wonderful. He treats you like royalty, knows your name, and provided service like you were at the Ritz. Julian the bellhop is amazing! He’s also awesome with restaurant recommendations and things to do around the city. I would love to talk to the owner of this hotel, it can be so much more than what it is. It’s not a hotel, it’s like you’re staying at a hostel now. Such a shame.

title: Cool place in SoHo
text: Outstanding views of the city because no nearby skyscrapers block the vistas, friendly and attentive staff, cool location near all the shops and restaurants, value for money, good in-house coffee shop

title: BEST Hotel in NYC!
text:
Perfectly in the heart of Chinatown - within walking distance of everything needed; many cafes, restaurants and shops nearby.
Beautiful view of the city in our room (King Deluxe), and BEST breakfast ever. We had the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes & Nutella French Toast. It was incredible.

The service was exceptional - very kind and accommodating staff all around. Can't wait to come back!

title: A stylish stay in Soho
text: From the bed and pillows, to the staff, the location, the views, and the ambiance, the Nomo never disappoints. I come to New York once a year and I have made the decision to stay here exclusively. Some of the rooms need a little facelift (mostly carpet and headboards), but you'll be hard pressed to find a busy hotel in NYC that doesn't need little things here and there. The only thing this hotel is missing is a rooftop bar. That would be the cherry on top!!

title: Excellent stay
text:
I loved the location. The view from our hotel room was outstanding, with a view of Hudson and the World Trade and Empire State Building.
We had reserved a king suite with a separate small living room. we had been moved up to the 24th floor:
The staff was amicable and attentive, and we immensely enjoyed our stay. Close to shopping and the subways.

title: Great trip
text: Was a great stay and hotel was very attentive, quiet and lovely staff we enjoyed the area and the lobby cafe and had a chance to use the gym that was very well equipped.  I loved the cleanliness of the hotel, we will definetly return

title: Terrible product and service
text: I reserved a room to use for work during the day and was unable to do so. The entire hotel had an internet outage and did not let me know when I checked-in.  It was very challenging and costly work day. There was hair on the bathroom wall. No response from several emails. I would not recommend for business or leisure. Terrible product and service.

title: Don’t get fooled
text: I was deeply disappointed by my experience at Nomo Soho. Upon entering the room, I was greeted with visible dirt on the floor, window sills that appeared untouched in ages, and, most concerning, black mold on the shower head. Their claim of "ensuring a safe, clean and inviting environment" on their website feels like a cruel joke after what I witnessed. Despite providing evidence in the form of videos and photos, I felt ignored by the management. After enduring just one night of a planned 3-night stay, I decided to check out. To add insult to injury, not only did manager George not offer an apology, but there was also no refund for the night's stay. I would strongly advise against staying here.

title: Another fine stay!
text: Have stayed at the NOMO SOHO a few times now, and each visit gets better than the last one. Nice, nice people and top notch accommodations. Conveniently located which means close to some terrific clothing shops and some fine restaurants. Love this place.

title: My favorite hotel in New York
text: We always stay at the Nomo Soho. The location is central to everything that we love about New York.  The staff, goes above our expectations every time. The views from the rooms are absolutely breathtaking. We love the food in the hotel restaurant and the ambiance is “next level.” Can’t wait to return.

title: This hotel is a vibe
text: Great hotel, great service, clean, comfortable and conveniently located! We loved the restaurant inside the hotel, too! My daughter and myself very much enjoyed our stay! We will definitely be visiting again!

title: Worth it
text: Lovely hotel in perfect Soho location. Best front desk staff. Small rooms but that should be expected. Recommend asking for the highest floor available. Magnificent views. Solid bar at hotel. Ok food.

title: Charged 500$ without explanation, explanation request no one answer
text: at the end of the stay we were charged $500 without explanation. after an exchange of emails they explained to us that according to them we smoked in the room, they sent us the traces of the smoke detectors in the room. the day before we had asked the hotel to send us an electrician who found problems with my hair dryer. the next day the hair dryer burned out and increased the fumes detected in the room. we sent three emails to explain what happened but no one ever replied. I have no words for this behavior. unfortunately we will never recover our $500 but we will advise against staying at the name and the agency that sold us the trip will do the same.

title: Useriøst hotell
text:
Useriøst hotell. Trakk 500 $ av kortet uten å si ifra. De mente noen hadde røyket på rommet selv om vi er en familie med barn og ingen av oss røyker. Vi føler oss lurt.
Veldig små rom og bråkete aircondition. 
Dyrt hotell som jeg ikke anbefaler til noen.

title: Great comfortable hotel in central Soho location
text: Had a fun trip with my teenage daughter who picked this hotel for a birthday trip. Hotel has a nice decor. We had a great corner room with awesome views. It was clean. Breakfast was delicious. Location was perfect for exploring Soho and close to subway to other areas in the city. It's located on a quiet back street.

title: False card charges after checkout and shameful service
text:
Appalling service and false billing 6 weeks after we checked out!!
$573.76 charged to my credit card without any explanation. After several emails being ignored I finally got a reply. An empty email without any words, just an attachment showing smoke particulates in the room, presumably insinuating we smoked in the room and this was some kind of fine. We do NOT smoke! Several more emails and proof that we were not in the room at that time finally resulted in a refund, no explanation and no apology. Several more emails since and I still haven't had any replies. I am $8 down on the deal due to currency charges which they are not showing any signs of refunding. I am sure the management will reply to this review saying that this is regrettable and hope we come again etc but will probably not make any other contact to apologise and explain and rectify my issue. If they do want to contact me its booking ref 179258918 and you will find the full sorry shameful email chain containing my contact details.

title: Pickpocket
text:
J ai séjourné a nomo soho 4nuits ce mois d aout 2023 nous avons remarqué que le service n était plus le même qu au paravant..Nous avions à plusieurs visites sur NYC séjourné dans cet hôtel et avions ressenti un certain laissé aller lors de ce dernier passage.
Le pire c est qu après notre check out nous avons été débité non seulement de notre caution mais aussi d une amende concernant une accusation d avoir fumé alors que nous ne fumons pas.
C est du vol manifeste !!!!!
Je déconseille fortement cet hôtel qui fut si sympathique avant 
…….un comportement anti commercial et affreusement indélicat….

title: Tolles Erlebnis
text:
Sauber, sehr gut gelegen, gute Ausstattung.
Leider ist das Hotel-Restaurant für das Frühstück sehr teuer… 4 Personen 145$😅
Aber was macht man nicht alles im Urlaub um eine unvergessliche Zeit zu erleben….
In der Umgebung viele gute Restaurants, Shops und Sehenswürdigkeiten 👍

title: nomo soho
text: It was in a good position in Soho and transport was easy from their.  It was not a 4* hotel, more a 3*. the facilities were not good enough.  There was not a fridge in the room, although when we asked for one, we did get.  There were no tea or coffee making facilities.   the walls were very thin and we heard everything going on next door. I mean everything!!   Not so pleasant.  The staff were very friendly and welcoming.

title: Perfect 3 nights in NY
text: It was everything I expected from a NY hotel. Clean room, well stocked, beautiful view. Quiet atmosphere, when I needed things they were taken care of immediately and done well. Staff was friendly and available

title: Book elsewhere.
text: Service here is horrible. From check in to check out, every person we dealt with was rude and unhelpful. They were unwilling to honor the promotion listed on their own website when we booked directly through them. Customer service claimed we’d receive our rewards at check in. The reception desk claimed they were handled through a third party. Management was useless. No response to emails sent or the multiple surveys we received after our stay. The location was nice, but rooms are very small and the restaurant was in disrepair. Literally every chair was ripped up. Nothing about this place justifies $500+/night. We definitely do not recommend.

title: Amazing !! Thanks to Jeffrey without him we would have been lost
text: Jeffrey, the amiable host at NoMo SoHo, displayed exceptional hospitality. He generously provided a list of wonderful restaurants, all of which turned out to be delightful. His assistance throughout our trip was invaluable and truly made our entire experience unforgettable!

title: Like a Dream!
text: How can one person make your mother daughter trip memorable!!!???  Meet Jasmin- from the moment we checked in to suggestions for massages- she was always available, pleasant and warm.  You can't imagine the views you will get- the pictures don't do it justice.  The restaurant and entry are perfect for pictures.  All staff were welcoming!  Ice available from restaurant and water bottles are in the gym...what more do you need?  The location is safe and easy to navigate.  In minutes you can be in China Town, Little Italy or on Broadway....and you can return easily to the comfort of the room.  This should be a 5 star hotel and we will return to make more memories!!!!

title: Chic hotel in SoHo
text: Nice room including linen. No fridge or glasses (even plastic ones). Had to get ice to keep milk cold for tea drinking!! The bar is nice but they do charge like a wounded bull ($102 US for 4 g&t and 6 wings; I guess that's SoHo!

title: Check your bill! This place is a scam.
text:
Not at all worth the hassle.

Nomo Soho added a $500 "smoking fee" to my bill *without even telling me they were doing it*. I only caught it by accident (buried on p. 2 of the bill). And I DON'T SMOKE.

This hotel is fundamentally dishonest - will add fraudulent charges to jack up the price. And then will refuse to address the problem. I've spent weeks dealing with them. Do yourself a favor and stay someplace else.

title: Photo Worthy
text: The cobblestone street lead up to a welcoming and lush entrance. The lobby (a few floors up from the ground floor) smelled clean and was occupied by patrons as a lovely place to spend time. The staff was welcoming and everything about the room was well-appointed, down to the room number on the marble floor entrance.

title: William made our day!
text: What a great place with bright rooms and plenty of room for two. No refrigerator but that was okay as they got us ice when we wanted it. William was wonderful as host of the great restaurant. He made sure we had a table by an outlet as we needed to charge all our electronics before leaving.

title: Will go again for the sake of the view.
text: View (penthouse room 2501) was amazing!!! Suite was “average”, good beed, nice couches but very scarce lighting /light setup and the noise level from what seemed to be the aircon master in- and outlet was quite high.

title: Summer stay
text: The hotel is lowkey, and in a good location. The room was average, the bed was comfy, beautiful view. The employees were amazing, kind and helpful. The restaurant was delicious , I loved the ambiance. I would stay here again.

title: False smoking fee applied without warning and without evidence (since we don't smoke/have never smoked)
text: Nomo Soho leveled a false charge of smoking - at 6:45 am (?!) against my family - two kids and two parents, and will absolutely not budge, even though none of us is a smoker and we were obviously not smoking before we were even awake. We've stayed twice, and will not only never stay again, but wanted to alert folks to the fact that they have "detectors" which apply an "automatic charge of 500$" for smoking (even if you're never smoked and are literally staying there with your kids), which is absolutely impossible to reason away. We are furious.

title: Rip off
text: On arrival for a 6 night stay we were told we had to pay $150 per night security and $50 resort tax, we booked with British Airways luckily as they got us a new hotel after our 1st night, which incidentally haven’t had our $150 refunded, room was poor also…avoid

title: Disappointed
text: The location is great. But for the price and “resort fee” very disappointing. The room felt worn and bed had only 2 pillows. No phone in room to contact room service, no outlets near the beds - only one set by desk. You had to go to the restaurant to get ice. The hostess stand to get waters. The coffee shop staff and other employees were not friendly. No help with bags. Been to NYC many times - will never stay here again. No service at all.

title: Watch out for hotel charging your card falsely
text:
We were charged $200 on our card a day after we checked out without being told what it was for. I contacted them several times and days later they got back to me saying it was a bill from their restaurant, which was not made by us. We never ate at their restaurant and weren’t even at the hotel at that time and date on the receipt. I asked them to provide proof of signature on the bill and cctv footage but hotel management was extremely unprofessional and stopped responding to emails and unwilling to help resolve this.
I’ve sent them several emails and they’re not getting back to me, so I’ve raised a dispute with my credit card provider to help resolve this.
I can’t believe how easy it apparently is to dine at their restaurant and put a random room number down, so watch out staying here as you can very easily be scammed on false bills and without any help from hotel management.

title: No air conditioning
text: I’ll keep this short and sweet you’re paying a premium for an upgraded room, only to find out there was No AC in the building. We were planning on staying for a few days after the first night but decided to find accommodations elsewhere. Called the staff and was told they would send someone up to look. No one ever came. Later the next day a staff member told us it was with the entire system. We stayed in a room that was 84 degrees through most of the night, dropped to 82 by the time I woke up and couldn’t leave there fast enough.

title: Third time not a charm
text: I have stayed at the hotel two other times and i loved it.  This time not so much.  The room was very clean but the air conditioning was not working on the hottest day of the year.  I went down to get some coffee at the cafe and i was told they were out of coffee.   Also, there were not any glasses in the room.  Not sure i will be back.

title: Great experience !
text:
Great view, great location.
No issue whatsoever with the room.
Breakfast : beautiful room but limited choice for those who prefer fruits and yogurts to eggs and bacon.
Overall great experience.
Rather expensive though.
But no regrets !

title: Another great 3rd stay at the NOMO SOHO!
text: This is my 3rd stay at the NOMO SOHO and it was as good as the first two stays. Great location within walking distance of all attractions downtown. Great views from the floor to ceiling windows. So comfy beds. Love the decor and the vibe. Very attentive service and great dinner at the restaurant. I will be back and would definitely recommend it to anyone.

title: Terrible service and the room is not worth it.
text: Never left a review before. No one available for check in, management can’t help. Waited 30 min to find someone for checkin and received attitude about ‘get a manger’ but mangers can’t actually do anything. Honestly feel bad for employees there. Rooms are spacious but no noise control and not comfortable at all. Be clear to ask for water at check in or you won’t get. Great location - but would recommend 11 Howard one block over (Marriott property). Even if cost is higher.

title: Great Location
text: Soho hotel was an excellent stay for a night in the city with my wife. NoMo is well located with an amazing City view. My wife and I will definitely be coming again. Our rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. Thank you to Jeffrey at the front desk for being so attentive and caring, anything we needed he was on top of it and was always friendly.

title: For location, you won’t do better in Soho. Friendly service. But …
text:
Fantastic Soho location and friendly staff. Bed is very comfortable.

The $43  daily "resort” fee is simply a money-grab extra profit fee. There is no swimming pool in this “resort”. When questioned about the resort fee, they speak of “amenities”. If you’re going to gouge people for amenities that are common (and usually free) in most hotels, at the very least there should be some. A couple of discount coupons to neighboring businesses does not constitute an amenity.

“Amenities” supposedly include bottled water but that requires an elevator ride to the main floor restaurant where they ration out the water. Restaurant has mediocre service, OK food and exorbitant prices. Breakfast was not included in our rate. There is no reason to go to this restaurant except for your water bottle ration. 

We found that the wifi amenity was not stable and requires logging in each day. Minor hassle.

There is a tiny fitness center amenity in the basement. I visited each day for 5 days and the water cooler did not work. I was thirsty. Each time I called the front desk and each time they promised to deal with this but it certainly did not happen while I was using the equipment. I mentioned to staff each day that the clock is an hour off in the fitness room. Each day, they threatened to fix the clock but nope.

Basic amenities like a coffee maker in the room are not provided. There are not even drinking glasses in the room. Not even plastic or paper ones. Forget about coffee mugs or wine glasses. Don’t even think about a corkscrew or snacks. A fridge in the room is only by request, but once we learned this, one was brought up quickly. If you don’t know that you can request a fridge, you probably won’t. I suppose that is the idea.

Ahh, those “amenities”. Just bend over buddy, and pay that resort fee.

NoMo SoHo ain’t no resort. But it does have a great location.

title: A night in the city with my friends
text: Soho hotel was a perfect stay for a night in the city with my girls! NoMo is well located and has beautiful decor. We were discussing we would come back again. Our rooms were clean and the staff was friendly.

title: Awfully expensive for little to nothing.
text: First day and night a/c didn’t work the water cut out on us during a shower and came back 40 minutes later but dark brown. The toilet constantly ran and was annoying and kept us up at night. The restaurant and bar is stupidly over priced and not worth it. Save your money and go to the Citizen M instead and the NOMO.

title: Rip off hôtel with bad service and bogus charges at check in.
text:
Rip off hotel!

Buyer beware this hotel is worst example of a over priced under good hotel in NYC.  The room was expensive.  The room was small, building old and low quality.  

The final straw was the unadvertised $50  ‘resort fee’ they charged for room.  The resort fee’ was in addition to advertised room rate and a obvious attempt to falsely advertise a lower room rate and hit and surprise customers with an additional charge at check in.  The resort ‘amenities’ they claim include use of a phone in the room (for local calls…like no one has a cell phone) and a substandard gym which no one uses.  

The room service eggs and potatoes was served in cardboard container…no plate and plastic silverware.  Very very low class.

Avoid this bad bad, hôtel the is trying to rip off customers.

title: Lovely hotel and easy location
text:
We found NoMo after a flight cancelation resulted in two more days in NYC.  We had not been able to do much research, and at first we were "taken aback" by how small the room was.  But it turned out to be great.  We appreciated the breakfast credit and the excellent menu.  Staff was very accommodating. 
Having already stayed in Midtown for the previous seven days, we really enjoyed the easier pace of SoHo.  It was a great location.

title: I was charged over $500 for smoking in my room, with my 2 small
text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for my birthday in mid May 2023. We liked it so much we came back with our 2 small children for a special weekend (they both are stepping up to new schools next year) My wife and I were just reviewing our Amex bill and found that we were charged over $500 because they said we smoked in the room. So neither of us smoke, nor do either of my 2 children that are under 10 years old. I will never be staying at this hotel again. Be weary of them in the future when planning a trip for your family. Im sure their dis-honest business practices get a lot of people with this scam.

title: Regn ikke med at hotelledelsen vil hjælpe.
text:
Vær sikker på at have ALT hvad i aftaler på skrift. Hvis de kan omgå at holde aftaler så gør de det. Evt få en advokat til at hjælpe.vi bestilte igennem iprefer og var blevet lovet bed and breakfast, men en fejl fra vores side gjorde at det kun var 1 person der kunne få gratis morgenmad og vi er 4. 
Vi har skrevet før vi ankom om det kun rettes og det var ikke noget problem, men de havde godkendt at vi var 4 på værelset, men ikke 4 der spiste morgenmad ….. det kunne man måske regne med var logisk men det kunne hotelledelsen slet ikke forstå, og iprefer er ligeglade.

title: Great Stay, Clean Hotel, Close to Subway
text: Great location, close to subway. Room was great, had a deluxe king on upper floors. Room was clean and a good size for NYC hotels. Traffic  noise wasn't bad at all and you had views. Only had drinks in the bar and we were well taken care of each night. I would stay here again

title: Wonderful experience but inconsiderate parking that is also too far way.
text: Love the people. Love the service. Love the room. Parking at Wooster street gave me a hard time. They said they didn’t want to take my car because it was too expensive. Weird.  I told them I was staying at the No Mo and then the guy called his boss. After talking for a bit they took my car. That happened twice this weekend. It would cause me to go to a different hotel if it persists

title: NoMo Sales Team = The Best!
text: I booked the NoMo for a company offsite; a total of 22 rooms over 3 nights. The sales process was seamless and the team was extremely flexible in terms of my needs and some contract timing issues. My team enjoyed the hotel and the feedback was positive. I encountered one minor issue that and it was handled expeditiously. The team on the ground is friendly and the property is clean. Will continue to stay at the NoMo when I visit New York (3-4 times per year). Thank you Mirian and Erica in the sales department!!! You're the best!

title: Great Experience
text: We go to New York often and this was our first stay at NoMo SoHo. It was recommended to us by our good friend Lou Silver! We stayed in the balcony suite. The room was beautiful,  the bed comfortable, the service excellent! The balcony was INCREDIBLE and the view was SPECTACULAR!! We will definitely be back!

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed in a king suite as a family of 4 including 2 teenage boys. Room was spacious with lots of natural light and fabulous view. Everything was great except there should be a provision for tea/ coffee in the room.

title: Just so so
text:
This hotel looks so promising online…but doesn’t deliver in person. The front desk was stressed and told us our room wasn’t ready because it got skipped on the cleaning list ( we arrived several hours after check-in time). We didn’t have to wait very long, but the room didn’t match up with the pictures once we arrived to the room. 
The air unit made loud clicking noises while running. The staff kept opening our door without knocking…happened three times and we still aren’t sure why. The staff was friendly, but the hotel has not been maintained and was not the cleanest. Great location, but wouldn’t stay here again.

title: Spectacular View!
text: It was amazing. View was spectacular! The food was fantastic. Bed was comfy. We had the penthouse suite. Perfect location. Seriously worth the money if it is your first time in New York. I highly recommend.

title: Run Down Area - Tiny Room
text: This Hotel is in a Run down area of Soho. Only a couple of Blocks from China town. The Building next door was empty and covered in graffiti. The Plastic flowers in the entrance did not give a good impression.  Only good thing ,we were Put on a High Floor so had a good view.  The Room was tiny. There was nowhere to put 2 Suitcases apart from stood on end inside the wardrobe ,so nowhere to hang clothes.  It was clean but would not choose to stay here again as we were stung at the end for over £110 in resort fee for nothing used.  The Breakfast offering was minimal so we got things from the deli round the corner. Evening meal in the Restaurant was ok but very expensive . A Glass of house wine was $20 without the tip. Bar Staff were Friendly.   If you stay here you can walk to lower Manhattan and the Statton Island Ferry .

title: Great time in SOHO
text: Great part of town in SOHO. Beautifully decorated with a wonderful entrance. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the restaurant was great. We will definitely stay here again if we want to be in SOHO.

title: Over priced and over rated
text:
We recently stayed and found the hotel to be over priced and over rated. 

The room was small and looked tired. It was in need of updating, or just a good lick of paint in some areas. The air conditioning in the lounge/living room wasn't working so our room was incredibly hot, until this got fixed.

We had dinner at the in-house restaurant, which was very average.

The location however, was excellent.

title: Memorial Day Getaway
text:
Great location, close to shopping on both Broadway and Chinatown with a nice restaurant in the lobby as well. Loved the decor and the smell of the hotel.
Hotel staff was very responsive with our requests as well! Would definitely stay again.

title: Just decent
text: Staff is absolutely lovely and I even received a complimentary upgrade. Room cleanliness is a little bit iffy. Found long black hairs between the clean towels. Yuck. There is also no complimentary water in the room nor any glasses one could use to drink water one buys out of. No toothbrush holders or other complimentary toiletries, like cotton pads and cotton swabs or even tissues, one expects from a decent hotel. No outlets anywhere near the beds to plug your phone or computer into either. Ordered room service for 2 glasses of wine at $20 each and they were delivered in plastic cups!!  Weird oddities that would unfortunately make me think again about staying there again.

title: Quite overrated
text:
very convinient location, but the rooms were quite basic.
there was no minibar, or espresso machine, kettle.
I had originally booked from the 17th May-the 23rd May.

we left the property, as we got to Boston, we realised one of our suitcases was damaged. I reported this to the hotel, via email. No one has responded. 
Quite disappointed

title: Good and friendly environment
text: I went with my friend. It was really amazing service and the food. I really appreciate the service. Also the employees were so friendly and well behaved. Mr. Imran was one of them . Awesome service! Great job!

title: Staying at a hotel where the staff simply doesn't care.
text: The last time I wrote a bad review of a hotel was 9 years and probably 300 nights ago.   The entire operation was disappointing, from the check in to the restaurant to the room.  When I finally checked out they could not provide me with an invoice.  I was told it would arrive via email later that day.   Only when I called five days later did they send the invoice.   Needless to say, I was overcharged.   I can't imagine I am going back to this hotel that sits in a neighborhood with lots of great hotel.

title: Great stay!
text: Just spent the weekend at Nomo and it was lovely!! Absolutely fabulous location in Soho, and right near everything there. Cool young vibe. Stunning entrance. Took a subway easily up to midtown to see a Broadway show, Central Park etc.  The rooms were decent size for NYC, clean, modern, comfortable bed. Good shower, wifi and AC. They were even able to bring be a Nespresso machine to my room on request which was great. Very professional and friendly staff. Nomo was more than adequate, very enjoyable and I would definitely stay here again.

title: Yuck
text:
I am not sure how this hotel is rated with four stars. I will start by saying we booked our room via my husband’s iPrefer Rewards program. And I know some boutique hotels are not keen on travelers using membership/reward programs, as it cuts into their bottom line. That said, we did expect the level of service and cleanliness we have experienced at other I Prefer Hotels. What was promoted as one of the premiere hotels in SoHo is nothing more than a 2-star hotel at best. 

I will admit the archway entrance is quite stunning, and the outdoor patio for the restaurant is gorgeous, but the rest of the hotel is showing its age. Our room was dated, banged up, and dirty. Our headboard was cracked with stains and wear. We had stains on our sheets. The caulk around the sink was cracked and moldy. The mirror was broken and chipped in multiple places. There was mold and mildew in the shower stall. The hair dryer was also cracked on the end. The pendant lights next to the bed was dusty, listing to the side, and we were so low my 6’5 husband hit his head each morning. We also believe there was mold or something wrong with the HVAC system, as each time the A/C turned on, we both started to sneeze and cough.  I have attached pictures of some of these issues as a reference for others.

I ate in the restaurant for lunch one afternoon. My lettuce leaves were brown and wilted. The salad dressing had been cut with water and was messy with little flavor. And my chicken was rubbery and undercooked.    

Except for a maid in the hallway and one bellman, we did not see anyone else from the hotel. We were never greeted or asked if we needed directions or help. 

If we had not paid in advance for our room, I would have checked out immediately and never looked back.

title: Terrible Stay
text: Awful experience and can’t get anyone to call or email me back about how disappointing our experience was. Room was smelly, dirty, and was shaking from the building’s pipes. We complained upon seeing our room but were told they would get back to us when a room became available, which never happened. Front desk knows how bad conditions are and managers are unresponsive.

title: DESRESPEITO E NÃO CONFIÁVEL
text:
Hotel bem localizado, só! Preços caros pro que é .. funcionários extremamente mal educados. O hotel não disponibiliza nem uma água quente pela manhã, pagamos 4 dólares todo os dias por 1 copo de água quente. 
Pedimos comida no quarto e eles cobram uma taxa de 12% só para entregar a comida no quarto. 
Ao final da estadia, eles resolveram INVENTAR que fumamos no quarto, sendo que nós não fumamos. 
Eles alegaram que o dispositivo no quarto informou e que eles não podiam fazer nada. Extramamente grosseiros e mal educados. 
Enviei um email solicitando a comprovação e eles apenas responderam que foi constatado na limpeza que houve sim e que o quarto ia precisar ficar fechado por 2 dias por conta disso. SURREAL. 
500 dólares por algo que não fiz. Fiquei sabendo que isso é um esquema do hotel. NÃO VOLTAREI, NÃO RECOMENDO

title: Great hotel and location!
text: Love the location, decor, beauty and cleanliness. Comfy bed, great shower’s water pressure and wonderful service.   Restaurant food was good!  Helpful baggage storage.   For $500 a night, I would have expected a refrigerator, water glasses and ice availability on the floor.  Will come again!

title: Very clean and pretty but a few things missing
text: The view and lobby are lovely. Very convenient to all the things!  The Nomo kitchen served a nice lunch  and the ambiance was outstanding! A few missing items though… no coffee/tea available in our room.  No small refrigerator either. The robes were also no longer provided. These things are nice extras most hotels- even boutique hotels -provide.   Could the Nomo be slipping a bit?  The staff was quick to respond when we asked for drinking glasses and bottled water but, should we have to request that?

title: I LOVE this Hotel!!
text: This is a wonderful little hotel hidden away in Soho, very close to the Canal St. subway stop. Excellent, friendly service and the view from our room on the 14th floor was stunning. Next time I'll ask for a higher floor but even the 14th was great in a queen corner suite. The rooftop deck looked nice but was closed for a private event so we couldn't go out there. The restaurant breakfasts were delicious and the service was super friendly! The only thing we didn't like was the fact that the coffee bar suddenly switched to independent ownership so we couldn't charge anything from there to our room. Plus the guy at the counter was very rude. He didn't work for the NoMo but they should know this. I wish they could keep that under their own management.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: We stayed in the king suite on the 20th floor had beautiful views! Room was clean and staff was friendly. Walking distance from awesome shopping, fun cafes, and restaurants. Entrance is definitely instagram friendly for those who love to take photos

title: Great location, clean and trendy, friendly staff
text: Great location, clean hotel, nice staff, comfortable stay! It was a good place to stay with friends. It’s a short walk to food, coffee, Duane Reade. You can grab dinner and drinks downstairs if you don’t feel like going out. The staff was friendly, we didn’t have to wait long for luggage, housekeeping or for elevator. It’s a trendy hotel and the rooms have a nice view

title: Hotel très bien situé au personnel agréable
text:
Très bonne literie et espace fonctionnel 
Prendre chambres en hauteur 
Idéal pour séjour court 
Quartier génial et animé, fabuleux pour le shopping 
Trop bruyant pour le Pt déjeuner mais autres options dans quartier

title: Great spot for girls weekend
text: Visited with friends for a college reunion. Fun hotel in a great location central and walkable to lots of shopping and restaurants. Nice staff and decor. Comfortable beds. Nicely done rooms. Great bar.

title: Hotel in soho
text: Super nice rooms, nice location and the food at the hotel was excellent. The service was on top, I can definitely recommend this place if you whant to eat, breath and live in soho. Best place for sure

title: Outstanding experience at this hotel
text: The front desk staff, especially Jasmin and Garcia make this hotel experience special from the time you arrive until you check out. They are the first faces and people you meet after a trying day of travel that make you feel that you arrived and are at the right place. There is nothing better than being welcomed to a temporary home away from people who care about a travelers experience. This makes a good hotel great!!!

title: Nice cosy hotel in Soho
text: Very nice hotel , large comfortable rooms, great beds and soft pillows : -). 2 bathrooms in the suite is much appreciated with the family ! unfortunately the staff at reception is not too nice but overall experience remains good !

title: This place was amazing
text: The best service, the host amber had the best vibe and energy and spoke really created such a great environment for our experience, our waiter Leyton was there when they needed to be, but wasn’t overwhelming and was incredibly helpful with the menu. Leyton had such a nice energy and was so easy to talk too!

title: Fun birthday dinner
text: Had a great birthday dinner with Leyton serving us! Would definitely come back here again.  The food was great and we got a bunch of dishes to share. Their cocktails were fun and different. Great spot for a bigger group or a private dinner and the aesthetic was perfect with the chandeliers!

title: Great Resturant and service
text: I was there with a large setting their staff was very attentive and food was great. Thanks Leyton. You were attentive to minute detail. And accommodated everyone adeptly. I lol KD foreword to visiting again.

title: Hotel di charme.
text: Tutto bene ma la mancanza del frigo bar e soprattutto del bollitore dell’acqua in camera vale una stella in meno. Camera e bagno con ottima vista nella camera Queen Superior. Il ristorante è davvero molto carino.

title: Hotel is Beautiful
text: Stayed at Nomo Soho for my birthday. Jeff at the front desk was professional, friendly, and very helpful with what sights to see and restaurants to eat at. The Hotel is beautiufuI. The views from my room were spectacular. Room was clean, bed was super comfy. Good Drinks and good eats what more can one ask for. I am planning my next stay in the summer.  I can't wait!

title: Awful awful awful
text:
Oh boy where do I begin on this vile hotel. I was traveling to my local headquarters in soho and this was the most convenient hotel. We have a special corporate rate and the pictures look nice. But I should have listened to the many many dreadful reviews. I’m surprised they have any good ones, but then again I’m not because the front desk agents practically begged me to write a review on multiple occasions . If they spent that much time trying to make you have a nice stay, that would probably be more beneficial. 
My room looked like a prison cell with zero embellishments to the rooms what so ever. A king size bed with only two pillows. Only one bath towel. No water in the room, no fridge/ mini bar, no coffee. I called down multiple times to request more towels and pillows and received nothing but horrible attitude from every staff member. I went down to talk to the manager. I was rudely dismissed by a boy named Tyler. I heard him say to his colleague as he walked away from me “it’s my last day. I don’t give a sh**”. Very professional. I had 3 of my colleagues with me who heard this as well. We will absolutely be taking our business elsewhere.

title: Great stay, great eats, and fantastic staff
text: Great stay at the hotel. The restaurant connected to the hotel is fantastic! The staff is super helpful and very professional. Especially loved my waiter, Leyton who served me for the two days I visited. He made me feel at home in the big apple :). I visit NYC every month for work and will be sure to stay and eat here again every time I can!

title: I love it here! :D
text: I had such a great time! My first time here was in 2017 and I decided to come back because I just love NoMo SoHo. Leyton (my server) was so great and he tended to all my needs. Would definitely recommend to family and friends. I can’t wait to come back! :)

title: Roaches, Staff Walk-in's & Room Key Galore.
text:
Our room keys were constantly demagnitized multiple times, everyday during our stay. Aside from my bed, the lobby is where i spent the majority of my time at the hotel.

On one occasion, my wife and son could not access our room because the key wouldn't work, again. Staff at front desk refused to give my wife and son a new key because they weren't listed on the reservation.

Instead of a phone call, I had to leave a major work event (the reason I was in NYC) to get yet, another room key card. This was extremely irritating. Guess what!? I had to get another card the next time I accessed the room.

The room had the LARGEST cockroaches I have ever seen. Roaches on Roids. 

Being on a tight schedule, it was frustrating not being able to get something as simple as coffee in the morning, because the concession area did not open on time 2 days in a row. Getting coffee at 7am at a 4 star hotel should never been an issue. Especially with the daily services charges guests incur. 

Worst of all, and why we will absolutely never come back is, I received a work-related-package and a staff member brought it to my door, with 1 quick and quiet knock, to subsequently open my door while my wife wasn't clothed was extremely bothersome and felt like a complete and utter invasion of privacy and should absolutely never happen.

My wife wanted to leave, but I insisted not to because I had enough work-related responsibilities during my visit. A new hotel and moving around is time consuming.

I also overheard a staff member speaking of another staff member in a negative light, using descriptive phrases such as the skinny weird guy... I felt embarrassed just hearing it as a guest.

As a New York native, I was disappointed to have this experience and wish I chose a better hotel for my son's first time in NYC. We travel a lot, and this, is by far a top 3 worst hotel experience's.

Hopefully the management can take this disappointing, but much need review and seek to make some changes to enhance people's experience, at what could be a GREAT hotel.

title: Quick trip to NYC
