text: Very comfy bed and linens. Small, but well appointed room. Staff attentive and kind.  Lovely approach to hotel with gorgeous plantings. Starbucks across the street and super convenient to restaurants and shopping.

title: Great SOHO Stay!
text: The room was clean and modern, service was prompt and friendly. Hotel is in a perfect location - near subways and great shopping.  Couldn’t have asked for a better SOHO experience! We will definitely be back soon.

title: Front desk manager Jennifer C
text: I’m here working for most of the week, alone and missing my family. I have signed up for the “iPrefer” rewards program but have 0 points for upgrades or specials. Jennifer listened, and quickly, efficiently found me a room that met my needs for work (this isn’t a business traveler hotel, typically). To do so, she upgraded me without hesitation or extra fees and costs. She later checked in with me to make sure I had everything I needed, and then when I ordered dinner and didn’t want the delivery guy to come directly to my room (the typical practice), Jennifer ran the delivery to my room.  She refused my grateful tip, too.  Kudos to NoMo Soho for finding Jennifer!!

title: Excellent location and view very mediocre rooms amenities
text: Super nice location in the middle of the Soho. Excellent view to the city (in upper floors). The maintenance condition of the rooms and the showers are not in good shape and repairs are immediately needed

title: Outstanding hotel choice in NYC
text: Excellent Hotel!!!! Superb customer service - ALL  staff were friendly and eager to make  our stay special! Location is spectacular for visiting SoHo and surrounding areas. Lobby is very welcoming and  the restaurant was delicious!  Can’t wait to return!  Keep up the exceptional job!!

title: Ruined holiday
text: Spent 3 nights in NYC as part of a US holiday with my partner. I stayed at the hotel back when it was the Mondrian Soho 10 years ago, and was expecting a similar experience. I was excited for my partner to see what I was telling him about for the past 2 years. Sadly, I was gutted for what we experienced. The hotel was never renovated and still has the same blue carpets and furniture, though now old and minging. Went to the restaurant for a bevvy before heading out to dinner, but the bartender seemed rudely indifferent and his martini was bloody disgusting. The one and only good thing was a nice conversation with a lad who was a luggage porter in the morning who gave us some nice restaurant suggestions.

title: Worst hotel in NYC
text: I was on this trip with my fiancée and I won’t even begin to touch on the room quality which includes not a single amenity, stained sheets, ripped curtains, chipped headboards, hair in the bathroom, mold in the shower, torn carpet, and only two pillows for a king bed. But the absolute worst was the service received. Checkin was a nightmare. When we finally got to the room after our key failed to work the first 4x, we found pretty severe damage to our bathroom ceiling. We asked to move rooms after a day due to our key rarely working. This was a big mistake. Our room flooded and a lot of our belongings completely ruined. The worst was the apathetic attitude received from staff and management. We asked repeatedly to speak to the general manager as we were getting no where with the staff, not a single apology or refund for a major flood in our room. Apparently it was impossible to speak to Patrick, the general manager.  Not sure why, since If escalated, he should be willing to speak to an unhappy guest. We tried the next 5 days to get a hold of him in person or over the phone. His voicemail is full, he doesn’t respond to email, and he is at all times not at the hotel to speak in person. We eventually gave up but to this day not a penny of a refund for our $500+ in damaged clothing and shoes or a refund for the flooded room we paid for.

title: Fabulous restaurant
text: Fabulous afternoon at this gorgeous restaurant. We were initially disappointed because we were looking forward to brunch as we didn’t know there were certain times for it. However our waiter Leyton was a very kind and entertaining server who made our experience even more delightful and the lunch was also absolutely stunning . 10/10 experience

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: My daughter lives on Crosby street and recommended this hotel. Everyone was great,…The front desk employees; housekeepers, young guy in the coffee shop , restaurant hostesses, Michael and the curly mustache gentlemen at the bar. However; The doormen/security(?) always seemed to be preoccupied.

title: All style and no substance.
text: The hotel is in a great location, really close to a subway station.  Our welcome on check in was disinterested verging on rude, not something we are used to from quality hotels.  The receptionist seemed to think one complimentary bottle of water on our first day was a great thing. Our room was a classic queen and small.  There is a small wordrobe and no drawer space so we could not put suitcases away.  We ate breakfast once, and it was fine but there is no concept of sutainability; even if you eat in you get paper cups, plastic cups for cereal and paper plates.  The mind boggles at the terrible waste of this.  This is the first hotel I have been to in years, where they do not give you the option of leaving towels on the rack to show you are happy to use them again, so our towels were changed every day..sustainability folks!  Climate change!  However checkout is what is leaving me in despair.  Again, a rude member of staff with a curt 'write your email, we'll send the bill shortly'.  12 HOURS LATER, an incredibly wrong bill arrived charging us for meals and drinks we did not take in the hotel.  Given we checked out at 6.30 AM and the cafe opens for breakfast at 7, I am keen for them to explain how we ate breakfast with them on our last day.  So far I am over $200 down due to their incompetence. It's all a bit too cool for school, with poor service, rude staff.  They booked us a car to the airport for a flat $85, we paid with $100 and the driver kept the change without us telling him to.

title: EXCELLENT service and great food
text: Our server Leyton was super nice and so friendly! He was the best server ever! Such great service for my birthday and the food was AMAZING! Top tier experience and would definitely come here again! It was a great end to my birthday :))

title: Leyton ROCKS
text: Leyton was the best! He was very kind and sweet. SUPER friendly and very accommodating. Would 100% refer him to other friends that would like to visit this restaurant. He spoke to us frequently to make sure we were okay with our meal!

title: Another Great Experience
text: This was the third time our group has stayed at the NoMo Soho Hotel. The staff and accommodations are excellent! They treated all of our guest with extra care. We will certainly be back! Erica and Mirian in Management are top-shelf.

title: Inappropriate Staff interactions
text: Stayed for our honeymoon staycation in New York City with my husband. Upon calling to make a reservation, when mentioning to the gentleman on the phone that we were celebrating the special occasion, his response was very inappropriate saying “you’re going to get it hot tonight”… I hung up and booked through a third party site instead. Upon check in, the lady who checked us in was very monotone the entire interaction making it feel like a transaction rather than an exciting moment and couldn’t even be bothered to ask about our reason for joining or mentioning anything about the hotel. That said, housekeeping staff were as exceptional and super attentive and friendly. Upon checkout, we brought our negative experience to the manager on duty to which her response was that their reservations team is third party and pretty much there’s nothing she can do. She proceeded to check us out. No compensation, no offer for a coffee or any sort of proper apology was provided. Won’t be staying again.

title: Overrated
text: Went for brunch, had a poor experience. Food was cold, staff was overwhelmed and the restaurant just felt and looked dirty. Won’t be back. There are plenty of other good places in Soho worth going instead of Nomo Kitchen that are just as trendy but overall better.

title: Sunday Brunch
text: Came here for brunch with friends. The atmosphere of the hotel and restaurant was aesthetically pleasant. Our server Leyton made our experience worth it. The food was amazing and the service top tier

title: Birthday Brunch
text: Leyton is the best!!! he was so accommodating & super friendly!!! he made our experience so great & was on top of refills & asking if we were okay. we were a big party of 8 so it’s not easy to maintain that!

title: Awesome place with awesome people
text: Stayed here with my girlfriend nice and comfy room’s little small in size but the view fill in for it. Through the weekend had brunch and dinner in the restaurant. Staff is great and attentive. My girlfriend loved the stake and sent compliments to the Chef. Chef amid also came to table side to say hi. That’s a great gesture from the chef. He took time from his busy time to see us. I’ll be visiting again this gem. Keep on the great work “Nomo soho”.

title: Great spot to stay at in SoHo
text: Nice, laid-back hotel, very friendly and helpful staff; excellent location and great views from the higher floors; good breakfast plus a really convenient "early bird" option with coffee and pastries even before full breakfast opens; decent gym room

title: This was my first time at the NoMo SoHo and I will definitely be back
text:
I travel to the city quite frequently for business and pleasure. This was my first time staying at the NoMo SoHo and I will definitely be back. The location was central that everything that you need. 

The room was clean, unbelievably quiet for sleeping, and the elevators were lickety-split. I know the last comment is probably silly but it’s pretty important to me. There’s nothing worse than to be waiting for an elevator for 10 minutes.

title: nice from the outside
text: I spent 2 night at the hotel. it's nice on the outside with seemingly nice restaurant (didn't eat there) . However the rest of the premises doesn't live up to the promise especially for the price point. Location is very good.

title: Organized and professional
text: I had a wonderful  with my family for vacation. The hotel was hygienic and very organized. The food was incredible considering the protein content and also varieties as per my diet plan. This gave me a confidence throughout my stay. I would recommend such experience.

title: Excellent service, great experience
text: The scenery is beautiful. The atmosphere is exquisite. The portions are small, but filling. My waiter, Leyton, was very nice and even gave free apple cider to us. First time here and would love to come again!

title: Good service with chill environment
text: Ley Ton brought us really good service. We had a small talk and he introduced the restaurant for us. Then, he gave us some beverages for free. That's so sweet for him aww. And the glass house is good for taking pictures too, especially when the weather is nice.

title: Great experience and good food.
text:
I stayed in the hotel for a week and I found the environment very healthy even in the prime of the city. 
I met the chef Amit to ask on how they were able to achieve such hygiene and also good quality of food. It was a very good experience overall.
I insist people to stay and have fun.

title: 28th Birthday Party
text:
My 28th birthday party at Nina's in Nomo Soho was amazing. The staff was SO accommodating and people said the party was truly amazing. From the bartenders, to pre planning and day of, I would recommend anyone to have a party here!

-Remi Bader

title: The NoMo is a GoGo!!
text:
The NoMo is a fun & funky boutique hotel with great staff that we will 100% stay at again! We had a 3-night stay and have nothing but great things to say... friendly, polite, accommodating staff on all levels...from check-in (where we were accommodated a corner room on the 15th floor with a great view) to the great resto recommendations by the knowledgeable team at the front desk to the sweet thank you note from the cleaning staff for a tip left in the room!!

The beds are very comfortable, the bathroom & shower were great - big enough for our family of 3...

The location is ideal...we walked & subwayed everywhere! 

We look forward to staying again on a future trip to NYC!

title: Hospitality at its Highest Level !!
text: Arrived at the property pretty late and requested an upgrade, the room was amazing but on a high floor which I was grateful for although I asked if there was a room on a lower floor with the upgrade. The manager Anson immediately showed me a couple of rooms that matched what I was looking for and quickly got me settled in. I appreciate his efforts and won’t forget it !!

title: Must Stay
text: Stayed the weekend for my girlfriend birthday.  Jeff who works the front was extremely nice and helpful with my stay. Very knowledgeable of the area. Give us numerous recommendations. The lounge was a nice place to get a drink and listen to music.

title: Can’t say enough great things!
text:
I booked the premium king room for two nights (18&19th of March). I put in a request when booking that it was a birthday surprise trip for my significant other and i would love a room with a great view. Not only did they accommodate my request, I got a personal email addressing my requests the morning of my arrival acknowledging my stay, wishing him a happy birthday, assuring me she put me in a room with a great view & asking if I needed anything else from the guest relations manager Jennifer C. She is a GEM! She was so great with communication and always a step ahead. Ontop of giving me a GREAT corner view room, she hand wrote a note and had a birthday surprise delivered to the room shortly after we arrived! The room was clean and the decor is beautiful. It was quiet and anytime we needed anything they were so quick to take care of it HAPPILY! Also the entry way is a great photo op, along with the area it’s in. Tons of restaurants and shopping and train access! 
Give it a try, and definitely book the premium king or better. Get the full experience :) 

THANK YOU JENNIFER AND NOMO SOHO!

title: Perfect location
text: Hotel very nice. We had two queen beds on 19th floor with great view of city. Staff very welcoming.  Found the resort fee ridiculous however, No pool, no exercise room, no free breakfast. When asked what this resort fee was good for I was handed a list of useless items like ten percent off items I would not purchase anyway.  That was my only gripe. Very clean and modern. Easy access to subways and waling distance to Chinatown and Little Italy

title: Amazon views and great customer service!
text: I stood there for a few day and what stood out to me was Jeffrey Urbina customers service and professionalism. He's great at what he does, definitely will recommend nomo soho to family and friends. ....

title: Excellent
text: We had brunch on 18th March ,it was amazing ,nice archway ,nice restaurant,we had good food ,me and my wife was celebrating our anniversary,we spoke to Manger Toku ,we told him that it’s our anniversary,he brought us slice of cake with candle on it ! We loved it ! Will be back again .

title: Staff make all the difference.
text: 3rd time in NYC but first time we stayed Downtown. Chose the Nomo Soho on Crosby St. What a beautiful place! Close to great restaurants, bars & convenience stores (useful). But, as good as the holiday was, occasionally someone steps up and makes it stellar. That person was Jeffrey. What a star! All the staff were good but Jeffry went the extra mile and turned what was a good holiday into a truly memorable one. Hats off to you sir!

title: Old hotel that should’ve been renovated
text:
Lobby, and dining room beautiful, renovated for Instagram pictures… but rooms haven’t change in 12 years (have been customer of this hotel for 12years).
No minibar due to Covid… 2 years after !
Carpet dirty, curtains scratched with holes, can’t close the door of bathroom cause of humidity, smell humidity in the room, window let the air go through… honestly every year I come it getting worse and worse. That was my last time in that hotel. Will come
With please after they renovate rooms.

title: Food and View
text: Stayed here for couple of days nice rooms nice view from the rooms had a great brunch in the in-house restaurant food was good met with the Indian chef. I’ll also recommend to check out this hotel with some good food great view and the entrance is cherry on the top.

title: Stay at Nomo Soho.
text:
Not too happy about this stay. The room was too small. All the amenities are on request. I can understand the fridge is on request but the hair dryer and the coffee maker?
I was charged the accidental deposit twice and it's $150 per night. The room credit wasn't applied at the check out and I already called the hotel three times to straighten it out. So far - no luck.

title: Excellent service
text: Its was really amazing service I received there food was so delicious nice environment and  food runner Imran hussain is very helpfull friendly and kind thank you for nice service we will come back again

title: Excellent service
text: It was really good service. I loved the food. The employee was super nice "IMRAN HUSSAIN" thank you. I will come back. The environment was also clean and nice. I will celebrate my next birthday here for sure.

title: Great time at the Interpafums event
text: I really enjoyed myself at the Venue & met fantastic people as well. It was very well organized & met Erica Who works in the venue of the event, she was amazing and very fun person to talk to.  Overall 5 Stars.

title: Leadership Off-site
text: Wow! And wow a thousand times. Hosted a Leadership off-site ELT, the customer service and food, experience…PRICELESS!  We’re going back for the next one. Erica Figueroa was our Event Manager, ask for her; attention to detail, thinks ahead and client satisfaction driven!!!  Book the Penthouse!!!

title: Excellent food
text: Excellent service. Nice staff, and more importantly I met chef Amit Sharma because I loved the food so much that I could not resist lol. I suggest everyone to must visit there because it’s fully worth it

title: Great experience! Amazing service 😬
text: Great hotel, really pleasant and clean rooms, but the thing that makes this such a good place to stay are the staff. Especially, Jeffrey Urbina. Great service. He helped me from the moment I got there to the moment I left; Very generous with his time.

title: Dinner service
text:
Thank you Leyton for looking after us! You made our last minute decision to have dinner at Nomo Soho very special. Nothing was a problem even when I asked for Sourdough bread you went and found it for us. 
Will definitely be back. 
Also we made it just him time before the kitchen closed and you didn’t look at your watch once unlike the other lady. 
10/10 from us.

title: AMAZING BUSINESS EVENTS AT THE NOMO PENTHOUSE!
text: We hosted 1 business Seminar back in 2022 at the Nomo and recently organized 2 Retailers Events in the Penthouse - The Event & Planning Team were amazing partners: easy communication, efficient organization and always reachable! Great Job Erica, Poli! But also a big thank you to the Nomo Kitchen Team for always being so helpful to accomodate everyone's expectations - Iwona has been a key player in our event + Angelo leading the cocktails and table service. I would highly recommend you to host a business event there -> these people have been great partners! BIG thank you all!

title: See you again soon!
text: NoMo is fantastic for my business meetings. Thanks Erica (Figueroa).  You went above and beyond to accommodate all requests and make our two day event special.  The staff is knowledgeable and fantastic, the catering staff is professional and amazing. We always have a great time. The Penthouse Suite is gorgeous! The decor and ambiance throughout this boutique hotel is fabulous. It's clean, quiet and smells divine the second you walk in.  I was also surprised to see how close it is to the subway.  Guests were able to find their way very easily.  I was able to also park nearby.

title: Bad service and many problems
text: The lock on the door of our room didn’t work. We came back one day and it wasn’t locked at all (!!) despite locking when we left in the morning.  They came up and fixed it but then claimed at check out they had “no record” of this (huge!) problem and didn’t do a single thing to try to make it right.  The lock continued to malfunction throughout the trip and we had to request new keys almost daily because it kept not working; but at least it was unlocked just the once as far as we know.  They also failed to make up our sofa bed when we first arrived until being asked for the third time, way after we wanted to use the bed.  The bathroom doors also didn’t close all the way, which is just awkward for everyone.  The location is great, but the hotel itself was a blight on an otherwise great trip.

title: Great place great food
text: I went stayed here for two days and my stay was nice and comfy the staff is great and very helpful had great time and good overall and had dinner some great dishes like the Asian style cauliflower and the gnocchi met the chef (Ahmet). Will visit again soon.

title: Amazing Vacation!
text: One of the best experiences I’ve had at a hotel in a long time! The service is exceptional especially at the front desk checking in. Jeffrey was extremely friendly, and made check-in a breeze! He even gave amazing recommendations on restaurants/things to do in the area. I will definitely recommend NoMo to my friends/family that will be traveling to NYC!

title: Beautiful Hotel / Terrible Experience
text: NoMo is a great hotel with an excellent location and cute, instagrammy vibes. However, the staff (at reception and on the phone) is just rude and unhelpful - they charged me twice for my stay, twice for a deposit, and can't even assist with basic things such as an invoice.  I would never stay here again because it is excruciating to go through multiple follow ups for basic assistance.

title: Añ
text: My stayed my was great, I stayed at nomo for 8 months, basically it was my house lol, coming from miami to New York was a big change but thanks to Jeffrey from the front desk made my stay very pleasant, Jeffrey has great customer service skills, even better than the managers there.

title: Wonderful atmosphere and beautiful location
text: I loved my time at this hotel. It is so well kept and the location was fantastic. My view was phenomenal. The check in experience with Jeffrey was super smooth. He had answers to all my questions. He was knowledgeable about the neighborhood and his recommendation were highly appreciated. I will certainly be back.

title: amazing staff
text: I came here with my husband for our anniversary and we had an AMAZING time. Quick and responsive Front Desk staff. Great shopping area and restaurants nearby too. i will certainly be coming back to the nomo soho in the summer for a trip with my entire family. Loved my stay overall😁

title: Perfect hotel for staycations
text: Booked a suite for a staycation 2 weeks ago and  exceeded my expectations. Wonderful living room and great views of Brooklyn bridge, Starbucks across the street and good gym as well. Has 10-25% off of Bloomingdale’s in soho which is a great benefit as well as others. Very comfortable bed and modern living space, bedroom and bathroom. I didn’t go to the restaurant downstairs but heard good things about it from friends. Overall a must try hotel in soho.

title: Not worth the money
text: My stay at NomoSoho was mediocre at best. I wasn’t a big fan of how tight the room was, room service came in and threw away food that was packed away that we weren’t finished with but didn’t clean old food out on the table. We were in the lobby taking photos and the staff unpleasantly came up to us and asked if we were staying there and asked to see our room key. Its over charged and not worth it. I wont be staying there again.

title: We were disappointed, we expected more from this hotel
text: We heard no more than yes. We were not given any information about the hotel upon check in. They made us paid $50 for checking out one hour later after asking in advance. Over all we were disappointed as the hotel has a premium price.

title: Not sure I’d stay here again
text:
Cons: Walls are fairly thin so you really hear everything. There are no mini refrigerators or coffee pots in the rooms and there are no ice machines in the building. If you want ice, you have to go to the restaurant/bar. If the bar isn't open, no ice. The first time I asked for ice at the bar, I got 3 cubes. I found this very unusual and probably my biggest frustration. That and breakfast. 

Breakfast does not open until 8:00. What??? Why?? A Breakfast credit was included in my reservation. It was super frustrating waiting until 8 to get coffee and food, and a big crowd  rushes in at 8:00, so getting food is a slow process. Pro move - Arrive early. 
Get seated first and order instantly. They don’t offer to-go options for coffee or food. Also the online menu is completely different from the menu in the restaurant. 

The bathroom is fairly open to the main room, so it is not super private. The shower didn’t drain at all. 

I was offered a late checkout then locked out of the room twice. I spent 20 minutes each time waiting to get my key card reset.
Sigh. 

There is no informational paperwork in the hotel room - how to order room service, what floors are things located on, restaurant hours, fire safety, how to use the TV etc. 

Pros: The entire staff was very nice. From housekeeping to the front desk. They were lovely. The concierge booked a wonderful driver to the airport ($85 to jfk) The hotel is in a safe area and I felt comfortable walking around at night, alone. The view from my room was lovely. If you want a nice view, stay on floor 16 or higher. The entrance is IG worthy and looks wonderful at night. The hotel delivered bubbly water on my first night which was nice. 

Result: Overall I'm not sure I'd stay here again.

title: Great views comfy hotel
text:
It is great for the price and quality. The neighborhood is nice and less touristic than midtown with good restaurants around. It is well connected to the airport and easy to walk around the city. 
The room is clean, the views are great and it is overall comfortable.

title: Going down hill
text: We have been coming to Nomo SoHo for about 5 years.  The last 2 years we have started to see some not so favorable changes and neglect.  This past year we stayed over Christmas and the room did not even have a mini refrigerator in the room. The hotel needs fresh coat of paint and updated furniture. We recommended this hotel to 2 separate friend groups  that traveled around the same time as we did and once we got to the hotel and in the room, I was so embarrassed that I recommended this place. Where did the art work go through out  the hotel and the cute boutique when you enter the amazing restaurant. The wine bar area?  The hotel is such a gem and in the heart of an amazing area of the city.  However, the great customer service and amazing cocktails and food have not changed.  Nomo please make some changes back to when you had standards.

title: Overall Nice Stay, Rooms need some updating
text:
We had a nice time at the hotel. The rooms are starting to show their age. The shower grout needed attention, the safe handle was completely broken but did not affect the functionality of it, one of the outlets wasn't working and one light flickered like a strobe light if on for more than a few minutes. The headboard was peeling off, not just a little, a lot-really needs to be re-covered or replaced. It looks really bad. The room needs to be updated with USB outlets or something that can hold a USB outlet.

The lobby/hotel smelled delightful and was decorated beautifully. My two sisters and I are sensitive to smells (causes migraines) but all three of us couldn't get over how nice it smelled. We were very impressed by how fast the service was. I requested 2 extra pillows and they were at the door in less than 5 minutes. We upgraded the room and it said it included a fridge but it wasn't in the room so when I requested it, same thing, it was there in 5 minutes and it was the COLDEST fridge. NEVER have I had a hotel fridge that worked so well. Check-out and check-in were easy. We didn't eat at the restaurant but I did have drinks at the bar and the service was good. We ordered room service one evening and the menu was a little disappointing. The food arrived hot in to go boxes but was nothing too exciting. I would not recommend room service to anyone. 

All in all, we had a good experience. The cost was very reasonable. I just recommend trying to do a little updating to the rooms.  I think it would be nice during the summer when the rooftop and outdoor area are open. If you're looking for a decent place to stay, with a great location in Soho, I would recommend Nomo Soho.

title: Gutted that it wasn’t the same as before
text:
Disappointed and wouldn’t recommend.
This is our second time in Nomo (5 years between) and not a review I wanted to write.
Firstly the good, the place looks amazing and the funky decor is awesome if you’re into instagram and your vacation looking good on social media then this is the place for you. The rooms are clean, although we had clothes from the previous guest in the drawers, very easy to overlook by housekeeping so easily forgiven. Towels are changed daily but we had to remind housekeeping each morning there was three of us in order to get the right amount, again not a biggie but it slows you down from getting ready.
Now the bad, not a great place for the international traveler, the place basically closes at 10pm so no food or drink available at all after that, and with no tea and coffee making facilities in the room or mini bar/fridge the only option is to get a bottle of water from reception if you are thirsty or arrive late. Personally we had to drag ourselves round to Little Italy to get a late night bite after our journey which wasn’t great and totally unexpected from a hotel that sells itself above budget. 
Checking in was a ruthless, emotionless affair, front desk is the first impression and this was not the best, I should mention that on day three we met Angie on reception and she is the best, cheery, professional, courteous, the whole nine yards. 
We also had to go back to reception as the room wasn’t made up for a family as we had booked, sorted reasonably quickly in fairness. It should also be noted that you have to give $150 a night deposit for sundries so if you are on a budget and here for a while then this needs to be taken into account, it’s all in the booking conditions but should be mentioned as most people don’t go to that detail. Handy though and probably the hotels plan to encourage the use of room service but trying to get through on the phone to room service is an experience and be prepared to be hung up on if they are busy. The room service food is really, really good however it comes in a takeaway box and not on a plate with no cutlery or salt/pepper, napkins etc so best not to get the chicken as this comes with polenta and sautéed veg, get a burger as this is easier to eat with your hands. Also and more frustrating is that we got the food in takeout boxes in a bag, no big deal but we got charged two tray charges for the one bag and the hotel helped themselves to a $15 tip, $27 to get takeaway sent to the room seems extortionate so be mindful that the money you leave as a deposit needs to be checked on departure, even though you have not actually been waited on you will pay a full tip, when this was questioned at reception I got a cold stare and we had to accept it. Buyer beware….  The $6 tray charge and tip of €6 for bringing water on the first day seemed cheap in comparison. 

The showers aren’t very user friendly so be prepared for a cold blast as you negotiate the taps, interestingly the shower window has no privacy glass, fine if you are an exhibitionist but if you don’t want the neighbours in the next buildings to see you washing then pull down the semi opaque blinds.

The aircon in the room is noisy, needs a service and quite annoying at night, having a drink would help with the sleep but this needs to be done before ten……

In summary, if you want your break to look amazing but not BE amazing then come to Nomo, if however you want excellent service and to feel that your destination goes above the bare minimum then maybe use one of the hundreds of other top hotels Manhattan has to offer. Sadly my next trip won’t be here and it’s such a shame as this place could be golden. A bit gutted to be honest as this was “our” NY hotel and I’m hoping they improve as the location is really good and it feels like you are in New York and not the tourist area.

title: Not safe
text: Not safe place , horrible customer service, saw rats inside the hotel , got stuck in the bathroom due to maintenance problems door was broken and got stuck , too much money for no service no one helped with my bags , kids slept with no blankets … don’t stay at the this hotel

title: Dreadful service, poor amenities, basic room
text:
Oversold the room. To pay over $220 a night for a room with no tea and coffee making facilities or minibar and a very basic, poorly decorated room. Service appalling. Bar and kitchen closed every time we asked for service. Tea and coffee $18.50. When we complained the manager did not offer anything or apologise but was rude and dismissive. 
A shame as it is a great location and very comfortable bed.

title: Christmas stay in NYC
text:
I'm not usually one to write reviews but I feel that I need to counterbalance the recent negative revies NOMO SOHO has received. Myself and my wife spent 8 nights there over the festive period and all aspects of our stay were great.

Location wise the hotel was perfect for us. You're surrounded by great restaurants and bars and also really close to Little Italy and Chinatown.  You're not right in the centre of Manhattan but with the hotel's proximity to Canal Street station and the express trains that stop there you can be in Midtown/Times Square in 10-15 minutes.

We found the service to be fantastic. I sent an e-mail prior to arriving requesting a room on a high floor to fully appreciate the great views that the hotel affords, I also mentioned that we'd be celebrating an anniversary while we were there. When we got to the we were delighted to see that we'd been given a room on the 25th floor (photo of view attached) and there was also a hand-written card and some festive cookies left for us, it was a little touch that was greatly appreciated. During our first night my wife had a slight allergic rection to the feather pillows in the room, we popped to the front desk on our way out the next morning to ask them to be replaced and by the time we returned some new synthetic pillows had been put on the bed. The staff at the front desk were always really friendly and accommodating as were the night porters when we returned to the hotel every evening. 

We stayed in a King Suite which at the time of booking was similarly priced to most regular hotel rooms in Manhattan, it was a great size and was always cleaned to a high standard. We also loved the Chromecast option on the TV's allowing you to stream Netflix, Amazon etc....from your phone.  As for the complaints about the lack of coffee making facilities, who comes to NYC to drink poor coffee in their room????, there's loads of amazing cafes literally on your doorstep.

We didn't eat in the restaurant, but the space looked amazing, and food smelled delicious whenever we walked through reception. 

Overall we had a great experience at NOMO SOHO and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again when we next return to NYC.

title: Disappointed
text: Disappointed to not see ice buckets, coffee maker etc in room.  Additionally, room was said to sleep 4 and we had 3 but sofa couch was not set up with sheets available etc. and had to call multiple times over the course of 4 hours to receive sheets etc.  Housekeeping staff did a great job.  Was charged for early arrival but did not receive room until 4:30 pm after check in.  Was double charged daily for donation fee.  Location was solid, and obviously hotel is focused on instagram moments and not quality service which is unfortunate-as the hotel has great potential.  We are iPreferred members-just overall not the hospitality I am used to from other iPreferred and favorite hotels.

title: Inconsistency throughout hotel
text: Not a great location. Far from most sights. Poor value for the money. Tiny room with ripped, wet carpet from bathroom shower and strong musty odor. Very hot and poor air quality. Positives were comfortable bed and great view. But felt like sleeping in a dirty locker room. We had a late checkin at 9pm and only offer was a huge fan to try to flow the carpet dry but we were exhausted, so just suffered. No quality checks on the room.

title: Great location and interesting hotel but a lot of missteps
text:
Really wanted to love this hotel, but there were a lot of missteps for the pricepoint.

Customer service overall was unimpressive (esp. with regards to front desk help), and it felt like a flophouse a lot of times we walked through the lobby. Lots of random people literally passed out on the chairs and people in the walkways at most times of the day. 

We joked a lot that it almost seemed like the hotel didn’t seem to know what exactly their aesthetic was. Are the people hanging out actually guests? People off the street? Who knows? Certainly not the hotel staff. 

Paying this much for a hotel in a fairly exclusive location and seeing people passed out with a fast food bags laying on their chest at 2pm in the afternoon was a bit much. In the lobby. In front of hotel staff. I guess that's the look they're going for? 
Too cool for me.

Service lacks. Need a cab called or general info about something? Eh. “Cabs don't come down Crosby. You can try to walk up to canal there's cabs there usually.” is the likely response you’re going to get from the front desk. That's what I got at least. No problem, we found a cab. Just odd, the lack of any effort whatsoever. Especially since cabs actually do come down Crosby all the time. We both caught and left them there. Maybe we weren't important enough or something? Calling a cab is a pretty basic thing to ask from the front desk. 

Good thing we are very experienced travelers and have spent a ton of time in NYC before. I feel bad for the guests that are new in town.

Beautiful (but dated and a bit worn) hotel. Great location. Weird lobby/hangout area. Seems like there’s zero effort to enforce security or dissuade non-guests from using public spaces. The lighted instagram-ready walkway is beautiful, but there's people constantly hanging out in it from off the street taking pictures that often won't move out of the way for guests just trying to get by.

Check out the lobster place across the street btw. The staff is awesome and the food is great.

NoMo SoHo seems to still be trying to figure out what exactly it is (is it a hotel? A very expensive bed and breakfast? A hangout? An insta spot?). Anyway we did enjoy our stay because we enjoy the city, our own company, and the room itself was great (also the housecleaning staff was exceptional and friendly)  just were confused about the experience a bit.

title: Not luxurious, Not service oriented
text:
My family was looking forward to staying in this reportedly luxury boutique hotel in the SoHo area; however the experience with this hotel did not come close to meet even minimal expectations. 
First: We arrived at 4 pm for check in, our room wasn’t available until 6:30pm. We were told our room was not available because it was currently occupied by a visitor using a day rate and needed to be cleaned. Why would a room I had reserved had been given to someone for day use? I was informed my checkout time would remain 12 noon. 
There was no offer to upgrade, no offer for breakfast to be included or even a bottle of water or cocktail while we were waiting 2 1/2 hours. 
.
Second: there was mildew in the shower, I had to wear flip flops in the shower. Then the faucet handle to switch to the hand held shower wand the faucet handle came off in my hand when attempting to use. 
.
Third, we requested an additional blanket, we were told someone would bring one right up. 4 hours later we had to call back to remind them of the earlier request. 
. 
Fourth, While waiting at registration desk to have my key card reset I witnessed the Manager(?) on duty very rudely chastise another guest who was reporting her room concerns. I was embarrassed to be made to  witness how the hotel associate responded to this other hotel guest in such an immature, disrespectful, unprofessional way. 
.
The service and rooms in this hotel are not at a level one would consider luxurious, rooms are not well maintained or offer anything special compared with rooms at similar rates.

title: This once luxury hotel has broken fixtures and the rudest manager in hotel history. AVOID!!!!
text:
I have stayed at this formerly excellent hotel at least ten times for multi-night stays in the last two years and while there are often small issues, we chose to stay there repeatedly because the staff was excellent and the location perfect. They are also a member of Preferred Hotels, which usually guarantees a nice stay.

 I’m afraid the hotel must be having major fiscal issues because our three rooms I booked for last night were treated to the most abysmal customer service and problematic rooms I have ever experienced. It made a Motel 6 look like the St. Regis. 

I had booked three rooms: two King Suites (each for three people) and one Double Double Deluxe. I knew there would be a problem at check-in because our three person King Suites were the “07” rooms. Although all of the King Suites cost the same, there is a big difference between the “01” rooms (such as 2201) and “07” rooms. The living room area is significantly bigger in the 01 rooms, which allows them to accommodate three adults, whereas the 07 rooms can only accommodate two. 

The reason for this is because the living room is so small in the 07 rooms, the couches cannot pull out without creating a fire hazard. I learned this first hand by being assigned one of these room in October or 2021 and the hotel website will not allow you to book three adults into that room type. When the couch is folded out, there is absolutely no floor space leading the bathroom or the exit door. 

Nonetheless, we were booked into 1407 and 2107. As soon as I got the assignment, I explained it was going to be a problem. I told the front desk clerk that I have been in every room type at the hotel and I know these rooms cannot accommodate three adults. There was some consternation and Zeta, the Front Desk Manager made her first appearance as “The Worst Person to Ever Work in a Customer Service Position”. 

It is very important for anyone reading this to understand the following: the night before check-in, I got three separate emails (for each room) offering me upgraded room types for an upcharge. Furthermore, I had checked their website prior to starting a discussion about the room size to see what was currently listed as available. The Balcony King Suite, which has the larger footprint, and a balcony was available, in addition to other King Suites. 

Zeta started the conversation by firmly stating, “I’m sorry, there are no other rooms. We are completely sold out.” I pointed out that by law, we are not allowed to have three adults in the smaller room types. Apparently a glitch on the mobile site (or in the integration between their website and the Preferred Hotel booking site) booked the rooms with one person instead of three in each. Rather than acknowledging the likeliest reason for the mistake was a site glitch, Zeta repeatedly accused me of purposely booking it for one to save money. My previous experiences with the hotel booking site has been that the price is almost always the same, but if she had taken into consideration I never book one person into a room, she might have thought twice before accusing me of being too cheap to include the correct number of people. 

After telling me several times there were no other rooms available, Zeta took me to two other rooms that were available. One was the Queen Suite with the larger living room and the other was the Studio Balcony, which is a single room with one King bed. The latter was absolutely ridiculous as a suggestion because she knew we were traveling as three adults. We opted for the Queen Suite and despite that suite being less money per night than our original booking, she still charged us the higher rate (as evidenced by the invoice at check out. 

The Double Double room was an even bigger issue. The room wasn’t available at 4PM check in. In an effort not to be more of a problem, I said it was fine that it was still being cleaned. We would store our friends’ luggage in our room. We checked again at 5 and the room was still not available. When we checked again at 6:00, the front desk clerk apologized and said that the hourly customer they had booked into that room hadn’t left yet. Despite having already given us a terrible customer experience, Zeta made one of our rooms wait while an hourly customer did God-Knows-What in our room. When I complained that this was utterly unacceptable, she repeated the “the hotel is sold out” line, despite having just shown us two rooms that were definitely available. I pointed out this out to her and she said, “you didn’t pay for those room types. You can’t have them.” 

As you can imagine, there was a very heated argument because of all of this. An allegedly luxury hotel doesn’t book hourly rates, but more importantly, if they accidentally double book, they should do whatever they can to accommodate the mistake, not insult the customer. 

Because that is what Zeta did. Zeta insulted me. She also took several steps back from the counter, crossed her arms and stared at me for several minutes. When I didn’t say anything, she said, “Are you done?” In the most condescending way possible. 

This kind of behavior went on for some time. Whenever I asked who her direct supervisor was, she said he was on vacation. I found out later that it was someone named “Patrick” and he would be gone for two weeks. I was told by Zeta that a different manager would be available in the morning. When my husband and I walked to the front desk this morning, Zeta was standing there, smirking at us. There was no one to talk to us. We could call Patrick in two week. It wasn’t until the very uncomfortable front desk representative finally pointed out that Sara, the Rooms Director, was in-house, that Zeta went to go get her. The entire time we were talking to Sara, Zeta stood at the front desk, ignoring other customers, and stared, smirking at us. Sara promised to contact us as to how to resolve the situation, although we still haven’t heard anything. 

In addition to the insulting way in which Zeta treated my entire party, the hotel is beginning to fall apart. The hourly rate is a bad sign, but so was the faucet handle that came off in room 1110. There were no glasses in 509 and the outlet connected to one of the metal side tables was detached, causing the table to “hum” with electricity. One of the bathroom light bulbs were out. On our last visit two weeks ago, the sink and shower ledge in 2201 were FILTHY. You could scrape the dirt off of both with your finger nail, which made it obvious it had not been cleaned properly. It’s almost not worth mentioning that the Preferred Hotel Elite status perks were completely ignored in all three rooms. 

These rooms were $460 per night. I paid $460 per night, pre-tax, for three problematic rooms and have Zeta treat me like a vagrant who walked in off of the street. My guess is that a better manager was let go to save money and Zeta was hired based on her experience at a Super 8 motel. 

It’s a shame. I used to love this hotel and happily recommended it to many friends. I am telling you that you should avoid it like the plague. I am going to have to contact my credit card company about refuting the charges based on their refusal to provide the service they promised as a part of the booking contract. Customer loyalty is means nothing. You hard earned money means nothing. Book somewhere else.

title: Horrible NYC Hotel
text:
The pros of this hotel are the location and the tunnel, however, you don't need to stay at the hotel to take a nice pic in the tunnel, and there are plenty of other hotels in the area that provide a MUCH better experience for the very high price of the room. 
Check-in experience was average at best. No personality, very routine. the room was less then basic. not very clean, rotting baseboards, not even a clock in the room. Room Service was basically a delivery service from a local deli. Left a message for the hotel manager (I think his name was either Taylor or Tyler)  and he never returned my call. Very indicative of the overall experience. We live in PA and come to NY every few months on a weekend trip but crossing this hotel off of my go-go list. Next time I am in the Soho area, we will go back to the Soho Grand.

title: Great view
text:
We stayed in room 2410, view was amazing. 
No fridge or microwave. Hard to nap during the day as light comes through bathroom. 
Had a couple of parcels delivered with no problems. Heating was great, bed was comfy, good location, close to Canal street. 
I booked this hotel for the view and was not disappointed!

title: Amazing overall experience.
text: We loved staying there. They worked through a couple personal issues with us and made the stay great. Food and drinks were top tier at Nomo Kitchen. Highly recommend for both restaurant and hotel stay!

title: Unimpressive for the price.  You could do a lot better.
text:
There are much better choices for the price in the area.  Rooms are not functional- no desk.  No place really to be but in bed.  No coffee maker in room.  You can’t turn on the shower without getting wet.  The sink is in the main room.  Odd and not particularly useful design choices.  Heating/AC is loud. Oddly, they have even chosen to skip providing a cup in the room unless you request one.  Overall, the property is showing its age and isn’t particularly well maintained.

Overall, not nearly worth the price.  The place is a “C”, at best.

Spend a little more at other hotels in the area (not 11 Howard, which is arguably worse) and you’ll be better off.

title: DO NOT STAY at NoMo
text: I would never recommend the NoMo Hotel in SoHo. Issues include (1) a hotel staff member coming into our room while we were out and using the toilet and peeing on the edge of the toilet bowl and floor; (2) rotted baseboard in the bathroom; (3) the bed’s headboard, which is padded with fake leather, showed significant signs of wear and tear; (4) the hotel cafe opens at 7am and promotes several options such as yogurt parfait and oatmeal, but we were told those items would not be available until 10am; (5) the second morning we tried again for the yogurt parfait, placed the order, and after 45 min. of waiting we were told they forgot to prepare the food we ordered.

title: Awful experience
text:
The best thing about this hotel is the walk way from the street to the lobby. 

The person behind the desk asked for a card for pre authorisation and took $450 from my debit card only telling me after the funds were taken. I was advised that I would get the funds back on check out, 10 days after check out, still no funds.

Our room was dirty, someone had used the toilet without flushing (and brushing). The curtains were broken and when we asked for this to be rectified, they essentially made sure the curtains could shut, but not open again.

The rooms are extremely basic. We had a complimentary water on night one, but no other night.

This was my 5th trip to NYC, we usually stay in the fashion district. I can guarantee that I will never stay in Nomo Soho again. 

Our friends stayed in the Arlo and it was far superior.

title: Never again
text:
HYPE with zero delivery. You can take a nice picture here but the stay itself is mediocre at best. I   should have know when in room dining was served in to go boxes. If you are looking for luxury, SKIP.
I have stayed in almost every "boutique" hotel in NYC, as I live in BK and like to come into the city once a month, this was the worst thus far and off the list forever, Holiday Inn service with a desperate need of a paint job. Im sick over the amount I paid for this experience.

title: Friendly staff and great location!
text: It was our first time staying at NoMo Soho and we would definitely come back. It is in a great location, with lots of shopping and restaurants within walking distance. The staff were friendly and helpful when asked a question.

title: Old rooms - but very clean!
text:
The staff is very helpful. All of our requests (more blankets, more towels) were immediately responded to. The rooms are very clean albeit very old. The bed is the most comfortable bed I've ever slept at in a hotel! The hotel also provided drink vouchers that can be used at their beautiful bar/restaurant. Didn't get to try the food but the ambience was fun!

This hotel has a renovated reception and lobby, but the rooms itself are quite old. You can see that the furniture is slightly worn down and the bathrooms have cracks from water damage. The room is very small which is typical for new york city. The rooms overall were clean, but there were some mishaps. The towels were not fully cleaned. You could see stains from previous guests. The metal soap dish reflects fingerprints and dirt easily, so you could see dirt from previous guests. There is no mini-fridge or cooler - that was a disappointment! 

This hotel tries its best! This stay ended up being perfect for our vacation!

title: Not impressed
text:
Great location, but a title tired (rug, grout) my night stand has plugs for charging, but they don’t work…light bulb out in bathroom, which made showering dark - no robes.  The tv changes channels on its own (ghost, maybe) called front desk and they said they would send someone to fix it, no one showed.  
No mini fridge or waters, as promised at check.  No glasses either.  Pretty basic.

title: Ami is amazing!
text: Ami is amazing!  She’s so incredibly helpful, I had an extended stay and she made sure all the things I requested were ready upon my arrival. She made a long travel day & stay so much easier. I would stay at the Nomo again.

title: Appalling Service
text:
We booked to stay with Nomo for 8 nights. We are very disappointment with the service of the hotel. There has been a lack of hospitality.

We tried to order bottled still water at 2pm and even by 2am we still did not receive any still water in our room. 

We called the reception many times asking for delivery of water and their answer was to go to the gym to get water. 

Staff has been very unhelpful in this regard, poor customer service overall.

I do not recommend this hotel at this price range.

title: Best view, clean and nice staffs.
text: I have a wonderful time stay about a week in October at NoMo Soho hotel. Ami, she works at the front receptionist check in so nice and accommodate whatever I need to make it easy for my travel. I will recommend anyone to stay here and you will be satisfy!  Also hotels have a great view, clean and in the best area to get around.

title: Best hotel and service ever
text: The front desk was extremely helpful and allowed us to check in earlier than any other hotel we have been to. We have been to New York countless times, and from now on this is the only hotel we will be staying at! The rooms are spacious, clean and the people that work here are the best!!!!! Especially ask for Jeffrey when you check in, he will give you all the advice, PERKS and ideas on getting around Soho, the city and you will be treated like royalty!

title: tired and old
text: The headboards are vinyl and they are so old that chips of the vinyl fall into the bed.  The carpet in the room was not vacuumed and the previous guests had a white dog- on blue carpet, it should have been easy to see for housekeeping.  the bathroom door is so crooked that it does not close form the inside, so my wife had to close me in!  At brunch, we sent back a burrata served on a bed of ketchup with tomatoes and melon, two flavors not to be combined.  It was like the breakfast your 5 year old makes on fathers day and you choke down to be polite!  This place is so far gone it was not worth complaining!

title: NoMo no more
text:
I stayed at this hotel 5 years ago. It was fantastic. I opted to come again. 
What a difference. The entrance is still gorgeous. As is the lobby. The rooms and I was in 2 different ones are run down and need upgrading. 
The first room 804 literally creaked which was not the wind. The temperature could not be controlled. As it was late maintenance turned it off. They said the creaking was the movement of the building. In the morning the creaking was worse. I changed rooms. 
The next room was worse as I was off to meet friends and family I would deal with it on my return. 
There was mold along the shower. Photos are attached. Paint and plaster peeling by the desk. 
I stayed in the room based on the discount. 
My 3rd morning I turn the shower on it’s stuck on hot I couldn’t move the handle. To lower temperature or turn it off. Maintenance came up to turn it off. Room temperature could not be adjusted. Once again maintenance came up to reset the controls. It did take some time. 
I was offered another room again. I opted to stay as the room was smaller and it wasn’t worth all the effort. 
I am not listing everything if you went over with a more eagle eye

It delay my meeting up with friends and family once again. 
In fairness  - They did take off the amenity charge of 45 a night. They gave me 50 to use for food. Took off 50 spent at the bar the first night. 
I paid 300 a night currently offers are much less. 
The 300 a night does not inc amenity charge. 
The hotel is certainly busy. A hotel can only rest on its laurels so long. 
Due to the reductions I had to give more than one star. 
Next trip to nyc Will not be at the NoMo ever again

title: Poor Service.
text:
First off the room was great, location great, service... awful. 

Charged me one payment of roughly $1500 then another at roughly $300 when I rang to question it they said no problem will sort.. next day another charge of the same. Process repeated to the point of nearly $4000 pending on my credit card. Eventually after the 4th time of asking the charges was removed. 

no one seemed to accept any responsibility or could be bothered to sort it out. Total incompetence on their behalf. Judging by other reviews this isnt the first time it's happened.

title: Poor Hotel
text: Not a good experience. Rooms are rundown and outdated. Door locks do not work, room does not even have a clock. restaurant was nothing short of a disaster. Slow service, food only decent and fruit flies everywhere. Gym is in the basement, dark and equipment doesn't work well. there are plenty of other much better options in the area. I'll go back to 11 Howard the next time I'm in the area.

title: Great honeymoon celebration in NoMo Soho hotel
text:
First Time in NY, celebrate honeymoon. Thanks to Lovely Zaida the manager from the reception everything was amazing! Zaida Make sure to give us a room as we requested with lots of treats and a hysterical view of New York
Thank you Zaida and your team for all!
The location was the best!!! 
Hotel with great style, very comfortable room and nice light from the window.
Definitely
We will come back again.
From the Manshary’s :)

title: Awesome hotel with great vibe
text:
We really enjoyed our time (9 nights) at the NoMo! 
We were generously allotted a room on 23rd floor (there is only one floor higher, plus two penthouses)! The view was spectacular!
The bed was massive and very comfortable, as were the pillows. There was plenty of storage in the wardrobe, and large drawers under the bed. 
Only odd thing was the sink in the entranceway or the room, but that meant the room seemed much bigger, due to the space saved in the bathroom. It didn’t bother us. We had water and wine glasses and were able to get two water bottles a day, plus ice from restaurant downstairs.
There was also a nice lobby area and a cafe, where staff was very friendly. There was a large choice of breakfast items like muffins, croissants and Greek yoghurt granola, which could be ordered in room service (and thus amenity fee).
The most breathtaking part was the entrance and restaurant downstairs, which was popular with instagrammers. It was also perfumed nicely. 
Can highly recommend the area which is convenient and cool, whilst still being in a quiet street off Howard Street. Lots of shops, cafes, restaurants and the Canal St. subway station close by. Handy for Chinatown and Little Italy, too.

title: The bare minimum at the maximum price
text:
I am from New York City my whole entire life and two years ago moved to California. I came back for a business trip with my husband for a full week and am quite disappointed at this hotel that we chose. 

This hotel has the bare minimum. The rooms do not have refrigerators or coffee makers. We don't have glasses to use to get some water from the tap. We only get two flat pillows on our bed, which I'm pretty sure is a full size bed. The bed is hard as a rock also. 

During my stay here there's a power outage where there was no electricity or air conditioning for at least seven to eight hours. We were offered two free bottles of water. You are supposed to, as a part of the $40 a day fee you are charged, get free bottles of water each day and also a $15 credit to be used in the hotel. We do not receive the free bottle of water everyday in our room and I have no idea how to use the credit. I'm going to find out today when I go to the front desk. This $40 fee is unnecessary as I don't plan on using the gym. The fee apparently covers the gym, the free waters daily, the 15-dollar daily credit, and a bunch of things to watch on the tv. It doesn't even cover the advanced version of their internet service whatever that is. When you log on to the Wi-Fi you have an option of complimentary or to upgrade at a price.

The carpet in the hotel room is the kind that always looks dirty as well. When I arrived I had a chair at a desk that was covered in stands and somebody else's hair. I sent the chair back and told them I didn't want it in the room. My room door lock also doesn't work correctly is I have to put my card in multiple times to get it to register and turn green. Tonight there's a karaoke bar across the street that kept me up for hours. I know the hotel can't do anything about that but if you do come here ask to get a room that faces Crosby Street to avoid having to listen to that.

Besides all this I would say that all of the staff is really really nice. Everyone was super gracious at answering all the questions I had and attending to all the requests I had for the chair to be removed, more pillows, assistance with helping to get my phone and my air conditioning back up and running after the power outage etc.

I definitely wouldn't stay here again though. I know it's New York City and you're not supposed to spend a lot of time in your room but for somebody that's coming for work perhaps you might spend time in your room. You might want to have a coffee in the morning while getting ready before leaving the room. My suggestion would be to get rid of this arm chair that they have there and put a Nespresso coffee station, add a refrigerator below the sink as there's a slot for one with a fan and ventilation and everything, take care of some paint touch-ups that need to happen, sure that needs to be replaced when it needs to be replaced and put the Free bottles of water in the room each day when it's cleaned. Lastly I would say be really transparent about the $15 credit and how you go about getting that daily.

title: AMAZING AMI!
text: I have frequented NOMO SOHO more times than I can count over the last 5/6 Years. I have always been pleased with the standard service but always love their rooms despite minor flaws here and there for different stays. However, with my most recent visit in early September I had Ami check me in at the front desk who was immediately extremely professional, kind and accommodating. Ami went out of her way to upgrade me complimentary, to a gorgeous 14th Flr King room, as she saw that I had been staying a lot in the recent past weeks. Can’t thank you enough. We loved the room and I hope to work with Ami everytime!!! 7 out of 5 stars for Ami!!

title: Overcharged for my stay
text:
I checked into the hotel on 5th Aug 22 for 6 nights and on the second last day of my stay, I was given a bill. Upon receipt, I went to the reception and informed the staff that I would like to take out the $1 per night charity contribution as I’m already donating to other charities.  This instruction was apparently ignored and the bill was never revised. To make matters worse, 4 days after I had checked out, I realised that a debit was made to my credit card when the original bill was fully settled. I then write 4 emails to the hotel including one to the customer service contact email address but not a single response was received.  Fortunately my credit card issuer was able to reverse that last debit transaction and my bill is now in order again.  Had I not checked, I would have been overcharged for my stay without me knowing. 

This is a warning to all future guests of this hotel to check their bills and subsequent credit card transactions even after they had checked out of the hotel.  

The least the hotel could do was to respond to my emails to clarify any misunderstanding. I did not call to clarify as I have left New York and was not prepared to incur international call charges. 

Very disappointed and will definitely not stay in this hotel again.

title: Location. That’s it.
text: Great location. The setting for the entrance and restaurant is good, but poorly executed -blue neon lights and fake lowers take away from the rest (unfortunately!) Customer service is barely ok. The room on the 17 floor had a fantastic view, but that was it. Restaurant service and food was ok too UNTIL Sunday night. I walked into restaurant to grab coffee and dessert (8:30ish pm) I was notified that the kitchen closes at 8:30 and if I wanted coffee and dessert it would have to be decaf and whatever they have ‘leftover’ for dessert. I proceeded to sit at the bar (as they indicated me) and when I sat, only one chair apart from me a guy, drunk, high, or whatever he was on to, completely passed out (or sleeping) on the bar counter!!! No one, the waiters, the bartender, the hostess, or anyone walking by seemed to be bother by this fact. of course, I am mediately got up and left the place. needless to say, I am not coming back to nomo soho.

title: Crappy gift in beautiful packaging
text:
NoMo is an Instaworthy establishment, but Instaworthy only goes so far. This was a single night stay after a birthday celebration.  Upon arrival, you walk through the pretty greenery-covered-fairy-light-lit canopy and breathe in the sweet scent of flowers (or the hotel-version of rohyphol).  Neon lights point to the guest reception desk which was one flight up.  The staff was friendly but appeared frazzled due to a technology issue which disabled their ability to check-in electronically and create room keys.  We were informed of the $15 hotel credit during the "duration of our stay".  We were escorted to our room on the 23rd floor by a manager and were told to return a few minutes later to receive our keys.  

The view from the room was breathtaking.  We prepped quickly to go out for the evening as we were already running late.  As we exited the hotel, keys were still not available so we resumed our evening plans.  When we returned to the hotel at a quarter to midnight, there was no one at reception.  A couple of other guests were also waiting.  Keys were still unavailable and this time we were told to go up to our floor and wait for someone to open our room.  A hotel staff was on the elevator with us going to a different floor and told us that he had been running up and down for the past 3 hours.  We were finally able to access our room after waiting for 10 mins.  We were tired and my partner fell asleep while I got ready for a shower.  This was when the saga began...

I found a pair of yoga shorts draped atop of the sink along with 2 bottles of water.  I assumed the shorts belonged to the previous guest and those bottles came from the fitness center because there was not a single bottle of water, nor a cup (plastic or glass) to be found in the room.  I turned on the shower and within a few minutes the drain began to overflow and nearly flooded over the 3-inch lip of the shower stall.  Needless to say, there was no shower to be had for me on this night.  It was too late to call the front desk because it was nearly 1 am by this time and I just wanted to go to sleep.  I wished I hadn't discovered the horror that was the shower drain in the morning.  There was so much hair that was clogged and VISIBLE in the drain that I threw up a little in my mouth.  But the saga continues... 

A bill was slipped under our door for the hotel fee of $40 for the use of their amenities.  We booked this stay through a travel booking site and everything was paid for in-full at the time of booking.  We were bewildered by the $40 fee at this establishment, because other than the use of their fitness center, WiFi, and ChromeCast-enabled TV, we were unsure what other amenities were available to us.  We are not first-time travelers so understand that some hotels will add an additional resort fee; however, most of these other hotels provide at least some if not all of the following: WiFi, plastic/glass cups, coffee/coffee-maker, refrigerator, more than 2 pillows, mini-bar, etc.  When we approached the reception desk to inform them of what transpired the night before and to see about how to utilize our $15 hotel credit, we were asked why we did not inform them last night and were told that we are not allowed to use the hotel credit since we were checking out on this day.  I asked her to clarify what "duration of stay" means since it was 10:45 am and we were planning on having breakfast at the hotel restaurant and checking out by 12 pm.  We were informed that we had to use it during the "last night of stay".  This information was misrepresented and would have been helpful at time of check-in. We were told by the hotel staff at the front desk to have our breakfast at the hotel restaurant and charge it to our room where adjustments can then be made.  To add more salt to the wound, keys were still unavailable.

NoMo Kitchen is yet another Instaworthy space.  The same sentiments hold true as the hotel itself.  After we were shown to our seats, we were not greeted by a single staff member.  The space was large and at this time of the morning only occupied by a few tables. We were not provided with water or offered coffee.  No one even made eye contact with us.  After about 10 minutes, we were finally able to get the attention of our server who somehow made us feel as though we were interrupting him from something important.  The food left much to be desired.  I did not recognize the French toast I ordered and could not identify the crème fraiche that had congealed into globs on my plate.  My partner needed a mimosa to get him through his meal.  Our server was completely inattentive and again we had to get up to find him in order to get our check.

Upon returning to the reception desk, we were informed that keys were finally available.  In addition, they absorbed the resort fee plus breakfast.  While we appreciated that NoMo provided compensation for our inconveniences, I would never stay at NoMo again nor recommend anyone to stay here, which is a shame because I love my city and SoHo is one of my favorite areas.  

NoMo is not worthy enough to earn 4-stars – its feel is akin to a more upscale version of a motel or hostel.  Highgate Hospitality & Management needs to do a better job at managing its properties and training its employees.  In reading other guest reviews, the technology issue with the room keys is not something new. Others have also experienced similar issues or worse as us during their stays.  Hospitality is more than just banking on the perfect location or using NFT packages to attract your patrons - you can and should do so much better.  Incredibly disappointed by this experience and would also hesitate to stay at another Highgate held subsidiary.

title: TERRIBLE! Never Again!
text:
Only thing going for this hotel is it’s superb location, which saddens me to report since I used to LOVE this hotel! 

I wrote the following email to NOMO when they asked about my stay from August 22-24:

“I am writing to inform I am very disappointed in the room. I was under the impression that my room would be renovated since that’s how it was described on website and as such worth the higher daily rate than usual room I book with NOMO. I was interested and excited to see and experience the newly renovated experience at NOMO Soho. Well, expectations certainly did not meet reality. I was shocked to find the room was subpar with its renovation at best. I was extremely disappointed to not see the level of luxury and sophistication I’m used to when staying at NOMO SoHo. I’ve been staying here once a year every summer for the past four years but I believe this reservation will be my last as I do not feel I was given what was described on website.

Attached you will find photos of the room and how disappointing it is (the mattress does not fit the bed frame making the bed look frumpy and ugly, only two pillows given, the door to the bathroom does not fully close, crack and chipped paint on rusting/rotting corners of bathroom, no luggage stand, just a cheap extension to charge phones by bed, dirty and cheap looking furniture). . I don’t usually write negative reviews online but I think I will this time because when I called the front desk to address my concerns I felt belittled by the snobby attitude of the receptionist and did not feel he listened to any of my concerns and did not offer to make things better, just told me “That’s how the rooms are” basically. All I heard was “oh well deal with it.” 

Again, I say I’m VERY disappointed. 

Sincerely, 
A Displeased Guest”

I’d emailed them this and did not even garner a reply, which I found incredibly unprofessional… 

I will never again stay at this hotel and urge you to look elsewhere for your stay in NYC!

title: Disappointing
text: We were disappointed and cannot recommend a stay in this hotel. The library coffee bar was not regularly open in the morning, there was no bottled water in the room when we arrived (we had to ask three times), but the worst was that our credit card was charged again (without any receipt or bill) for our room although we had paid already with the full amount. We realized this when we returned to Europe. We complained and got no answer. This is a very bad style!

title: There is much work to be done here ..
text:
We’d stayed here pre-COVID and the hotel had a great service ethic, food and world class concierge.

It’s now gone from that promise of going somewhere to what feels like a combination of a badly run motel and a youth hostel!

Not even the 7am coffee runs on time ..and not even a plastic cup for water in the room..

My recommendation …book another location if you need to be in SOHO

title: Dirty Air filters
text: Overall our trip was not the greatest. The air filters in the room were filthy we had to leave the door open where they were in order to get them changed. The bathroom sink once you push the stopper down you had to call maintenance to unstop it. We inquired at the front desk about things to do in the area and how to get around we were handed a map and that was it. When we went to dinner we were seated at a nice table on the patio and promptly forgotten about in fact an hour after we walked out. We went down to get our Uber eats and our table was still set the way we loved it. Overall I would say this was not a good stay for us.

title: Horrible stay
text: Room was horrible. Small, no lock on the washroom, sink is beside the bed. TV and phone did not work when we arrived. Room service forgot my order and staff was unhelpful. Asked for water bottles and the front desk acted like we were inconveniencing them. Not one to write a bad review but I will not be staying at this place again.

title: Perfect
text: Nice hotel, perfect location. Nice view over Manhattan. Jeffrey at reception desk was very friendly and helpful, with good tips and suggestions. Good pancakes for breakfast. Nice entrance. Good vibe. Thank you!

title: Il peggior albergo di New York
text: Pessimo albergo , senza nessun servizio neanche l’acqua in camera. Personale maleducato ed incompetente. Non cè nessun servizio di concierge e neanche ti aiutano. Attesa di due ore per il Room service e si erano anche scordati. Hanno dimenticato gli asciugamani, personale maleducato e incompetente

title: Where is my Room Deposit????
text:
I stayed at this hotel on a work trip over 4 weeks ago. I paid a room deposit upon arrival and was told I would receive it within 10 working days upon checkout. I received confirmation of the return of the security deposit but I have had not received within the 10 working days. 

Where is my money?!

title: Style over substance, great location
text:
We wanted to stay around Soho, as the vibe of the area and the architecture is real New York.

The hotel is beautiful, it's all very instaworthy, and so are alot of the people you see, there's lots of photo shoots going on in the hotel and on the street infront.

The rooms were, err basic, white, threadbare in places and not cozy in any respect. Views fantastic from our 9th floor rooms. 

We didn't try the restaurant as most days it was closed due to events. The coffee shop was a great idea, but it would be handy to make sure the servers actually knew how to make coffee before you opened it?!

So this is a bug bear, we paid $40 per room per night tourist tax, which gave us $15 dollar credit per day in the coffee shop and restaurant, free wifi, and their big selling point the ability to stream your phone to the TV! No water in the rooms, no coffee machine, no fridge, no fridge, seriously in this day and age!

As the restaurant was closed to private events we couldn't spend the credit there, and the coffee shop experience put us off spending it there.

So all in all, beautiful hotel, bang average accommodations, good location to explore.

Would we stay there again? Not by choice.

title: Disappointing
text:
Great location but not much else.

No mini-bar, tired rooms, noisy air-conditioning, holes in curtains, $45 daily charge (completely over the top for what its meant to cover) and really bad levels of service.
