There are better alternatives in the area

title: Roaches in bed and no reply from management
text: I have stayed at Nomo Soho before, but I had an awful stay recently. I woke up at 3am to a couple giant roaches crawling over us in bed. My girlfriend jumped out of the bed screaming and I immediately called the front desk who sent security up to check. He saw the bugs for himself on the bed. He then brought us to a new room. But already not feeling well after a night of drinking, in the middle of the night, we had to get dressed, pack our clothes and food and drinks, make sure we didn't leave anything behind while half asleep, unpack and take showers in the new room. We definitely did not sleep well the rest of the night and ruined our trip. I emailed them and did not even garner a reply, which I found incredibly unprofessional.

title: Great Hotel- Great Location
text: NoMo SoHo is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The rooms were average size for NYC which means they’re small but well designed. The team at NoMo are very helpful and knowledgeable. There wasn’t a concierge but the front desk was able to answer most questions. You have to eat at the restaurant- the food is delicious and the restaurant is beautiful. Overall- great experience!

title: FRAUD! DO NOT STAY HERE, THE STAFF ARE SCAMMERS
text: When I checked out, I noticed a $1000 charge on my credit card, which I did not authorize. Someone had discovered my name and room number, and it was presumably and inside job (likely the bar or restaurant staff) as I did not release this information to anyone else. The charge occurred on the second day of my stay. The management was extremely unhelpful and refused to provide an invoice/video footage, and has yet to refund me for the fraudulent charge. THE NOMO IS A SCAM, DO NOT STAY HERE.

title: The hotel needs to do better
text: The staff are excellent with great service. Hotel is showing its age. Things need to be up kept. The sofas in rooms have been relaxed with crappy uncomfortable ones not going with the color scheme. Sono was cracked. Curtains stopped. Bed headboard cracked. Safe cracked. The list is endless.

title: Never Again
text:
I would not recommend this hotel. 
Fees you don’t know about such as
$40 a day service charge which includes unsecured wifi and not effective 
$77 fee if you need to upgrade your room 
The air conditioner made loud noice all the time. 
The rooms are badly designed example you can’t get into the bathroom if you are working at your desk 
The lounge was closed all the time. 
Worst stay

title: Good hotel … not exceptional!
text:
The hotel is conveniently located for business in Soho. It has a good restaurant that for breakfast usually opens at 8am. 
The room is relatively small without key tools like the hairdryer. 
The phone has been out of service since my arrival. 
Limited restaurants around but close to the Soho luxury shopping area. 
Not sure I would come back unless forced for logistics linked to my business.

title: Best in NYC
text: Excellent location, excellent service, George the manager is very helpful and very understanding. Rooms are great and upgrade to higher floors a must. Food is great in the restaurant in a very nice ambiance. All staff helpful and friendly. Great stay for business and leisure.

title: Great place to stay
text:
Stayed her with my teenage daughter. Excellent location and a fantastic view from our hotelroom. The hotel had a great vibe, and the breakfast in the restaurant was really good. Make sure to try the french toast with nutella. Too good for my waiste line. 
An extra thanx to Jeffrey Yen - The director at The front office. He went above and beyond to make our stay so good. He sent email when our flight got delayd, gave us a great room and had excellent recommendations for restaurants etc. Thank you! Cant’t wait to return to NY again, and will deffinetly return to this hotel!

title: Style over substance
text: We first stayed here back in 2015 & we were impressed. Fast forward 7 years and the hotel could definitely do with a remodel. It’s looking jaded. We were there for 3 nights and most of the time the bar was unavailable due to private events. Every morning an engineer had to come and unfreeze our AC! And it was very hot 🥵 in the room. My fella went to the gym & was not impressed. It was down in the basement, no windows & no AC. Plus some of the equipment was out of order. Definitely a case of style over substance. Staff friendly enough.

title: Not great service
text: Wonderful location, beautiful entrance to the hotel. The restaurant is beautiful but very noisy. The food is expensive. There is no in room service (at least nothing works), the staff is not always very helpful both at the front desk and at the restaurant.

title: Terrible customer service
text:
AVOID. The WORST customer service. I stayed with this hotel for one night and have now called 31 times to get a hotel receipt. The person at the front desk on May 24 from 9am- 1030am has repeatedly hung up on me or picks up the phone only briefly to transfer my call to a mailbox that is already full.

I’ve never experienced customer service this bad. NYC has too many options to deal with terrible customer service.

title: A real negative feeling
text:
Potential good Hotel,not chip but there was NOT frigobar in the room, there was Not a daily rechange of shampoo and other needed stuff,that one considering 40Usd daily as Amenity seems totally unacceptable.
Downstair there is a Bar suppost to be open 7 AM but nobody was there in the right time.
Last but not least we did received from Chris ( I assume the Hotel Manager) a fruits plateau and bottle of Wine as well come.... same day we did check out.
Many things to improve in terms of cost/benefit rate.
A real disappoinment.

title: Shocking service
text: Great location and had such great potential but so disappointed with the overall service.The staff that you could find showed little to no interest in helping and really seem to be happy working there.

title: Beautiful NYC views and convenient, quiet location
text:
Pros: beautiful views, quiet street in a convenient location (easy access to SoHo boutiques, Chinatown and Little Italy). Decently sized given typical NYC hotel rooms. Appreciated the bright blues and whites to feel crisp & out of the city. Cleaning staff very attentive and friendly. 

Cons: like most NYC rooms, you can hear your neighbors (noise machine helps). No amenities (water, hair dryer, remote control) or help to grab a taxi (typical services at a hotel). Desk staff acted a bit like you were disturbing them. 

Overall, I’d return and enjoyed my stay. But, some service elements can be improved for the stay to feel boutique.

title: Would not go back
text: First the fact that lobby and reception / check in - out are in different floors is very inconvenient. While the place is somewhat trendy, this might work for the restaurant, bar or parties, but to stay as a hotel guest the “trendiness” does not foster the experience. Rooms are simply ok, some maintenance details are overlooked. No glasses or anywhere to put toothbrush (pretty basic), no minibar, no complimentary (nor charged!) coffee and tea. Nice detail is a 15 usd discount to use at restaurant… but not the last day, of which you are only informed… the last day. No card needed to use elevators up to rooms, and no, security staff does not control everyone in and out of the hotel. Room cards don’t work, needed to replace them every day! One day room door was not even locked. So overall, not a disaster, but wouldn’t go back.

title: Don’t waste your money
text: Expect nothing beyond a very basic 2/3 star experience. Not one amenity in the room - and not possible to get even a bottle of water to your room after 10pm. Unacceptable and bizarre even in this covid era. Do not waste your money. Rooms are rundown and old and once  again I repeat - not even a bottle of water available once the kitchen has closed. You don’t need a kitchen for a plastic bottle of water !! Far from my only complaint but this is absurd. Nothing luxurious about this property -  water is a basic essential. First and last time staying here.

title: Decent hotel but exorbitant hidden charges
text: Few things work for the hotel including decent food, good location and good service etc., however they charge you an exorbitant 45 USD per night over and above your room rent as resort fees. Was surprised to note that it was mentioned in a fine print but was not clearly explained while booking the room. Also, was not happy with the fact that the rooms are only cleaned on the weekend and not more frequently

title: Fantastic stay
text:
I’ve just returned from a short stay and I really cannot say enough good words about the property but most importantly - the team. 
The hotel is very conveniently located for dining, shopping as well as regular “touristy” options while being on a rather quiet street and therefore unaffected by too much traffic noise. 
The property itself feels quite boutique while nothing was too much trouble when it comes to the team. Be that pre-arrival communication, quick yet informative check-in or any additional questions or requests during the stay. 

I would also like to take this opportunity to thank Jeffrey for his excellent communication, hospitality as well as warm welcome. 

All in all we’ve had a fantastic stay and will most definitely return again in the future.

title: Not a hotel I would stay at again or recommend
text:
Ok, the beds were good and the view fantastic from the 24th floor. The room was outdated and needs a complete refurbishing. Water leaking in from the window, carpets shredded. No glasses in the room, no minibar. No coffee machine. Extremely expensive drinks in the bar and arrogant staff.
When returning to the hotel around 9.30 the bar was closed ?? and no chance for a glass of wine. Tried to order roomservice but no chance for that either. Breakfast was mediocre. We will not stay in this hotel again.

title: Skip this hotel !
text:
No refrigerator-mini bar ..said because Covid reasons ..really ??? All hotels have had those in rooms during Covid. Also looks like they purchased the mini toilets from a local Elementary School!
Not one glass in room ???? Had to steal two from the bar. Asked head of housekeeping she said they are there in a draw next to empty refrigerator hole.. not there.. No extra toilet paper ..they said complimentary water ..none .. App to order breakfast didn’t work never mind they open at 8.. most hotels are earlier.. on one positive..excellent bar restaurant and employees there especially Angelo and Nate!!!!

title: Overpriced, rip off
text:
Room is tiny, the sink is literally in the bedroom

The gym is completely run down, half the equipment doesn't work, the other half makes noise and is dangerous to use. The gym also smells like sewer

$15 DAILY FOOD CREDIT IS A SCAM - they tell you that you get a $15 credit per day, but what they don't tell you when you order room service is that they bake in a $6 delivery charge AND include 18% gratuity, so that effectively applies an automatic $8 charge. If you're ordering room delivery, you're only getting an effective miniscule credit on super inflated food prices. The rigatoni I ordered was a box of pasta with unimpressive tomato sauce. It probably cost them 50 cents to make 

Front desk was snark and not helpful.

Cleaning staff was amazing. They went above and beyond.

title: Fantastic hotel - Incredible views!
text: I had an incredible stay at NoMo SoHo! The staff is incredible friendly and nice. They accommodated all of our multiple requests and service needs during the weekend. I loved the restaurant, the decor, and the trendy vibe. Their breakfast burger is amazing and I love the courtyard feel of the restaurant. Nina's cocktail bar was great also and I'd recommend getting the Espresso Martini. We had a blast and can't wait to go back. The location is perfect and right near the Q train. If you can go out on the balconies or get a room with a good window view you can see across most of the city as it's the tallest building around.

title: Rundown
text:
Missing mini fridge - purpose of trip was daughters 21st bday and had nice champagne to chill.  Called front desk, no ice bucket in room.  No ice machines in hotel.  I was told to walk down to restaurant and ask for ice.  Restaurant refused to give me ice.  For $500 a night - it would have been appreciated if someone made an effort to accommodate our single request.

Very rundown, scratched walls, floors, ripped carpet.

Also, not very secure.  No room card necessary to access floors.

title: Great Hotel
text: My 2nd time staying and NoMo SoHo hotel and I loved it. It is the perfect location, extremely walkable and tucked in on a quieter street. Rooms are nice and quiet and decently sized for New York. The restaurant is super cute and has amazing breakfast.

title: Time to find a new hotel
text: I have stayed here many times and nomo has been my go to nyc hotel. This time was different - there were many issues with the room including mold in the bathroom and windows that couldn’t close or seal being covered in painters tape. But worst of all was an incessant loud high pitched whistling noise in the middle of the night each night making sleep difficult. Staff was aware and said it was coming from a nearby building. Sad to say it’s time to find a new go to.

title: Great NYC trip
text: This hotel is wonderful. Great location, friendly staff, and comfortable rooms. As a frequent traveler one appreciates great service and comfortable accommodations. The hotel vibe is a truly New York experience!!

title: Mixed Visit still a good hotel.
text:
My second visit to the hotel was really looking forward to returning and emailed twice before arrival to request a high floor room.  No response from either email.  Checked in 5pm guess what lowest floor no views.  Girl checking us in quite rude not her problem we were told and advised to check next day.  Not the best of starts. 

Sofa bed not made up in room.  Went back to reception and asked why.  Told you didn’t ask for it to be made up.  Bizarre when we’re staying with a 14 year old where do you think he’s sleeping ?

Anyway to the positives -
New bar at back of hotel is a nice touch great drinks. 
Meal at restaurant was superb.  
Issue with my taxi booking to airport that was resolved very quickly by front of house staff. 
Room still great size for NYC. 
Checked by credit card on return to the UK over $700 of charges that were not ours. A quick call to the hotel and this was resolved and refunded in a matter of hours. 

Would I return ? Probably as more positives than negatives but please sharpen up pre arrival requests.

title: Baby - I used to love you....
text:
The vibe is still pretty chill. The location can't be beat. And the design is exceptional. None of that has changed. 

A few things, though, are a little different since pre-pandemic... The Nomo is my goto hotel in NYC. I have recommended it to dozens of friends. That may have to change.. 

First clue was that I emailed them twice with a question/request per arrival. Neither was answered. I distinctly remember prompt and courteous responses in the past. 

Second clue was my room... Since i booked with Amex i get an upgrade and was on the highest (just sub the penthouses) floor. Lovely. But there was mold in the bathroom (i'm talking about a baseboard covered in mold) and the remote control was literally held together with a rubber band. So kinda not cool for that price... 

I (which I almost never do) complained and got a new room on the 16th floor - which was ok. The gentleman at the front desk was helpful and courteous. 

Housekeeping didn't take any of the garbage. I was there for 3 nights and by the end of it had quite the collection of starbucks cups and sundry other trash. If it wasn't in the trash bin they didn't clean it up. Never seen that before. They didn't even remove dirty glassware from the bar downstairs. Truly odd. 

There is no water in the room - and no glass/cup of any kind. Twice my request for water at the front desk was denied with 'we don't have any at the moment'. Odd. 

The night guards are rude. I appreciate the effort to keep us safe - but hey. Maybe a little 'welcome.... may i ask which room you are staying in... vs the snarky orders they barked. 

Now.... on the plus side: 

The cocktail bar in the back is a nice touch. Spend some good money in there... 
The bartenders in the main restaurant at the bar are amazing. That's the kind of laid-back, smart and elegant service i was used to. Cudos to the bar crew. 

All-in-all - for the price, I think I'll be shopping around for a place that puts in a little more effort.

title: Great location fabulous atmosphere
text: This no frills hotel DELVERS on fabulously!  The decor is chic and minimal, but colorful, the staff is helpful.  There aren't a ton of bells and whistles or amenities and the rooms are small but they are big on VIEWS OF THE CITY!  This was the perfect spot for my 40th birthday weekend with my best friends.  And NoMo kitchen is amazingggggggggggf

title: Atención. Cobran un fee de 45 dólares diario cuando vas a pagar aparte del precio de la habitación
text: El hotel está bien pero te cobran a parte de la habitación un fee diario de 45 dólares de amenities. Es mucho más transparente si te cobran la habitación de una vez y no en trozos. Si lo hubiera sabido hubiera elegido otro hotel . Tampoco tienen desayuno todos los días.

title: Chic, Fun hotel!
text: The Arch is the cool attraction for the hotel but the staff, room and service overall was AWESOME! I stayed in one of the suites on the 25th floor.........OMG the view was to die for, especially at night!

title: Avoid if you would like some service.
text:
Week away trip through British airways to this hotel. British airways had this down as a five star which id say it’s more like a 3 star.

Rooms are a lot more dated and used than they look in the photos, quite small aswell. For some reason the bathroom is that small they had to put the sink and a vanity unit in the room next to the front door. Bed sheets feel like a waterproof material, very noisy. The beds were a good size though. There wasn’t even a kettle in there to make teas or coffees and the mini bar was empty.

As for the service it was non existent, the front desk rarely answering the phone, concierge in the lobby was there at times but until the end of the trip when we wanted to store our bags we didn’t even know what the guy was doing, there is no desk to state concierge or anything. Upon check in we wasn’t given any information just where our room was etc.

There is a morning cafe downstairs for morning teas and coffees which for the diration of our trip was not open until 11am, so hardly morning.

Upon check out we came across a surprise bill for amenity’s, which came to $40 a day which we was not at all made aware off. Apparently included in these amenity’s you get the morning tea and coffee and various other things like room service (which you would expect would be in the price). One thing it apparently included which again we only found out on check out was a $15 voucher at the hotel downstairs each day which would have been great to know that at the start as we used the bar many times and paid cash each time as we didn’t want to run up a room bill, which ended up being over $300 after amenity’s and also room tax.

Don’t get blinded by the photos for this hotel, it won’t be as it seems when you get there.

As for good points, the downstairs restaurant is lovely and the staff there also are great but it seems like something run completely seperate to the hotel. Location is pretty good, just a short walk from the subway and local things like little Italy and China town. Brooklyn bridge also only a 15 minute walk.

With better hotel staff and more communication this place might be a 4 star but needs a lot of updating in hallways and rooms to be anything near a 5 star like British airways stated.

And also to make people more aware of the amenity bill, it just leaves a really sour taste in your mouth if you don’t know anything about it until check out. British airways should also advertise a lot more about amenity tax too

title: Amazing Views!
text: This past weekend I took my best friend to New York for the first time. We stayed on the 24th floor of Nomo Soho and had an amazing experience. Going to bed abd waking up to the city skyline was unreal. The hotel sheets were so comfy and the shower had a view of the Brooklyn Bridge. In the lobby you can get anazing coffee and go to the hotel’s club called Nina’s. Not only is the hotel comfortable, but the location is perfectly situated near China Town and in the heart of Soho. We had a great time and I would definitely come back again.

title: POSIZIONE OTTIMLE
text:
Ottima posizione a Soho.
Vicino alla metro e Little Italy e Chinatown.
Bella vista panoramica dalla Camera e suggestivo ingresso.
Personale molto cordiale e disponibile.
Punto ottimale per muoversi in città con diverse scelte di locali nei dintorni.

title: Great location, very poor costumer service.
text:
Great location, but there are other great hotels in this area that's I'd recommend staying at instead.

Rooms were just ok. Felt like a hotel that tried to be funky and on-trend, but really fell short. Staff during my stay seemed to be practically non-existent.

The thing that really brought this review down from a 3 to 1-star was that my company booked this hotel for me for a business trip. Upon checking in they asked for a credit card, as most hotels do as a hold before handing over the room key. When giving them my personal card (I didn't have a company card), I was not told that that was the card they put the whole booking on. That might be something you'd want to tell your guests... especially if the card you use for booking doesn't match the card given.

It wasn't until after I left New York, that I realized the $1,000 charge had been made to my card, significantly running up my utilization rate.

When I called the hotel to share this feedback, the hotel receptionist seemed completely unbothered. Didn't even mention I'm sorry. From someone who has worked in consumer service in the past, the receptionist's nonchalant response left me feeling very taken aback and unsettled.  

I've stayed in many hotels during my lifetime but this was by far the worst experience.

title: Fun and Funky spot is SOHO, but has issues
text: We stayed here for about 2 weeks, which was well, too long.  We needed a place in the neighborhood that would accomodate our dog, so that was all great.  There is definitely a funky vibe to the place, and there are places to get on-line, meet with people, and get work done.  It was a bit noisy and the hallway smelled like skunk weed the WHOLE time we were there and they seemed understaffed.  At some point, you HAVE to stop blaming COVID for everything.  For instance, no coffee in the lobby in the morning as promised.  Why?  COVID.  But maybe tomorrow.  Well, that tomorrow never came in 2 weeks.  It's okay, but you could definitely do better, especially  for that money.

title: Stay away !
text: The location is good and the rooms as well. But expect strictly no hotel service which becomes a real issue for jet lagged hosts : no minibar, no coffee machine in room no room service and breakfast opens at ….. 11 am. Not a proper hotel, stay away from it

title: Not as good as it once was
text: Second time staying at NoMo Soho and it might be the last. The first time a few years ago I thought the hotel was beautiful inside and out—this time around it seems like the inside has not been kept. Carpets in the rooms are dirty, the shade in the the bathroom had lots of stains (707), the furniture/hair dryer are old. I was a bit disappointed with my overall stay. They ran out of umbrellas by mid day. I asked reception for water and they too had ran out.

title: Sucks
text: The hotel rooms are old and noisy, I couldn’t find the mini fridge for like three days (it was underneath the bathroom sink). There’s an extra sales tax or vacation tax or whatever it was that I believe was $150 a day on top of the grand total. I’m here for 7 days. The room service stops at 9. Also, it’s  not really room service it’s ordering to-go from the restaurant downstairs. Everytime I order, they get the order wrong. The service is terrible. The room even with all of the curtains shut is still soooo bright you can’t sleep. The doors are paper thin you can hear EVERYTHING in the hallways. The pillows and bedspreads are awful you just trust me you won’t get any sleep.

title: It’s beautiful, but service and experience is terrible
text: My best friend and I came here for a girls weekend to celebrate her birthday, I booked this hotel as a surprise to her because of how beautiful the photos were online. The service concerns started as soon as we landed in New York. When we were in transit from the airport to the hotel, I called the hotel restaurant, Nomo Kitchen, to order a pizza for us to pick up when we arrived to check in because we were starving from traveling all day. When we checked in I let the front desk know that we ordered food and asked where to pick it up, she stated that she would call down to the restaurant and have it sent to the room. We were STARVING and some time went by and our food had not arrived, I called down to the restaurant and the woman that answered the phone who stated “if someone called I would be the one to answer because I’m the only on with the phone” had then mentioned that no one called down to request our food be sent up to the room, I then gave her our room number for the pizza to be sent, and still, the food never made it to the room, we were in the room for hours getting ready and planning the rest of the day so we would have been there if it arrived. The next day I went to the front desk to make sure the charge of the food was not on my room and the woman at the front desk said “no, I show them charge was removed” so this tells me, someone realized my food never made it to us, removed the charge, and never contacted us. Not to mention this girl at the front desk never apologized! Secondly, the air conditioner was not working in our room and we were staying on the 23rd floor, it was beyond hot in there. When I asked for them to send someone up to look at it they did and they did fix it. Lastly, which is probably the thing I’m most frustrated about, I purchased A LOT  of dessert to celebrate my friends birthday and put it in the fridge, days later when we went to enjoy it, I took a bite and realized it went bad. The fridge was not working or plugged in. So our dessert from the famous bakery Dominique Ansel was warm and melted as well as all of our leftover food from the weekend. Hundreds of dollars of leftovers went bad. For the price I paid for this hotel for the weekend I would expect A LOT more. The aesthetic of the hotel is not worth the experience, I’m very disappointed.

title: Could be better
text: I think this hotel, like many, is understaffed due to the current situation with the pandemic. Service was lackluster and the waters promised in the room and room service was poor. The refrigerator was not working and when I pulled it out the outlet was hanging out of the wall and definitely not up to code. Overall the hotel was fine, but not my first recommendation.

title: Vacations
text:
A fabulous hotel, good location, excellent service and delicious food.  A good place to visit if you pass through New York.

From the reception you meet friendly people who make you feel at home. My recommendation today.

title: Excellent Location
text: First time in NYC and it was very easy to move around the city from the hotel, actually there are a lot of interesting places at walking distance, which was great for us. The hotel is very well kept, the room was very clean, and we loved the style, very modern, although on the small side for a "deluxe room", we loved the view from the room, the bar/restaurant is pretty nice and convenient after a long day of walking everywhere.

title: Perfect picturesque balcony suite for micro-wedding ceremony
text:
I went to several Manhattan hotels with balconies or terraces when scouting for a location for my micro wedding ceremony. I couldn't be happier to choose Nomo Soho's Nomo Balcony Suite! The view from the suite room and the balcony was absolutely stunning and breathtaking. The bright, classic, and cheerful white and royal blue color theme in the room complimented our wedding outfits and floral design perfectly. 

Prepping for a ceremony can be very tiring. The bed in the room was super comfortable, which helped us to have enough rest before and after the ceremony. Waking up to a panoramic view of Brooklyn, Lower Manhattan, and the Hudson River was an experience to remember forever.

Many thanks to Andrew the director of sales and marketing for making our wedding weekend absolutely perfect. We look forward to staying at Nomo Soho on our future anniversaries.

title: Lower your expectations because sadly the property management doesn’t meet the basics of a 4 star hotel
text:
Although this hotel has some strengths in terms of location and an attractive restaurant it doesn’t fulfill the basics you would expect of a 4 star hotel and should really be reclassified as 3 star until they address the small things that matter. 

You simply can’t have a 4 star hotel that doesn’t serve breakfast 7 days a week. You can’t not offer coffee machines in the room and not serve coffee downstairs certain days of the week. You can’t have rooms tight lack basics like a cup to drink water from and similarly a gym that doesn’t offer stocked paper cups. You can’t offer a $15/day restaurant credit in a restaurant that may not have space to receive you due to external guests dining there and limited opening hours to accommodate the guests you’ve offered the credit to.

I booked without doing my research because frankly you shouldn’t have to. Those things should all be given at a 4 star hotel but sadly here they are not, which may be a function of it being an independent hotel that has got a bit sloppy and doesn’t have to adhere to brand standards of a chain with established standards. 

I would avoid the hotel until they address the basics …or just reset your expectations for the stay until management address these small but consequential things that add up to a poor experience.

title: A great SoHo stay
text: The location is great and it was fun to feel like I was living in SoHo for a couple of days. The subway is nearby, lots of shops and restaurants and easy to get everywhere in the city. The rooms are bright and pretty. All rooms in NYC are tiny, and they made theirs feel airy and spacious -  I was in 1411 and there were large East-facing windows with great views of the neighborhood, the desk was an "island" in the middle, sink separate from bath, decent closet space and under bed drawers. The front of the hotel is a restaurant which looks like a green house and garden. I enjoyed a drink at the bar (a post-vax celebration!) - they gave a $15 credit which covered part of a glass of wine. (the $40 "resort fee" is frustrating, but pretty standard in NYC). The coffee shop was not open so I went around the corner to Smile which is cute. There is also a Starbucks around the corner. The down sides were minimal, but I will share because these review websites demand details :) THe front entrance is a popular selfie spot and I often had to walk around all of the phototaking tourists. I had to ask for the bottles of water they state are free upon checkin, the mini bar fridge was hot, there were some scratches in the tub and the outlet by the sink was askew. I would come back!

title: Love the location, but the hotel disappoints
text:
We booked this hotel for 5 families who were all attending our sons' wedding. Families stayed on 4th, 5th, 18th, 20th and 24th floor, and ranged from two double beds to a King room, so our experience isn't limited to one room/floor. 

Pros: 
- Great location in Soho, within walking distance of Little Italy, Chinatown, and subway stations.
- Rooms were contemporary design-basically all white with a lagoon blue ceiling. They were cleaned well each day. 
- Hotel felt clean and artwork in lobby was fun. 
- If you are on an upper floor, the views are amazing. If you are on lower floors, your views are old, crappy buildings.
- room 1812 had great AC

Cons: 
 - No insulation between rooms. None. We stayed in room 1812, which happened to have an adjoining room and you could hear EVERY SINGLE WORD from our next door neighbors. There was simply zero privacy when your next door neighbor was in residence. One of our families had a baby next door to them, a third had a yappy dog, etc. If you like quiet, this is not the hotel for you.
 - no coffee pot in the room. The coffee bar in the lobby is only open from 7 am - 12 pm and it's $4-6 per very small cup of java.
 - The entrance is an Instagram hotspot. We crashed more 16-year-old photo shoots than any one person should be allowed to. It's a beautiful entrance, but when you are trying to get in or out of the hotel in a hurry, it's not happening. 
- you are charged $40/day "entertainment fee", with a $15 daily credit to use at the hotel coffee bar or restaurant. Cocktails at the restaurant are around $19, and are very small. You are also supposed to get two complimentary bottles of water in your room upon arrival (part of the $40 fee), but all 5 of our families had to ask for the water.
- two pillows per room. You can ask for more, but when we did, they had run out of extra pillows. 
 - exercise room is a dungeon - no windows, black walls, minimal lighting. Five cardio machines in the room, two of which were "under repair". All had TV's on the machine and none worked. 
- room 413, 512, 2009 all had terrible AC. The rooms never got below 74 degrees, even when they changed the thermostats to the 60's. 

If none of the cons bother you, then this is the hotel for you. As I mentioned, the location is wonderful. For all five of our families, the cons outweigh the pros and we will look for a different hotel for our next stay.

title: Excellent cocktails from Leyton
text: This is a great place to have a cocktail and enjoy the artwork and great conversation with Leyton! The cocktails are absolutely delicious and  the scenery lovely! Come and enjoy a bit of peace and quiet in the middle of downtown NYC!

title: Wonderful experience in an incredible location
text: Been coming here as my New York home away from home for over a decade.  Excellent hotel and excellent staff.  Can't beat the location in Soho, but still quiet.  Tall building with incredible views of Manhattan and Brooklyn via full wall windows. Excellent beds. And though ownership and management has changed over the years they are still excellent and know how to treat their guests.  Thank you Nomo Soho!

title: Great experience!!!’nn
text: I visited  NOMO soho for the first time and walking in the tunnel gave me Alice in wonderland vibes which was wonderful but the service incredible. Leyton was a great person to assist us he was very accommodating and informative. Made us feel like family can’t wait to come back and bring everyone I know for th ambiance

title: Eh, mixed bag
text:
The location is ideal, the room is basic (nothing special), the room could have been cleaner, definitely quiet location, so you'll get a good nights sleep.  Walking distance to many things (food, subway, shops).  The on site restaurant is H O R R I B L E... just save yourself the trouble and upset stomach and don't eat there.
I might stay there again, just because the location is ideal, but the overall experience was MEH.

title: NoMo Food & Service
text: Eating at NoMo was comfortable, place has  great lighting, asthetically pleasing, and good food. Leyton also provided great service and was welcoming. He was friendly and very engaging. Most definitely will dine here again in the future.

title: NoMo is a no no for now… bad experience
text:
NoMo is a no no for now. We have stayed at this place many times but this time - the first after the pandemic - we had a really bad experience. There was only one person at the checkin so the line was long and it took almost 15 min to get
Our room. When we got to the room, it was smelling like cigars and we just couldn’t stand. They moved us to a second room, and when we open the door, there was already some guest in there. So embarrassing! They upgraded us and the third room was just ok. It was bigger but the decor was completely off. Like they dropped several pieces of big furniture in a small living room…. Despite the fact that they told us that there was bottles of water in the room, there was none at ours. I called room service to ask for some water and they said they had no one available at that time - around 11:30pm. The only thing that worked was the restaurant and the service. From host to server, all very nice and kind. I left feeling very sad… we love that hotel but right now it far from the nice place it used to be.

title: Worst Customer Experience Ever
text: Hotel front desk flat out lied about the possibility of us reserving adjoining double rooms when we first called to ask. It was the only reason we chose to stay here. When we arrived for check-in and found out they had no adjoining double rooms, they did nothing to make up for it. No apologies. Unbelievably rude. Even implied we were the ones that made the mistake!  Too many other great hotel options in NY to ever recommend NOMO to anyone.  THE WORST

title: Chic hotel in nice location
text:
Nice chic hotel in good location, walkable to a lot of shopping, Chinatown and Little Italy.
We had a minor issue with the AC but we were quickly moved and upgraded.  Standard King is a little small but it’s NYC, so normal for there.
Staff was polite and friendly, room was clean and up to date.

title: Great staff. Gorgeous location.
text: Amazing stay at NoMo Soho. Staff from the fort minute was amazing. Cheyenne in reservations made sure I had the exact room I was looking for. When I arrived the front desk was clean and safe with Covid precautions in place. Angie and Katie verified and delivered everything I needed over the two days. Most hotels aren’t offering services but they are at NoMo. Shiibbir and Yeshi made sure I had everything from ice to extra towels. Location and room was amazing. Beautiful hotel great views. Just book it!

title: Leyton is the best!
text: We came here for mother’s day and not only was the food incredible, but Leyton was the best server and went above and beyond to make our experience enjoyable. Will be back very soon, to enjoy more yummy food!

title: Great location, but at what cost?…literally.
text:
I have such mixed feelings about my stay at this hotel. 

Location - 5 stars
Cleanliness - 5 stars 
COVID safety- 5 stars 

However, there were a few things that didn’t quite sit right with me. 

1. We received a “daily dining credit” of $15 to be used in the restaurant or in room service. I tried to order room service THREE separate times and was either turned away or the phone was never answered. 
2. Price and fee transparency. At checkout, I was charged an additional $40 plus taxes PER DAY that I was in the hotel as an “Amenity Fee.” Was this for the dining credit I could never receive? Or for the days where I asked them not to clean my hotel room? On checkout, they didn’t even present me with the receipt or tell me the charges. Just asked if I would like it emailed and then charged me almost $300. 
3. Last thing is something I know is out of my control, but the walls are so thin and young drunk people are loud and NYC being the city that never sleeps means that they are loud all night.

title: Loved the location, room with a view and aesthetic of the hotel...But the bed was uncomfortable.
text: So I had a quick overnight staycation at the Nomo Soho for my hubby's birthday. I loved the Premier room with the floor to ceiling windows and view of the  NYC skyline behind the headboard. Views looked spectacular during the night. Room was nicely decorated.  The bed/pillows itself needs a ton of improvement. The mattress was soft but our bed had two DEAD pillows on top. They were literally flat as a pancake. I had aches the next morning. Additionally, there weren't any robes in the closet. What's a hotel visit without getting to put on a white robe? title: Romantic weekend turned into a disappointing and scary experience.
text:
I very rarely write reviews, however felt after this experience it was necessary. I recently stayed here for one night with my significant other over Valentine's Day weekend for a fun staycation as we both live in the city. The hotel itself was beautiful, the room was clean, and we had a great view of the city. Unfortunately, the service was far from enjoyable and quite frankly unprofessional.

Sunday morning, we were awoken by someone trying to intrude into our room without any warning. There was no knock and they used a key to open the door. Luckily, we had the top lock on so they were unable to enter the room. Shortly after, we received a call from the front desk asking if we were still in the room. We said yes, and then were informed that it was security who had tried to come in. Confused as to why security would be entering our room while we were asleep in the first place, we asked, and were informed that the hotel's system said we were checked out. So, instead of knocking or simply calling our room first to confirm if we were still there, security chose to attempt to sneak into our room without making themselves known. It is incredibly unprofessional and quite honestly frightening that hotel staff would try to enter your room unannounced while you are asleep. A hotel should be responsible to some degree to ensure the safety of their guests, and that has seriously been called into question if you employ security that attempts to barge into a guest's room without simply knocking first.

We then decided to order room service, as it was still Valentine's Day weekend and we wanted to salvage what was left of our stay. After an hour of waiting, our food finally arrived. However, the coffee we ordered was spilt all over the meals and we were missing several pieces to our order. We contacted the front desk and they informed us that the restaurant manager would be coming up to our room to inspect our order. After opening both boxes of food to ensure we were not trying to pull a fast one on them (despite the bag blatantly dripping the spilt coffee on the floor) the restaurant manager stated he will take it back down and have our order remade. However, he stated it was going to take at least another 45 minutes.

At checkout they informed us that they would be waiving the $45.90  resort fee due to the inconvenience (but not the bill for our food). Unfortunately, after leaving and checking our credit card statement, we were still charged the $45.90 resort fee.

I have stayed in many hotels and have never had an experience like this. We came into this expecting a fun and romantic evening, with reasonable expectations of NoMo SoHo (ie, feeling secure in your room without strangers attempting to enter unannounced while you are sleeping and eating food without coffee spilled all over it), but this was apparently too high of a bar for them to meet. I cannot say I would return after this, especially due to the lack of empathy or concern the staff seemed to have when we brought up these issues during the stay. This is New York, there are plenty of hotels for the same, if not cheaper price, that I would recommend over this establishment. Look around and find somewhere else.

title: We had a Five Star Experience at NoMo SoHo
text:
I have stayed at the Nomo Soho about five times, and each time had such a memorable stay. From the atmosphere, to the rooms, to the dining options at the hotel and nearby, this hotel is a true gem. 

I would highly recommend this hotel Under normal circumstances, And amid the current pandemic, I think the hotel has gone above and beyond to be a super clean and stunning home away from home. Whether you're visiting the city for vacation
or just doing a staycation. Here are a few reasons why I love this hotel.

The service: during each of my stays, but particularly my most recent stay, I've been impressed with the hotel's team - they are truly five star, The hotel service has been phenomenal. I recently encountered one of the hotel managers Tenzin Basnet,  He went above and beyond to ensure my stay with my newborn baby and husband  was comfortable and enjoyable. We felt we were in great hands and an unforeseen issue with one of the rooms we had booked was seamlessly taken care of, putting us at ease. We had such a great time we even extended our stay an additional day.  We enjoyed breakfast vouchers - breakfast and coffee arrived at our room hot and delicious.

The rooms: I have stayed in different room types around the hotel - all are lovely. Base your stay on what you need.  I’ve stayed in a standard king, the Crosby suite, and one of the suites on the higher floors. Each room was impeccably decorated, including all the essentials and some cozy items like a bathrobe for maximum lounging. It was really great to have Chromecast in the rooms so we could log into our streaming services. It was like an upgraded version of our home experience. If you can, I highly recommend splurging on a room with a terrace so you can enjoy some private time outside and an incredible view. 

The location/vibe: this hotel is flanked by the best neighborhoods in New York City for dining, shopping, art, culture— good vibes all around. There are so many cute shops and boutiques that are open, and you basically get a private shopping experience if you go during a week day. If you were coming from out of town it’s super easy to get a cab. If you’re driving in, it is possible to park in a nearby garage or street side. I think it says a lot that I stayed at this hotel as a treat for 30th birthday party, but also with my growing family! It's really versatile.

Thanks NoMo and especially Tenzin for an incredible stay!

title: Amazing will deff come back!
text: The room was gorgeous and very clean! The views of Manhattan are breathtaking. The restaurant was delicious and well priced. Our server Imani was super sweet ,attentive and her recommendations were on point. Definitely will be coming back!

title: Stunning wedding venue
text: We had our micro-wedding at the NoMo SoHo in September and we could not have been happier. Andrew was very responsive and helpful during the uncertain times, and we were fortunate to carry on with our wedding despite everything. The Penthouse is a stunning venue with arguably the best view in the city. The terrace has ample space and the indoor area was ideal for our dinner and bar service. Everywhere you looked there was the view of the city.  It is truly a hidden gem and we could not have envisioned something more perfect. We felt completely safe at the hotel and everyone was so attentive and caring. We had a three-course meal for dinner, and the food was fantastic (tuna tartare, filet mignon and peach cobbler). They even catered to a few special requests and accommodated many changes to follow CDC guidelines. Big shout out to Alex, Erica, Angello and Raku; they were our team for the night of, and everyone loved them! They were so much fun and really made it a party. All of our wedding guests (14 total) stayed the weekend at the hotel as well, and everyone loved it. We hope to be back to celebrate many anniversaries to come!

title: Amazing service
text: The service was incredible and the cleanliness made me feel super safe. Really couldn’t say a bad thing about the whole stay. Great setting, great environment and neighborhood. Really though it was the staff that made the stay. Thank you!

title: Great Stay! 10/10 Recommend
text:

The room itself was beautiful, with a great view of Manhattan. I must say that I was throughly impressed with everything & will definitely be back.

(P.S, they give you a free mask/gloves incase you forget any or need a spare)

title: Shashanika rajapakse

title: Wedding Shoot at NOMO SOHO
text:
My husband and I got the chance to stay at the NOMO SOHO penthouse to take wedding photos for  since COVID cancelled it back in April. Everything about the stay was perfect. Rooms were beautiful and clean. We felt safe in the common areas seeing as masks were provided to maintain COVID measurements. The hospitality was amazing, from the security guard at the entrance to the bottle of champagne that was sent to celebrate our Union.
 
The space is beyond words. Ceiling to floor windows with views of the NYC skyline. A beautiful terrace.  The modern and clean decor was exactly the esthetic we were looking for. Not to mention the hotel is just filled with beautiful art inside and out. NOMO SOHO exceeded every expectation we had going into this and this was the perfect place to seal our union. 

If you’re looking for a cute place with character to stay in NYC this is the place.

title: Wonderful hotel in the heart of Soho
text: The NOMO SOHO is my personal favorite in New York. Tucked behind broadway and next to Grand this hotel gives you access to all you need within walking distance, whilst also enjoying a wonderful personal touch. Small but well equipped rooms with a warm home feeling. Complimentary walking and running routes every morning, accompanied by complimentary water and apples. Fresh roasted complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby for the visitors and guests. Great restaurant turn bar that has amazing breakfast dishes worth staying just for. FYI nearby you have soulcycle / drybar (in Bloomingdales / Joe and the juice / nail salons and more. Enjoy!

title: Jeffrey
text: Jeffrey, our Check In Concierge was outstanding in his attentiveness and service during our 5 year anniversary where we first stayed;) He even went out of his way to personally deliver our room service order first thing in the morning! Only if more people in the world existed like this today... ThanX NoMo Soho!

title: Feels like my home in NYC
text: I stayed for 3 nights in April last year, 4 nights in October & 4 nights in December 2019 and January 2020. NOMO Soho is again my first choice when travelling to NYC and I now ask for specific rooms with specific views. There's just something about that view from one of the top floors from the shower. I'll never get tired of it. Check-ins are speedy, I'm greeted as a return guest. I use their receiving packages services quite a lot and despite some issues with getting them to the room I still get everything and the issues might be due to me checking in late or very early. A big shout out to Dorjee who's gone above and beyond with my packages and staying on top of things. I like NOMO Soho after they facelifted a bit and will continue to stay there when in NYC. I've stayed a total of 12 times I think now - all minor issues are sorted quickly and professionally.

title: I can't wait to come back again after this pandemic
text: I couldn't have been happier with the service! Love the aesthetics of the hotel, very clean and modern rooms. During the COVID19 I stayed at the Nomo Soho hotel right under the penthouse suites and I was very pleased with the hospitality and assistance from Tenzin, he was well knowledge of the area and since a lot places were closed he steered me to the directions of all the essentials I needed. Although I could not do much due to everything in the area being shut down I was able to enjoy the skyline views in all directions from my room on the balcony it was very nice and I was able to enjoy my stay. I'm definitely coming back again.

title: Excellent Stay & Excellent Service
text:
My wife & I stayed at the NoMo SoHo Hotel for two nights from 3/15 - 3/17, during the COVID-19 pandemic.  

The hotel was largely empty, but we were greeted at the front desk by Richard & Tyler who made it their mission to ensure that we had an amazing stay despite the circumstances.  Both staff members were polite, courteous and well informed on the hotel, the neighborhood and were eager to answer all of our questions with a smile on their face.  

We were fortunate to get a room on the penthouse floor (PH1, room #2504) that has a clear, unadulterated view of mid-town Manhattan.  The room was very spacious for an NYC hotel, with a modern-European twist!  

On our 2nd day, we decided to have lunch at the restaurant located at the hotel, and were once again met with excellent service (and food!).  

I would highly recommend this hotel to those visiting NYC, and will be coming back ourselves because of the service & care we received.

title: Literally to die for...
text: We stayed here during the corona pandemic and we had the place all to ourselves. I must say the service was immaculate. 3 waiters at a time.  2 bar tenders helping eachother mix one drink. 3 bellman. One offered to actually carry me to my room. But no touchy touchy during states of emergency. The food was fantastic. I don’t drink and they had an amazing MocTail menu for me. The room was a bit small but very clean. Bathroom was great but they didn’t have a fan which I like and the door to the bathroom was practically see through and did not provide much privacy. But whatever I just used the bathroom in the lobby While my date watched the news in horror about how NYC was in a state of emergency. Perfect time to slip away. Love the artwork. Classic photos of Andy Warhol, Madonna and boroughs. I mean if I’m gna die from a disease at least let me get some art culture in first. Walk in is very gramable. I would recommended. Hope I live long enough to come back!

text: I went to Nomo Kitchen yesterday and had the most amazing mid day dessert. I only wanted a coffee when I went , reluctantly I grabbed a dessert menu from the host stand . title: Spontaneous stay at the Nomo Soho!
text:
I came to the Nomo Soho in the period between moving apartments. It was a holiday weekend, and I was offered early check in. Instead, I chose to come back later for a higher room with a better view. When I returned, my key to a room on the 19th floor was waiting for me at the front desk. 

However, I had work to do and was going to be on calls, so when I requested a quieter room (loud neighbors on the original floor) Tenzin Basnet, the Front Office Manager offered to move me to a new room. I specifically asked about a room with chairs and a table, and although this is a different room category and requires an upgrade, he was willing to provide a complimentary upgrade for me. 

My new room is a corner deluxe queen room on the 24th floor, and has some of the best NYC views I have ever seen. There are floor-to-ceiling windows, similar to all other guest rooms at Nomo Soho, but there is also a large window in the shower looking towards the Empire State Building. A large window above the bed also faces North, allowing for beautiful skyline and ESB views from the bed. 

I will definitely be returning and staying in my new favorite room!

title: Brunch

title: A great base
text:
We stayed at the Nomo Soho as part of a trip to New York City and found it to be very well located. We were able to walk or catch the subway to wherever we were going easily. 
The rooms were quirky but clean and comfortable. They were able to arrange us having adjoining rooms as we had requested in advance. The check in staff were helpful but when we wanted to have a drink in the bar/restaurant area one night, it was made clear that we weren’t really welcome to have a table unless we were eating. Because of this, we went elsewhere. 
The wine hour was fun to have although we were only around for it twice during our stay. In my opinion, the amenity fee isn’t necessary or worth it for guests and should either be built into the room rate or scrapped entirely. Things like WiFi should be included - not paid for as an extra as part of an amenity fee.
Overall, it was a good stay and we would recommend this hotel. The entrance is very pretty and was good for photos.

title: Great Dinner!

title: Best in the city!!
text: This is one of Manhattan’s best kept secrets. Bar scene is excellent!!! Rooms are excellent!! Prices are reasonable!!! Customer service is comfortable. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting NYC and is looking for a great place to stay with magnificent views of the city!!

title: New York Luxury!
text: My girlfriend and I stayed at NoMo SoHo for about a week. The hotel is located in the heart of SoHo and is perfect if you, as me, love the SoHo atmosphere with its beautiful buildings, great shopping and slow pace (if you compare it to Uptown). NoMo SoHo has delicate rooms with breathtaking views, if you choose a room a bit high level. Even the showers have classic New York views with large windows overlooking Manhattan and The Empire State building. We ordered the breakfast up to our room one day, and it was delicious. A bit pricy, but worth it as a one time thing. The restaurant on ground level is also great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Recommended!

title: Saturday Brunch
text: We had wonderful service from Iamni. This was my first time at NoMo in New York and the experience was wonderful. Not only was she completely attentive, but she also provided wonderful recommendations. Thank you, Imani. Your beauty radiates 🙏🏽

title: Nomo Kitchen
text: The Nomo Kitchen was spectacular. Our server, Emily, was very kind. The food was amazing, they have such a wide variety of options. I highly suggest coming here for a night out or a fun day with your friends.

title: An Extended Business Trip - Thank you!
text:
I am not usually one to write a review, but I felt extra compelled after my most recent stay and my interactions with the staff. 
The whole stay was amazing, as I was welcomed by a very friendly and helpful staff member at the front desk, and met a few other great employees that assisted in one thing or another during the stay. Not to mention the location is unbeatable, the prices are especially fair for the area, and while it's a larger hotel, it doesn't feel that way. The whole crew I travelled with actually noted that. 
But in reality, I'm only writing this review because of what happened after my stay. I reached out to the hotel with some questions about dates and folios in regards to the stay my coworkers and I had. 
In short, it was a lot of requests for time consuming paperwork and things, which I would normally dread reaching out to anyone for. 
I must say I was very pleasantly surprised when I connected with the Front Office Manager, Tenzin. 
He reached out to me and approached every conversation with a great attitude and attention to detail. He really went above and beyond to make sure I had everything I needed, which is not something I see every day in hospitality anymore. 
So, thank you to the whole crew at Nomo Soho for a great stay, and a personal thanks to Tenzin for going the extra mile and helping with all the asks. 

If you're looking for a great hotel in a great location where you can stay for a night or a while, and know you will be treated well, this is it. 

The team and I are looking forward to our next stays!

title: Breakfast
text: We came Nomo for breakfast but they past lunch.Thus, they tried to help us for made a breakfast.And they did.Thank you so much to Clara.we loved Nomo's kitchen and their staff whose had kind and smilely face...

title: Unforgettable stay at Nomo Soho
text: Location of hotel is perfect, walking distance to many desired places. Rooms are nice with incredible views. Staff is helpful. Room service is fast and meal is delicious. Thank you Tenzin Basnet for complimentary room upgrade for my wife’s birthday. I would go back to this hotel and recommend it to everybody.

title: LOVE THIS PLACE
text:
I loved the Hollywood Regency vibes.  The rooms are small but very cute. Nicely furnished and great views.  I had a corner Queen room on the 22nd floor with views of the Empire State and Chrysler building.  The food was fantastic.  I had dinner there as well as brunch.  The lemon ricotta pancakes are out of this world!  The hamburger, the swordfish and the fried artichokes were all amazing too.   

Angie at the front desk was super helpful and sweet.  Chris, the bartender was excellent  and the lobby concierge was great although I don't recall her name.

title: NoMo Kitchen Server Nicole
text:
Nicole was awesome, she provided excellent service and did it all with a smile. Deffinetly would come back just to have food at the hotel just because of Nicole. 

The food is really good as well, which also helps!

title: Amazing
text:
I love staying at this hotel, the view from the bedroom is unbelievable with the floor to ceiling windows. 
It is in a great location , close to great shopping and very close to subway stops. I really like the on site restaurants and there are such amazing restaurants in the neighborhood.

title: Retro Chic!
text: As a now removed New Yorker; always love coming back home.  Was very impressed with the uniqueness of the property - the courtyard exemplifies the vibe of the hotel.  Upon entering the lobby was greeted by the concierge who directed us to the check-in area.  Mia & team were extremely helpful & friendly.  22nd floor room had a spectacular view of downtown Manhattan.  Restaurant & bar staff were excellent - food & drinks were great too!  Nicole, the manager, had some great recommendations. She was also very friendly & helpful (also helped me find my lost sunglasses).  Last but not least, the GM, Brian, could not have been more hospitable; gave us red carpet service - truly a class act!  Definitely will stay at NoMo SoHo every time I'm back in the city.  BTW, great location!!

title: Modern and trendy in Soho
text: My 5 days at NOMO Soho were really fine. Nice service, nice food in the "Greenhouse restaurant". The hotel is modern and my room on the 14th floor had superb 180 degree views of  the East side and Brooklyn. I felt well in my blue/white painted room with a huge comfy bed. The location is perfect - quiet and yet in the middle of everything in Soho. My only advise for improvement is (the too) small fitness center located in the basement with 2 out 5 machines not working. Overall - would stay again and recommend.

title: Fabulous boutique hotel in Soho
text:
Came to NY for 2 nights in January to visit friends.  Wanted to stay in lower Manhattan for proximity and the Nomo was recommended by a friend who had stayed here previously.  My flight arrived early in the day and I had planned on leaving my bags at the hotel while I walked around for a few hours.  They told me they were able to give me an early check in, which I was thrilled about.  This was the first sign of fantastic customer service. 

The room was clean and spacious, the bed was very comfortable and the shower was huge.  Also, the mini bar in the room was well stocked.

Now let’s talk about the restaurant/bar on site.  Food and drinks are fantastic and in my opinion, very reasonable priced for NYC.  I spent a couple of happy hours as well as a few evenings there enjoying the cocktails.  The staff was very friendly.

I visit NY at least 3-4 times a year and this will be my go to hotel from now on.  Highly recommend.

title: Awesome hotel
text: What an awesome hotel and great staff! Kiara was elegant and such a great host! Will come back just be a use the hospitality was so amazing !!! The drinks and restaurant is so amazing as well !! The furniture is beautiful and the location is easy!

title: First time in New York
text: We had a great trip! Kiara took such great care of us everyday. She was always right there on the spot before we even asked, she made us feel right at home. Excellent hospitality. Hotel was very nice, and a good location.

title: Great Location and Room - Amenity Fees beware!
text: Visited for 5 night stay, hotel is located in a great area on Crosby St. When we arrived around 7pm with 3 large bags and carry on, there was no one to help with bags or guidance where to check in. After standing around in reception we were advised to use elevator to go up a floor. Check in was quick and easy. Room was compact but very nice decor and clean and comfy bed. We had a great stay until we had to check out when we found a hidden extra $45.90 per day per room which BA or check in staff failed to advise when we purchased the package and checked in, the fee which seems totally excessive when there is no turn down service, no real concierge or help in main reception. The few times I had asked for information regarding a day trip to shopping outlet I was made to feel a inconvenience by the front desk, and all I got was a fairly short response. Also not sure if they have smoke detectors in room but to be woken up by a pungent smell of weed 2 days running it seems not. If there wasn’t the high amenity fee I would have given a better review but the amenity fee for the lack of hospitality we received really spoilt our trip

title: NoMo Kitchen - Daniela helped with these best surprise birthday!
text: Wanted to have surprise decor at our table when we arrived and Daniela did a wonderful job making it happen!! Love NoMo Kitchen 💛✨ Order the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes and a Bloody Mary or two!! We loved it

title: No-Name cocktail and great food
text: Came for Brunch with friends and Nicole was very helpful and even had the bartender make up a cocktail for a friend. Great service and ambiance. She was able to offer feedback on the menu and her advice on menu items.

title: Think twice
text:
Besides the AMAIZING view, location and the room being clean with wonderful Malin & Goetz amenities, nothing else works. No room keys, no service, no directions, no one in the lobby to assist.
Apparently the system was down and they couldn’t make keys, understood, however no one reached out when the system came back. Phone were also down. Not a good experience as the hotel lacks on service.

title: Amazing experience of quintessential New York!
text: My boyfriend and I booked the NoMo SoHo last minute in the middle of the night after a bad Airbnb experience and Taylor on reception couldn't have been more helpful and kind and understanding of our situation. He made us feel at ease and excited about the last few days of our trip despite the bad experience. Our room was beautiful and the view was unreal. The location is also perfect - right in the centre of stunning SoHo and within walking distance to all the other gorgeous areas of New York. The hotel also organised our transport to the airport on our last day and held our bags for us until we were ready to go. Would definitely recommend!

title: Where coolness meets elegance
text:
I visited the Nomo Soho Hotel in early December. The location in the middle of Soho is simply top. I love this area with its shops, bars and restaurants. The entrance area of the hotel is beautifully designed. To get to the reception you take the elevator to the first floor. Contrary to other reports I found the staff in the lobby and at the reception very friendly and helpful - ok, from time to time I was sent back and forth between the concierge in the lobby and the reception if I had any questions. My room Deluxe King on the 21 floor had a beautiful view towards Lower Manhattan, and the furnishings were a combination of coolness and elegance. The room also had all other amenities and plenty of storage space.  The bed was very comfortable, shower and bath had enough space.  The free evening aperitif with various wines was very well appreciated by the hotel guests. The ideal moment to get to know people and make contacts. (if you are looking for peace and quiet, the lobby is not an ideal place at this time of the day. 

Nomo Kitchen is the hotel's own restaurant. Here I had lunch once. The location is super cool in a kind of winter garden. As a solo traveller I love to eat at the bar. This was no problem here. The small but nice lunch menu offers something for every taste. Also the drinks and cocktail menu invites to stay.

My conclusion:
I would recommend the Nomo Soho to everybody who does not like the typical traditional 5 star service although there is a lot offered here. Surely I will return.

title: nice but...
text: nice entrance, beautiful views, room is clean, hallways a bit dark, gym not good without music   and all  equipment malfunction, no cameras on elevator, music is so loud in the elevators don't feel safe, no hotel people in the lobby to answer my questions on directions.

title: Go and enjoy...
text:
Katie in reception was very warm and welcoming. Emily (in the restaurant) took such good care of me! Cheery, informative - the most professional and pleasant I've encountered in years.The bartenders were very upbeat and fun to talk to when I grabbed a nightcap, too! Every single staff member was positive, helpful, and professional. BRAVO for the wonderful people!
Was able to get a lot of work done in the restaurant - beautiful spot to work if you have to! Peaceful, bright - with good food and drink.
Ratings:
Staff - 5+++
Location - 5
Food/drink - 5
But - there were some initial room issues.
Got in at 2:30, room was ready. Cold, but figured heat had been turned down as the room was empty. Put thermostat on 80, unpacked, made calls, and did some work in the room - no change. Went to dinner, came back - no warmer. Cranked it up to 82 - nope. Cold all night. First thing went down to the desk. Katie immediately sent a tech up. Found the vents were angled towards the windows! Quick fix - yay!
Very upset I paid for a day/night and was so cold! But very appreciative that I received a call from the manager acknowledging the issues within 2 hours of finding out about them yesterday, telling me he was grateful for the feedback, and promising he would oversee my next stay.
Note: be aware that you pay a $40/day amenities fee. This includes water, a wine reception, wifi... make sure you get things. 
Both my kids live in NYC, I come often. I will be back to review again after my next stay.

title: A Gem in Disguise
text:
Nicely appointed room, even with its limited size, in a great location. 
Check-in staff not very helpful or courteous, but otherwise a good choice for a short stay. 
Had trouble getting the front desk agent to locate my luggage, which had been dropped off earlier:  she intended me to do the work for her.

title: Lean on Basic stuff
text: Do not try calling the hotel or ussing the guestroom phone to call guest services as no one will pick up the call. if you go to the main lobby you will find an empty desk as they do not offer concierge services. Well, they are missing an opprtunity to make money. Nice location, entrance is charmy but beat up.

title: NOMO Reality
text:
My partner and I stayed twice between December and January and we notice both times that the wall is badly damage at the entrance as we had to grab the luggage carts since no one was available. The fitness center is a joke, only one machine works.The only plus is that we got a corner room that was fresh and clean with an amazing view. 
I think is ok to also mention that the hotel operator or receptionist  may have been on vacation because there is no one picking up the phone, we called at least ten time on different occasions but no answer. What a waste!

title: How could be 4 and half stars ???
text:
No class, cheap designed room . How could this cheaply made hotel have same 4and1/2 stars like a wonderful hotel like The Intercontinental Barclay. or Marriott Marquis, Westin Times SQ.  Hilton mid town and Sheraton Tribeca have 4 stars.
This is not 4 stars even. This is 3 stars hotel and no more. No more than 3 stars hotel.

title: Lovely experience
text: We decided to book into the hotel after dropping in for a drink a couple of days earlier, what cliched it for us was the warm welcome we received from Kiara, the lovely girl who was doing happy hour in the bar, she was so nice and generous we knew we would enjoy our stay here. We were right, the rooms are lovely and there’s a great vibe in the hotel. I highly recommend booking here for your New York trip.

title: Christmas in New York
text:
My wife and I spend every Christmas (it also happens to be our anniversary) in NYC and we typically stay at a neighboring hotel. We stumbled on nomo online and decided try something new this year, and we have zero regrets. In fact, we almost instantly decided our new tradition will be to stay here. The hotel is clean and the rooms were amazing. We stayed in a corner suite with stunning views of the city skyline. We told the hotel manager it was our anniversary and he made it his mission to make sure were taken care of. The restaurant is amazing (strongly recommend you try if you stay here) and the entrance is very picturesque. 

Overall a great stay, and I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, modern place in the heart of the city.

title: Exterior is amazing
text: 2nd stay. Disappointed. Superior king room. Size of my closet. Took over 2 hours to get a coffee maker brought to my room, then no cups with it. Took another hour. Never told about coffee/tea/bottled water in the “bar” area. Didn’t acknowledge our anniversary. Husband got sick and went to enjoy Xmas breakfast alone and was told they were fully booked. Couldn’t accommodate 1??? More than half the tables were empty. Doubtful they will get our business in 2020. Neighborhood is one of the best in ny, cool cafes and shops.

title: Excelente hotel vale o preco da diaria
text: Com excelente localização no soho e com diversos restaurantes e comercio abundante. Apartamentos com linda vista da cidade que vale demais o investimento. Ha restaurante na area interna do hotel e ha entrada e saida pelas duas ruas

title: Great location
text:
Situated in a lovely street , the Nomo in Crosby street Soho is in a great spot with ideal proximity to the subway to all of Manhattan, Brooklyn and beyond.
The rooms are typically small but well maintained. The housekeeping services are superb. The price is expensive during the holiday season - but this is to be expected and is acceptable 
However, the attached restaurant brings down this hotel. The servers were extremely slow, disinterested and generally inhospitable. Breakfast was ridiculously overpriced and poor in quality- compared to the nearby cafes. 
So- stay in the hotel and eat elsewhere

title: Best Boutique Hotel in SOHO!
text: Had a beautiful stay at the NoMo in SoHo NY. The rooms and hotel is very clean with a great bar and restaurant, NoMo kitchen. Excellent staff, Tenzin was so accommodating and kind as well as very helpful with anything we needed. Recommend staying here, the double deluxe room is spacious enough for a few people and the view was gorgeous from the 24th floor!

title: Lovely stay over thanksgiving
text:
My girlfriend and I stayed for 3 nights over Thanksgiving. The hotel has unrestricted views of the city, lovely rooms, great views and attentive staff.

The floor manager Tenzin Basnet ensured we had a lovely room (on a high floor) and a great view to make sure our stay was extra special. 

Would recommend!!

title: Not 4 Star
text:
First I’ll start with the positives. 
Located on a quiet street in SoHo with good access to the subway. Beautiful restaurant on ground floor and friendly staff. Rooms are adequate size for NYC and if you are an iPrefer member they’ll upgrade you if possible.
Now the room itself was fine but I’ll tell you what it was lacking.
A top sheet on the bed. All you had to use was a comforter. 
Extra pillows on hand since the ones they provide are super thin. 
Drinking glasses. If you woke up in the middle of the night you’d better hope to not drink the one bottle of water they provide as there were no glasses to fill up at sink. 
Turn down service, if you can even call it that. Coming in to make a bed and add extra towels is not the same as a turn down service. So why say included in your stay? 
And while the restaurant was beautiful, don’t bother trying to eat there as it was closed for private events both nights.
Overall, this is not a four star hotel. I’ve stayed at two other Preferred Hotels properties within the past six months and NoMo SoHo doesn’t match up. But stay if you can get a cheaper rate than usual.

title: Corporate Event
text: I had the pleasure of hosting our first Investors forum for one of my clients in the Finance industry and working with Mariya in the events department at NoMo SoHo.  I've planned many events before and I have to say this staff blew it out of the park!  They were incredible to work with and catered to my every need.  Mariya in particular was amazing as well as Kathie and Eddie.  It was so nice to work with such an incredible venue and people who really cared and made the event a HUGE success!  I would definitely recommend this venue for an event.  The ambiance is truly beautiful and very "cool" and "hip".

title: Amazing Hotel beautiful place
text:
This Hotel is a very amazing place in New York City.  It is a beautiful hotel to look at and I love the rooms and the colors.The rooms are beautiful with nice view. The hotel has very interesting art that make it feel like a gallery.
Daniela and Marina at the restaurants were very nice with us in the mornings. And Kiara was very nice with us at the free wine hour. 
The most helpful person for us was Ritin at the concierge desk.  He gave us so many good suggestions on where to go and what to see, and even took the time to help us make a day plan for the time we were there, and give very good advise on amazing restaurants. He really help to make our trip full of memories.

title: Great room but meh service
text:
I would stay here again due to the great location, comfortable beds, and great views. Front desk needs to be retrained on service and friendliness.

Cons:
--Biggest con of all: Front desk staff. They were very short with us and lacking friendly service. We were staying in a suite and through a reward partner, too. Any small request or question was met with no warmth. Most disappointing front desk. Holiday Inn has done better. It's not so hard to be nice!
--Chilly room in winter if you have mostly outside windows as walls. Lots of condensation on the glass also. Keep the blinds closed most of the time to keep warm.
--No slippers or robes in our suite

Pros:
--Nice, new TV you can watch from bed! Highly suggest on a bad weather day.
--LOVED the comfortable bedding and pillows
--Complimentary coffee or tea in the morning (6-9am?) & wine (4-5pm?) for guests
--Housekeeping was friendly

Overall pretty nice. Should have better service for the price.

title: a trendy and smart choice
text: Ideally located on stylish and secluded Crosby St almost in the heart of SOHO. Chinatown, Little Italy and -obviously- SOHO are just at footsteps for you to enjoy. If you go for upper floor rooms you ll be amazed by the views of manhattan and you may be lucky enough to get those views on impressive picture windows in the showers. Rooms are well appointed, clean and with linen and pillows of top quality. Housekeeping and Room service are attentive and efficient. You wont be disappointed

title: Great Boutique Hotel with a fantastic staff and great vibe
