text: We really enjoyed the hotel staff especially Enock and the team in the bar and restaurant. Wonderful people doing a great job it really made all the difference. I would  highly recommend that a friend or family visit when in SOHO.

title: Beautiful Hotel and Awesome Service!
text:
Our family of 6 stayed at the NoMo SoHo 
over Thanksgiving and had a wonderful experience!  The restaurant/bar is gorgeous!  Our bartender, Enock, provided us with excellent service and was incredibly kind and welcoming. Highly recommend!!

title: Great Service
text: The bar was awesome! Our bartender Enock was very welcoming and entertaining! He was very kind to us, and always serves us quickly. Our favorite part was when we would make drinks up on the spot when we were not sure what we wanted. The NOMO SOHO bar, and Enock were great!

title: Soho Hotel Stay
text: We loved our stay at the NOMO SOHO. We were there for one night and it's in our favourite neighbourhood, easily walkable, very clean, nice staff and a really cute room with everything we could need. Rooms are "small" but absolutely on par with NYC hotel rooms.

title: Ciao Bella
text: I stay at this property a few months back when I come with my friends and I came to NYC to celebrate a bridal shower.  We had a great time then and I decide to stay here this time again with my boyfriend.  I was very happy to see one more time Chiara from the restaurant as she is very nice with me.  And am also very happy to see again Ritin from the concierge.  He was very good with helping me the first time and also the second time.  He even remember me by my name and make me feel very welcome and give me very good things to do and go to show my boyfriend New York. The Hotel as beautiful as before and this time the room was very nice with very nice view.  I tell all my friends in Milano to come stay here because very beautiful, very clean, and good stores and food close to hotel.

title: NOMO SOHO Kiara at the wine bar!
text: The wine bar at NOMO SOHO is wonderfully thoughtful and has the best service. Kiara at their complementary wine bar was attentive, friendly and gave “generous” pours of whatever wine we selected. It’s a wonderful addition to the NOMO hotel and a hidden treasure of NYC. Thank you Kiara!!

title: Excellent Hotel on every level
text: As a repeat customer of NoMo Soho, I am more delighted with the property with every stay -  exceptionally clean: kind generous professional staff; delicious room service food; enchanting restaurant.  One of my favorite hotels anywhere.

title: Perfect weekend
text:
On the second weekend in November I stayed at NOMO SOHO and it was the best choice.  I usually stay in midtown, but this weekend we had a wedding in Brooklyn on Sat. Night and my wife and I were going with my son and his wife, who live in Tribeca.  In addition to being very convenient to all of SOHO it was easy UBER convenient to the wedding venue.

When we first arrived late on Friday night, we ended up having a late addition to our suite.  We called down to have someone make up the “trundle couch” and instant housekeeping was there to make our daughter feel at home.

Finally, on Sunday we went for a family birthday brunch to NOMO Kitchen on the ground level of the Hotel.  The food and staff were great and attentive to the goings on at our celebration.  Overall, staying at NOMO SOHO this week was perfect.

title: Nice hotel in good position, grade B
text: The hotel is in a great position. Room was very clean, bathroom is tiny, no in-room facilities for tea/coffee (queen std room). You can hear next door neighbors talk+tv so when in happens in the middle of the night it is very disturbing. Restaurant is fairly good but very expensive for what they offer. If you get to stay with an offer price it is ok

title: Live the city of NY
text:
Excellent location; amazing facilities, room and bed! Breakfast was awesome and staff is very friendly and helpful. 

The bed was so comfortable and the room was very clean.

Is near the metro so you can move easily in the city.

title: Best experience
text: I have been to the hotel in the past. However,  this was my first time having a corporate event on site and I couldn’t be happier with the two individuals who went above and beyond to support all my needs. Elliott Encarnacion and Maskim did such an AMAZING JOB! Elliott was super attentive and responsive when I needed him. I will definitely consider using this property in the future due to the support and attention I received from Elliott. He was very pleasant and always thrilled to help me, rather it be with AV needs to moving frames from the wall so that we could hang up papers that we were using for our meeting. Thank you so much for such a great experience.

title: Read this before booking
text: The best part of this hotel is it's location.  Here are the issues:  Payed full price for a room that was 200 square feet,  about the size of a prison cell.  The color is sterile white with an odd bizarre ultra blue hue.  The room was clean,  it's best amenity.  Only one small metal chair with small and tiny 18" x 24" metal counter with a box of extremely high priced offerings for sale including a "sex kit complete with condoms, feather tickler(?), vibrator and lubrication, $10 bottle of water, Jascques Torres chocolates,  wine, etc.   You almost had to turn sideways to walk around the bed without hitting the TV mounted on the wall at the foot of the bed.  The bathroom, was slightly larger than a toilet stall you would see at an airport crammed with toilet and shower.  Toilet paper was one grade softer than sandpaper held in a vertical holder glued to the tank behind you in which you had to take off and use like you would in an outhouse setting.  A small towel holder above the toilet was the only storage for towel, no hooks or anything else beside the toilet to set your towels.  The shower head was located at about 7 feet and you had no choice but to stand under it when you turned it on adjusting the ice cold water waiting to warm.  The drain was completely clogged when I took a shower and the water flooded the room, in which I had to take the two towels I had to soak up the water.  I went to the front desk to complain and ask them to fix it,  the girl at the desk said it would be taken care of.  The following day,  I called the front desk to ask if it was fixed and was assured it was as I needed to get washed and out for a meeting.   When I was taking a shower,  the water filled the 3" basin and overflowed again,  flooding the room.  They sent a maintenance man up who was not too happy.  He tried to clear it with a can of propellant which didn't work,  then had to get a drain "snake".  After 45 minutes, he unclogged the drain.  I was an hour late for my meeting.  The heating unit kicks on and off throughout the night with a loud humming sound if you'er a light sleeper.  You can hear your neighbors shower running and tinkle sounds which you can assume what they were doing.   I am happy to say the bed was clean and comfortable.  There are two night stands on either side about 12" x 12",  only enough room to set your glasses and cell phone.  no clock in the room.  They offer coffee in the morning, two pots that were empty and a line of guests waiting for 20 minutes for them to be refilled, at 8am.  I was one of them and people were not happy about this.  After all this,  a nice surprise sheet of paper left under my door the morning of departure for "Amenities" charges,  $90!  When asked what it was for,  they said it was for the "free wine tasing, coffee, and other offerings that nobody ever uses or knows about.   I complained to the manager on duty about the flooding.  He knocked off the Amenity charges and offered breakfast in which I declined as I had plans.  I would not recommend this hotel and will not return.

title: 3 stars hotel
text:
Rooms are 3 stars - Hotel is pricey - Only the restaurant is worth visiting.
Overall experience is bad. Staff is ok. Location ok but not great.
I will certainly not go back in this hotel. No glass in the rooms, nothing to hang your towels, no wardrobe.

title: not bad
text: this the second time in your hotel, many years ago my first time experience  was really good, hotel bar was so cool, restaurant was perfect but this time I couldn't find my expectations. 2 times I found different luggage's in my room in different time. I called front desk and they took away. another day I ordered lunch in my room after one hour they said "we sent to your room but you didn't open the door" then we realized that they send to wrong room and I waited again. every morning in the restaurant I waisted a lot of time because of (kitchen) service.

title: Soho visit
text: Great little boutique hotel.  Close to shopping and many restaurants. Very friendly helpful staff. Room was small but efficient. I would eliminate the Mini Bar and tray of amenities for purchase. Who pays for these overpriced items?

title: Terrible
text: Used to be my go to place as I have family in this area. I have stayed there more than 15 times in the last two years. This hotel, under new management is terrible. Will never stay again - lost the service i used to love - and rooms are tired..at best. Worst service ever - both front desk and housekeeping.

title: Great Location, Underwhelming Experience
text:
The photos looked so great, but our experience was not. We were very excited to stay at this hotel in a part of the city we'd never explored before, but our experience at this hotel was less than extraordinary. We arrived in late on Thursday night and were told we could grab some food from either room service or the restaurant before 11 pm. We went down to the restaurant at 10:40 and were rudely told by an unfriendly hostess that the kitchen was closed, when we explained our situation (that we had been traveling all day, had not eaten and were staying at the hotel) she was unhelpful and did not seem to care.So we went back upstairs, told the front desk and they did nothing to help. Called room service a few minutes later and no one answered. Not the best customer service nor first impression. 

The room itself was quite small for being a 'deluxe' there was barely enough room to walk around the beds. If you are ok with being in a tight space and paying over $250 a night for a room then you'll enjoy it. I don't think it was worth the cost just for the location. That was a plus, but the overall room itself was lacking - there were no glasses, not even a glass for water, and not even a soap dish for the bathroom sink. These are simple things to expect for the cost. Overall very underwhelming.

title: Bebida con amigas
text:
Excelente servicio de Erica en el restaurante. Felicitaciones!!!!!! Es divino el sitio. Fue maravilloso como nos hizo sentir Erica
Los mejores sitios de Soho, no se nos olvidará nunca. Nos dio los mejores nachos de remolacha que he comido.

title: Bebidas con amigos
text: Visitamos el bar y recibimos un servicio excelente de Erika; demasiado amable; nos consiguió comida que no estaba en el menú; se esforzó demasiado en hacernos sentir bien y hacernos pasar un tiempo maravilloso

title: Worth the visit
text: Beautiful hotel, overall a great experience...from the moment I called to say we would be arriving late I knew it was a special place.  When we arrived we were greeted by a spectacular entrance.  Our room was a little tight, but had a spectacular view.  The restaurant is amazing, definitely worth a visit!  I am giving the hotel 4 stars because when we went back to our room on the last day we found we had been locked out of our room.  Not sure why, we had a late check out.  I had to call twice and wait over 20 minutes for someone to open our room.  This really upset me, if we had been on  a tight schedule we would have missed our flight.

title: Watch out for the Facility Charge and Bottled Water in the room
text: This is a nice hotel in a very good area to use as a base for sight seeing New York. Subway is close by. Make point to ask for a room on a high floor. Our room was on 24th Floor with a view of Brooklyn Bridge. The other side of the hotel has views towards the empire state building. We found the staff friendly an efficient. Note that the roof top bar does no longer exist, however the is a decent bar on the ground floor within the restaurant area. Watch for the room facility charge this is added to your bill and not included in the room rate, $44 dollars per room per night soon adds up. We found New York expensive, we had meal in hotel restaurant one night x2 cocktails, x2 two course meals, a glass of wine and x1 beer £170.00 and portions were not great. Be aware that after the first night the bottled water in the room is charged @ $10 per bottle per day if you use it, this was over the top for a bottle of water which given the costs of staying at this hotel you would reasonably expect to be included.

title: Loved it
text:
Close to metro. Very nice place Great location, very good service. Will definitely return to the same hotel. Walking distance from shopping. Close to the subway- 3 min walk.
Staff are kind.
I definitely recommend it

title: Halloween
text: Fui para NYC com meus amigos para os dias de Halloween e decidimos dessa vez nos  hospedar no Soho. Foi uma grata surpresa este hotel. Quarto e banheiros ótimos, staff sempre cordial que atendia prontamente qualquer solicitação, seja de água, toalhas, entregas. WI-Fi também funcionou muito bem. Vale destacar que o Hotel recebe todas as entregar e entrega no seu quarto sem cobrar nada por isso. Alem disso fiz o check out mais rápido da minha vida.Talvez as únicos pontos que precisamos de certa forma melhorar seria a luminosidade da manha no quarto e a arrumação/limpeza do quarto.

title: NoMo SoHo
text: Lovely entrance way, this was probably the best part of the hotel.  The room was so-so, furniture and bed were not particularly comfortable and the blue carpet showed every bit of lint, etc. so was hard to keep clean.  Service was below average and dropped the ball a few times.  Decent location for shoppers and people watching.

title: Nomo Soho experience
text: Just because of the "dine in the room" experience it is average. Cleanliness is a 10!! Love the room and the hotel, just service is not that good. We spend $3600 and I asked for a paper delivery and this was not possible.

title: Bra belliggenhet, små og lytte rom,
text: Flott hotell med potensiale for en fantastisk utsikt.  Dessverre var rommene små, det var altfor lytt mellom rommene og gangen, og det føltes som et ran å skulle betale ca 45 USD i tillegg til en stiv rompris for tjenester som ellers bør regnes som inkludert (kaffe/te i lobbyen (ikke på rommet (!)), aviser, tilgang til treningsrom, vannflaske ved ankomst). Rommene var freshe, men ikke veldig praktiske, da badet ikke er veldig lydisolert, og om man skal på toalettet om natten, vil hele rommet ble belyst. Ikke mye plass til ting og kofferter. Hyggelige ansatte i resepsjonen og renhold, concierge var derimot ikke like hyggelig, som er synd siden det er første person man møter...

title: Stellar Hotel, Great Location
text: NoMo Soho is very reasonably priced given its location. Some rooms are more up to date than others but at the very least i always find the rooms to be clean. the hotel is a bit sceney with tourists everywhere taking pictures at the entrance, which can be a bit annoing. but overall if you want to be near great shopping and restaurants in Soho its a great option.

title: great hotel
text: the rooms were a little small, but that is to be expected in NYC. The hotel was very clean and welcoming, and the staff was amazing and professional. The location is great and you are close to everything you could possibly need.

title: Nightmare in NY
text: I booked a family room, basically for 4 people, impossible to be there because 2 sigle beds (« small king size »). I asked the manager to change, no way because of booking reservation, impossible to discuss with him, aggressive and unpleasant. Horrible experience, sens of service less then zero, no understanding, no service, no more customer of this very bed hotel; and expensive!!!

title: Denied at front desk
text: Absolutely appalled by the front end manager Steven Barcomb and staff. I made reservations for my daughters 19th birthday weekend, no where on their site did it say 21 to check in. She drove an hour to nyc with her boyfriend, tried to check in and was turned away. When she called me and I asked to speak to someone I heard the staff loud and clear say "no we don't want to speak to her". My daughter travels all over for her YouTube work and checks into hotels all over the world. They turned her away had valet bring her car and dumped her in nyc with no hotel. That's so unprofessional and disgusting! Thankfully the Marriott close by not only gave her a room but dinner and more because she was so upset. Marriott always steps up! The only reason my daughter picked nomo is because she has attended events there and stayed in the penthouse. Absolutely will never be back. Waiting for FULL payment back!

title: Great Location
text: This is a beautiful hotel in a great part of SoHo. For the price of this hotel you would expect more customer service. The few interactions I had were lackluster and employees seemed indifferent. There was no in room coffee so you had to pay for room service or leave for coffee.

title: ONLY staying here now
text: everything about our experience was amazing - the service, the cleanliness, the location, the price, etc! Wish we could have stayed longer because it made our trip so much more fun. The three blocks around the hotel have everything you could ever want!

title: Was hoping for the best
text: GREAT location, not so great property - from the "attitude" of the front desk to the poor maid service to the weirdly LUMPY pillows to the staff changing their clothes in the lobby/library area - I would choose to a different hotel.

title: Good Location, Bad service
text: There are so many hotels to choose from in NYC, thought I’d try something new but was rather disappointed. The room is very small, did not like the sink being part of the room, housekeeping service is quite poor and very slow. The front desk staff (with the exception of the 1 male there) had way too much attitude and was not friendly or helpful. There is NO business center. Had coffee downstairs one morning and the “maids” were there changing their clothes and packing their bags where I was sitting in the lobby area - unusual for such an expensive hotel. Overall, NOT worth the prices they charge sorry to say.

title: Feeling Ripped Off
text: During the past three years, I have stayed at the NoMo Soho Hotel four times. I have been very satisfied with the level of service from their excellent staff and the location of the hotel is outstanding with only short walks required to reach Little Italy, Chinatown, Soho, and Tribeca. Since the Subway entrances are nearby, travel to other areas of the city is easy. Also, my hotel rooms have always been clean, comfortable, and quiet. The price of each of those rooms was reasonable until my most recent visit revealed an item had been added to my bill which was non-negotiable. Apparently, the management of this hotel has decided to hide the true cost of a room by adding an “amenity fee” of $40 per day. When I questioned this additional cost, I was presented with a list of “amenities” which I never used and never would use. Again, there was no option to reject these “amenities” and they were subject to city and state taxes totaling $5.90 per day. If the management of this hotel needs to raise the rates of their rooms by $45.90 per day, I would encourage them to do it honorably and publish their room rates accordingly. As a formally loyal customer, I feel betrayed and victimized by this shoddy and greedy business practice. Since this is not the only hotel in New York City, next time I travel, I will find more reputable accommodations.

title: View from the 13th floor is Awesome
text:
We stayed here and Loved it
Our room had a wall of windows😱

Canal st. Is a step out the door. 
You can shop all day walking the neighborhood.

We started in China town and without realizing it were in *Little Italy.
Just a really great place to check out.
Highly recommend to anyone.

title: Cute Hotel
text: The hotel is super cute and the rooms are cute too. My bed was broken and I told the lady when I was checking out and she literally could not have cared less. All she said was 'ok'. The smugness of the staff is disappointing but the hotel itself is nice. Although I would sit on your bed to check if it's broken as soon as you get to the room.

title: Nice clean, fresh hotel rooms, (awful bar service)
text:
hotel clean & fresh, great location 

had an unfortunate experience with poor attitude of bar staff and cold food, which needed to be returned to the kitchen
sadly the staff can make such a big difference to how you feel, this time it was not in a positive way

title: Ok...... but
text:
So we stayed here for 6 nights. 2 couples. Our room was good (1812)but my sisters was smaller(1808) and not so well laid out. Views were superb. Staff really nice and helpful and room always lovely and clean. Great position in Soho with a quirky feel to it. 
BUT BEWARE
there is a resort/amenities fee of $40 PER NIGHT on top of the room rate. It is stated but in small print. This charge entitles you to a room safe? And free Wifi? Also a newspaper in the foyer, water and fruit as long as you are up to get it before 9am. Use of the fitness room and a turn down service but you have to request it. They do provide bottled water on your first day. Now the big thing if you’re a wine drinker is the free wine between 5pm and 6pm. Red and white and some nights Prosecco. Maybe the $40 a night is worth it if you’re a big drinker and you’re in the hotel at that time!! My other gripe is that there is no tea or coffee making facilities in your room. Apparently due to health and safety. (There is an iron in the room? ) included in the $40 per night is free tea and coffee in the foyer between 6am and 10am. So my husband gets dressed to go down 18floors to get our drinks. He scolds himself on the way back as the cups are so hot and spills some when trying to press the floor button in the lift. After the 3rd try he realises that if he uses 3 cups to insulate the heat, his hands are ok!! Happy days. I know it’s a small thing but a cuppa in bed, is it too much to ask?

title: Challenging, Disorganized ... Lacks “a touch of class”
text:
Let me first say that our corner room on the 22nd floor was lovely . The views were terrific.. Our towels were at times taken but never replaced. The checkin is excruciating. You arrive on the ground floor , expecting to checkin. You wander til someone tells you to take an elevator to the next floor but leave your bags there. Then you come back to ground floor and someone takes your ticket and assigns you a room.
The Libby has sloppy, eccentric, uncomfortable seating that makes everyone look like a slob. We couldn’t get an alcoholic drink to enjoy on the outside patio. And that’s my story....disappointing.

title: Great view, great food.
text: While the closet space was incredibly small, and there is not much free space in the "queen room with great view", the view was amazing. The location is also a good fit for those who enjoy shopping. I especially enjoyed the room service, as I the pancakes I ordered were amazing. Their coffee is pretty nice too. I love how they have the complimentary tea in the morning as well. The NOMO SOHO restaurant is a beauty as well - the staff are kind even under pressure of regular NY busy-hour.

title: מלון מקסים מיקום נהדר
text:
קיבלנו המלצות חמות ואכן לא התאכזבנו. המלון במקום פנטסטי בסוהו.
קיבלנו סוויטה גדולה ל 3. המחיר מעולה...
המלון נקי והשרות מצויין.
יש פינת קפה חופשית..
כל יום Happy Hour כמו יין חופשי לאורחים.
בכניסה בקבוקי מים חינם, פירות וכו'..

title: I’m not staying in this hotel NoMo! Pun intended
text: This hotel is very nice and trendy in the lobby. It’s not worth the price for the type of room and service get. My stay was not terrible but subpar. I had issue with cleanliness on the pillows and the bathrooms. Issues were resolved first impressions are everything.

title: Third time was not the charm.
text: This was my third stay at this hotel in the past two years. The first two times I stayed, once with my husband and once with two friends, I loved the property. Unfortunately during this third stay the hotel lost it's luster for me. I still love the location on a quiet street in Soho within easy walking distance to restaurants and shopping. However, the hotel lobby is looking tired and needs a revamp. The room was just ok. The service was marginal. And then there's the accounting. I had booked the trip for our group of three with three separate rooms for four nights each. You'd think that might have merited a little bit of an upgrade or some show of appreciation, but no. I got the small room on the lower floor with the scaffolding view. When I mentioned that to the front desk staff their response was that they had no way of knowing that I was the one that made the reservation. Ok, not a big deal so I let it go. Then I see that they have charged my credit card for some of the other rooms. I'm still not confident that they've gotten the accounting straightened out. Too much time and brain damage on this one. At this price point I'm pretty sure I can find a better option for my next trip.

title: Boa localização
text: Hotel bem no meio do Soho, só por ai já tem seu charme. A entrada vale uma boas fotos, é belíssima! O quarto que ficamos apesar de pequeno, era confortável e bem decorado. Tinha uma janela enorme, carpete em todo o quarto e uma decoração em azul e branco bem charmosa. Fui com o meu marido e passamos ótimos momentos lá.

title: 3 Punkte wegen der Lage ...
text: ...  denn, weiterhin hat das Hotel nicht allzu viel zu bieten – wenn man von den überteuerten Preisen einmal absieht.  Das Personal scheint überfordert, auch mit einfachsten Fragen. Regenschirme, wenn es regnet, Fehlanzeige. Bestenfalls aufgesetzte Freundlichkeit. Die Zimmer haben längst bessere Zeiten gesehen, das Bett viel zu klein, das Sofa ungemütlich, Schrankplatz kaum vorhanden. Essensgerüche aus der Küche steigen in die Zimmer auf – Pfui. Zu laute Gruppen werden aus Auslastungsgründen beherbergt. Fazit: da muss es Besseres geben für den Preis.

title: Шикарный отель
text:
Расположение: отлично. В районе Soho очень атмосферно, безопасно, рядом 2 станции метро, универмаг и много-много Кафе.
Номер: белоснежный, чистый, не большой по площади, но очень компактный, все необходимое есть.
Вид: прекрасный! С одной стороны окна выходят на Уолл Стрит, с другой - на Эмпайр Стейт Билдинг. 
Работа персонала: отлично, дружелюбные и отзывчивые. Просила при бронировании номер повыше, чтобы вид был отличный, и они это учли! 
Завтрак не включала, оценить не могу, но на территории отеля есть очень атмосферное Кафе с красивым интерьером.

title: Loved this hotel!
text:
The location is fantastic and the vibe is so great! But the views from the rooms are unreal!  We were in a corner room 1608 and had views on two sides of the room - full glass including a huge window in the shower, which caused me to be late as a lovely warm shower and a window to look out of is not a great combination for punctuality!
The staff were helpful and polite and we would definitely stay here again!! The decor in the rooms was warm and welcoming and the beds very comfy!! A coffee machine would have been welcome!

title: Go Go Go
text: I simply love this restaurant.  It is so beautiful, unique and very special.    You should go with family, celebrate a birthday.  Start Late in the day, enjoy the daytime that moves night.   The food is very very good.  The service is also excellent!

title: Hidden gem in Soho
text: My family and I really enjoyed our stay at NoMo. We loved, loved the room and the location. The view from our room was amazing and my boys loved all the art in the hotel. We will definitely book the same hotel again the next time we visit NYC.

title: Super alla moda e vista fantastica
text:
Ho soggiornato al Nomo Soho dal 9 al 14 settembre 2019 con mia figlia 
Hotel di tendenza in un quartiere alla moda.
Profumi e cura dei dettagli sono la sua caratteristica ed ristorante è ottimo.
Camere pulite nel loro piccolo dotate di tutti i comfort, incluso asse e ferro da stiro!
Letto comodo!
Noi avevamo una camera  Premium  Queen con una vista spettacolare sulla midtown da est ad ovest. 
Il personale è gentile ed efficiente!
Per la cena a pochi passi dall’hotel si possono trovare anche  vari ristorantini 
Lo consiglio vivamente a chi vuole vivere la città in maniera dinamica, giovane e non solo da turista!

title: Not the best
text: The cost of the room was high for what you received. The IT system was down when I checked out, so could not review the bill. It was emailed to me later with a number of erroneous charges added on. Also room service was expensive (tip and fees added automatically to the bill).

title: When you pay this price, you expect the little things
text:
We stayed in the King Suite for five days. Enjoyed the room, sleep ,and view. Staff is inexperienced. Concierge/b bellmen could not get us a cab and insisted on private transports (which if your not from the city cost significantly more than a cab). 
Coffee is not in the room and even though its free when you go downstairs to get it, staff will charge you 8 bucks to bring it upstairs with breakfast.
Also...you have TWO entrances. Why make people walk all the around to Crosby to enter the building. you are ignoring an opportunity.
Over three grand for five days (over 600 a night)  should be attentive to the  little things. your playing with the big boys. bring it, do't hold back. Dont make someone come down 24 floors for a cup of coffee.

title: Modern, Luxurious Hotel with Excellent Service
text: We loved our stay at the NoMo SoHo. Great room with a lovely view. All of the staff was so friendly and accommodating. They even sent us a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary! We will definitely be staying here again next time we are in NYC.

title: Save your money
text: This wasn't my first time staying at this hotel, but it will surely be my last. I was given a room with a broken sink and the phone in the room was not working. I had to move to another room which was a waste of time since I only stayed for two nights. Upon moving to the other room, there was broken glass on the ground which could have injured a guest were they bare foot. After calling the manager and threatening to write a bad review, he said I had every right to complain and to do so if I wanted to. Never in my life has someone suggested I go ahead and write a bad review about their establishment instead of trying to diffuse the situation. The manager and staff should learn the basics about customer service. Save your money and go to another hotel where they will treat you like royalty and the rooms are adequately prepared and checked upon your arrival. Waste of my time and money.

title: home in our daughter's city
text: This is a Great hotel and very convenient to walk to SOHO as well as Chinatown and Little Italy.  Rooms are clean and beautiful with wonderful views.  The bar offers wonderful cocktails.  We have stayed here multiple times and the staff is always helpful, friendly and welcoming.

title: Soho Gem
text: We loved our stay at the Nomo Soho! The location is great as it's in the heart of Soho with walking distance to stores and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and accommodating the bar/restaurant at lobby level is worth an apperetivo.

title: A bit disappointed
text: Hotel is in a good location and is quite swanky.  Rooms not very big, but adequate.  No clocks or minibar in room.  During the 2nd night of my stay, the main bar/restaurant/patio was closed ALL DAY for a private event and had i known that, i would've stayed elsewhere.

title: That amenities is a sting to an otherwise great stay
text: Great hotel, hip ambience and nice rooms even though they're on the small side (it is New York!). The surrounding area was fabulous. But that amenities fee spoils it all for me and so I'm not sure I'd stay again if they continue to charge it. Shame really

title: NoMo in Soho Ny
text:
The NoMo hotel is a great choice if you are looking for a get away in Ny. The decor even from the street before you enter is something to see.!! And The inside of this hotel is 
 Very cool and will not leave you disappointed !! The rooms are very nice with some great views of the city.
It is located in a great section of the city as well.
The extra attention the staff gives is a huge benefit in staying here. From the moment we called to book our reservations the front desk manager Tenzin Basnet
Took excellent care of us. Stayed in contact with us and made sure we had the best stay!!! We truly appreciated 
All that he did and will be sure to visit the NoMo hotel I’m Soho again.!!

title: SoHo Jem
text:
I stayed there at the beginning of September with a couple of my girlfriends as we were celebrating a few birthdays and an engagement.  The Hotel is BEAUTIFUL and the entrance definitely made for some awesome selfie photo shoots.  The rooms are bright and clean though maybe a bit on the small side, but I guess thats normal for NYC.  The NoMo kitchen is a beautiful restaurant especially for breakfast.  The staff is friendly. Vanessa who was hosting the wine hour was an absolute  doll and thanks to Ritin at the concierge desk who helped us with our restaurant choices and reservations as well as giving us all  the great  info we needed to do the "girly" things we wanted to do while we were there.  He redally helped make our stay there special.
The only negative I have is that there was a bellman working there that was a bit on the creepy side.  He was older with dark hair, and he made us feel a bit uncomfortable by injecting himself into our conversation. Maybe he was trying to compliment us, but the way he was doing it made us feel he was a bit of a perv, and we didn't feel comfortable leaving our bags with him so we waited for the other guy who was very friendly.  If you are a single girl or a group of girls staying here and dont want to feel creeped out - avoid the old bellman with the dark hair.  Other than that - we had a great stay!

title: So worth it
text: Felt like a queen in this hotel.  The food was delicious and service was excellent. Everyone is helpful and attentive  rooms are beautiful. Location is great. Dining area bright with beautiful natural light.

title: Lovely and different
text: I just love arriving at the Nomo, with their beautiful entry way, the garden, it is so inviting and feels cozy. The rooms are clean and comfy. I love the breakfast menu, avocado spread, chia seed pudding, what a nice change.

title: Great hotel, great location
text: Highly recommend this hotel.  Location is perfect and the rooms are nice and clean and have great views. I have to put 200 words and I'm not sure what else to say other than I would recommend the hotel to anyone looking to stay in NYC.

title: Great location!
text: I thought the hotel was beautiful, but the constant barrage of people taking selfies/pics at the entrance and in the lobby a little annoying at times. Other than that, I thought it was a great location and close to everything!

title: Pleasure
text:
Wnat a great hotel!! Great junior suite! Perfect location for Soho, Little Itsly, Chinatown and West Village. Unbelievable bar and restsurant licated in a solaium. Staff was fabulous- a shoutout to Jeffrey at reception whi hooked us up with an extra room  on short notice.
Will definitely return as often as possible!

title: Très bel hotel
text: Pas de 5 étoiles car l’accueil est déplorable ...outre le fait que notre réservation a été annulée pour la première nuit pour un problème de CB que nous n’avons pu résoudre étant dans l’avion 😳😡. Chercher un autre hôtel à 1 h du matin c pas ce qu’il y a de mieux! Sinon hôtel bien placé à la deco sympa. La suite King au 19 e a une vue fabuleuse..plus belle que tous  les rooftops.

title: NoMo SoHo is a must - I will return for sure
text:
If you are planning a trip to NYC staying at NoMo SoHo is a must. Surrounded by fabulous neighborhoods and hip boutiques this is easily one of the most intriguing and coolest hotels in New York. Overflowing with style, there is a clear passion for art and design here.
The rooms were bright, clean and thoughtfully and uniquely laid out. We had a room on the 21st floor and the huge windows opened up to a beautiful view. 
We had dinner at the onsite restaurant NoMo Kitchen and it was exceptional. We started with the house-made focaccia with whipped ricotta, fennel salt, and the octopus with saffron lentils, sherry, chorizo, and celery heart, …so good. Our entrees were equally delicious. We also had some wonderful cocktails at the bar adjacent to the restaurant. I can’t remember the bartender's name - but he was very friendly, made some great cocktails and played great music! I had to try the New York Sour, and it was spot on. 
We ordered room service on two occasions and everything was delivered promptly and service was on-point. Breakfast, in particular, was very good. 
We travel often and have very high standards. This hotel exceeded my expectations at every level. Rooms were bright, clean and comfortable. The staff, from check-in to housekeeping was superb. This hotel will most definitely leave a lasting impression and I will return for sure. Well done management.

title: Hosted Company Event at Nomo Soho
text:
We hosted a company event at Nomo Soho and Mariya is a pleasure to work with. My team and I truly appreciated Mariya’s partnership and support planning our event. We were so pleased with our experience working with Mariya and Nomo Soho, but mostly Mariya. 

We only heard wonderful things about the space, the service, and the menu, and we’re so pleased our guests had a great time. If you plan an event at Nomo Soho, request to work with Mariya. Elliot was helpful the day of, but Mariya is fantastic and the best in the industry!

title: Nice hotel but beware overcharging
text: Great location and good rooms but I found mysterious charges on my account. These weren’t part of the famous Resort Tax but additional charges that were just plain incorrect. This is the second time I have stayed at the hotel and the second time this has happened. Cioncidence??? Not sure.

title: Contemporary but comfortable
text: Great location, very well appointed and comfortable. I would highly recommend the Nomo Soho. The service is on point and not obtrusive. The decor is very cool and the entrance is a focal point for photo shoots.

title: Wonderful Staff and Great Design
text: The Nomo in Soho has great design. Each room and space has been carefully curated with modern design. The team here is friendly and helpful, in particular, thank you to Kiara Baret, Lamar and Josè who have gone above and beyond. It’s in a great location and would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great little spot!
text: We really loved our stay here. The hotel is modern and lovely without being over the top. The location is great, very close to the subway lines on Canal but enough off canal to be quiet and nice. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was bright and clean and a good size for NYC standards. The bed was very comfy and we had no issue getting a few extra pillows. I would stay here again for sure.

title: Very Helpful Front Office Manager
text:
I've stayed at NoMo on a few occasions and during my recent stay, had some issues with my room after check in. Tenzin, the Front Office Manager, was extremely helpful in making sure he got me into a comfortable room, which ultimately had the best view in the house! 

I am very grateful for his consideration and would recommend this property to others. I will be returning again for work travel and leisure. Ideal Soho location and friendly staff.

title: Loved NoMo SoHo - Get the 25th floor terrace room!
text: Wow, what a beautiful hotel and great room! The 25th floor "Penthouse 1" floor was amazing and the terrace was to die for. Only tiny point of critical feedback would be to suggest that they should put up a 6 foot full divider between terraces of room 2512 and the neighboring room. There are small 3 foot planters currently and it was a little awkward the few times we encountered our neighbors on the 'private' patio. Other than that, wow, definitely 5 stars.

title: An Unexpected Pleasant Surprise
text:
After a long, stressful and dissatisfied Labor Day Weekend in NYC our flight out of LGA was cancelled and rescheduled for the following morning. We had stayed at Nomo Soho (when it was still called the Mondarian) several years ago during the Christmas holiday season and really enjoyed our experience so we decided to give it another try. Upon our arrival, we were delighted to see the hotel was just as beautiful as we had remembered it. When we got up to the lobby (1 floor up from ground level via elevator) we were introduced to the Front Office Mgr - who checked us into our room. He was great and was attentive and sympathetic in hearing our frustrations over the weekend. He gave us an unexpected room upgrade which was probably one of the only highlights of our trip. 

Not only was the room outstanding providing unbelievable/unbeatable views of the cityscape but the hotel service was top shelf in all facets. We were thrilled with our in-room dining experience and the food was off the charts. Thank you again Tenzin Basnet and the Nomo Soho staff for your collective understanding, kindness and generosity during a frustrating time, it is greatly appreciated. 

We will certainly return to this hotel when we return to the Big Apple!

title: Uber cool SOHO Hotel
text: Just loved this very cool boutique hotel. From the fairy lit arbour style entrance, the industrial style restaurant, which served great food, to our very stylish room, we were impressed. Our room on the 12th floor had a view of the skyline and the sunset. Just lovely. The rooms aren't large but that's New York. The location was brilliant. One block back from Broadway, the Canal St subway station was a short stroll. We walked to 911 Memorial and Ellis Island Statue of Liberty Ferry-about 20 mins. Little Italy and Chinatown also less then 5 mins walk.

title: Amazing nomo
text: What a wonderful place in NYC, I am in love with the location, decor and mostly with the cleanliness of the hotel and my tiny room. I just checked out and will come back to the city for thanksgiving. I can not think of a better place to stay at. I loved the crispy fresh and clean linens and amenities. The room had a bar and the prices seem a bit high.

title: Great hotel!!!!
text: In late August, our family of four stayed at the NoMo SoHo Hotel. The place is super clean and the staff were all well dressed and professional. We had trouble of getting to the hotel at first due to transportation issues. We ended up calling the hotel and the front desk person gave us the perfect direction on how to get to the hotel. With two small children under the age of 4 and several luggages, that was much appreciated! The hotel was very impressive. We had a perfect view of downtown Manhattan and the river. Beautiful view we all gravitated to each morning and evening. The housekeeping crew gets an “A+”! With two little boys, our room is ALWAYS in the “ tornado alley”, however, each day after returning from sightseeing, our room is ALWAYS clean and immaculate, with or without tipping! Highly recommending this Hotel!

title: Dirty, Outdated, Horrible Manager
text: We've stayed at this hotel every year since it was the Mondrian. We've watched this hotel slowly deteriorate over time. Nothing has been updated at all. It is dirty and outdated. The manager at this hotel is absolutely awful and really just rude. Although the location in Soho is excellent, we will no longer be staying at this "luxury boutique hotel." Do not be fooled.

title: Exceptional hotel experience!
text: We loved our stay at NoMo SoHo!  The hotel is exquisite while also offering us a great location to explore SoHo and other neighboring areas by foot.  We did not have time to indulge in all of the amenities that the hotel had to offer.  We will definitely return again!

title: Anna's Stay at the NoMo Hotel
text: My very FIRST impression was not good due to the attitude of the gentleman who greeted us on arrival, which was very late due to our flight delay.  He had a very low-toned voice and could not hear a word he said and did NOT make us feel welcome.  I doubt I will return to this Hotel.  Sorry.

title: Bad reservation process, great locating, enjoyed the room
text: Day before our arrival, we received an email from hotel to say their reservation system lost our credit card information and will only hold our room for a few more hours. Highly unprofessional to shift the blame on us and expect that we respond to the email in time. This should have been a simple matter that can wait until we check in. I suppose if we didn't happen to see the email, we would be left without a room upon arrival. Other than this, we enjoyed the location oh the hotel and room is nice.

title: Nice hotel but good luck finding help.
text: No extra pillows or blankets on xloset. Called houdekeeping and front desk but got no rearesponse from either. Had to use decorative pillows to sleep. Next morning went to shower only to find not 1 yowel, not even a hand towel or wash cloth. My husband found 1 robe in the closet which we both had to use to dry ourselves . totally unacceptable.

title: Pretty but...
text: So this hotel is very pretty! The bar was great, and very warm and welcoming. The hotel room had terrific views and we got upgraded which was AWESOME! My only but is ...no waters in the room for free ($8), very small sink, shower long and roomy but waste of space that was needed for mirror/sink space! And no phone chargers in the Lightning/walls (how is this possible in this day and age). Just seemed to skimp on extras that guests staying beyond one night would really appreciate.

title: Adding one night to reservation made all other nights more expensive
text: I booked a room for Labor Day weekend, then two weeks later called to add another night to the reservation. This additional night made the prices for the other four nights jump up for a total of $350 more than they had been two weeks previously. The reservation rep said that their system could only use whatever prices were currently in the algorithm, and if I wanted to negotiate the price back down I'd have to call the front desk. So the next day I did just that, and got a very nice woman who explained the same situation but said she had no power to change the prices back to what I'd originally booked, only the reservations manager (or a similar title) could do that. She took my info and said that that person would call me the next day. A week later, no one has called, and needless to say, I cancelled the reservation altogether. So instead of adding a night because I wanted to stay there LONGER, I dropped the whole reservation because their IT system, in 2019, can't handle looking up the price for a two-week-old reservation??? Or are they hoping people won't notice a $350 upcharge? I stayed here a few years ago and thought it was lovely, but now I feel like they were scamming.

title: Amazing location and staff
text: This hotel is great especially if you don't want to be stuck in the middle of a ton tourists.  It is a very quirky and unique place, I love the blue in the rooms- made me feel like I was in Santorini.  Jasmine at the front desk was very helpful as was Jose with our bags and getting us a car to the airport, and Ritin at at the concierge desk is a wealth of knowledge and was most helpful with getting us our dinner reservations and helping us organize our daily activities. And the lemon ricotta pancakes at the NoMo Kitchen are A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!!

title: Great location, shame about the service
text: conveniently located, good rooms. Use surrounding restaurants - bar and table service was very poorly managed: slow, no priority for guests, poor customer experience. Internet good but constant need to reconnect annoying.

title: Wow an absolute nightmare!
text:
When I first arrived at NoMo I was so excited by the beautiful entryway and chic yet confusing non-lobby (you have to take the elevator up a level to check-in). 

Once I got my key and put my things down I popped back out to get some snacks for the evening. As I walked toward the front door, there were two young men on staff (perhaps bellhops?) that were leering at all of the young women that went by making comments. Yeep.

When I attempted to re-enter my room upon my return, the keys no longer worked. So I went back down to get them reactivated (no explanation re: what happened and as I walked to the desk, I overheard one of the women complaining loudly about another hotel guest).

Back to my room with keys that work, there's a pretty bad downpour outside that warrants a mobile weather alert. I hear a strange sound of water coming down hard close by and thought it may be outside, but quickly realized it was in MY BATHROOM SHOWER where the ceiling was peeling and bubbling).

Sitting back down on my bed, pouring an extra inch of wine into my dusty glass provided by this fine establishment, I pray the ceiling doesn't cave in during the night, waking me to the point of not being able to get back to sleep (early meetings you know?)

Completely resigned, I finally slip into bed only to discover no top sheet has been provided which is pretty gross.

Some level of refreshed, I wake up to enjoy the coffee I'd brought as they do not have a coffee maker in the room. As I shifted around, I spotted a massive YELLOW stain on the pillow I just had my head on. Wowza.

This all in all was a pretty gross experience but I tried to have a good attitude about it.

One thing I did not note, was there was a loud child/mother fight going on in the hall/in a room with the door open for a good part of 3 hours. I did put this last because this is NOT the hotel's fault but it was pretty grating.

title: Amazing spot
text: Loved hotel, very clean, well staffed, modern hotel, restaurant very classy, entrance walking in was amazing. Hotel staff goes above and beyond for the guest loved everything .... will definetly stay here again!

title: Terrible Experience
text:
This was my second time at NOMO SOHO Hotel This time it was awful. I reserved for 3 adults the Crosby Sofa bed Suite. It was a sofa with NO mattress pull out an adult can't even fit properly I asked for a cot instead they said No cots available in hotel and so we had to move to another room we got our new room one bed in that room we had to move again to another room rooms are small 
Our reservation was for 3 adults and there were towels and shampoo for one person No body wash
We had to ask for body wash !!!!!! 
Noise on the corridor and next door room in the early AM hours !!!!!!
Beware parking is 69$$$$$$$ for a car !!!!!!!  
Upon departure the lobby was being renovated it was terrible terrible - plastic wrap hanging from the ceiling to the counter it was simply terrible
 What a mess !!  
Never again this hotel !!!! !

title: Friendly and Helpful Hostess
text: Kiara was really helpful, friendly and accommodating. I was not staying in the rooms but the restaurant had a good environment and the staff were great. The prices are reasonable for the location. Happy to recommend visiting.

title: August Anniversary Stay
text: Very clean hotel. Small room but we knew the size going in. We mentioned when we booked that it was our 25th Anniversary. A small bottle of champagne or sparkling wine or chocolates would have been a nice touch.

title: A brilliant hotel
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights and it was a fantastic place to rest our heads. The staff was 
were gracious and helpful particularly Pauline at the front, Rafa at the bar ( he makes a good Manhattan!) and Jeffery on the desk. We had an incredible room with brilliant views of city. Room 2403 is the one to ask for. If you are coming to NYC this is a great place to stay !!

title: Romantic Trip to NoMo SoHo
text:
A fairytale like garden upon entering this fun hotel in the heart of SoHo. You feel like you're in a different land when you come in. The hotel is beautiful and has really different furnishings and the atmosphere puts you at ease right away. We went here for a romantic night away and were not disappointed. We would definitely recommend this hotel and visit again.
Frank and Laurie Esposito, NJ

title: Chic BoHo Hotel in the heart of Soho
text: Great location and funky lobby . Rooms are cute and small but efficient. Modern and clean. Service is exceptional. Restaurant is fabulous ! Stayed at a lot of hotels in New York and I would highly recommend this one.

title: Perfect hotel for those that prefer to stay away from midtown
text:
My family had an excellent time as first-time guests at NoMo SoHo.  Every single staff member, from valet to management, is warm, engaging and helpful.  The bar and restaurant staff are also first-class.
In particular, make sure to visit the in-lobby bar, where Enock will make you feel like you are the only patron and also make you one of his signature drinks!

title: it's a Wow
text: white walls, crispy linens, clean white showers... you get an unbelievable calm fresh clean feeling. this is my second visit to Nomo and I just love it. the restaurant is awesome, please try the salmon!! walking distance for mayor shops. two blocks away from little Italy.

title: Wonderful Weekend Getaway
text: My family and I traveled up from Washington DC to see NY and stayed at the NoMo SoHo Hotel and the service there was simply amazing. The rooms were pristine and had a wonderful view of the city. I was thoroughly impressed with the food and vibe of the entire place. Robert LLopis and Akeem Mcneil were the managers on duty and they did a wonderful job of welcoming guests and accommodating their needs; truly top notch talent and service. I would definitely recommend NoMo SoHo hotel if you are visiting New York. A must stay and a must see.

title: Beautiful Views
text: I was very lucky to get a room with such a beautiful view!! The hotel is incredible lovely. We checked in on Friday and were invited to wine hour. A lovely lady was serving wine and we were told they do it daily from 5-6pm. The hotel is very clean, the bathrooms in the lobby were clean but need a bit of maintenance. The restaurant is gorgeous, I am in love with the green house concept. Everyone was friendly.

title: nono Rock's
text: love the tunnel of love, what a gorgeous place to stay. my room is super clean, I mean very clean  I love making goetz amenities near to the train station is a pkus. they have towels and water waiting for you in the morning if you go for a run. I just love this hotel.

title: מלון מדהים
text: כיף של מלון מרכזי מאוד שירות מדהים חדר שעוה מיטות שוות מסעדה מקהימה למטה מאוד מומלץ . קיבלנו חדר בשש בבוקר . קרוב לכל החנויות  מיטה מפנקת חדר לא גדול אבל כיך מאוד ממליצה בחום המסעדה למטה יקרה קצת ושנרות איטי אבל אוכל טעים מאוד

title: Take what you get, don’t ask for more
text: It is at a great location, and if offers optimum performance: affordable prices for a 5 star hotel. The rooms are clean and they are well taken care. US being the most service oriented market on this planet, and this hotel being 5*, I always struggle to understand why the staff can’t be friendlier. And I stayed there 3 times, a total of 15 nights, my opinion does not change. And next time, I will stay again because everything else is so optimal for Soho.

title: Personal vacation
text:
A few technical issues, but great and cool place.
Staff helped but with more attention, we could have solved the problem before.
Overall good and positive: perfect location for shopping.
Common areas can be arranged better

title: NO bathroom privacy!
text: From the street you approach via an  enchanting entrance to the hotel/restaurant and make your way up the elevator to the front desk, which at the moment, is part of an area that’s being renovated. With typical NYC rooms being on the very small size we opted for a suite. That being said the design for the bathroom is a HUGE problem if your a gal. First and foremost there is no privacy. The bathroom sink and mini fridge are one unit. The bathroom sink is the size/depth of a “dog bowl” located on a very small counter with one light located off to the side. Very hard to put on makeup! The bathroom is apart of the sitting room area across from the desk beside the entrance door. The toilet and shower are in separate room with a feature picture window with a roll down shade if you don’t want to share your shower time with the building next door. While we have stayed in many new concept rooms this by far was the most inconvenient bathrooms concepts that we have experienced in a hotel. If your staying on your own it may not be a big deal but as a couple it’s may be a big problem. Again there is NO privacy. On the bedroom front it’s very tight with a king size bed but it’s workable. The bed was very comfortable which was the saving grace. The TV in the sitting room didn’t get any of the main tv channels on Saturday after midnight. The next morning all was fine. And finally the sink drained ever so slowly. We reported to the front desk upon checkout. The restaurant with it’s green house glass ceiling and beautiful chandeliers was definitely a high light. The food was delicious. We had breakfast/brunch there every morning. The service was good once the service team discovered we were seated in their section.  The location is a couple blocks from “Little Italy” and around the corner from some wonderful shopping experiences. So next time we’re gonna try something else in the Soho area.

title: Losing Its Mojo?
text: NOMO is in a perfect location and used to be great. Right now not so much. Am sure they can pull it around but they seem to have lost their attention to guests and detail. They need to remember the small things that made them so great. The staff need to mean it again and not just stick on a superficial smile as they tell you you can't sit somewhere or that's not possible. Come on NOMO!

title: Amenities!
text: We were in NYC for a weekend trip and got the hotel through Hotwire. We were told there will be a 45 dollars extra for ‘amenities ‘ and I thought it was a little strange but, ok. When we get to the room with my husband and our two children (10 and 12 year old) the children start looking into an amenities tray next to the TV (the usual 10 dollar water, 12 dollar candies...) and they found a little bag with condoms and sex ‘toys’! Yes, unbelievable that they would include such a thing in a room, more even so when they know it’s a family with young children. Never saw such a thing in my life...we had to come up with an explanation and quickly remove the bag and switch gears as fast as we could. Interestingly, there was no coffee maker in the room! We were busy and got coffee at Starbucks across the street, but I thought a coffee machine in the room should be pretty standard (maybe it’s not considered ‘cool’ ?) If not in a hurry, I like to have a coffee while getting ready and then head to have breakfast. They offered coffee in the lobby, but of course you have to dress and take the elevator. The hotel was otherwise very nice.

title: Family holiday
text: Great location. Staff incredibly kind. Except at the door, no one there to help you with your luggage or the bell boys are busy. Everyone else is really kind and helpful. Rooms a bit small. But pretty. And all is very clean.

title: Dinner
text:
Excellent!! service, food, dessert ,drinks friendly staff,a very nice place, our waiter Angello was great, we will definitely be back soon !
 it was a great experience in New York 
Very good option to enjoy, I recommend it 100%

title: Amazing service!
text: I booked a surprise bachelorette weekend for my sister here. The location is the best, we had access to everything. The manager Yariv Schein took care of us, sent up amenities and made sure we had a great experience. We had a great time and would stay again!

title: Solid Hotel
text: Very nice hotel in a good location.  Cool design and very comfortable.  They did not have our room ready at check in. Signing into the internet every day is irritating and the premium "fast" wifi seems to be an outdated idea.  The balcony of our room was awesome and room 307 was both quiet and easy to get to..  I would suggest this hotel for sure.

title: Incredible Experience!
text:
Our team hosted our annual offsite meeting at NoMo SoHo and I can't say enough about what an incredible experience we had from start to finish. The Director of Catering & Events, Mariya, made the planning seamless and our Banquet Captain, Elliott, ensured every detail was handled the day of -- even when we had a few last minute changes. The service was exceptional and the entire staff was friendly and accommodating from tech support to the bartenders. 

The space itself was gorgeous and incredibly unique -- the meeting room had an exceptional amount of natural light and even opened up onto a gorgeous patio. Such a treat to be able to step outside in between sessions and have some fresh air! 

The food was also delicious and I highly recommend this space for events -- looking forward to coming back to check out the gorgeous restaurant and planning to have our team stay here the next time they're in from out of town. Great experience!

title: Beautiful, Overpriced Hotel
text: The hotel itself is beautiful, the views are stunning. Unfortunately, simple amenities like coffee in your room or even ice machines in the hotel are not there. If you want ice in your room you need to order it, which we did 3 nights in a row but it never came. We finally just started asking for a bucket of ice from the bar.

title: Great location, great service, great view, great stay.
text:
Stayed 5 nights in a King Suite.  Given 24th floor during check in.  What a window and what a view.  

Love the layout of the suite.  Extremely spacious.  The sofa becomes a sofa bed that can comfortably sleep 2 people.  Wide enough, but more importantly, comfortable and not saggy.  There is a work desk and big tv.  A sliding door separates the living from from the bedroom.  Bedroom equally spacious with a comfortable bed.  Bathroom is next to the bedroom.  Sink area is outside the shower/toilet area, making it more practical.  Not drawers to put out clothes so we lived out of a suitcase.

Housekeeping does a stellar job cleaning.  Generous with toiletries.  Folded some of our tshirts and lined up our toiletry bottles too!

Extremely friendly service from everybody I came across with.  

Location turned out to be great.  Of course, all the shopping is just a stone's throw away.  But Canal Street Station is so close and can take you anwhere.  The staion might look dingy, but so many train lines cross it.  So easy to get anywhere from Canal Street.    

My only complaint is that the air conditioning compressor makes a loud vibrating noise (like a refrigerator).  If you are not sensitive to this, then don't worry about it.  

Highly recommend this hotel should you want to stay in the Soho area.

title: NYC Vacation
text: NoMo SoHo was absolutely amazing!  Our stay there was a great experience.  Our room on the 24th floor overlooking the city provided a breathtaking view.  The window isn the restroom shower was divine!  Our family ate at the restaurant below and their manager name Robert L and his staff treated us with the best customer service.  The atmosphere and vibe was pleasant and the food was delicious!  This hotel is a must see establishment that has a beautiful vintage chandelier in the bar and sultry paintings on the wall.  You gotta see this place!

title: Great Stay!!!
text: Wonderful, picturesque hotel in a great neighborhood. Close to shopping in SoHo and the restaurants of Little Italy.  Amazing food as well at the hotels restaurant and the staff is very courteous. Highly recommend!!!

title: Hotel service extremely poor
text: Had to call and ask for my complementary water two times before they finally delivered it (was told it would be in the room when I got there). Also, my shower head was broken/sprayed every direction and I didn't have any shower towels when I got out of the shower. Just the little hand towels. Lastly, the front desk staff was always distracted talking to each other and would hardly pause their conversation to answer a question. Overall, I would say the hotel and service were below average.

title: Thank you for Nomo Soho
text: Hello, I am Han. I have been in New York for two weeks, and I always stay in Nomo Soho. I found out that I had left some clothes in the hotel after returning my hometown Seoul Korea. I sent an e-mail to the hotel and asked for check it up. Fortunately, they found my clothes and kept them, and they shipped my items to me. They sent me the package very quickly, and they all very kind.  I really appreciate all the staff at the hotel. I will continue to choose Nomo Soho every year when I visit New York.

title: Absolutely wonderful!
text: Went to NYC for a convention and was originally staying in an airbnb which turned into a nightmare but after Airbnb support was able to get in contact with Nomo Soho they were able to quickly book us a room with no hassle. Isaiah was amazing and helpful and thanks to him we were able to get up and into our suite within minutes.

title: Great ambiance but poor service.
text: This hotel is in a great location, clean, and has nice ambiance, however the quality of the service and demeanor of the staff needs significant improvement. Long lines to check in and poor dining service and no one picks up the phone for room service. For the price you pay, you can stay somewhere else and have more peace of mind. Wanted to like this place but unfortunately these small things go a long way.

title: Very good
text: I think my room was upgraded on the house. Sweeping views all the way from the freedom tower to Times Square. Loved the 12pm checkout. Room was nice and cool despite the record heat outside. Will return.

title: Perfect location!
text: NoMo Soho is the perfect spot for a long weekend or midweek business visits. Location is key close to subway and nearby restaurants and of course, shopping! I’m usually in town for a few nights a week and the team always takes great care. I love the space for breakfast or lunch meetings and for a great happy hour vibe. Don’t miss the weekend Champagne brunch! If you’re planning to stay in SoHo, look no further!

title: Exceeded Expectations! Highly Recommended!
text:
Had a short 2 night getaway to the city with a family of 4 (4 and 7yr old).  At first was a bit weary of booking this hotel or any Soho hotel for that matter because of concerns of room condition (cleanliness) and size.  However once we opened the door I was very very happy.  

The booking process through the hotels website directly gave me the best price (almost $100 lower than hotels.com!)  Once booked, a few days before checkin, I received a welcoming email from the GM.  Their system allows you to pre-select your room before arrival which seemed pretty nice.  However it did not work for me because I booked this just a few days in advance.  So I emailed back with a request for a higher floor with a view if possible.  They confirmed that my request would be sent to the reservations manager. 

We arrived in the morning knowing the room would not be ready but to check our bags.  The lady at the front desk was very kind.  She pre-registered us and told us they would call when the room was ready and that she saw our request. 

Stayed out the entire day and went back to the hotel after dinner.  Our keycards were waiting at the front desk and very excited to hear that our room was on the 22nd floor.  I believe the hotel has 24 or 25 floors but the top two are the penthouse floors.  

We opened the door to 2209 and were very happy to see that it was a corner room with views of downtown and one world trade center.  The room and bathroom were very clean, very bright, and with great views.  Even in the shower you had a view of downtown.  

The room is a bit tight, especially with two double beds, but continuous windows throughout the room make it feel spacious enough.  

A few cool features worth mentioning are that the hotel provides free basic wifi and the TV has chromecast built in so you can stream from your phone.  Also there is a mobile phone in the room that you can use to call the hotel for free (I think) and use as a mobile phone without roaming charges (if you are visiting from another country).  

In conclusion, the room was great, the staff at the hotel was very kind and courteous.  

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and will come again for our next city getaway!

Highly recommend room 2209

title: Still not great
text:
Ok, I keep coming back to this place and keep getting disappointed. 100% my own fault.

The rooms are small but ok. The service is at best non existent and at best truly appalling. The best thing going for it is the location, which is perfect for me as its close to most things I like. Negatives are, as stated above, the service is really bad. It doesn't help that the reception is not on the ground floor so you never feel part of the hotel community, if that even exists.

I'll still come here next year but that is only because of the location and I am clearly too lazy to search for better alternatives. I would not recommend this place to friends.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: Love this hotel in SoHo. Room is nicely appointed.  Parking is ridiculously expensive though. Would stay again. The service is five star. Lots  of great restaurants in walking distance of the hotel. Recommend.

title: Beautiful, eclectic experience!
text: Perfect location, conveniently located to really nice shops, Duane Reade (thankfully, because we forgot to pack some essentials) and great places to eat. Our room was SO clean and the view was gorgeous. The food at the hotel's restaurant was incredible! The service was great and the staff was so polite and helpful.

title: Trendy hotel in great location
text: Really enjoyed our time at the NoMo hotel.  The restaurant has a light, airy and funky feel to it - it has a great vibe with outside terrace.  The food is excellent.  Rooms are large and have great views.  The location is good if you want to explore independent shops with artistic / design edge.  We would highly recommend the hotel and restaurant!!!

title: Lovely place
text: How wonderful it was for me to stay at the hotel. All the people working on the Nomo Soho were nice and ready to help. The location is the best, right in the heart of Soho, highly recommended! I'll be back soon.

title: Authentic Hospitality and Service
text: I booked the Nomo Soho Penthouse Suite as part of a company event, and was truly impressed with the professionalism of the Catering and Events team every step of the way.  Mariya rolled out the red carpet and assisted us with planning all the details of the event, quickly and efficiently.  On the day of our event, the weather grew stormy and the forecast was 80% chance of rain.  Due to potentially not being able to use the outdoor space, we were concerned that the rain and heat would affect the attendees' enjoyment.  Mariya knowledgeably talked us through the alternatives.  As it turned out, the storm was pushed back later in the evening and we were able to enjoy the penthouse after all.  Eloitt and his amazing events team sprang into action and helped us execute the event perfectly despite all the changes that ensued.  Our attendees commented on the quality of the food, the kindness in service, and breathtaking views.   We are so grateful to Eloitt, Mariya, and the entire Nomo Soho team for making our event a success.

title: Good Vacation
text:
I want to compliment Isreal Scott.
My check-in and stay experience was wonderful, thanks to Isreal Scott.
Isreal was especially helpful upon my check-in at the hotel.
I really appreciate his kindness and helpfulness.

title: Best Hospitality welcome at 3:00 am
text: All flights inn July 17 th were canceled out of NYC catastrophe hit hotels all hotels were fully booked I kept looking for a hotel till 3:00am they AMEX platinum they suggested I go stay at the lobby of NOMO and hope for the best upon arrival I was welcomed but Isaiah ! It was the best customer service i had encountered through my intensive business traveling ! He almost created a room for me and after a stressful night he made it possible to get some sleep ! Seamlessly ! Thank you ! I am a raving fan !

title: NoMo was excellent fo sho!
text: We decided to take a quick trip up to Manhattan and spend a couple of days. Friends recommended that we try NoMo in SoHo. The ride was pleasant on a Sunday morning, found parking nearby and the party was on! Lamar was our bartender at the Library bar and he was outstanding! Warm regards Lamar, you make an excellent cocktail! The room had a beautiful view. We were able to walk to Chinatown and Little Italy extremely easy!

title: Boa localização, zero conforto
text: O hotel fica no coração do soho. Sobre a localização, não ha o que dizer. No entanto, o quarto é péssimo para o valor cobrado. Será privacidade entre banheiro e quarto. Logo, se você está namorando ou eh casada há pouco tempo... não recomendo. O vaso sanitário eh quase dentro do quarto. Não tem toalhas em fartura (como nos história desta faixa de preço), a ducha do chuveiro eh fraca e a água escorre para fora, invadindo o quarto. O sanitário é pequeno tb. E não tem bancada na pia. Achei muito pequeno e com pouco conforto. A cama eh ótima. E à vista também. O hotel embaixo é bem bacana tb.

title: Amazing location!
text:
I stayed at NoMo SoHo while I was in New York working for a pop-up. The location is spectacular and the hotel itself is extremely unique and beautiful. The rooms are fairly small which was completely fine.

The restaurant is gorgeous and the food tastes great! Make sure to try the pancakes! Definitely a hotel I would recommend and will be staying at again when in New York!

title: Weekend getaway perfection!
text: My husband and I stayed here for a quick weekend getaway and from the moment we walked up the unique, picturesque entrance we were relaxed and taken care of.  We arrived before the 4 o'clock check-in, but we were able to valet the car and have our bags checked without problem.  Once the room was ready, a bellman quickly brought our bags to us which was a relief because after an afternoon full of shopping in the hot sun, I needed to shower!  The room was just as advertised.  The mainly white decor made the room feel spacious and it had honestly one of the biggest showers I have seen in a NYC hotel room.  Another huge benefit was the 5 o'clock wine hour!  Although I was in the room showering and getting ready for a night out we were still able to bring our drinks to the room.  My husband and I both had a great night's sleep with no problems with noise, air conditioning, or water temps the entire stay.  I would absolutely stay here again!

title: SARA IS THE BEST
text: Sara showed us a great time at the hotel ! She is amazing she helped me find the receptionist on the first floor. She is very kind and knowledgeable of the hotel. Keep her around because she is doing her best .

title: Perfection!
text:
I wanted a hotel near my son's condo. SoHo area hotels are very pricey. Through MagellanLuxuryHotels.com I booked the NoMo SoHo, formerly the Mandarin, at a good price. I was a little wary due to the 1- and 2-star negative reviews on this site, but my experience was stellar.  Cannot imagine those reviewers and I are referring to the same hotel.
The hotel is very hip. My King Deluxe room was magnificent. Beautiful, spotless, compact with clever, efficient use of space, perfectly quiet with an extraordinary view of the city from my floor-to-ceiling windows. Room was so clean, top-to-bottom, that it felt as though it had been freshly painted and newly carpeted an hour before I arrived. Nice amenities, including the use of a smartphone.  Plenty of outlets, large closet with ample number of hangers, accommodating staff and both air conditioning and water pressure were unusually powerful.  Blackout curtains truly worked and there were plenty of lights. My peaceful room felt like my little piece of heaven.  I didn't want to leave it to return home.  Will look for an opportunity to stay there again...soon!

title: Accomidating & Chic!
text: I stayed here last month for a weekend to visit friends and had a wonderful experience! They are dog friendly which was a relief and Toby (my dog) was also enjoying the perks of our modern room with a stunning view of the city! When we weren't out and about we ate at the Nomo Kitchen which was just as phenomenal as the rest of our experience. Our room was always taken care of with an extra stock of towels and toiletries. All the staff were so friendly, it was nice and quiet (for the most part) which made it really feel like a home away from home. I would, without a doubt, stay at NoMo again in the future. Highly recommended!

title: Nomo Kitchen
text:
The place is beautiful and the food is good. But the service is not that great. I went for lunch with a girlfriend who works in the area and we decided last min to come here for lunch. The host made a huge deal that we didn't have a reservation and asked that we next time make a reservation online before coming, but the place was practically empty so not sure what the big deal was. 
@traveleen_gurl

title: Super chic!
text: My teenage daughter and I stayed here and loved it! Beautiful entrance, lobby and room. I wish we had time to have tried the restaurant but it was nice that they had a little wine tasting in the bar area. Concierge very helpful and I loved the relatively quiet location.

title: SoHo’s Most Promising Hotel
text: NoMo is a great hotel in SoHo on a quiet street away from all the hustle and bustle. From the second you walk in you realize it is a special place but the greenery-drenched entrance. The restaurant of the hotel feels like a conservatory and is one of the most unique spaces in NYC. The rooms are great as well, especially for the price. I have stayed here 3 times and each time my room has had a nice view...once there was even a view from the shower which was nice! I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay downtown. Great art in the hotel as well! I had the pleasure of meeting Terry who runs the place and he truly understands the hotel industry and ensures the best service to all guests. He told me about some of the upcoming events going on in the studio space which all sound very cool and exciting! Definitely becoming my favorite spot in SoHo.

title: Good stay, mod hotel
text: This hotel had comically small rooms.  To the point that it was a bit uncomfortable.  Front desk staff was not impressive.  Value was good but only because I used hotels tonight.  It can go either way, I cannot recommend this place or dissuade from booking.   Beds were very comfortable, great sheets.

title: 4th of July in NYC
