text: Excellent stay over the 4th of July week end. This hotel has a beautiful entry and restaurant room, stylish rooms and very friendly personnel. We enjoyed the food at the restaurant. Excellent position in lower Manhattan with lots of things to do and see all around.

title: Great Hotel Downtown
text: British Airways suggested I try this hotel and what a great call ! Arrived at Checkin was met by really helpful staff who immediately upgraded me to a Kingsize room in floor 15. The room was great and the bed comfy. The hotel location is 2 mins walk from Canal Subway so easy to get around. I had continental breakfast every day for $21 which is a good deal as the choice of additional dishes great. All staff at the hotel, waiters, reception, security were fantastic I will definitely be staying back her when next in NYC

title: In Need of a Refurb!
text: Let me start by saying this is a hotel with a funky, cool vibe in a great location.  With that said, there are too many things lacking which is why I give it a 3 star rating.  The rooms are in need of refurbishment as they are just plain tired, with furniture chips, damaged headboards, stained marble and grout in the bathroom, stained white desk chair...the list goes on.  I could tell that at one point, it was probably awesome, but at this time, because of how tired the room appears, it doesn't feel as clean as it could. Not sure what the $40 daily resort fee covers other than a complimentary glass of wine. Concierge was no longer there after 4 to help with dinner suggestions.  No bellman was out front to assist with luggage. Front desk said there was no bottled water to give us when we asked for some upon checkout, when the hostess at the restaurant had it right on her stand for us.  All we had to do was ask.  It just felt like this places misses the mark.

title: NYC girls trip
text: Gorgeous hotel. Beatiful rooms. Very clean. Great food. Ricotta lemon pancakes, my favorite.  PERFECT location. Close to the subway and great shopping. Amazing views. Staff is so sweet. Second time staying here and haven't been disappointed. I will keep coming back.

title: Cozy hote in the heart of Soho
text: This fun, hip hotel is an oasis in the heart of Soho. The NOMO has modern quiet rooms, friendly staff, and a vine-covered entrance clogged with couples taking that one of a kind engagement photo. Check-ins and outs are super-efficient giving you more time to do the things you want to do. While the rooms offer great views of the Manhatten skyline, they do tend to get hot towards the end of the day. So crank that AC down to avoid returning to a hot, stuffy room. If your AC goes out during the night, as mine often does, don't fret. Just pop open the decorative pannel below the thermostat and flip the switch to cut the power to the unit. Wait for about 60 seconds and flip the switch back on. Bingo! Your AC is up and running again.

title: Great spot
text: My second time staying there and I just booked a third. Beautiful clean and stylish rooms. Great location you can walk to everything. The rooms are comfortable and clean and I love the restaurant. Staff was friendly and helpful.

title: good location in soho
text: It was a pretty good stay.  My big complaint was the $40 amenities fee and the amenity was a health club I didn't use and a wine hour at 5pm.   Come on man!  That's a joke.  Nomo is not the only hotel doing this I know.  I feel like I'm being gauged.

title: Very disappointed at these hidden taxes and fees.
text: My daughter and I stayed there on July 4th, we booked the hotel due to its good location and reasonably rate.  Unlike other hotels, this one do not list all other taxes and fees upfront and our hotel bill ended up almost $50 more than the booking rate.  Very disappointed to have these hidden fees.

title: Ottimo Hotel per soggiornare e mangiare a SOHO NYC
text:
Sono stato al NOMO nel mesi di Giugno. La posizione è ottima all'interno del quartiere SOHO. Camere molto comode con tutti i confort e situate in una zona tranquilla longa a da rumori di traffico. Al piano terra ci si può divertire con un Lounge Bar con una ottima selezione di bollicine. Il ristorante è mio tranne. Oltre a mangiare bene si possono bere cocktail e passare la serata anche per il dopocena.
Personale professionale e attento.
c
Ci tornerò.

title: Great, trendy hotel
text: Really enjoyed this hotel. Went with my 13 year old daughter. Nice atmosphere, great location near shopping, Chinatown and more. Quick cab to Chelsea, High Line, Greenwich Village, etc. Regular rooms are a bit small (typical of a boutique hotel) so if you can upgrade, do. Quiet as opposed to staying in Times Square or Midtown. Restaurant downstairs was good, though a little pricey. Overall, we really liked it - glad we stayed there.

title: Fantastisk atmosfære og utsikt
text:
Fantastisk atmosfære, utsikt og ansatte 🤩 
Gå avstand til alt. Shopping, severdigheter og bra restauranter. 
En favoritt ble også morgenkaffen på den deilig kafeen - før byen våkner. 
Vi kommer igjen. Ser frem til det.

title: Best Experience Ever
text: Stayed in NYC for a family birthday and let me tell you, best hotel I've ever stayed at! The location was PERFECT! The hotel was spotless, the room was so comfortable and the views were amazing! They had some of the best food and some delicious cocktails,  The staff there is super friendly and helpful too! I would HIGHLY recommend anyone visiting this part of the city to stay here!

title: GOOOOORRGOUS!!!
text: I stayed at this hotel for four days!  Great location for anything. The restaurant was hip and had great food and amazing appropriately named cocktails!  The rooms were big and comfy and cozy.. Very French styled with awesome views! Great value as well.

title: Nomo Hotel SoHo is Amazing!
text:
We were in NYC for 4 nights and we had a very good experience at Nomo. Super Clean, Great food and Location. Safe Area. The gym was equipped well. We had a pleasure of being assisted by the Manager Pablo. Pablo was super nice in accommodating our needs and he was always available. Thank you Pablo. I give them 5 Stars. 
Isabela & Miguel Peralta.

title: This hotel is amazing!
text: From the staff to the food, this is the best hotel I’ve ever stayed in! They have excellent service and with all of the amenities offered, I’ll definitely be back for another stay. The look and feel of the hotel is artsy!

title: Excellent Brunch, Amazing Atmosphere...
text:
We visited this spot for brunch last weekend and were impressed with the understated elegance and overall refinement at this spot. 

NOMO Kitchen manages to be refined and elegant without making you feel underdressed or out of place in your everyday wear. 

The food was excellent and average priced for the area, more than that though the feel of the place is peaceful and serene against a backdrop of airy greenery.

Servers were efficient and polite and while the tables are a bit close together in spots we are definitely adding this spot to our list of favorites in the city.

title: Nice location but awful service
text:
I stayed here with my family for 3 nights in late June/early July 2019. The hotel is in a nice location and within walking distance of some on the downtown and midtown sights.

The real disappointment however is the very poor level of service - nothing like it should be for a hotel of this price. An example would be having to wait 10 minutes for breakfast for a quarter full restaurant because “they only have one server”!!

It’s a City with some great hotels -you need to sharpen up your act

title: The Perfect NYC location!
text: This was the perfect location for us in lower Manhattan, close to Little Italy and walking distance to many museums.  We had a higher floor that afforded terrific views of the city.  Was impressed by the atrium.  Service was excellent (room service) as was the dining.  Perfect place for our group of 6

title: Hip and Chic
text: I love this hotel and stay here whenever I am in NY.  It is conveniently located in walking distance of so many eateries, attractions and of course shopping!  Amazing food and great staff make this hotel a gem in Soho!

title: business trip to NY
text: Very nice hotel. Very cosy restaurant and great Atmosphere. It may be a place for the younger but despite that I felt comfortable. Very friendly and efficient staff. Nice rooms. I got one with a great view.

title: Great location. Clean rooms. And great views!
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the NoMo SoHo Hotel. The location was perfect for all the SoHo shopping we were planning on doing. The rooms were very clean and had floor to ceiling windows with great views. The entrance and restaurant are beautiful and very Instagram-able. I am planning to stay here next time I travel to NYC.

title: It was amazing!!!
text: The Hotel was great I enjoyed my stayed! I Would recommend it 100% times! Oh and don’t forget to go down and try their best mimosas bar ever :)! Everything was so clean and the tunnel of love is just unforgettable ❤️

title: Enjoyable little Lunch Spot
text: Few of my colleagues mentioned they had lunch over at the NoMo Hotel. Feeling a bit out of place dining alone, but that didn’t stop me after seeing the menu. I enjoyed an old fashion and had the SOD which was a mushroom consommé with noodles and shrimp tempura on top then the homemade duck Ragout raviolis. It was perfect for light lunch. Can’t wait to see what’s for dinner soon!

title: Unforgetable experience
text: I booked this hotel for the night of proposing to my long-time girlfriend. I informed the manager, Yariv, of the proposal ahead of time. The room had amazing views and a personal note. Yariv greeted us as we arrived and he went above and beyond to make sure our stay was exceedingly exceptional. NoMo is my new go-to hotel in the city and I highly recommend it for any type of traveler!

title: Best in NYC
text:
When in NYC for business this is my fav hotel. 
Boutique atmosphere and nice staff and services.
Big plus is the food, great quality and nice wine list!
The rooms are all new and clean, hotel position is perfect.
V

title: Awesome service and great wine list!
text: Beautiful hotel with delicious cocktails and the wine list is Interesting, fun with a super friendly staff. Will return for sure. I stayed there over a week end and loved the room, the view. Location is convenient.

title: nice but watch out - hoteltonight users
text:
gorgeous and clean and modern hotel, it's new, and hip and cool., easy checkin, great view. we booked a room for 2 for $130 on hoteltonight.  add $30 for taxes. then $49 for hotel fee. fine.
30 mins after i checked out, my visa was charged $113.
i called, on hold for 15 mins, asked them why, on hold again another 15 mins,
then they said it was a mistake. no apology, no explanation. 
so watch out.

title: Beautiful View
text: I stayed at the Nomo Soho hotel on June 17th and I had a great experience.  Angie at the front desk was very warm and accommodating.  The corner room view from the 24th floor was breathtaking.  We didn't eat at the restaurant but it was also very pretty.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Nice Hotel
text: The hotel is nice, modern, and on a great location. Staff was friendly, however we had to wait 45 minutes for our luggage to be delivered to our room after we checked in. This was tough especially with a one year old who needed to be changed and napped. We didn’t experience the restaurant, but it looked nice. I would stay again purely because of the location, but the price is pretty steep.

title: a must stop in soho
text:
after a long day just walking around, had to stop to res my feet and leave the shop bags down and sip a good cocktail without paying crazy price. 

great bar and atmosphere, bartender was very attentive, good spirit selections.

title: What a Gem
text:
We had the luck to be recommended to try out this hotel, 
Witch not only is located in a super area. Easy to get to shops and night life!

But, the in-house services it is what impressed us the most. Breakfast it’s a must. 
Staff very friendly and and kind 

good cocktails, some of the best mezcal based one I have tried.

Check out their restaurant and don’t miss he cacio e Pepe

title: Great Hotel
text: I have been coming to the NoMo Soho 4 times since January. I love this place. Love the entire staff very professional, location, service food and the restaurant. I travel a lots for work around the world and i have to say this is my favorite place.

title: Looking forward to getting back there!
text:
I recently spent a fabulous weekend in NYC, at the NoMo Soho Hotel. Such a different hotel experience—it’s not a gigantic, impersonal place. It feels cozy, but in a chic and trendy way. The flowerpot-lined entrance leads to an open, airy lobby space (that, by the way, smells amazing). The main restaurant/bar area is also very light and open, and allows a view to the outdoor patio seating and the street beyond.
We had drinks and a light bite in the bar, and both were wonderful! Spectacular drink selection—I’ll have to go back to sample more of them for sure. Dinner was terrific, as was our breakfast the next morning. We had a lovely room, outfitted with every amenity. Loved every minute we spent there, and enjoyed chatting with some of the staff as well. This is a perfect spot, and a great alternative to the typical city hotel. I’m looking forward to my next visit!

title: Fantastic!
text: LOVE this hotel! Trendy and luxurious at the same time. My husband and I were in to celebrate our anniversary and what a great experience!  The service was excellent and attentive from check in to check out. The restaurant and bar is beautiful and the food and cocktails were even better (see attached photos). Amazing mixology!  Our room was fabulous as well—super comfortable, beautifully decorated, and very clean. I can’t forget to mention the gorgeous city views from our room which really topped off an already wonderful stay!

title: NOMO
text: The best kept secret in SOHO! Had the pleasure of staying at the NOMO in June. The views were exquisite, the service was impeccable, the cocktails are top notch! One of the coolest hip hotels! See for yourself you won’t be disappointed!!

title: NoMo SoHo is cool
text: Great location. Within walking distance of a lot of attractions. Staff provided excellent service. Charming rooms and decor. The NoMo Kitchen has excellent food and drinks.Interesting items provided in the mini bar!

title: Quick weekend staycartion in NYC
text: A girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for the weekend and I was so impressed with this place. It was beautiful inside and out from the lobby to the rooms and especially the cute little restaurants and bars they had. The bartenders were exceptional even when they were pretty busy serving amazing cocktails they still served us fast. Our room was so beautiful and comfortable, and had the best views of the city. I watched the sunrise from our bed both mornings we were there. Overall I had the best experience with this place and would 100% recommend it! Totally worth it

title: Beautiful Views
text: I went to the NoMo for a bridal shower in one of their top floor suites. It had a large balcony space and incredible views. It had windows all the way around that looked out over the city. The walk up to the hotel was beautifully decorated. The lobby was extremely busy, with lots of people just sitting. The catered food was not great.

title: Poor Customer Service
text: This is a fabulous hotel in a great location and premium amenities for a NYC hotel. The only thing that spoiled it for me was the miserable receptionist who treated me as if I was an inconvenience when I arrived early (12:30pm), I did not feel welcomed nor appreciated as a guest. She didn’t tell me about the hotel’s amenities nor did she ask if I wanted an overview. My short layover stay was otherwise good, the bellman was very courteous and I got to behold one of the most amazing hotel room views I have ever seen.

title: Pros and Cons, Mainly Cons
text:
Pros: 
1)Fabulous location
2) beautiful common areas
3)  friendly staff
Cons;
1)  Rooms small even for NYC standards. Not even room for a FULL sink! You get a half sink! And it's located right inside the hallway door so there's not even a place to hang a hand town. Cubby for a desk. Drawers under bed instead of a dresser. They describe it as "minimalistic." Code for uncomfortable and inefficient.
2) No coffee maker so you have to throw on clothes and trot down to lobby if you want coffee when you wake up. (Probably no coffee maker because no place to put it)
3) $40.00 amenity fee for the "privilege" of walking down to the lobby for your coffee, having a gym which you may not use, and having a glass of wine from 5-6.. AND...Amenity fee is TAXED! So you end up paying $45.90. If I'd realized this going on, I wouldn't have booked hotel. The only way to end this outrageous practice is to boycott every hotel/resort that does this.
4) A/C blows directly on bed. 
5) Warning to those over the age of 40:  some kind of weird techno music in elevator all the time! Because hotel is...wait for it...cool and trendy.
Never again.

title: Empire State
text: I've known this place through various times and under different ownership. It was previously Mondrian, part of Morgans, now it's Nomo, Soho. Location is brilliant. On the edge of Soho, Nolita, LES isn't far, Chinatown... You can't help but enjoy the city from here. Space and place is good. Rooms are clean and large (generally). Good staff and food in bar/restaurant os also good. Really good prices too - similar places 5 minutes away were close to double. What's not to like?

title: Ok hotel i Soho
text: Rommet har en helt grei størrelse,men det ville vært bedre med et eget bad med ordentlig dør på. Nå er vasken plassert i rommet uten noe sted å henge håndklær. Renhold virker helt ok. Veldig støyende aircondition som slår seg av og på med intervaller hele natten. Hotellet ligger i et rolig område og er et fint utgangspunkt for å oppleve NY. Hotellet er relativt dyrt og vær klar over en belastning på 40 usd pr natt som vil komme ved avreise for fasciliteter som man kanskje ikke har noen glede av. Ble også belastet feil for restaurant som vi ikke besøkte. Til tross for at vi tok opp dette med frontdesk og de   ga oss kvittering på at dette var rettet ble trekket utført feil. Måtte gjøre mange henvendelser for å få rettet opp dette og håper det nå går i orden. Kan nok finne like bra,men billigere hotell  i Soho

title: Underwhelming Hotel
text:
Our original hotel's AC broke at 1AM and it was a very hot summer night. We checked in here at 2AM and had the most unpleasant check in experience. There was no one at the front desk, the cleaning ladies were yelling at each other and made no attempt to notify anyone at the desk that we were waiting. Finally an extremely disgruntled front desk agent came to check us in and it is clear he hates his job and everyone else. We got a really strange room and the Disney princess aesthetic really didn't help. On check out a mere 7 hours later we had a nice $45 surprise "amenity" charge. Avoid this place.

The one positive was the ice cold AC.

title: Too much noise
text: The staff is friendly...and it is well located in soho with a nice restaurant and a nice terrace...BUT...way too noisy...even for nyc standards: street noise, room noise from other rooms (avoid rooms with connecting doors...you have the feeling that you share your room with the room next yours...horrible...especially when your neighbor being loud in the middle of the night...)...and noise from the corridor as the rooms are absolutely lacking noise reduction materials...so if your plan is to party in soho/nyc...no big deal...but for businessmen like me...just skip it...

title: Funzionale ottima posizione
text:
Locali accoglienti e molto puliti, servizio lobby e ricevimento eccellenti

Splendida vista dalla camera al 20-esimo piano

Posizione molto comoda per poter raggiungere a piedi in 15 minuti WTC

Belle passeggiate sulla broadway la sera o nel tardo pomeriggio

title: Beautiful city views, clean, crisp rooms
text: Great windows and views, loved the huge shower with big window framing the Empire State Building. I like to unpack when I travel and between the built in drawers under the bed and the closet, there was plenty of room for everything. The pastry basket and coffee we ordered from room service was delicious as well as the dinner we had in the restaurant. The staff was friendly and helpful. We are so glad we chose the NoMo SoHo for or vacation in NYC!

title: One of the best hotel in NY
text: Hace 6 años voy a este hotel.  La ubicación es inmejorable.  Desde hace un par de años sirven café y té en el desayuno y vinos y Proseco en la tarde.  El personal y vista de las habitaciones es lo mejor del hotel.

title: Mixed
text:
The room was clean and good value, although the carpet was torn in our room. There were two different sorts of mismatched Toiletries, which was most peculiar.  For the $45 resort fee, which is a poorly camouflaged way of charging more than the stated rate, we got coffee which was supposed to be there until 10 AM, but was removed early. In addition there was wine, served between five and six in an obscure room, which was anything but obvious. To their credit however when we did get wine, they offered refills. 

The main reason to stay here, is that despite the resort fee, it is relatively good value in a totally fun part of New York. The staff was friendly, but in effective.

Looking out the window was creepy, as there was an overhang, I think over an entrance To the hotel, into which several things had fallen, including a child is now torn and sad stuffed animal. This should be cleaned up, without doubt. This was disgraceful. I have attached a photograph.

title: They add fees for nothing
text:
Am shaking with anger after staying at NoMo Soho.

For a four night stay, this hotel added $164 of ‘amenity fees’. When I questioned what these were for, I was presented a list of activities that were apparently going on in the hotel, none of which I saw or took part in. Apparently it was in the T&Cs. Of course it was, although staff conveniently forgot to mention this when I checked in.

This is a basic and dishonest ripoff. If you really think guests are going to get $41 per day of value from your ‘amenities’, why don’t you actually make clear how much they will be paying for it. That you don’t betrays the fact that you know it’s just a scam. 

It not even the cost of this, it’s the fact it’s done in a dishonest way.

Staff couldn’t give a damn when I objected, either. You’re supposed to be in the hospitality business.

title: Exceptional stay!
text: Exceptional stay!  Ambiance is comfortable and calming.  Great location, very clean, great staff and service.  Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable.  Service is exceptional.  Loved the complimentary coffee in the Library Bar in the morning.  Would definitely stay again!

title: I will be back!
text: Really enjoyed the vibe of the place. The art in the lobby and tiki bar makes it.    The entrance is very instagram worthy.  The lobby is action packed and it’s worth it to have a couple of drinks to watch the peeps coming and going there.   Great view from the room too.  This was my second stay and will return when I visit next time

title: Watch out for the extra's!
text:
Firstly, this is a comfortable boutique hotel in the heart of Soho. For those who love boutique, it will be close to perfect. Sadly, I'm not so much of a fan of boutique as like the familiarity of brand names and the bonus of loyalty rewards.

This was a business trip and rather than staying the financial district, decided to stay here based on its location to some of the excellent restaurants in the area. As we were a party of 3 businessmen, all dressed in suits, ties etc, we didn't really fit in with the other clientele which are generally 30 somethings dressed as cool as cucumbers!  Checking in was easy but with one small problem, the front desk failed to inform any of us about the "Extras".

Drinks were as expected in the bar but a little pricey but hey, your in Soho. Service was good and as expected. The following morning after a fantastic nights sleep in a super comfy bed (Note, each business had their own room), albeit typical NY type smaller than average room compared to other US cities, we all headed to breakfast. Again, good breakfast, a little pricey but certainly satisfying. We then headed to check out which was where it started to go wrong.

The overnight statement was showing minibar usage even prior to my arrival. Thankfully, this was resolved quickly. Sadly, when it came to the "Extras", these were now explained in detail and wasn't optional. $45.90 inc tax was the amenity charge as they call it. For this, you get a host of things other hotels offer for free such as Tea, Coffee, exercise room and a turndown service. The one item to note is the hourly wine tasting from 5-6pm. Unfortunately, if you check in after 6.00pm, you miss that perk which was exactly what the 3 of us missed. You also get spin classes so make sure you stay for 2 nights and these need to be booked a day in advance.

As we were all at the hotel for less than 24 hours, checked in after 6.00pm and missed the wine, all I can say is the three of us were fleeced out of nearly $150 for these "Amenities" so beware. One last thing to note is the Amenities also includes the WiFi which states its free on the website. Don't get caught out thinking that means you get free "high speed" WiFi as that's extra as well. Even the person on the front desk agreed "free WiFi" cant be free if included in the $45.90 amenity charge.

Overall, a nice hotel but felt ripped off with these charges.

title: really nice place in dowtown manhattan
text: the overall experience is quite nice. Perfect place in dowtown manhatten and you can feel really cmfortable and the price is really great. Watch out, that you get a room with a view over upper manhattan.

title: Last Minute Hotel for Locals
text:
We had to deal with an unexpected home renovation, so we looked for a hotel in Lower Manhattan. This came up as one of the more reasonable choices (price-wise) on Hotel Tonight and we went based on the reviews. The resort fee is ridiculous, as I still haven’t quite figured out what resort amenities were available to justify that fee. There wasn’t even free bottled water in our room! 

Fees aside, the room was teeny-tiny, but serviceable for one night. If you have big suitcases, it may be tight for two people. The shower had excellent water pressure and the location is great, if you want to be near Soho, Chinatown/Little Italy, Tribeca or the Financial District. Duane Reade is about a five minute walk if you forget anything. There’s also a Handy phone for visitors traveling here from abroad. Our room had great light during the day. The entrance way to the hotel is quite pretty, and there were many people taking selfies for their Instagram posts when we returned from dinner.

The Cons: while looking for a cup or glass to hold our toothbrushes, we found a glass in the snack tray with pink lipstick on it. On the toilet, we found hair on the seat. The rooms and hallways have a heavy perfume circulating in the ventilation system. Every time our A/C went on, a blast of the perfume would come out. We would have left the window open overnight, but it lacks a bug screen, and being that our window opened to a utility/roof top area (3rd floor), we did not want to chance it with rodents coming in. A lamp in our room was on the fritz, and clearly needed a new lightbulb or wiring. 

The lobby for check-in is upstairs; you need to take the elevator up from the ground floor. Better signage would have been appreciated. We had no bags with us, but I would imagine out-of-town visitors would not have liked searching for the front desk with all of their stuff in tow. 

We gladly checked out early and will be looking for another hotel to stay in tonight.

title: A great option if you get a good rate
text:
I stayed at the NoMo last minute on a really great Hotel Tonight rate and was pleasantly surprised. My room was small and a little tired but the views were gorgeous and it was spotlessly clean. I loved the big bathroom and comfy bed, as well as the well-stocked mini-bar and Molton Brown products. The location here on Crosby St is also amazing. 
The resort fee felt like an overkill for what was provided (and was more than what was quoted on Hotel Tonight), though the free Wifi was more than fast enough for my needs. For that much I would have expected bottled water every day.
With the exception of the surly gentleman who checked me in, each member of staff I encountered was so warm and friendly - shout out to Paulo on the library bar and the evening guys on the main bar. 
I would definitely stay again: I usually stay at the more expensive Public 10 minutes away but, while it's not as polished and stylish this hotel is much friendlier.

title: ANGIE AT THE FRONT DESK!
text:
Everyone at the hotel is amazing.  Always get great service there.

Angie at the front desk is the real MVP!  

Left a very expensive jacket at the restaurant and she held it for me.  THANK YOU!

XOXOXOXOXOXO

title: Pretty hotel
text:
Pretty hotel the entrance is amazing, good food and nice rooms very comfortable bed.
Good service and the staff very friendly.
Location is perfect if you like to go shopping, walking distance to nice restaurants and name brand stores.

title: Jackpot again!!
text: I keep coming back to this funky hotel with such a great location. It really is one of my favorite in Soho. The view over the city is phenomenal and at times even entertaining. We watched a gentleman taking his dog for a walk on a rooftop .... a sight probably exclusive to the big apple!! Great service, funky and super clean. Love the atmosphere and the restaurant has fantastic breakfast.

title: Great service from Pablo
text:
I stayed at Nomo last week and wanted to write a review about one of the employees, Pablo Pozo, who gave me above and beyond service. 

After helping me print out some documents and having them delivered up to my room earlier in the week, Pablo responded immediately when I emailed him about some very important personal items I left behind in my room when I checked out. Pablo gave me his personal number and updated me with whether or not the intems were found, and then went to FedEx for me to make sure they were overnighted. He kept following up and I was so relieved when I received them back in my home in California the very next day. 

With customer service being something I feel a lot of good establishments are lacking these days, we need more Pablo’s out there!!!

title: Great in every way!
text: Stayed for 7 days. Clean rooms. Great service and brilliant location. Free mobile phone for use during your stay is a fantastic addition too. Would happily stay again and recommend for business or pleasure.

title: Great location. Comfy bed too....
text:
Stayed in a one bedroom suite which was large and nice to not have to sit on the bed all the time. 

Rooms are large and have two bathrooms, but they are adjoining rooms opened up as one. 

Didn’t eat here but great location. Not much value in the resort fee, not even a free bottle of water.

title: Location!! Location!! Location!!
text: We loved the location in SoHo!! Close to all the shops,restaurants, and attractions!! Plus subway right around the corner, great seating area outside you can chill out, also lounge area downstairs, very hip...

title: Perfectly located but service a bit haphazard
text:
We stayed here for a 40th birthday, which I spent time arranging various upgrades and amenities in advance. On arrival you are struck by the great location, right in the heart of soho and a stones throw from china town and little Italy. The walkway and reception confirm that this is a hotel that’s had a lot of thought put into it. The room, a corner suite on the 16th floor, had panoramic views across midtown Manhattan, with the Empire State Building forming part of the vista above our headboard. Well designed and using the best of furniture and materials, it’s a pleasure to be in. 

The let down... the lack of service. The staff are nice, but they don’t have a clue who is doing what sometimes. Especially when it’s busy. The amenities I ordered just didn’t turn up. When I asked they said they’d be sent right up. They weren’t. I asked again. Several times. Eventually on our final day a warm bottle of Prosecco was thrust at us through the door way. Disappointing. On check out they tried to charge overcharge us as the second day had been flagged on their system as a no-show! I’d been at the front desk a dozen times that day, so they definitely knew I was there. Shame as it’s a fantastic hotel. If they can fix those service issues it will be one of the best places to stay in the city.

title: Súper lindo Boho Chic
text: Me encanto todo, el lobby huele a rosas, el restorant es muy cool, los precios del Restorante para los Argentinosnun poco caro nos queda, la comida buena, el patio del frente muy lindo, todo mundo se toma fotos en la entrada, las habitaciones pequeñas pero el espacio suficiente para estar muy cómodos, todo en condiciones.  Batas y pantuflas muy cómodas. Volvería. Vine con un niño de 12 años. El detalle te dan gratis un celu con Wi fi para salir del hotel con el podes hacer llamadas locales y a algunos países gratis (no a Argentina) podes usar el Maps, solo que aveces anda mal y no tiene buena conexión, es un fastidio. La ubicación del hotel perfecta! Todos los negocios que les gustan a las Argentinas cerca Pink, H&M, Sephora, Uniqlo, ZARA, Forever 21 etc

title: NYC Birthday Celebration a Success
text:
We chose TheNomo Soho to celebrate our granddaughters 16th Birthday. The hotel had a “cool” vibe and the location was perfect for us.
The staff was friendly, helpful and very pleasant.
A wonderful time was had by all!

title: Great location, sadly only OK
text:
Have stayed numerous times at this hotel prior to the change of management and name of the hotel. In the old days, it was amazing...the hotel had a buzz and excitement. Great restaurant and bar, just what you expect from a NYC hotel. The hotel is now looking and feeling old. The buzz has gone as has the service. They however do love to charge an excessive "resort" fee which includes everything that you expect to be included in the base hotel rate. I half expected to be charge for the water and electricity that we had used. The resort fee payable daily for example includes one bottle of water (that we did not get) for the entire stay. 

As I have said, location great, hotel crap. Much better hotels in NYC

title: Modern and Hip Hotel in the center of Soho
text:
A great hotel for family, couples or a friends get away! In the center of Soho and close to many restaurants and great shopping! 
The restaurant has a great menu for dinner and is charming! 
Went with my family and we had a great time!

title: Breathtaking from arrival
text:
If you're looking for a hotel with great spots for pictures...look no further!  This place is breathtaking from the minute you arrive and walk underneath the archway into the hotel itself.  The bar and restaurant is equally gorgeous and included a DJ throughout Sunday brunch.  Very cool vibe to this place.
The rooms all seem to have terrific views (mine was a view of the Brooklyn bridge), the rooms are small (but we are in NYC!) but comfortable and clean.  It's a boutique hotel, so it's small and welcoming and unique.   
The hotel is also located in a great spot if you love to shop and eat!!  It's a very short walk to Chinatown and Little Italy and the shopping is fantastic!!!!  
This is my new Go-To hotel in the city!!

title: Great Escape
text: We stayed overnight to celebrate our anniversary sans bebe, it's a great little gem of a hotel in a fabulous neighborhood.  The cocktail menu at the hotel bar is inventive and fun.  Also, the rooms were very quiet for NYC and the bed is very comfy!

title: South of Houston (Soho) and Amazing
text:
This was our first stay at the hotel and we totally loved it!  The amenities (bar, restaurant, gym) are all fabulous.  The layout of the hotel is spacious with larger than normal NYC soho rooms.  Elevators are fast and always available plus the gym is resort like with everything you need.

Well done and we recommend that you join the preferred club for later checkout and the points.

title: MNomo Hotel Soho
text:
Great place to stay. Sensatioal views great location comfortable room friendly and helpful staff. 4th stay.  Highly recommend.
Located in Soho 1 block from Canal St and Broadway easy subway access.make sure to take a photo on the hotel walkway entrance

title: Too expensive for the real state and comfortability
text: Really expensive for a hotel with a lot of guests noise and several not working services. Door was not working ant hotel service took a hole day to fix. Small rooms, noisy, not very clean at all. Food was OK but very expensive.

title: Overrated hotel - but excellent location
text: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in April with my teenage kids. Sterile hotel room - small.  Felt a little like a hospital room. Dirty bathroom, bad service from reception- had to call them 3 times in one day before I got the right amount of towels in the room - this happened twice. I also tried to get an upgrade to a room higher up - the 5th floor view was a little depressing - but no reply. The beds were wonderful. The Reception was on the 2nd floor, made it very impersonal - also strange with other employees sitting on ground level as if the entrance of the hotel was their office.  Tasty breakfast, but small portions and pricey compared to plenty of delicious breakfast places close by.  Excellent location - close to lots of great shopping on Broadway, and great restaurants. Got excellent help with luggage and transport to the airport.  I also sent a mail several days ago to the hotel to let them know of the dirty bathroom - but no reply.  So all in all I was disappointed - had read so many good reviews before our trip. Will find another hotel next time.

title: Bello,deluso solo un po’ dalla camera
text: Hotel molto bello,con la Nomo Kitchen nella quale si fa colazione e si pranza/cena molto bella.Sono rimasto deluso dalla camera/suite data per 4 persone,ma in realtà,oltre al letto matrimoniale per 2,il divano letto può essere utilizzato solo da un bambino di Max 10 anni.Le gambe di mio figlio uscivano dal letto di almeno 40cm..Quando l’ho comunicato,mi hanno detto che non potevano sostituirlo.Sono comunque stati gentili nell’offrirmi di cambiare camera il giorno dopo,ma non avevamo voglia di rifare i bagagli.Bellissimo l’ingresso(nel quale molto si fermano a fare foto).Ottima anche la posizione.

title: Nice location, front desk are very unfriendly and non-accommodating
text:
Pros
- Great location, and very picturesque, particularly at the entrance - you might find it difficult some days getting out with everyone looking for the perfect insta shot :)
- Rooms are clean and comfortable, but they are tiny

Cons
- Hotel reception staff were very unfriendly and not accommodating in any way. 
- BEWARE - there are TONNES of hidden charges that you get hit with at the end of your stay, so don't be fooled by the price tag you think you are getting when you make the original booking. We got charged over 100-150 for "Amenities", which included things like wifi, and spin classes (yes, you read that correctly)??? This was NOT made aware to us when we checked in, and surely these should be made optional.

title: Management, and front desk are terrible!
text:
Our family has stayed here several times each time the the customer service got worse.
The rooms are small but, decent, the location is perfect we have a daughter that lives walking distance and we like being close to the shopping. 
We will not be staying there again which is a loss for them since we come every couple of months and usually get 2 rooms one for our other daughter. 
On our last visit I accidentally left my favorite items of clothing in one of the drawers in the room. I called immediately when I realized this and was sent to housekeepings voicemail I left several messages including one for the hotel manager and never heard back. finally 4 days later I was able to get through to the manager of housekeeping he was rude, didn't speak enough english to get my name right after repeating it and spelling it over and over he finally figured it out just to tell me that my clothes were not there because the housekeepers would have put it in the log book. I begged him to please just look in lost and found and described my items and he refused. I lost about 1500.00 worth of non replaceable items. Yes, I know it's my fault for leaving them I am just so sad about it.

title: Okay for short stay
text:
Okay hotel. I felt service was lacking, check in was minimal and I was left to my own devices a bit. 

Room tiny but okay for one. Decor was odd, I didn’t get the blue tinted mirror taking up a whole wall, made the room feel cold.

Food very good, breakfast nice.

I had issues with the shower and had to get handyman in.

I don’t think I would stay again.

title: Great Place, Great Stay
text:
I stayed for the second time this year at the Nomo Soho Hotel came back because the the previous experience I had - back in February this year,  was excellent. The location of the hotel is probably one of the best - in the heart of Soho (the hippest place to be in NYC),  everything is close by, the trains station is a block away, great restaurants & bars  all around (even a karaoke place right across the Lafayette entrance), and amazing stores at every meter. And it has a nice terrace right in front!

The staff was very nice, in particular the Manager of the hotel- Mr. Pablo - who was incredibly attentive, always eager to meet the needs of its customers. The room i stayed in, 2001, was a great one, just a bit noisy from overseeing Lafayette street. I asked if I could change the room and immediately i was offered more options.

As well, Jeffrey, the front desk agent, such a respectful man, always smiling and eager to be of service.

There was a free wine tasting every day at 5 PM in the hotel's lobby, sometimes fresh fruits or other treats awaited at the entrance of the hotel- making one's stay feel so much closer to home. I have stayed here over the past years many  times, and I have to say that in the last years I was quite disappointed with the staff and the fact that I had booked through a third party - Hotels.com, that had hidden taxes...So,  this year, when i was back , I was a bit reluctant, but the place had changed so, so much for the better. I was amazed. I stayed in total this year over three weeks here and I don't think I could have made a better decision.  I highly recommend it!

title: Small rooms
text:
It's a design hotel,very nice, but the rooms are very small and the bathrooms really tiny.
In 2 people it's hard to live in...
I don't think I will stay again in the future in this hotel.
Breakfast was very good.
They apply a 40$/day resort fee which doesn't include anything usefule...

title: Cramped and Hot!!
text: The grounds of the hotel are very nice.  The restaurant and bar downstairs were awesome.  However, for the price point the room is a closet.  There is barely any room to even walk around the bed.  However, it is the city and I understand space is a commodity.  My deal breaker was the temperature of the room.  When we checked in the room was 88 degrees.  After almost 12 hours of the AC on the highest setting the room was still 82 degrees.  If the room is this hot in the beginning of April I would hate to see it in the middle of the summer.

title: Disappointing
text:
It wasn't a terrible experience except for the heat. I didn't get room service and I stayed on someone else's dime.

It is pretty and pictures are accurate. Rooms include complimentary water. I had a king size bed and the room was a good size for the location. I stayed on the 7th floor. Had a decent city view. Wine hour between 5 and 6 for mingling. 

The room was a very warm 73 degrees, so I turned down the thermostat. I noticed an intermittent beeping that sounded like a smoke detector out of batteries. I told the front desk and they said they'd send security to check it out. At midnight my room was still 73 degrees and the thing was still beeping. The night crew fixed the beeping immediately. (I didn't complain about the heat, seemed pointless.) It got up to 76 degrees and I was sweating buckets. It was hard to get read for a professional business related dinner. Not ideal conditions.

There was some sort of white stuff on the mirror in the room. It could have been cleaning solution, but it was gross. The sheets literally had holes in them. Shower controls were unmarked, leading to mess.

It was clean and had no evidence of bugs. I would stay here again but I would look elsewhere just in case.

title: Absolutely loved this place
text: So super beautiful.  Love the blue ceilinged rooms, love the blue mirrors. Love the location, love the restaurant. Love the lobby, the concierge, the upgrade to a suite, the couch in the suite. Toilet was tiny, shower divine.  Nice to have a view of shorter buildings, not as claustrophobic as mid-town.  Can't wait to go back.  Only (tiny) flaw was that room service was just slightly above average, nothing spectacular and I hate going to lobby for coffee (give us a tiny in-room Nexpresso, please!)  . Breakfast in restaurant was wonderful.

title: Bachelorette party - great rooms and view
text:
The views views and our room made up for the lack of organization of the staff but I would go back again with a smaller group. Pros- the view, the large rooms, breakfast in the downstairs garden restaurant
Cons-no having connecting rooms like they had sold to me. Unorganized staff.

title: Perfect place in Soho
text:
The place is nice very well located in Soho before Little Italy and China town.
The lobby and terrace are nice and rooms very sunny.
It is pity that the service is very limited. Réception little cold and you will learn the hôtel will charge you after you already paid the price of the room during your booking 40$ more each day to supply a strict minimum of amenities ( which are offered for free in other hotel around the world). For us it was sample size shampoos and water bottles only!
The concierge is here at minimal. And the food on restaurant is unfortunately not the best!

Really we love the hotel and have been coming for a decade, but not how it is operated now.

title: Simply funky & truly HIP .... my favorite in SoHo!!!
text: I love everything about Nomo Soho, ..., never disappoints, amazing location, I really could not be better!! With a phenomenal view over Manhatten, always  great service from a wonderful team. The best breakfast. Nomo Soho is just the right amount of HIP and funky....  I just love it!!!

title: Stylish, Hospitable
text: Stylish, hospitable without being smarmy. We paid a bit extra for a corner room with windows on 2 sides, and it was well worth it. Restaurant breakfast was quite good (especially the lemon ricotta pancakes). My only beef is that the floor numbers are quite hard to read in the elegantly-but-dimly-lit elevators.

title: increíble hotel en el soho
text: el hotel es increíble súper bien ubicado, la habitacione tienen una vista increíble y son súper amplias. la decoración es súper linda. venagan no se van a arrepentir. la cama es súper cómoda y amplia.

title: Beautiful Hotel with Thin Walls and Rude Desk Staff
text: You had to ask for everything twice at this hotel. Sluggish valet/room service. I told the manager that I was planning on sharing my displeasure with Trip Advisor and he began to threaten me. Paper thin walls, dirty window. A big "scene" downstairs but who cares?

title: This place is always near perfect
text: This is my fourth time staying at Nomo Soho and I’ll be staying here a lot more. I usually choose to stay at luxury 5 star properties because I believe you get what you pay for. However, the Nomo Soho delivers in so many ways and at a price that just makes you smile, as if you know something that they don’t. Rooms are cheery, fun, super clean, and have amazing blue hued mirrors which suit many purposes. Floor to ceiling widows with some of the best views of lower Manhattan. Then there’s the location!!! You’re in food Mecca here. Chinatown is basically a block away and that’s all you need to know. Try a different restaurant all three meals a day and every day. It sound like too much, but it’s not. But then there’s little Italy, still another block or two away and Le cou Cou for fine dining across the street. I could go on. Request a high room facing the bridges for the best views.  A corner room has more windows and more views!

title: Great hotel
text: This was my first stay at the NoMo SoHo and would stay again.  We stayed in the Crosby sofa bed suite and was amazed at how comfortable the sofa bed was!  We had a great view from our room on the 8th floor and the room was clean, staff were friendly and the food was amazing!

title: אין הצדקה למחיר
text: אין הצדקה למחיר הגבוה שמשלמים,אין מכונת קפה בחדר או מינימום בקבוק מים!הם מתקמצנים על סבונים במקלחת.השירות נוראי.אין גם הצדקה למחיר במסעדה שלהם,גם שם השירות נורא לא נעים.המלצרים רואים שקראת להם ופשוט מתעלמים

title: Loved this place!
text: Beautiful rooms with gorgeous views.  Fantastic neighborhood.  Awesome. Will stay at Nomo again.  Have now stayed for business and for pleasure.  Both times it was great.  My 20 something kids adored it as well.

title: El mejor hotel de Soho
text:
Me hospede en este hotel durante la epoca navideña hasta año nuevo, la experiencia fue increible. Empezando por la ubicacion, esta muy bien ubicado y alrededor tiene tiendas de muy buena calidad. 

Al llegar quise pagar en efectivo y no conte bien el dinero, le di dinero de mas sin saberlo. La chica del mostrador se porto integra y honestamente, me regreso el dinero que di de mas. El hotel siempre huele rico, te ofrecen cafe y te gratis todos los dias en la mañana. 

El cuarto siempre limpio y ordenado, los jabones y shampoos de cortesia me encantaron. Me volvi fan de la marca que utilizan. Algo que no me gusto fue que el ultimo dia an año nuevo, el hotel realizo una fiesta que no estaba muy bien organizada. Al entrar la hotel por la parte de atras, que colinda con otra calle principal, el de seguridad no queria dejarnos pasar por que el evento era privado. 

Le comentamos que eramos huespedes, el respondio que no importaba y teniamos que dar la vuelta. El hotel nunca informo de esto, lo cual deja una experiencia amarga. Fuera de este incidente todo fue correcto en forma y tiempo.

title: Loving this hotel!
text: Great hotel to stay in! Great location too. Brunch is awesome at the hotel Cafe too. Staffs are friendly and they have the room ready very early which is good for us as we touchdown early in the morning and wanting a resting place. Definitely coming back again!

title: Wonderful location
text:
I really enjoyed my stay here in nomo soho. The rooms are quite modern and unique. And by modern I don’t mean those hotels who just use ikea cheap quality minimalism and call themselves modern.

The suite is quite spacious and definitely bigger than average manhattan standards. The overall quality of the interior is quite decent. 

I have to point out that if you choose (or accidentally) stay at an Instagram popular hotel, you will have to kind of live with the consequence that staff may or may not equip with an impersonal and some what arrogant personality. But nonetheless I’m not there to be their best friends 😂 and I would recommend the east side facing rooms for a better view.

I also like the interior decor of their Instagram popular nomo kitchen. But the food is relatively more generic than its decor.

title: PERFECT & MAGIC => AWESOME
text:
Une déco raffinée, un parfum d'ambiance envoutant, un personnel souriant avenant et professionnel. J'ai adoré la déco, les couleurs, les cartes de chambre. La suite crosby au 8ème étage offre une vue magnifique et une luminosité exceptionnelle.J'ai adoré et je reviendrai

A refined decor, a charming atmosphere, a friendly and professional smiling staff. I loved the design, the colours, the room cards and the perfume. The Crosby suite on the 8th floor has a great view with exceptional brightness. I loved it and I will come back

title: Best Trip!
text: We came to NY for the first time ever and had a wonderful time. Cameron helped us with everything! He told us exactly where to go, how to get there and with step by stop directions. He even wrote them down for us every time. We are from Texas and don’t know how to navigate a subway system and he made this so easy for us. We would come back because if him!! The stay was very clean and accommodating, as well! We are definitely planning to come back just because of this! Thank you, Cameron!!

title: My stay at the NoMo
text:
It was my first visit to this beautiful hotel. The entrance was spectacular the lobby on the lower floor and upper floor was comfortable and inviting.
Check-in was efficient and easy. The rooms are a nice size  for New York and beautifully done. I will definitely be back!

title: Quick 3 days in NYC
text: What a pleasant stay we had at NoMo SoHo. The location really is great since you can easily step out into Canal street or walk over to Little Italy and eat some delicious food. Tribeca was a $10 Uber away for brunch at Bubby’s. Our room was quiet 19th floor and had great views. My 2 teenagers really liked it too! Cool vibe. Bar was full of fun people and lots of energy. So many young folks taking pictures at every turn since this spot is really cute. Staff was perfectly pleasant and helpful. Free coffee downstairs in the mornings was great. I think I’ve found my favorite place to stay after 8 or so NYC trips. Several subway stops just a short walk away so you can get anywhere easily! I’ll be back!! Also- yummy Molten Brown soaps and lotions were a nice upscale touch. Thank you for a wonderful Spring Break trip!

title: An attempt at a hipster luxury hotel, which fails miserably.
text:
From the moment of arrival the hotel was disappointing.  The lobby had the appearance of a homeless centre.  Tourists smoking in the front outdoor area and taking selfies, and lounging around in ( fashionably?) tatty old armchairs.  
In the lobby we were told to take all our luggage upstairs to the checkin area.  After queing, we were told check-in is at 4pm and we’d have to take our luggage back downstairs to the lobby.  ( Why wasn’t advised this when I emailed to confirm we would arrive at 2pm?  Why wasn’t there any one to pre-empt this at the lobby? Or to take our bags from the checkin area?).
Much fuss was made of coffee being served in the library.  The breakfast coffee was available in an area of the lobby, and consisted of an urn and paper cups, with an opportunity to purchase a coissant, again served in a cardboard box.  
The hotel is a peculiar mix of a hipster grunge design decor, and once classic rooms.
The bedrooms are exceptionally small, but do have large windows and classic interiors - the “left overs” of  the previous iteration of the hotel.  The floors and cushions are classic blue and bathrooms classic marble.  A minor gripe - but there was no complimentary bottled water and minimal toiletries, including no shower cap.
Overall, the service was rather poor.  No assistance was available for touring or transport. Our keys were recoded to deny access to our room on the last day one and a half hours before checkout time.
The location is fine in a lovely street, but more importantly the hotel felt more like youth hostel in all public areas.  We did not try the restaurant as it did not look appealing.

title: Ok but not the service level you expect....
text:
Fantastic location and good rooms. Walls are paper thin and so you can hear everything going on around you which for us was loud music and people having sex. Our floor and room also reeked of weed on one occasion which was off putting. Facilities and cleanliness were fine-staff attitude was luke warm. Our greeting on arrival was business like and lacking in warmth. We were ignored in the bar on the first evening and so didn’t bother with it again. The doormen on leaving also couldn’t care less and had a very off hand manner. 
On the whole it was alright but we didn’t feel tremendously valued as guests which was unexpected and a bit disappointing.

title: Medianamente recomendable.
text:
El hotel se encuentra bien ubicado hay alternativas de  transporte, el personal no me parecio tan amable. El check in se realiza  hasta las 16:00 horas  sin  excepción. 
La habitación   fue extremadamente pequeña no cumplica con as caracteristicas de mi reserva pero como estaba en capacidad de hospedaje no me cambiaron (  de la puerta de entrada a la cama no mas de medio metro)  la vista   a  la ciudad  muy bonita    y la limpieza  buena.  En las mañanas y en la noche existe un fuerte aroma a alimentos en los pasillos de pisos superiores por el tema del restaurante.
No tuve oportunidad de comer en el hotel por que a pesar de ser huesped tiene que realizarse reserva   para cenar ahi se tenia una lista de espera de 1 hora. 
 Lo muy malo de este hotel es que te cobran el cargo por amentie fee un cargo extra por noche de hospedaje  esto es aparte de lo que se paga por la reservación original, por una person son $35 dolares por dos personas $40. Para pagar este cargo extra no creo que lo valga el hotel. Con el precio se  pueden explorar otras opciones o inlcuso hoteles de linea. 
No me super encanto en lo particular  como escriben  muchas personas y que por ello me anime a reservar ahi, para mi es regular; nada extraodinario  y no me volveria a hospedar ahi.

title: Lindo restaurante na entrada!
text:
O hotel é super bem localizado e tem uma recepção linda. Para mim o Soho é a melhor região para hospedagem em NYC
O restaurante é belíssimo e alto astral .
Os quartos são bons, porém um pouco pequenos.
Voltaria com certeza.

title: Alway a treat staying at NoMo!
text: I travel to Manhattan quite a few times a year.  NoMo never disappoints.   I’ve stayed in hotels all over New York but NoMo is always my favorite.  If you’re looking for true SoHo experience look no further.

title: An average hotel pretending it’s something better!
text:
The hotel is in a good location in Soho and we enjoyed exploring that area.When we checked in the receptionist had to leave us at the desk and go away up in the elevator to see if our room was ready. It only took around 5 minutes but on her return she offered us $50 credit for the inconvenience. We were pleased but when we got to our room we realised that wouldn’t last very long when it was the equivalent to £8 for a bottle of Evian water. 

The reception and restaurant areas of the hotel are beautiful. The room we had was on a corner offering great views and the bathroom was nice. The rest of the room however was a bit tired looking and I found the white and blue combo a bit odd considering the interior design of the rest of the hotel.

We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning which was great but there was one afternoon we asked to have a drink at the bar but when taking a seat it seemed like the staff had no idea what was going on or we were being ignored so we swiftly left. On observation, whilst sitting in reception, there were always 2 staff hosting at the door of the restaurant but it seemed like no one knew what was going on and they were just there to look pretty. 

Giving the rating and price of the hotel, I would have expected more flawless customer service. If you want a hotel to take great instagram pictures then this is the hotel for you, otherwise, I would look somewhere else given our mixed experience.

title: Not the customer service you would expect
text: I planned this trip for my daughters birthday.  We normally stay at the Knickerbocker which we love but wanted to get away from Times Square since we weren’t seeing any shows in the theater district.  The NOMO Soho exterior is beautiful, the rooms are small but nice.  There are no coffee pots in the rooms which for someone that likes coffee when they wake up, is sad!  The biggest complaint is the customer service at this hotel.  It’s awful!  I booked my room through there website where it clearly states “free continental breakfast for two” and chose from three gifts when you book- Uber credits, shuttle, etc.  I never got the link for the credits so I called the hotel twice and got nowhere- was transferred back and forth multiple times between in house and regular reservations.  So I just forgot about that but then when I checked in, they stated my reservation didn’t have breakfast included.  I asked two different people and called the reservation dept but never got an answer.  Friday after I checked in, I got this survey link from the hotel asking if I had any issues to email them prior to filing out the survey- I emailed them twice regarding the issues and still have not heard back- 3 days later!  It’s really quite crazy!  Be careful what they promise you because they don’t really care!

title: A boutique hotel feeling in the heart of Soho
text:
I've been staying at NoMo Soho for few years.  It is in a fantastic location, nestled in the heart of Soho. This trip has been the longest so far. As this was about to be a longer stay, i tried calling to see what type of rooms they have available - wanted a top floor one, overseeing Manhattan. No one answered (I would say this is the downside, whenever you try to get in touch with with them, no one answers/ is available - front desk or reservation desk-, and if they finally answer, they immediately redirect you to another person that, once again...never answers...).
So I had to personally come to the hotel and ask the person that was working at the time - Israel,  to show me a couple of available rooms. He was very kind and took the time to show me not one, not two, but three or four available rooms and made sure to put a hold on the one that I liked - as i was about to check in few days later.

My 1st night there was one of the coldest of this season , so there were some issues with the heating system of the chosen room. Next morning I got in contact with the manager of the hotel, Pablo, and was in awe by his professionalism. He personally took on the matter, switched the room, offered me a beautiful one, and made sure that I have everything I need throughout my entire stay- which was even longer than expected. I have traveled in my life quite a lot everywhere in the world, and, of course, it often happens that there are issues with the room you are given, but i gotta say, this has been one of the few occasions when the manager of the hotel was so considerate and accommodating - it was clear from the beginning that he was one of the few people that has a clear understanding of what hospitality actually means.

I highly recommend the hotel. I will for sure be back. (I would recommend though to book directly at the hotel. I chose Hotels.com and was very disappointing as they had many hidden fees).

title: goed boetiek hotel voor NY
text: in Manhattan is het lastig om een goed hotel voor een redelijke prijs te vinden, maar Nomo is goed te doen. Het was ooit hip en is nog steeds best leuk, met een leuk terras en een levendige bar. Locatie is super. Net als overal in Manhattan zijn de kamers klein of heel klein, vraag maar om een kamer zonder fauteuils als je je koffers kwijt wil. Wastafeltje in de kamer, goede douche/toilet in het badkamertje. 5* weet ik niet, ik dacht dat daar wat meer bij komt kijken, maar het bed is uitstekend en je wil denk ik niet teveel op je kamer zijn, er is zoveel in Soho e.o. te doen. Die hipsters bij de ontvangst zijn goed voor een praatje, maar verder heb je er niet veel aan (kan die handy ook bluetooth? sorry, weet ik niet, ben ik niet voor opgeleid). De receptie op de 2e verdieping is na 7 pm onbemand en de rest van de dag meestal ook (notitie: ben even een gast helpen, binnen een uur terug, sorry). TV heeft chromecast, handig voor je Netflix. Handy is niet zo handy, want heel langzaam en er kan niet zo veel mee, maar bellen en googlemaps zit erop. Je charger en power adapter kan je bij Duane Reade om de hoek kopen. Al met al, Nomo Soho is goed te doen en tja het is wel NY dus overal zitten verborgen kosten, het lijkt wel een vliegmaatschappij.

title: Super séjour
text:
Nous avons séjourné en couple au Nomo Soho pour 2 nuits. La vue de la chambre était spectaculaire : vue sur New York avec les gratte-ciel et la nuit c'était encore plus beau !! Nous avons pris le petit déjeuner une fois à l'hôtel : succulent ! il y a pas mal de choix et c'était très bon. Le repas du soir était également parfait. 
Une literie géniale, propreté très bien et décoration de la chambre super ! Nous recommandons cet hôtel de plus l'emplacement est top.

title: Almost perfect.
text: The person at the front desk was a little brusque when we checked in, otherwise everything else was excellent. This is probably the best place to stay in lower Manhattan. Great restaurant, great gym, impeccable rooms, and a generally pleasing/calming atmosphere about the place. It is a great base if you want to explore Brooklyn's DUMBO, battery park, 911 WTC memorial, Chelsea, TRIBECA, even Greenwich Village. Plus it's in SoHo, so you would have the widest array of shopping and dining.

title: Love NoMo
text: We love NoMo SoHo! Such a great hotel nestled amongst the fabulous shops n cafes of SoHo. Everyone is super friendly and soo willing to help you with anything! Best Nutella french toast we have ever had!!!- in NoMo Kitchen.  Vibe is hip and cool. Rooms are sleek and pretty. I think I can still smell the awesome scent thru out the lobby. We always new we were "home" after a long busy NYC day.

title: Frequent Guest
text: I find this property very consistent in quality customer service, room accommodations, very clean, neat vibe with a mix of US and foreign guests. Cool bar/restaurant with great glass atrium (also for the very observant the location for the last celebratory scene from :The Other Woman"

title: Great location but hotel needs some TLC
text:
Pros - great location, v. comfortable bed and amazing views looking out over over New York.. catching the sunrise every morning was a particular highlight of the trip!

Cons - paper thin walls.. on the phone to my boyfriend back in the UK one morning and even he heard the person in the room next door to me sneezing and blowing his nose!! If you've booked to stay here then ear plugs for sleeping are a must!! The shower also leaked into the rest of the bathroom with every use.

It wasn't an unpleasant stay, but probably wouldn't book to stay here again.

title: Nice Hotel , good Location , but they charge you extra for " Amenities Tax "
text:
Good Location . Good Service from F&B department.  They gave me a room with a conecting door , the insonorization coming from the other room was terrible . 
 But the worst thing was they charge you for a " a complementary WIFI " - almost 30 Dollars a day for a " Amenities Tax " -  This information is not on the Booking.com , so i had to pay almost 100 Dollars for 3 night .

title: Room with a view
text:
Decent bed, large bathroom, minimalist furnishings but great location and great view of Empire State Building.

Limited room service but very close proximity to Little Italy with some great food options.

Great location between midtown and bottom of Manhattan

title: Cool and friendly
text:
We arrived at NoMo for a two night stay, and were immediately impressed with the exterior of the hotel, and it seems were weren't alone!

The entranceway is sometimes a little difficult to navigate as so many people want to take photographs here, and I stumbled upon a couple of professional shoots here (looking my most haggard and tired following a day of travel!)

The rooms are beautiful, but quite compact, although there is everything that you need contained within.

The restaurant was bustling, and seems to be where the beautiful people go to see and be seen at the weekends.  The food was lovely, and there's a great selection of drinks.

title: Great Hotel
text: Had an amazing experience at Nomo Soho. The hotel as well as its restaurant, Nomo Kitchen (great service there too), are gorgeous, smell nice, are clean and very stylish. Everyone working at Nomo was friendly and helpful. Not only did we get late check out, but we also received an upgrade which was a pleasant surprise. The views of NYC from our room were stunning, as was the room in general. Great decor, clean, comfortable. Will definitely be back and strongly recommend this hotel. It’s location in Soho is also perfect.

title: Third time is not a charm
text: Upon arriving to the NOMO Soho we waited in a line six people deep while the Real Housewives of Miami and Texas checked in. The elevator ride up to our room was heavily coated in Mary Jane. We finally made it to our room to find that our door didn’t lock. We were assured security would watch our room until the lock was fixed and we could go about our day. Imagine our surprise when we returned to our room eight hours later to an unlocked door. Not happy! Now we are told to wait 10 minutes and they will assign us a new room. We were unpacked  and now moving. No upgrade, no nothing!

title: Soho location with great views.
text: Nice clean rooms with floor to ceiling windows giving great views across NYC. Walking distance on Chinatown and Italian quarter which meant there was a nice selection of restaurants within walking distance. NoMo is popular for photo shoots so always something happening in the lobby area. Great breakfast room although Jack's Wife Freda is only a few minutes away and worth trying as is Jubillee Market for lunch.

title: Great location/super charming!
text: I love this hotel and have stayed twice now and would absolutely stay again on a future trip.  It is super convenient and close to so much.  The bar is also so charming and the entry way is always filled with people taking photos.  I'm definitely guilty of a many photos under the lights!  The rooms are small but bright and clean and the views are lovely.  I just love the NoMo and am looking for an excuse to visit asap!

title: I just love this place
text:
It's simply beautiful. Great sense of style everywhere. That's probably why it seems like there is constantly a photo shoot with some model going on. 

Attracts an attractive, style-conscious crowd. 

The rooms are awesome. We got upgraded to a suite - the views are spectacular. 

Only beef: My room wasn't ready til 4pm. that seems a little weird.

title: Good Place
text: I stayed there for 5 nights for a business trip. Everything was good. I'd like the gym to be a little bigger, but that's true for most hotels. As expected in NYC, you'll be paying for nearly everything in the hotel, but they have good complimentary coffee in the morning.

title: Not a 5*
text:
The location is perfect. It is a fashion hotel with very well maintained details in the common areas, beautiful people around and a chic enviroment during the whole day. But ... it is not a 5 star hotel at all. The rooms are small and do not have the details of a five star. If you are on a high floor, you'll have beautiful views of the city.

One of the nights, I arrived at 10 pm at the hotel quite cold, I asked for a cup of hot water (they did not even have to give me the tea, because I was carrying it) and the answer was: "I'm sorry, the kitchen is closed ".... this simply does not happen in a hotel of  5 *, either in a 4* hotel.... The service is quite unpleasant and unhelpful.

In conclusion, it's not a bad hotel, but either a 5 stars one. If you're looking for a fashion place to post at your instagram it's you place but it's not a comfortable and perfect service kind of hotel. Oh and New Year Eve party was perfect :)!!!!!

title: Nomo-soho hotel
text:
Staff are rude , not helpful at all. I got in from a 14hour flight and the lady at the front desk was unwelcoming , didn’t have my room ready in time.

I needed to see where the Uber would arrive as there are two entrances to the hotel - again not helpful at all, the lady at the front desk told me she doesn’t know. 

The overall service is zero from this hotel. 

Last time I stay here !

title: Eddie and Sheri
text:
What an unbelievable hotel.  From the rooms to the service - nothing compares. 
However most especially notable was the personal service given to us by Cameron the conceirge. His expertise and care was second to none. Thank you for making us feel at home. Your patience and special recommendations was greatly appreciated.  Good luck with your future endeavours. 
We’d love to hear about your progress 
Sheri and Eddie

title: Not bad
text: Overall the location of the hotel is great and the rooms are clean.  The staff was average.  Room Service was never available when you called. The restaurant also gave me problems to grab a table when it was 70 percent at capacity.  Strange as I have usually had a good experience here in the past

title: Great place for a shopping break
text:
Vibrant ambiance, good music, good food & great cocktails. Freshly prepared and fancy. 
Can be very busy. For more people a reservation is recommended. Quite good coffee too. The restaurant is part of the hotel.

title: Great location, stylish building, good rooms, mostly good service
text: We were in NYC for 4 days & nights: Nomo Soho is a great location, with stylish fittings and good rooms. The dining room (breakfast) service was occasionally poor, and the food not always up to scratch, but hey - it's NYC: There are thousands of great places to eat. This hotel is a good place to stay.

title: weekend trip
text: We had a great stay and would definitely come back! the beds were sooo comfy! The valet and front desk were great and very welcoming. Location was great and it was very easy to find. I would definitely recommend!

title: Great location but subpar service.
text: Hotel has a good location; however, the staff and service quality are subpar for a hotel that is supposedly 4-stars. The gym is a small room with a few machines. Can do some basic maintenance workouts, but you will need to go elsewhere if you do more advanced fitness routines or weights.Hotel restaurant breakfast is good. Nice ambiance. It's rather popular (read crowded) at dinner. Not a great bar so you will likely want to drink elsewhere.Room meets expectations. The chromecast feature with the TV is rather cool, but need to read the T&Cs about what kind of info you could be sharing.A little disturbing that you'll get pop-ups from time to time from the hotel about any requests you may have. Seems like an intrusive experience and rather creepy. I work in tech and it made me rather concerned about what the hotel is tracking and sharing from my devices via wifi and the chromecast tech app.If you've made it this far, I'd likely stay elsewhere unless you really want this location. It's a great location for some restaurants, shops and the subway.

title: Fabulous place to stay to experience New York
text: If you want to stay in a hip and trendy part of town then this hotel is ideal! lots of bespoke shops and restaurants and within walking distance of Littely Italy...Very easy to get taxi's to the more tourist areas too but do this early so you avoid getting stuck in traffic

title: Trendy and comfortable, but bad service
text: I loved the look and feel of the NoMo Soho ... the decor and the vibe were very cool and the rooms were comfortable and made great use of the space. However, we were frustrated by the lack of a response to any request we had from trying to get early checking to asking for towels for all three guests we had staying in our suite.

title: The Promised Land
text:
Here I am with my friend wandering the streets of SoHo looking for a last minute hotel. I was worried that I wouldn't be able to find a room without a reservation as late as I came in (around 11pm, perhaps later. but the front desk agent Israel was amazing and definitely proved me wrong! He was very witty, courteous and well mannered despite being under quite of bit of stress due to how busy it was, the weather, and police even showing up at once point (?). It was a crazy night for him, but he was still on top of his game.  He was even able to upgrade our room for no cost. I was extremely happy with our conversation before he handed off the keys to my room and I wish I could have talked to him for longer! The room itself is quite nice, small, but nice, especially for the price.They offer a mini-bar with snacks and various drinks as well as some additional useful amenities (bath robes, slippers, etc) you're allowed to use and take but I wouldn't eat or take anything with you that's on s since it's all overpriced anyway, but if you've got money to blow more power to you!

The place itself is extremely beautiful with lots of modern art in the lobby. I didn't eat in the restaurant or partake in any of the free coffee or tea in the morning but that hotel was definitely one of the best I've ever stayed at for only about $150 dollars.

title: Great stop
text:
Great location, walking distance to soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, Katz Deli and a little longer walk to the 911 memorial. Guest relations were really nice. Everyone was helpful. Rooms were immaculate and cozy. The only negative I had was that I put my breakfast card out at 10pm for room service and no one came to pick it up therefore no coffee first night  The next night I called the front desk to have a pot of coffee brought up and they said that they would relay the message, again I never got the pot of coffee. That being said the hotel does offer free coffee in the lobby so we got dressed and got the coffee ourselves. Truthfully the coffee thing was a little inconvenient because I just wanted to have a lazy morning but With that said i would stay here again. 
Anne

title: So Happy
text: i enjoyed myself it was probably I would say the best time out of my life free liquor so great n neat  the food did me right I give this place a ten outta a billion lol the balcony view is sick such a low-key place ;) :*

title: Business trip
text: Great location with cool restaurant. Cocktails are New York are standard New York prices but taste great. Traveled for work and would come back for pleasure. Definitely trendy hotel and perfect location if you’re going out and shopping

title: Cool hotel in great location
text: Just stayed in this hotel over Christmas. Really hip hotel in a fantastic location. It is walking distance from Little Italy, Chinatown and Soho. The entryway is beautiful and the concierge was helpful in planning my stay.

title: Don’t use the adapter and don’t expect to have a common toilette
text:
Location is great (the neighbourhood is my favorite in NYC!) and the hotel is cool. Rooms are clean and pretty new, but they are kind of small and you’ll find a sink and a mirror just 1/2m far from your bed. Only wc and shower are separated (no bidet of course!).
At the end of the journey we were charged roughly 40 bucks per 2 days, just because we used the adapter UE to USA that was in the closet, even if it was not written anywhere! 
Please pay attention.

title: Billing problems
