text: Hotel charged my debit card after being told my boyfriend was paying for the room. I was ok with holding the room and having funds held, but they actually charged the room after being given his charge card. He even double checked when we checked out and was told they charged him.

title: Disappointing.
text:
Booked two rooms in December 2018 The hotel is in a great location. The rooms are very small. Very clean and well looked after. Unfortunately thats where it stops. No free water offered. They offer you a free mobile to use and free wifi but tell you its part of the" resort" fee which they charge you at the end. So basically there is no free wifi either. It would be better if the resort fee was included in the price instead of being hit with it afterwards. I had no idea there was a resort fee of usd25 per day per room. 
The staff sadly are just not there. Lots of staff hanging around but no one there to help. They never greeted once. Not a smile or a hello. Would stand at the entrance and never greet. You would pass them at reception and they would never greet you either. They were always far too busy talking to one another. We asked them two simple questions - where the closest ATM was and basically what the resort fee was for and they had no idea. He wasnt even interested enough to enquire as to closest atm.
Never encountered such disappointing service before in all my travels.

title: Só simpático
text: Localização muito boa mas o hotel deixa a desejar. Internamente barulhento. Fiquei em um quarto próximo a área onde a equipe de limpeza guarda os materiais. Manutenção ruim e falta um pouco mais de cuidado com a limpeza.

title: Paper thin walls makes you hear all the neighbors and maintenance is poor
text:
Hotel looks nice but you can simply hear all the surrounding rooms. i had one room where i could hear my neighbors conversation, computer typing and bathroom. i asked to move to another room which they gladly did but it smelled of smoking so i got another room just to find out in the middle of the night that the heat doesnt work. staff was not even apologetic in any way.
There for another few nights but wouldnt stay there next time.

title: Tolle Lage, aber....
text:
Sehr positiv: die Lage in Soho ist wirklich ausgezeichnet. Viele nette Läden und Restaurants in fussläufiger Entfernung. Wir hatten ein Upgrade von Queen Suite auf King Suite im 25. Stock und wirklich sensationellen Ausblick Richtung New Jersey. Die Suite war schick eingerichtet, bisschen wenig Schrankfächer, aber ok. Beleuchtung vom Designer erdacht, ergo zu schummrig zum rasieren. Aber insgesamt wirklich ansprechend.
Das Negative: auf dem Zimmer keine Kaffeemaschine und auch kein complimentary water. Geht bei so einem Hotel eigentlich garnicht.
Zur Abwertung hat aber das Personal geführt: total desinteressiert, nicht hilfsbereit, muffelig, you Name it. Offensichtlich hat man alle gezwungen, in dem Hotel zu arbeiten. Management scheint es auch nicht zu geben, das einmal für etwas Kundenorientierung sorgt. So ein schlechtes Personal haben wir in den vielen Hotels, in denen wir in New York bisher waren, noch nie erlebt. Schade, denn ansonsten ist das Haus schon empfehlenswert.

title: The hotel everage is ok but the room is really small for the price and the heating incredibly noisy. Food price to high
text: The hotel everage is ok but the room is really small for the price and the heating incredibly noisy. Food price to high at all for sureNot so comfortable in total the room but to small nosy and cold.The lobby condition is nice but the rest everage

title: Nice decor, great view from room
text: Nice lobby, quick check in.   Great views from room.   Only problems were the shower didn’t drain quickly.  Stood in 2 inches of water.   Bar closed at 11 pm on Saturday night.   That was unexpected.   Good location.

title: Good hotel, but needs some improvements
text: This hotel location is good for exploring NYC. The decor is nice, however it would benefit from improvements such as tea and coffee making facilities. The reception area is understaffed especially at peak hours. The cleaniness was impeccable and the restaurant had a great menu. Overall experience good, but I wont be coming back.

title: Can’t recommend this hotel, the service attitude is really poor
text: We had some problems during our trip with the room and during check-out. On the second day we needed to change the room, since the problems was not fixed although we reported twice to the reception.During check-out we noticed that the price for the room was charged twice. We talked to the manager as well and during this time (45 minutes) our driver was waiting outside to take us to the airport. This caused stress of missing our flight as well. The manager could not solve the problem regarding the payment, but promised the other transaction to be cancelled during the same day and the money to be seen on the other card immediately. Now, 3 days later the money is charged from one card and still on hold on another. Due to our experience with the hotel and its staff we can not recommend it to anyone. The service was unprofessional and they did not apologize even once.

title: Great stay at Nomo
text: We stay four nights or new year's eve at Nomo Hotel.We have enjoy our stay thanks to the staff and services !Room was very clean lovely decorated but the space was too short and the bathroom too close of the bedroom. Moreover, Toilets are in the bathroom with no real door to stop noise, not so romantic for a couple stay.The air conditionning is very noisy

title: Good Soho location, small rooms
text:
The Nomo Soho has a beautiful entrance and great Soho location. The rooms and bathrooms, while clean and modern with a very comfortable bed, were quite small.
We had a room on the 7th floor so there was some street noise at night while trying to sleep. We had drinks in the bar which was pretty, but cocktails were expensive. We didn't try the restaurant.
My only complaint would be the $35 per night "property fee". This entitles you to free coffee and a newspaper in the lobby, use of the dark and outdated basement fitness room and a cell phone to use which I must say is a perk for foreign visitors but was of no use to me.
Overall we had a nice stay, but I'm not sure if I would go back.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: I would happily say its one of the most beautiful hotels in NYC, however the service and front desk staff were so below par, it really lets down the hotel and the overall experience. My room was not cleaned everyday so I had to chase the front desk several times.

title: SoHo nyc
text: Very nice hotel. Staff not responsive to requests. I asked for replacement light bulbs & never got them in 4 days! Didn’t have wash cloths. Housekeeping left door open. Asked for extra bath gel. Didn’t get it.

title: Great facilities and location
text: Great location in Soho. Room was modern and clean and came with own mobile device so that we could navigate around the city without using our own mobile data. Bed was comfortable. TV in room on the wall opposite bed had a good range of channels.

title: Nice hotel but very bad staff
text: Clean ? Yes  but very small rooms. They dont give what they promise. You booked for at least level 12 for the vieuw but you get 10. Staff is terrible and the food and drinks over priced. Location hotel perfect but for that money ? TAke a other hotel where you can move in youre room

title: Very clean, comfortable and luxurious
text: We had a great time. Rooms were comfy, the view is spectacular. Clean and neat immaculate. I would recommend getting one of their bigger rooms, since the price difference is negligible, but the comfort is much much higher. Lots of little surprises in the mini fridge and around. Totally worth the money for the most romantic  weekend getaway!

title: Love the Area - Nice Hotel
text: The food is good in the restaurant.  We did our first night as we were exhausted after a long journey.  Service was OK not great.     We were not encouraged to try ... which was surprising.  I'd of thought you'd want us to try.

title: Friends trip NYC 🎄
text: Wanted to stay in another part of the city, so we chose SoHo. Cute little boutique hotel. Rooms quite small, but clean. Nice Molton Brown toiletries. Happy that window opened a tad...nice bar & restaurant. Close to cute SoHo shopping, Little Italy, etc. Had one issue involving accessing the Wifi & was incorrectly charged for previous guests minibar tab, but was reversed.

title: Funky Boutique Hotel AND a great location
text: Absolutely LOVED our stay here, the truly funky hotel has great service, super clean and lovely rooms. The Concierge helped us with all our dinner reservations and managed even the impossible ones!!! All staff were efficient and helpful. We will definitely be back!!!

title: No Mo more
text: No Mo SoHo was highly recommended...I was disappointed in this Hotel. Hotel lobby is like a waiting area for Uber. Not formal and doesn’t give any direction to wether people are coming or going. Our King Suite was a tiny two rooms kinda. The sofa was the size of a doll house sofa. Bathroom was not a bathroom by any means. Toilst basically sits on the floor. Poor quality for the clients they want to attract and the rooms do not warrant the expense. There are many other choices in the city that are more comfortable and convenient. Location is basic in China Town......

title: Excellent location and very clean
text: I came to NYC with a friend for a girls weekend and shopping getaway. I was beyond pleased with the accommodations and the cleanliness of the hotel, rooms, and bathrooms. The restaurant was excellent for brunch and the location of the hotel is the best in the city. Everything from shopping to restaurants was walkable and so convenient. No need to ever leave SOHO! Will be the only place I stay from now on!

title: Stay Away! horrible!
text: Arrived at hotel after 21 hour trip from Asia at 9pm. Room wasnt ready. Hotel manager said only thing he could do was down grade my room and change next day since he wasnt authorized to upgrade ( wich was available). Said I was leaving he responded he couldnt care less. It was a 6 night stay overall. Very poor customer service. That was all after check in on wich they blocked the full amount of my stay on my card. I left to other hotel. The amount blocked on card was only released it after the whole six days and several calls from me ( on wich financial girl hang up on me twice) and 2 visits to the hotel because they “didnt know how to do it.” I didnt even stay there!!! thank god I didnt need the limit on card for the rest of my trip. horrible experience. It was my first time there because my usuals were full. never again. plenty of great options near by. try 11 howard or sixty soho. Both with great service.

title: Would stay again
text: Ride from airport was set up for us by hotel driver was prompt and we didn’t have to wait when arrived our room wasn’t ready but our luggage was stored for us. Rooms was beautiful and beds comfortable and clean. When arrived back luggage was delivered to our room. Subways very close able to walk to daily rained and was given an umbrella to use by hotel since we didn’t have one upon check out luggage was again stored while we exploded waiting to go back to airport which ride was also set up again would definitely stay again

title: Paper thin walls!!!
text: Paper thin walls!!! You can hear everything from next door. Reported this to the hotel manager but was told that this was a problem with the hotel and that nothing could be done about it. Room service to room a night time was very long.

title: Gem in Soho
text: This beautiful, newly renovated hotel is a gem! The king suite is spacious and the views are amazing. The bathroom is large, sleek, and bright! The people that work there are kind and super accommodating! I highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure. The location is terrific for shopping and dining. Forget midtown and the traffic and noise. I will be staying here in the future. You should too!!!!

title: perfect stay in soho
text: I liked the good position, my large room, the excellent cleanliness and the special equipment like the mobile phone and the Portable Battery for the guest stay. The staff was Always ready to help us, they organized an excellent private transfer to jfk in the early morning for Niagara, and they held our luggage for the entire day for free.

title: NoMo SoHO not again
text: The hotel entrance and lobby are beautiful. I'm assuming rooms are slowly being renovated to match the main decor. We had queen suite and one of the doors locks were broken, the tv randomly changes channels and the bathroom had hair in shower.  Hotel staff was hit or miss on how helpful/polite they were. The lobby bar didn't open until 6 pm and so there was no where to have a drink before heading out for dinner and show because the other option was the restaurant and the host was rude and dismissive because we didn't have a reservation. Overall for the room rate I would have stayed at a chain hotel instead.

title: Horrible customer service, nickel and dime chargers, good location
text: Good location, horrible customer service.  Should have known before coming, as I read very bad reviews.  Don’t insult my intelligence by trying to milk me every morning for $25 (amenity fee) coffee in addition to my $400/night room fee.  I’ll be staying elsewhere on my future business trips to NYC.

title: Nice boutique hotel
text:
A very nice, clean hotel.  Friendly staff.  Conveniently located for our visit to Manhattan.  No complaints.  

Their restaurant side could take pointers from the hotel side.  Hotel side was fantastic while not so much for the restaurant

title: ABSOLUTELY UNFORGETTABLE! WE LOVED IT!
text: This hotel and their staff is increible. It's very hip, has very good facilities and the ammenities are excellent! The staff does everything they can - they helped to plan and structure my proposal to my now fiancée, and they even went out to get flowers, balloons etc. They upgraded us to their best room for an unforgettable stay. I can not recommend this hotel enough. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous and the services provided are top notch! I have NEVER in my life stayed in a hotel like this, and this place will forever have a special spot in my heart. I RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL FOR EVERYONE! ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

title: Fabulous Customer Service
text:
Without question, the exemplary customer service by Jeffrey at the Front Desk was "the best ever".  

Jeffrey went out of his way to help us with directions, restaurant recommendations, transportation suggestions and much more.

Thank you!

title: Cool Soho Hotel
text: Nice, trendy, clean hotel - right in the heart of soho. Front desk staff was friendly/helpful, and the morning complimentary coffee in the lobby was a nice touch! The only downside was the thin hotel room doors - you could hear everythingggg going on in the hallway (doors closing, housekeeping moving around, people talking/coughing/etc.).

title: Amazing hotel
text: This hotel is our go to when we stay in NYC. It’s the beat! Great service, super clean, close to great shopping, easy access to the Holland tunnel, smells amazing and comfy and cozy room. Love it and we’ll be back!

title: Love it
text: I had a great stay at Nomo, such a great atmosphere, awesome food and everyone is super friendly! Especially Jeff who works at the front! He made sure my stay was perfect, he’s very professional and very friendly!  Can’t wait to come back!

title: Arsty, cool, upscale
text: Nice, very cool hotel. Great local. Upscale, artsy and stylish. Good service. Joss stored our bags for us and was really helpful and friendly. Gave us an early check in, which made it super convenient because we got there earlier than planned.

title: LOVED THIS HOTEL!!!
text:
My husband and I were thrilled with our first stay at NOMO SOHO for many reasons:

1.  Lovely hotel - from the gorgeous entryway on Crosby to the lobby and the modern rooms

2.  Great location at the edge of SoHo and NoLiTa, which to me are the best areas of NYC by far.  If looking for shopping, dinner and drinks, you really don't have to leave about a 1/2 mile area to get everything you could want.

3.  Quiet room - I was a little worried because I was on the 10th floor (hotel has 24 or 25 floors) and thought I'd be able to hear NYC noises as you do in most hotels there (I am a super light sleeper).  I heard nothing at all.  It does help that Crosby is one of the quieter streets in the area, but I also feel they spent money on soundproofing.

4.  In house reservations employee (maybe the mgr?) Victoria.  She is so nice.  I changed my rate when it went lower than the amount I had booked and then later upgraded my room type as I wanted a larger room.  She couldn't have been nicer to assist each time.  

We stayed in a king suite which is very nice and good sized for NYC.  It has a door between the bedroom and living room that you can pull shut if needed.  NOMO will definitely be the hotel I choose for all future NYC stays due to all of the above.  

My only (minor) suggestions for improvement to the hotel are that lighting is needed in the living room portion of the King Suite.  There were no lights around the couch that I could find at all.  If you wanted to read there at night, you could not.

When I checked in and out, there was only one employee at the front desk and I had a 6-10 min wait both times.  There are two computers and I feel like two people should be working at all times so guests don't have to wait long. 

Hotel has a nice on-site gym but it was pretty hot in there.  When I went there were prob 4 ppl working out in the room so maybe that's why it was hot, but I'd say it was prob 75 degrees or more in there.  

Even with the above minor issues, for me it was a 5 star experience.  Fabulous choice in NYC!

title: Location Location Location - SoHo Rocks!
text: Great hotel in the heart of SoHo - great access to shopping, dining, subway and NYC life.  Restaurant and bar were great; contemporary and spacious hotel room.  Great view of city - especially local rooftops.  No bath tub, and my TV was possessed... couldn't stay fixed on one channel - otherwise would have rated a 5.  Loved that I could open my window to fresh autumn air.

title: A pearl in the Soho's heart
text: Very nice and cool place to stay, you can do shoppings or go walking to different restaurants and bars. It's not crowded as middle or upper town, so you can enjoy your visit without being bored. The lobby of the hotel smells a particular perfum, it is so good! I'll never forget it.

title: Location is A+
text:
Free smart phone devices to navigate the town or the amenities and perks the hotel offers.  You can take pictures, use apps with free wifi and international calling. I never used it but it's a novel idea.  
Great restaurant...but expensive as high end NYC restaurants usually are. 

A puddle of dog pee was waiting for me at the concierge as I approached...They welcome dogs which is fine with me.  I'm a dog person pee and all. 

The rooms are clean, modern and bright.  
The best view I've ever had in NYC. We were on 24th floor.  I traveled with my 13 year old son who was quite impressed with the "hippness" of the hotel.  Modern which I love.  I reserved the room that had an additional living space so we (mom and son) could have a little more privacy than just a standard micro-room that NYC usually offers. The location is on a quite street just a short walk to all the action. Also, the Canal Street Subway was easy to navigate and we could get anywhere we wanted to go.  I LOVED this hotel.  I would visit again.

title: Great place!
text: The room was very nice and clean, well decorated. The service was also very good. The concierge was extremely nice and helpful. The restaurant was lovely and the food was excellent.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone with upscale taste.

title: Amazing location and vibe
text: The Nomo Soho is an amazing hotel in Soho NYC. Steps away from amazing shopping, great restaurants and lounges. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quick shopping getaway. Love love love this hotel!

title: Great Customer Service!
text: Clean and great customer service! Amazing staff that was so helpful! Rooms were clean and well furnished. Great location as well- convenient to shopping and subways. Staff also helped me get a cab at the last minute for a trip to the airport. Very considerate and helpful!

title: Amazing Boutique hotel - exactly what you expect in Soho - doesn't disappoint!
text:
Picture the perfect New York Soho experience and you'll see this hidden Gem!  The location is convenient to all New York has to offer with easy walking distance to Chinatown, World Trade Center Museum, plethora of shopping, etc.  

You walk through this amazing tunnel of greenery (okay maybe not in the winter but I bet it's beautiful then too) as you enter the hotel - great sense of arrival.  Everyone is so warm and welcoming - I don't think I passed one employee that didn't say hello and ask me how I was doing or if I needed assistance.

The guest room is fresh and inviting and has all you need for your NY adventure - and plenty of hangers... my clothes thank you for that.

I ate dinner in the hotel restaurant with some friends from town.  The ambiance is really nice and service was great.  The menu has just enough options to satistisfy any pallet and is sensative to all the dietary restrictions out there now.  One of my friends is on the Kelo diet and had no problem finding a lot of things to enjoy.  Some of my favorite appetizers were the beets and the calamari.  Yummy!  For dinner we each had something different so we could taste as much as possible.  My salmon was cooked perfectly and was delish!  My friend ordered his steak medium rare and it was perfectly cooked.  Not sure which one I liked the best but can certainly recommend the steak, pork and salmon.
We shared the apple crisp, which I understand they have their own pastry chef which is always nice.  It was the perfect cap to a wonderful dinner.

 I ordered room service, by the card prefilled out.  I noted I wanted breakfast between 8a - 8:15a.  Promptly at 8am, I get knock on the door.  Breakfast was well prepared.

Today will be a day of shopping, taking advantage of all their partnerships with local shops.  Great added discounts.  I mean if you are going to shop and then save some money too - added bonus.  

Unfortunately I'm only staying one night, next time I will stay longer and I'll look no further than the Nomo Soho.

title: Love the location
text: Our room overlooked Crosby St. At night we could see the beautifully lit entrance and glass ceiling of the restaurant below. We had a great view of the skyline including the top of the One World Trade Tower. The hotel is within walking distance of great shopping and dining  in the SoHo district.

title: Boutique hotel in Lower Manhattan
text: Charming little hotel near Soho in NYC.  The rooms are small but very comfortable, and the hotel is very quiet at night.  There is a lively restaurant and bar.  The restaurant has a limited menu and the food is good, but not outstanding.  The staff is very friendly and service is excellent.  The location is convenient to restaurants, tours and interesting things to do.

title: Perfect location to explore Soho and surroundings
text: Booked the Nomo after the usual careful consideration and research.The hotel is great, perfect location, nicely laid out and great rooms - we stayed in a Queen Suite as needed the extra room for our 2yr old toddler. On arrival the crib was already laid out and we were whisked up the the 24th floor in under 5 minutes from checking in - a record for NYC in our experience :)With most buildings in Soho being low, the views from our room were pretty special and something we appreciated, not least our son who loved pointing out various things.In all we loved our stay and were so pleased we opted for the hotel - the staff we brilliant and could not have been more accommodating.

title: The Only Place I Stay in when I'm in NYC!
text: Perfectly located in trendy SoHo close to great shops, restaurants and cafes.  Everything is within walking distance. Loved our corner room with great city views...even the shower had beautiful skyline views!

title: Great Location Hip Cool Hotel
text: This was our second time staying at the Nomo Soho. It's a perfect location if you are staying in Soho. It's near all the great restaurants and shops . The rooms are clean and decent with great views. The hotel overall is nice however, they could use some updating in certain areas. The restrooms in the lobby are dingy. For a hip modern hotel the restrooms need updating to match the rest of the hotel.

title: Soho happy at NoMo Soho
text: Other than the noisey (caused by streets below the 17th floor) room, my adult daughter and I enjoyed everything about our stay at this darling hotel. The checkin was easy-Jose stores our bags so we could explore the city until our room was ready. We loved the decor, but EVERYONE lives the decor so people swarm this location, particularly in the evening to photograph themselves there. Mamasitas in the lounge were fabulous. Staff was wonderful. We will return

title: Accogliente e grazioso hotel di design.
text: In 4 amiche abbiamo optato per 1 camera con 2 letti matrimoniali. Ben arredato, con ottima biancheria, pulizia ok.  La camera poco spaziosa però x 4 persone. Molto piacevole la sala colazione-ristorante con copertura trasparente e tanto verde. Zona ok ma, a piedi, abbastanza distante da Central Park e dintorni. Non abbiamo usufruito nè di colazione ( circa $30 cad. )  nè di ristorante interni preferendo altri locali consigliati in zona. La sera rientrate dopo cena senza avvertire alcun timore.

title: Love this place, What a view!
text: I have stayed here a few times alone and with my daughter. The windows are amazing, even in the shower - especially in the corner room on a high floor. I love the blue carpet and mirrors throughout the building, and the beds are super comfortable. Crosby St. provides a quiet little nook for this oasis, nice to escape the hustle and bustle of some busier streets.

title: Katastrofalt
text:
Det er mit andet besøg på NoMo SoHo og jeg bookede det igen grundet beliggenheden, som nærmest ikke fås bedre, hvis du ønsker at bo i området. 

Andre gode ting der er værd at bemærke er deres gode senge og hvis du er heldig, så får du et badeværelse med vindue til smukke NYC. Rengøringskvaliteten er høj, men det undrede os, at vi hver eftermiddag skulle henvende os i receptionen for at få et ekstra håndklæde. Vi boede på hotellet i 7 nætter og det lykkedes dem ikke en eneste gang at give os håndklæder til 3 personer, som værelset passede til og som reservationen var lavet til. Vores toilet løb over en aften, hvor vi måtte bruge alle vores håndklæder til gulvet, så vandet ikke løb ud på gulvtæppet. Da vi kom retur til værelset var toilettet ordnet, men samtlige håndklæder lå drivvåde på vores gulv. Ikke super imponerende. 

Der er generelt ikke højt serviceniveau i NYC, men NoMo SoHo slår alle rekorder for virkelig elendig service. Jeg kontaktede hotellets concierge inden ankomst for at få hjælp til at booke bord på en restaurant samt at booke transfer fra JFK til hotellet. Jeg har i alt sendt 12 mails til hotellet, jeg har brugt 3 forskellige e-mails som jeg har fundet på deres hjemmeside, jeg har sendt dem en besked på facebook og de svarede på en mail med noget ubrugeligt info, hvorefter jeg aldrig hørte mere. 

Personalet, som gælder deres “dørmænd”, receptionister og ansatte i deres bar og restaurant er så åbenlyst ligeglade med deres job, så det nærmest er komisk. Ingen hilser, ingen anerkender din tilstedeværelse når du henvender dig og de står i grupper med deres telefoner, colaer og hænger, og når man så har brug for deres hjælp, så går der i hvert fald 5-10 sekunder før de reagerer og det virker mest af alt som om at de tænker: “Måske går hun igen”. Eller når man henvender sig til restaurantens seater og spørger på et bord, som de skriver på et skilt at man skal og han svarer siger: “First to come, first to serve”, hvorefter man er overladt til sig selv. 

Det sidste de har lyst til er tydeligvis at yde service og man kan undre sig over, at de ikke finder et andet arbejde.

De løb i øvrigt tør for tonics i hotellets bar. Hvordan kan det ske i byen der aldrig sover og hvorfor smuttede en af de mange mange ansatte, som i øvrigt bare stod og hang ikke ud og købte nogle?

title: Substance is lacking, pretentious
text:
We come to NYC every 2-3 months and try different hotels.  The location of Nomo seemed interesting, so we booked a premium king room on the top floor- we always go "high" to try to mitigate street noise.  First, their lobby is too busy being "hip" and short on staff and organization.  Check in was a mess.   Two small desks, with the room key machine balanced on books, two people, and 30 guests in the lobby in various stages of check in, waiting for rooms to be ready, etc.  There is more space devoted to art and lounge chairs than there is to staff to make things move along.

Our room was not ready, so we went to the restaurant bar.   It is again trying too hard to be SoHo edgy and not enough focus on the details.  The bar top has holes peeling in the surface- when the bartender poured my glass of wine and I went to reach for it, my shirt sleeve caught in one of the "potholes" on the bar surface and ripped a small hole!  

The rooms are, frankly, misleading.  We have a premium king- which on line says has "a full size work desk" and a "sitting area".   The desk is a tiny alcove built in- my shoulders almost touch both sides of the wall!   The "sitting area" is two small arm chairs separated by a tiny table, which I can touch while laying in bed.   If my wife sits in the chair, I have to step over her to walk by!   As noted, we always ask for top floor rooms for noise- but that is no help.   However this is built, the street noise on the top floor is clearly audible.

Other little things just don't make sense.  For example, the thermostat for the room is very oddly located- a foot above eye level (I am nearly 6 feet tall) and on the wall above the "sitting area" chairs- so you cannot read it without standing on the chair!  Very poor design- should be over the "desk" (read, cubby).  

Perhaps the most disappointing thing is the vibe of the place.  We thought it would be modern, SoHo energetic, but upscale and tasteful.  Instead- it is pretentious and somewhat crass.   There was a buyout of the restaurant our first night.  When we returned from the theater, 5-6 younger men were outside, smoking cigars, one vomiting, laughing and cursing loudly and clearly beyond drunk.  We tried to walk past but they just staggered into us, talking loudly, and heading back to the lobby.   It was very frat house-esque.   The restaurant is open to the lobby, so when we entered the party was in full swing with more drunken idiots staggering around in $1000 outfits.  Note- money does not equate with class.   That really summarizes this property.  It is no inexpensive, tries to be upscale- but is more just a place for self important people to feel self important.  There are too many nicer hotels in NY to deal with this.  If you want something not far away but far more upscale, try the Dominick or the Crosby.

title: Like sleeping at a frat house
text: After 25 years, we moved out of NYC a year ago and went back for a family celebration. We thought it would be nice to stay in Soho for a change from our usual hotel - big mistake.  While the outside is very pretty and we had a great view from our room - it was tiny. We had our children with us and when we checked in at 2 pm the floor already reeked of cigarettes and pot and it only got worse as the night wore on. I am no prude but at 5 am there were people sitting outside our room door talking, smoking and drinking. My daughter who is 10 actually poked her head out to ask them to be quiet and they told her to "F*#% Off". Nice clientelle.  In the morning every other door had empty bottles outside. When we went to let the manager know at check out the first person we spoke to just shrugged her shoulders and did not care and made no attempt to tell her superior. I waited and waited for him and he stayed on the phone on what appeared to be a personal call until I left. This may have been a nice hotel at one point but it is obviously now a place where a group of people rent a room to party for the night. We may as well have stayed at a no-tell motel by LaGuardia.

title: Séjour raté
text:
Du début jusqu’à la fin, 4 nuits au total, un séjour décevant, limite désobligeant concernant le personnel.
Accueil minable, nous avons dû attendre 1 h avant que la chambre soit prête, alors que le Check in devait se faire à 15h. Personne ne nous a tenu informés de l‘évolution, donc nous sommes restés dans le lobby avec deux enfants sur-fatigués après 24h de voyage. 
Revenant après la première sortie, pas de lit préparé pour les petits (alors que ça a été demandé), pas de serviettes pour les enfants. Le personnel à l‘accueil est très très désagréable (avec tout le monde) et non efficace. Mais jeune et branché:-)
Le lendemain, les mauvaises surprises se multiplient... bruyant la nuit, douche minuscule, pas de réelle salle de bains, fenêtre non isolée et froid entrant,  pas de thé et café dans la chambre! 
Pour finir, nous devons dire que la literie est très bonne et l‘hotel très bien
situé. 
Mais pour passer un bon séjour, il faut se sentir bien dans l‘hôtel ou l‘on se trouve. Ici, nous avions l‘impression de déranger et de ne pas correspondre au client habituel... à plus de 500€ la nuit dans une Suite (!!!) et regardez les images de salle de bain (c‘est le seul lavabo de la suite, les plinthes sont moisies et le coin douche est directement situé derrière l’importe d‘entrée), c‘est franchement abusé.

title: Dårlig service, men perfekt beliggenhed
text:
Personalet er selv efter NY standarder både uhøflige, overfladiske og arrogante. De smiler ikke, står og hygger sig indbyrdes i grupper eller har hovederne begravet i deres telefoner. Der er dørmænd, men de holder/åbner ikke dørene. Første nat får vi ingen søvn pga. ekstremt meget støj fra naboværelset (vi er tildelt connection room). Vi er i kontakt med receptionen 3 gange i løbet af natten. De lover os et nyt værelse dagen efter, men da vi sov da de skulle flytte vores bagage, trak de i land igen da vi henvendte os i receptionen igen, igen. Dette krævede endnu en diskussion med en receptionist som intet anede om noget. 
Værelserne er dejlige, rengøringsniveauet er højt og pigerne i Housekeeping er meget smilende. Maden er ok, men serveret af sure tjenere.

title: Outstanding
text: This is my second visit to this hotel and  recommend l highly. By NYC standards the rooms are reasonably sized. The styling of the whole hotel is wonderful and that lovely smell when you walk in has to be smelt to be believe.  The whole vibe of the hotel is wonderful. It’s close to Little Italy, Chinatown and Soho and a block from the Canal St subway which can get you anywhere in Manhattan within 15 minutes.  We’ll be back. Well done all round.

title: Good, but a few things miss the mark
text:
Stayed here Sunday - Thursday for work. While the room was adequate size (by nyc standards) and clean a few things missed the mark given the price of the room and the additional daily room charges. As an example I would have liked a coffee machine in my room rather than the lobby coffee and at $25 a day I kind of think they could and should do this. 

For some reason I had the worst nights sleep there. It wasn’t down to the bed and the noise outside was nothing more than any other nyc hotel. I can only think it was something to do with the A/C

The communal areas were functional but not sure why a whole area was dedicated to foosball. The bar/dining room was a great area but hardly worked well combining both given you are not permitted to take drinks outside. 

All in all it was a very nice hotel, but for the money they charge I would have expected more. Unsure if I’d stay there again.

title: Best location is soho
text:
Hotel stay was perfect...cool luxury and vibe 
Room with excellent views and decor... floor to ceiling windows with great views and decor
Best location in the city..hotel is in the heart of the soho neighborhood
Solid restaurant downstairsk... food was good as  was service 
Excellent value...u get your money's worth 
Good service...exceptional for solo traveler

title: Charming hotel in a great location
text: We stayed at the hotel for 8 nights. The hotel is charming, new, clean, well equipped and beautifully decorated. A stunning entrance that is an attraction for passersby. A large sitting area is shaded and open to the wide front of the hotel. Beautiful rooms, too small. Room cleaning is required by removing cups and changing towels. The excellent soaps weren’t enough. Service is usually good. The most fun area to live in New York. I will no doubt choose him again and recommend him.

title: Decadente. Fuja!
text:
Já tínhamos ficado antes no NoMo SoHo e adorado. Voltar foi uma escolha fácil. 

Mas desta vez encontramos um hotel decadente, com staff grosseiro e pouco atencioso. 

Alguns exemplos:

1. Nas 6 noites que ficamos, tivemos que pedir mais toalhas todos os dias. Sempre tinha uma toalha a menos.

2. Pedi gelo a recepção 2 vezes, e esperei mais de 1 hora para recebê-lo. 

3. Em uma noite chuvosa, pedimos guarda-chuvas emprestados. O funcionário emprestou um com muita má vontade e ainda disse rispidamente: Não deixe de devolver! E a cara dele quando pedimos mais um foi memorável!

4. E, no final, zero de tolerância no horário do check-out. Desci cedo para pedir, a funcionária nem se deu ao trabalho de perguntar o número do meu quarto. Disse não. Viajo 3x ao ano, fico em hotéis melhores e piores que esse, os voos de volta para o Brasil são sempre à noite e nunca tinha passado por isso. Sempre conseguimos pelo menos 1 h de tolerância. 

De bom somente a localização. Mas existem outras opções na região. 

A sensação é que é um favor para o hotel hospedar você!

Fuja!

title: RAD Boutique Hotel
text: First time to New York with my girlfriends and after staying in Time Square then Manhattan we decided to head over to Soho and stay a few nights there. Absolutely love this hotel. So very cool. The staff are re so friendly and helpful. the room itself was quite small but very cute, suited the 2 of us and then our 3rd friend met us there on the last night before we checked out and the hotel staff were kind enough to let her stay at no extra charge. Great location, walked outside and ran straight into Jake Gyllenhaal. I recommend trying out their bar/restaurant, food was really good and the bar staff made awesome cocktails. Very happy and would stay here again.

title: Great Hotel but.............
text:
So we booked this hotel mainly due to its location and the fact it had floor to ceiling windows. We booked a king suite for 5 nights and was pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. The floor to ceiling windows have us fantastic views of NY. Even the shower had the same windows. Bed was comfortable with nice linen. 
Points on the rest of the hotel. The lobby area is really small and gets quite crowded and the entrance to the hotel restaurant is there also and on Friday -Sunday evening it was packed with groups not staying st the hotel so unless you pre book a table you will have a long wait to get in even as a hotel guest. There are no tea or coffee facilities in the room but you can come down between 6-10 to get one. No juice or cold drinks are included in your stay. I found this to be very off putting at over $600 a night for our room. The little interaction that I had with the staff could have been more friendly. Mini bar prices are extortionate as in most hotels! Also there is a $25 charge per room per night (explained prior to booking) which covers your use of the gym, a newspaper, internet access ( basic) and yes it covers the cost of your Tea and Coffee in the morning if you want to get dressed and come and get one.
Overall it’s in a great location and the room was great but the amenities, staff and extra charges for a coffee in the morning really let this place down. Would I book again?? Probably due to location but I will definitely look at what other hotels in the area offer before I did.

title: Anniversary trip
text: Loved this hotel. Room was beautiful, clean and the views outstanding! Entry way, lobby and restaurant all stunning. Staff friendly and accommodating. Workout facility clean and well maintained. We will stay here again!

title: Bom hotel
text: O hotel tem muito charme, o lobby é bem interessante e sempre perfumado. Creio que o valor das diárias acaba sendo elevado pelas taxas adicionais, tivemos problemas com as janelas do quarto e precisamos ser trocados, fora isso foi uma ótima experiência, pois o quarto tem muito espaço e tem uma decoração bem legal.

title: Nomo soho suite
text: Amazing location , Hotel for young people not so much demanding , rooms are very little, the suite is not big at all and the furniture is too big for it, in one of the couches you cannot seat , there is a tv on the top of it but everything flows in a nice way !!

title: Would not recommend. NOT W-type hotel.
text:
Really.
.
.
.
So disappointed with this hotel. $600/night and we get view of a parking lot?

No thank you.

Booked a package two rooms with breakfast. Showed up to checkin we are told only continental breakfast included no regular breakfast or brunch. Had to negotiate breakfast lmfao.

Shame on you. I just cancelled 2 remaining nights....just booked W Time Square ....better view n cheaper. Adios amigos. General manager needs to know whats going on.

title: A beautiful Soho hotel
text:
Nomo Soho was an excellent experience! Here's why:

1) Location: It's in Soho, a trendy neighborhood, close to several major subway stops. It's two blocks from my favorite breakfast spot (Kam Hing Coffee Shop in Chinatown making fresh sponge cake every morning). If you're a runner, it's a short jog to a long running path along the Hudson River. 

2) Space: It's beautiful. It's cool. Every space is beautifully designed from the grand entrance to the lobby to the rooms (think lots of blue for the room).

3) Rooms: For NYC, they felt more spacious. The bathrooms are large with a well pressured shower and enough storage for all your things.

4) Staff: Despite having a more pretentious brand, they come across friendly.

5) Price: For as nice as it is, they could up their price more. It's reasonable and you can always find a deal online.

I'd stay here again if it was just me and/or my wife and I in NYC. A baby may feel out of place.

title: NO MATA, REGULAR!
text: Normalmente en Nueva York vamos al hotel The Dominick pero esta vez me hablaron del Nomo Soho y reservé a través de Booking, llegamos de un vuelo nocturno desde Los Angeles y primer problema, no aceptan la tarjeta de débito con la que hice la reserva, les doy otra de crédito de empresa pero como no sale mi nombre tampoco, en plena época digital y aún hay que pasar la tarjeta por la banda magnética!! La chica no colaboraba nada, muy borde! Al final lo hice con una de mi otra empresa pero no me interesaba usarla pero era esto o no tener reserva!! Hasta las tres no pudímos ducharnos y cambiarnos, la habitación normal no sobraba nada pero tampoco faltaba. Era la semana de la fashion Week y todo lleno de gente guapa, todo muy moderno pero poca atención a los clientes normales. Otra alegría!! me llega el cargo de la tarjeta y hay 500 dolares mas de cargo y ne dicen que me los devuelven al hacer el check-out. Yo no estoy contento, no digo que sea malo pero no creo que vuelva!

title: Lovely setting, horrible food
text: Airport quality food in spite of a beautiful setting. They don't even bother to scoop your cream cheese out of the plastic Philadelphia packet. Not a particularly friendly lobby staff. One member suspiciously (not remotely pleasantly) asked my room number before allowing me to borrow an umbrella to walk out in the pouring rain. He didn't even write it down. Just a friendly, "are you staying with us, miss?" would have done the job.

title: Security issue
text: I was in bed with do not disturb sign and someone oppened the door with a room keyIt was a hotel employeeI did not receive any apology or explanationThe rest of the experience was satisfactory and would go back

title: Vergognosi. Indebito addebito su carta di credito
text:
Nonostante la cancellazione della prenotazione ampiamente nei termini contrattuali della cancellazione gratuita, l'hotel mia ha addebitato una camera al prezzo di circa 500 euro.
Sono stato costretto a richiedere il disconoscimento dell'addebito ad Amex Platino.
Probabilmente solo un errore, ma se fosse dolo sarebbe un reato.
Diffidate di questo hotel.

title: Quaint Hotel in Soho
text: I really liked this hotel as it is quaint, slightly off the beaten track and has really nice modern rooms. It has a small gym facility - it has power showers in the rooms. On the downside the Wifi can be hit and miss and the aircon humming very noisy

title: bad personal service, awfull attitude, no help
text: I already wrote the whole review, im a hotel reviewer, you can check it in my websites. The service was bad, front desk a disaster and the hotel was old, not like it was 1 year ago. The attention and the attitud of the staff was extremely bad and they never offer help or anything.

title: Poor experience
text:
Was staying in the hotel between septembre 22-28. (under the name Tal Teperberg) 

The location was great; 
Sadly, it was the only good thing in our experience.

The room was dirty, very poorly decorated
Less than minimum facilites. 
-No coffee in the room
-We had to pay ten dollars for a bottle of water. 
-The gym was very poor

On the last day, they charged us 30$ extra per day, when we asked what was the pay for, we were told that we pay for wifi, news paper and gym room. 

A total payment of 180usd for nothing. 

In 2018 we pay 500 usd per night and in addition need to add 180 for wifi? 

I have a travel agency, and I will not recommend my clients such a hotel.

title: Can do better
text: Electronic card to access my room jammed like almost everyday. Food is great, service average, rooms clean and spacious, nice variety of toiletries (loved the molton brown eucalyptus and mint shower gel), fast internet including handy - a mobile phone that guests can use to dial free local and international calls including unlimited use outside the hotel - practical for those staying on business. First time to have to leave a deposit upon check-in what was that all about? especially after having been booked and all payments done before I arrived.

title: Good option but expensive
text:
Great location, walking distance to subway, Broadway, Mulberry St restaurants, Soho shopping and much more. Location is this hotels best feature. 
Trendy and chic type place, funky vibe. Rooms functional - nothing great but everything you need. I thought the rooms were a good size by NYC standards, there was adequate room for two people and luggage. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom also a good size. Everything clean, staff friendly. Like some other hotels this hotel now adds a $25 per day “amenities fee” on top of the room rate - absolutely pathetic, just a way to increase prices. Paying an extra $25 for WiFi on top of the already very high prices here is funny (although noting that all hotels in Manhattan suffer from ridiculously high prices). Also found the room to be noisy - both external noise and the loud air conditioning.
Overall a good stay, great location. Would consider staying again although would recommend shopping around given the high prices.

title: Good experience in great location
text: Excelent experience in a very trendy hotel in Soho. Subway nearby and good shopping. And if Nome Kitchen is not an option there are plenty around. The service could a bit more firefly butbthe rest compensates.

title: First Choice when in Soho
text: I have been staying at the Nomo when I visit NY for a few years now. It's a great location, the service is always great and I am made to feel welcome every time I return. Like all NY hotels the rooms are not huge but best use is made of the space available and it's always great to take a larger room and enjoy the experience more. In some rooms the views are especially good - but all have wonderful floor to ceiling windows that show off New York

title: Hip nice place
text: It is a very nice hotel in the full “hot spot” in SoHo Manhattan. Amazing location nice rooms with view but very small eve if I toke a king executive. Very good bar and kitchen good to have cool meetings in the hot place in town.

title: Excelente experiencia !!!
text:
Nuevamente hemos visitado New York y nuestra elección fué este hotel excelente, no solo por su ubicación si no por la calidez  de atención.
Nuestro agradecimiento para John, Steve; Johnny, Key, Jose; Israel y todo el personal.

title: Crossing my fingers!!!🤞
text:
We haven’t even stayed yet and it doesn’t look good. It took over an hour to reach someone over the phone to confirm our reservation. My phone call was transferred to an “outside party”,🤷‍♀️ “ that handles reservations.” 🤦‍♀️ After a trial of communication efforts she finally was helpful enough to tell me I was speaking to the wrong person and I would have to call the hotel directly. ⁉️⁉️⁉️⁉️⁉️ I did already do that and was transferred🤦‍♀️. Once I was put on hold THREE more times, the phone connection was so poor the woman who answered couldn’t hear me. So, an hour wasted and a confirmation of my reservation was never established.😬
This situation got my curiosity going and I read some reviews. That.... didn’t make me feel better by any stretch. 
Our oldest son lives in nyc. He attended NYU and Columbia. We visit him several times a year but this trip is for my husband and I. ❤️ We always stay at The Crosby Street Hotel, we even had our son’s NYU graduation party there.❤️
Unfortunately, our home away from home  was completely occupied. I am in hopes the NoMo will prove my confirmation phone call I attempted to make was a fluke and the really not so good reviews are wrong.
Cross your fingers for us🤞❗️❗️❗️❗️

title: Marli Moreira
text: The hotel is a beautiful outside but the bathroom is very small the sink is inside the room and the room is the cane small the staff works there is so rude with the money they charge you fine better no go ther.im go to New York a lot.

title: Favourite Hotel in Manhattan
text: This hotel has it all, the location, good coffee and the all important instagrammable moments from the entrance right through to the lobby. The views from the bedrooms are amazing and the Molten Brown toiletries are a nice touch. I honestly can't say a bad word about this place. My family and I are staying here for Christmas and can not wait!

title: Nice views and distant staff
text: Very beautiful rooms with nice views (also from the bathroom - you can see the roofs of Soho while you take a shower!). Very nice breakfast and restaurant area. Service is ok with that kind of staff that hardly smiles and seems to make you a favor just because of talking to you.

title: Was perfect
text:
Good location, easy acess.
The decor is a perfect representacion of soho. Loved the hallway and mirror.
very comfy bed.
Such a cool palce!!

Recepcion, services, bar, very friendly staff.
 All perfect!!

title: Amazing location but poor serive standards.
text: I stayed for business with a colleague. The rooms are small and the sink is in the room, separated from the bathroom.However, it was all very clean.The service is very poor and the staff not very helpful.

title: Super hotel - magique et tout parfait - merci
text: Super hotel niché dans soho- suite au 24 eme étage Avec vue à couper le souffle sur tout New York - silencieux - service de chambre exceptionnel - propre et toujours dispo - mathilde fabella du département sales a veillé tout au long de mon séjour pour qu il soit parfait et ca ete parfait - on est choyé , aux petits soins , cafe a dispo le matin , accessible de beaucoup de metro cet hotel est le meilleur pour visiter et profiter de New York - tout est parfait - super accueil - service et luxe absolu pour un prix abordable Avec services et proximité de partout dans le meilleur quartier de Manhattan - merci beaucoup nous avons adoré l'hôtel et la chambre 2408 du dernier étage qui m'avait été attribué gentiment sur demande - a très vite  et encore merci mathilde

title: Fantastique séjour
text:
Séjour magnifique au Nomo Soho. D'abord, l'hôtel est idéalement placé au plein coeur de Soho dans la très agréabl Crosby Street : une rue typique pavée et comportant de très beaux immeubles. 
Les chambres aux étages élevées offrent une vue exceptionnelle sur tout Manhattan. En effet, l'hôtel qui comporte 25 étages est l'un des bâtiments les plus élevés du quartier. Le service est impeccable.
Nous garderons un souvenir inoubliable de notre séjour.

title: Lovely location, views, trendy but cleanliness and staff issues
text:
This is a beautiful hotel from the outside. It has a stunning lobby. We arrived at the hotel and had 4 large suitcases and was the last hotel in a 6 week trip. The beautiful people who worked there smiled and said welcome but not one person helped with the bags, or noticeably...the person at the door didn't hold it open as I literally stumbled through. It was a bit strange. But we were given our room, no issue. Beautiful views...I mean stunning views!!! It was lovely. However, there were some issues with cleanliness in the room and the more we looked, we found out that it was unacceptable. We had to change room (the hotel were good about it but did argue that it was nothing..it wasn't, te bed sheets were filthy. I took photos of it to show them but they were dismissive.) The room had other cleanliness issues- i.e. really not clean and I see this is echoed in other reviews. We experienced the same. The next room was fine, however. As compensation, we were given free breakfast, which we appreciated. 

At breakfast, the ambience is lovely, a courtyard restaurant. Everyone is taking selfie after selfie beside the fairy lights and of their beautiful breakfasts. However, we lost our server at some point after ordering. Meaning...our coffees and juices never came. We could see our server having a full disagreement with (I am guessing) the restaurant manager out front, some kind of work issue I am guessing. And alas...no coffee or juice...oh well. And no bill came after we asked another server twice. We never saw our server again (but are still expected to tip, hmmmm?)

We asked for late check out at reception (not given and the attitude was a little off- no apology, just "yeah we don't do that") but after we pushed harder (filthy room and not so great breakfast) we were granted a few extra hours which we appreciated. And we were perfectly comfortable in our new room.

The room we were in was lovely and we had a great time in NYC but in general, this place is all about face and little substance. The lobby is full of guests standing to take their Insta photos every second of the day and it is all about trendy but basic hotel service seems to be lacking. The staff were ok but generally not bothered to help us. I come to NY often and don't think I will be back here but the location is just awesome and the coffee shops nearby are great (don't count on getting one at breakfast from the hotel!!) 

But not helping us with bags from the taxi into the lobby, while we were clearly struggling, is a minus point. They MUST clean the rooms more thoroughly and the personality of the hotel was just 'vacant' with regards to warm welcomes and polite chatty conversation that make you feel welcome at their fine establishment. However...one thing. The view was great and we enjoyed it for hours. Pic attached.

title: Great location, friendly staff, some room issues
text: With all the amazing hotels in NYC, especially in SoHo the nomo hits something’s 10/10 and leaves others with much to be desired. The location is amazing, very central and close to subways. The front desk staff, especially Israel, are friendly and helpful. The rooms are very small and bright( wonderful when awake for enjoying the views, not so great when trying to sleep. The bed is comfy, however the pillows are very soft. We had an issue with our duvet being stained and it took calling three times for it to be fixed and even then the next two duvets also had stains/holes. While we enjoyed our overall stay, we would not necessarily chose the nomo on future stays in NY.

title: Expensive and over-rated
text: We were generally delighted with this hotel chosen primarily for its location in Soho. However, on checking out it was a shock to discover a $25 + taxes charge per day for Amenities. This included coffee and flavoured water in the reception area plus use of the Fitness Room. The coffee was rubbish, and the so called Fitness Room was too small. In almost all other Hotels these AMENITIES are included. We had no problem with paying for the room at the rate booked, but I have strong objection to hotels that add these additional charges for services that may or not be used. They are optional and therefore provided at the hotels discretion. I feel strongly enough to take further action but my time is more important and I am sure that's what the management think too. NoMo management - you need to read and listen (I complained at the desk too) to your customer complaints, otherwise, I am sure you'll soon be out of business.

title: Muy buena elección
text: Hotel con una ubicación excelente para visitar Nueva York. Las habitaciones son muy confortables y con buenas vistas en pisos superiores. La limpieza y la atención del personal, excelentes. Nuestra estancia fue muy grata. Repetiría sin duda si vuelvo a la ciudad.

title: Not worth it
text: They downgraded to a worst room when we checked in. The bar outside is very nice, but hotel guests doesn't have any special zone, so if it's full you cannot have breakfast there. The room doesn't have neither toothbrush or toothpast, shaving kit... just soap and body lotion. Also the room was very noisy (and small) and I could hear what was happening outside.

title: Fashion design
text: In uno dei quartieri più chic di New York abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel molto affascinante come design . Minimal , ma con influenze Art Deco , camere total white , con contrasto azzurro , clientela molto giovane e di alto livello . Unico neo stanza non grandissima e lavabo in miniatura , ma addormentarsi e svegliarsi con vista su NY e' impagabile .

title: comodo, moderno, centrale.......
text: poteva essere un hotel eccezionale se non fosse per la rumorosità dell'impianto di condizionamento che disturba durante la notte anche da spento in quanto si sente anche il ronzio fastidioso di quello della camera adiacente (secondo me da sistemare). per il resto un ottimo hotel comodissimo per le molte fermate della metropolitana nelle vicinanze, importante, a pochi metri anche quella che conduce direttamente all'aereoporto senza cambi, centrale, ma in una via secondaria offre un angolo di pace nel caos costante di manhattan. scelta particolare nel posizionamento dei servizi, risultato poi accettabile, ottimo il letto gradissimo e comodissimo. importanti anche i vari disimpegni sia interni che esterni a disposizione degli ospiti dove si può sostare.

title: Nice and convenient design boutique hotel in the very heart of Soho
text: a perfect base for visiting NYC from the Soho perspective, close to a variety of subway stationswe reserved a small suite (bedroom + addtional rom with sofa + 2 bathrooms), which was very convenient for my familyvery good service, expecially in respect of cleanliness

title: 4th time is our last for a while
text: We keep coming back to NOMO Soho for the location and was there this April for 3 nights. We got a king suite with a beautiful room this time and the view is to die for but the age is really starting to show (as noted before,) and we feel there's less and less amenities. The breakfast service is good albeit on the expensive side. (80$ easy for a simple breakfast for 2.) We love the Soho location and are going to NYC in a few weeks, but have chosen a new Thompson hotel for our next stay. We'll come back if they put some money back into NOMO Soho, but for now we'll go elsewhere.

title: A Chic Retreat
text: First of all the front desk staff were always friendly and helpful. I had a room on the 20th floor with great views, the room was of a very good size, decor very modern and bright, very clean and staff were always happy to help make your stay more comfortable.  I asked for a kettle and mug to be brought to my room and this was done very quickly, laundry organised and again they were very quick to collect in the morning and it was back before 7 pm that night. The location in Soho was good, very near Little Italy and within walking of some of the sights, financial district, Brooklyn Bridge, however, I felt it was out of town to the hustle and bustle of New York City so it depends on what you are looking for. The restaurant of the hotel Nomo Kitchen was lovely for dinner as well, in particular, the Rigatoni with a glass of red! I do recommend this hotel, I had absolutely no complaints.

title: Excelente localização
text: O hotel é um charme! Recepção, bar, restaurante, área externa: tudo muito bonito e agradável. A localização é excelente: perto das principais lojas e do metrô. O serviço é ótimo. Tanto o check in quanto o check out foram super rápidos. Também conseguimos comprar ingressos pra Broadway no próprio hotel, no mesmo dia do espetáculo.

title: NoMo Soho Highly Recommended
text: We loved our stay at NoMo Soho. It was an incredibly cute hotel, sweet staff, has all you need, and most importantly, is in the best location in the SOHO area. Near to everything. Cute, clean, and efficient. Loved it and will definitely be staying here again.

title: Great views and an excellent hotel
text: Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel which is a trendy place with very nice friendly staff.  We had asked for a room on and upper floor as the building is a high rise but is situated in and area that has lower traditional buildings. We were on the 17th floor in a junior suite and the views were spectacular from the ceiling to floor windows.   We could see up to midtown and the Empire state Building and downtown to the One World Trade Centre building.   The room was typical of Manhattan and compact but had enough space and was well appointed.  The rooms provide a smart phone for you to use.   It has a nice restaurant and a garden beyond.   It is a superb hotel set just away from the buzz of the city in Soho and right next to Little Italy and China town.  Recommended we will use it again.

title: Buenas vistas
text:
Situado como su nombre indica en el SoHo neoyorquino, un poco alejado de la zona más turística... hace difícil encontrar ese ambiente que te apetece respirar para cenar , etc.
Desde sus ventanas se ve una vista magnífica del puente de Brooklyn, pero desde la ventana del lavabo😬.
No se os ocurra desayunar en el hotel, es carísimo: unos 30 euros por cabeza por un plato de yogur con frutos rojos.

title: Kendo Brand
text:
Beautiful Hotel and phenomenal service. The rooms were comfortably contemporary and absolutely stunning. I slept like a baby all three nights. We enjoyed the bar and wine list.
I'm looking forward to my next visit.

title: My hotel in New York city!
text: I come twice a year in New York and I always stay at The Nomo SOHO hotel. The hotel is supercool with a strategic position in Soho, close to the shops and to the metro station. The room are nice and clean and the staff is very friendly. Very good value for money.

title: Fausse bonne idée
text:
L’hotel est idéalement placé au coeur de Soho et permet d’être à proximité de tout mais c est bien le seul avantage qu il est. 
Le service est déplorable, le personnel n’a clairement pas envie de travailler et de veiller au confort de ses clients (sauf les femmes de ménage dont on ne peut rien trouver à redire). Les chambres sont minuscules et les murs en papier. Impossible de ne pas savoir qu un autre client se trouve dans le couloir ou la chambre d’à côté et par conséquent impossible qu on ne vous entende pas non plus. 
Quand on rapporte tout les problèmes qu’on a rencontré (le réceptionniste qui nous donne une chambre déjà occupée, un cafard dans la chambre ou le personnel qui crie dans les couloirs) ils ne s en excusent même pas et vous font comprendre que vous les embêter plus qu autre chose. 
Bilan: très bien placé mais impossible d y séjourner quand on veut dormir paisiblement et qualité du service 0. 

The hotel is ideally placed in the heart of Soho and allows you to be close to everything but that is the only advantage.
The service is deplorable, the staff clearly do not want to work and ensure the comfort of its customers (except the cleaning staff which can not be faulted). The rooms are tiny and the walls are paper. It's impossible not to know that another customer is in the hallway or the room next door and therefore impossible to hear you either.
When we report all the problems we encountered (the receptionist who gives us an already occupied room, a cockroach in the room or the staff who screams in the corridors) they do not even apologize and make you understand that you annoy them more than anything else.
Results: very well placed but impossible to stay when you want to sleep peacefully and quality of service 0.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: Really great hotel in a prime spot in SoHo. Nice restaurant and fun bar scene. The staff was friendly but often seemed overwhelmed. A few mistakes with our stay, but nothing major.Unique rooms, ok room service options, comfortable bed. Rooms are a bit loud, but they make up for it in style.

title: Fabulous location great few days in NYC
text:
It’s a lovely trendy and luxurious hotel, lobby is fun-filled with modern art. It is in a great location with lots of great restaurants in Chinatown and Little Italy so perfect for grabbing some breakfast The hotel staff were very efficient and friendly. Hotel is situated in the middle of Soho with Canal Street subway nearby so ideal for getting to visit areas of New York.

Rooms are very small but comfortable with nice large windows. The bed very comfortable and very elegant hotel, always nice to go back and relax after a day exploring the city. The toiletries were gorgeous Molten Brown and were refreshed with a new set every day. The only thing missing was a shower cap. There is a safe in the room but you have be to 6ft tall to reach it. The room had air conditioning but again the control was very high up. 

Complimentary coffee in the lobby in the morning only. Shame that there is not a tea/ coffee machine in the lobby as no tea/coffee facilities in room. But we did notice third day that there is a mac’Donalds near-by if you wish to take a coffee back to your room. 

We travelled on train from Boston to New York and stayed here for 3 nights not as close to Penn train station as we thought but not far from Canal Street subway station. Highly recommend this hotel for people that are not on a budget. 

Great things to do while in New York - 
1. Walk Brooklyn Bridge,
2. Get up nice and early to visit the Bull and girl statues- get that photo without the crowds!! 
3. Walk The High Line, 
4. Visit Central park late evening ( 8pm) we even saw raccoons raiding the bins!
5. Visit Central train station really awesome station 
6. For great views we went to Top of The Rock as you get to see The Empire Statue building 
7. Stand on the Red Stairs in Times Square and soak up the atmosphere and watch the sunset
8. Get to see Statue of Liberty using the Staten Island Ferry 
9. Visit the 9/11 memorial

title: "No More" Nomo Soho
text: We travel to New York at least once a year and this has got to be the worst place we chose!  Location is great but the property is totally over-rated.Just the 2 of us, so we booked a king suite for comfort....we were shocked to see how tiny and cramped it was...no ensuite...the bathroom is near the front door and the vanity is not in the bathroom, it's out in the living area/next to the front door!!  They have no kettle or coffee machine in the room and there is no room service after 11pm so there is no way of getting even a cup of coffee after 11pm, let alone a snack.  We had a late start today and went down for a late breakfast but we were told that they do not have an all day dining/breakfast menu, so we were forced to have lunch which was not worth the effort or the wait.  The weather was really bad this morning, thundershowers etc and there was no umbrella in the room so we asked the reception desk if we could borrow one.  We were told that they ran out of umbrellas!  It's overpriced for what you get!  I would definitely not recommend this property to anyone.

title: NOMO SOHO great stay for family of 5!
text: NOMO SOHO was lovely- the valet even found a parking spot for us on the street for free. We were traveling with three children, and a small suite was perfect for us- and reasonable for a very safe, nice, and new hotel with 2 full bathrooms. Would definitely recommend and stay there again!

title: NoMo is no more
text: This is the third and last time I stay at NoMo. I stayed in a suite on the 22nd floor. The suite cost me over $1100 for 3nights. Scratches and scuffs everywhere. Couch was replaced with smaller uncomfortable one. No window covering in the shower and toilet area. I arrived early and was told they would call me when the room was available - they did not call. The noise level from main floor party was loud after 11:30 pm. Stay was overall a bust. I would not stay there again.

title: LOCATION AND MODERN LOOK - TWO PROBLEMS
text:
Location of this hotel is just perfect if you like Soho.

The lobby is very nice, it has a restaurant/bar outdoors that is located at the entrance. VERY NICE.

The elevators work very well.

The rooms are small but very well decorated. Beds are great! Pillows are VERY BAD. There are feather pillows, which are very very very thins, very uncomfortable. I asked four times if they have different kind of pillows, they said yes, we have FOAM pillows. But the four times they brought me the same feather pillows.

This hotel has two serious problems that can easily be solved:

1- Pressure of the water in shower. For me, is a HUGE problem. The pressure of the water was really really poor. 

2- The quality service of the front desk/reception employees. They seem to be doing you a favor when you talk to them. I asked in one day three times for a package that I sent from Amazon, and nobody ever answered my concern. They never smiled, they were never helpful with me.

The room service and housekeeping work VERY WELL, as well as the housekeeping... The room was very clean everyday.

The gym is 5 out of 10.

title: Bellissimo hotel in eccellente posizione
text: Hotel molto bello, molto di design, eccellente posizione in Soho. Prezzi da New York. Eccellente vista dalla mia camera (le camere come sempre a NY sono piccole). Abbiamo anche cenato, bene, ma un pò caro.

title: Excellent Value
text: I stay at the NOMO on all of my trips to NY. Great location, friendly staff, clean, quiet. A stunning entrance from Crosby street. I have not tried it yet but I hear the food and the bar are quite good as well. Not sure what more you could expect in a hotel stay

title: No-Mo Just So-So
text: SECOND stay here (first was a few years back) ... lobby is fun-filled with mod art ... also LOVE decor in halls & room ... room also very mod ... and very small ... but expected that (as I said, second stay)!! BUT what they lack in size, could have been made up in room amenities ... like robes ... there were NO robes ... which right away screamed NOT a very upscale hotel (don’t all mid to high end hotels have robes?!) ... and the soap was only a little larger than a quarter and the shampoo, conditioner and body wash came in matching sizes (very nice quality, just too small for two people) ... and no other extras ... like shower caps, etc ... not even a clock on the night stand??  The one weird thing they did have was the free use of a no-name-brand mobile phone (but these days doesn’t everyone own their own mobile phone?)!! AND the NOT so sweet icing on the cake, the metal desk had smudges all over it ... AND the metal night stand had something little crusted on it ... I would have called the front desk .., but we checked in AFTER 11 PM ... and wanted to get to bed ... so it took one second to wipe clean the desk with a washcloth ... and scrape ‘whatever it was’ off the nightstand hope this was an oversight ... and not their standard ... as I said, it was easy enough to wipe clean (a little harder to hide dirt on metal furniture) ... AND the rest of the room was beyond meticulous!! Anyway, won’t stay here again ... prefer to be pampered with a robe ... not a mobile phone!!

title: Best hotel in Manhattan
text: You're simply the greatest hotel in New York. I'm working towards building a building at Hudson Yards and have to travel there often. I stayed before and loved it so I returned. They were nice enough to upgrade me to a suite and it was absolutely heaven!

title: Love the hotel
text: I have been to NYC multiple times, and this is definitely my favorite hotel.  It is in a great location, easy access to the subway, shops and restaurants.  Love the decor, the bathroom is spacious and clean.

title: Fun weekend in NYC
text: Thank you. Great location. Excellent hotel. The cappuccino at the restaurant was the best I ever had.  Quiet and quaint in a lively location. The room had so.e cigarette burns on the carpet however they comped us for breakfast which was kind.

title: Cozy
text: Great location. Cozy and clean, but very small rooms. The hotel is very modern and there is a great bar and restaurant downstairs. The only downside is that we requested a room with a single bed, which we assumed would be a king but turned out to be a queen. In most hotels that I’ve stayed in with a single bed, it’s always been a king size. Apart from that, no complaints. Staff was friendly and attentive as well.

title: Beautiful Hotel + Location
text:
I've stayed at Nomo Soho twice now and have had great experiences both times! 

Everything about this hotel is unique and The rooms are extremely unique too and I love all of the blue colors. The view from my room during both of my stays has been absolutely stunning. 

The restaurant at the hotel is great as well. I always felt the staff helped with any of my concerns although I had few of them. 

Will definitely be returning.

title: Worst receptionist and cockroach in the room
text: We had to wait for hours to get our room. A receptionist was very rude and disrespectful. We found a cockroach in the room, it was very disgusting. Be aware, we were even staying in the king suite, it was unacceptable.

title: New York 'my love'
text:
That was our second time in New York. We love this State. We stayed at Nomo Soho for 3 nights. The service was very good. The second day we had dinner at the restaurant . The food was amazing and the service at the same level. 
The only negative was the prices

title: Torn on how to write this review
text: I have had a few days to think about how I wanted to write this review.  Let me first say, I have stayed at this hotel numerous times before and have loved it.  My company also stays here a ton, we are torn to go back.  Familiar faces like Allen and Julian are always welcoming you back, and being helpful with any situation.  Jasmin, Israel and Steve show support and are reliable in any situation and are pleasant to deal with, at the front desk. It is people like this and the location that makes me love staying here.  Unfortunately, there was a situation that came up and we had to deal with Fady, the manager on duty.  I have never met someone so rude in the service industry.  The lack of communication, the contradictions, and outright cockiness he had with me and a coworker was unbelievable. We had to reach out after hours, since nothing was communicated before he left, and the way he handled it was outrageous.  He would not let my coworker (who is seriously the sweetest person) get a word in, acted completely defensive, and cut her off several time.  I could not believe someone with that title, or anyone, would be so rude to a customer.  I have never been so frustrated dealing with someone.  He speaks without thinking, defensively contradicts stories and later apologizes.  It was too late, his true emotions had shown.  This is why I was torn to write a review about this hotel.  If you don't have any issues, this place is great.  If you do, good luck!

title: Best hotel in Soho
text:
I really enjoyed everything about this hotel
Cleanliness, location, quiet, best smelling hotel ever!
Friendly staff, atmosphere.... I will return and I highly recommend this hotel.
Great for families, couples, business....   comfortable all around.

title: Nice but poor service..
text:
Very nice location in center Soho but terrible services in such a nice modern hotel.
une très faible qualité de service où il ne faut pas demandé grand-chose par exemple un simple café avant 6h30, c'est impossible.

title: Great accommodations with perfect SoHo location
text:
The NoHo Hotel offered clean, modern looking, well appointed looking rooms in SoHo. 
Although the restaurant offered all meals we only went for their breakfast. We were served up our coffee with a smile right away while we browsed through the menu.  The food would suit both people with savory and sweet taste buds. I had the French toast while my husband enjoyed a healthier choice of fruit and yogurt. Both breakfasts were done perfectly. 
Having a Hotel that is reasonable and nice in the area where we were going to be most of the long weekend was especially useful to myself as I have a bad back. 
The hotel staff were not only efficient they were friendly too. We had come back to NY after living in the area for a number of years. Having friendly staff in all areas of the Hotel is key to giving people a positive experience, and that is exactly what we had. 
We will definitely be returning to the NoHo when we return to NY again.

title: Slightly quirky, but good
text: Check in was poor - staff seemed disinterested and happier to chat with each other and play on their phones.  We upgraded the room and it was excellent - panoramic views on 2 sides.  We had breakfast in the hotel on 1 morning and although very expensive ($70) it was excellent - other mornings we walked and breakfasted in Little Italy which was also very good.  Hotel location is OK - you will need to use the subway but it is only a 5 minute walk.  Id say the service levels on the front desk need to step up significantly - check out was also very average and the staff had no interest again in us.

title: Not SAFE
