text: Balcony DOOR did NOT Lock asked for TWO days to have Fixed NEVER happened, offered me breakfast [one day] to appease me lol [on a $1500 a Night room] Room not SAFE for Kids or for sound sleep worried about door NOT locked, told no other rooms to move me into ...

title: tappa fissa
text: Hotel in posizione centralissima, elegante e piacevole. non appena riesco a tornare a New York ci torno sempre molto volentieri. sicuramente uno dei migliori in zona , molto disponibile il personale e visuale dalla camera unica.

title: Can't imagine staying anyhere else!
text: I booked a last minute stay at NOMO and was pleasantly surprised by the overall experience. Beautiful clean room with fantastic views of NYC thanks to 2 floor to ceiling windows. Clean, quiet, comfortable, large bathroom.

title: Perfect SOHO location
text: The NOMOSOHO was a really fun hotel. Walking distance to Little Italy, Chinatown and the financial district. Plenty of on street parking during weekends. Incredible sunset views. I will be staying there again. The breakfast was expensive but excellent.

title: Amazing
text: An absolute amazing experience. By far one of the best trips. The hotel was beautiful and everyone was super friendly ! We stayed in the NoMo Balcony Suite and I highly recommend it! The views from the terrace are incredible! Can't wait to go back!

title: Clean and comfortable.
text: Very nice hotel! Comfortable bed. Clean room and shower. Air con worked well and not too noisy. Room service good (if not a bit early, but door sign available) Great room on 19th floor with 180 degree open view... a real treat. Lack of tea/coffee making facilities was a downside for me, especially as they had no bog-standard breakfast tea at the bar/restaurant either. Great location. Very pretty entrance...a few model shoots went on during stay, and  a lot of passer-by selfies! Outside seating area a great spot for people watching! Attentive entrance greeters. Didn't eat here so can't comment on food. Looked good though. Very comfortable stay (4 nights)

title: Problem with booking, (partially) solved once there
text: My experience with this hotel didn't start very well as there was a problem with the reservation done on Booking and the room wasn't enough for our family. But the staff allowed us to book another room, but at our expense (and it isn't exactly cheap). This was the only flaw, probably a Booking.com one, thereby the 4 stars and not 5. But the hotel is beautiful, big rooms and a lot of light through the big windows. Plus in our case we had an incredible view over the city, and the neighborhood was beautiful from that height (I believe it was something like 40^ floor). The toilet were big and practical too, but these are all things one should hope in a 4 stars hotel. I didn't try the restaurant, but there was a good vibe in that place.

title: Very nice Hotel
text: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in July with my husband and 2 other friends, lovely hotel with outstanding service. Would have wanted to have coffee and tea in my room ( you just get free coffee between 7 and 10 in the morning in the bar area)

title: Great hotel great location
text: Stayed here for my husbands birthday loved every minute of our stay.Lovely chic hotel in the middle of soho,fab location,great atmosphere. Room was very clean staff very friendly and helpful , can’t wait to visit again😀

title: I was, I am, I will be back
text:
The size of the standard room was fine, the hotel was quiet if you are not on lafayette street, breakfast was very fine (no buffet), design nice.... 
I came already once and came back and would be back again.
Soho is a great place and all the subways are going to canal street very close by so easy to go uptown for work.

title: Extremely Disappointing - Priorities all wrong
text:
I wasn't impressed with the rooms.  They were small (questionable decor), a tiny sink in the actual bedroom, no drawers or shelves for clothes.

One evening there was a terrible drunk in the bar who was making inappropriate comments to a number of hotel guests including myself.  The staff continued to serve him and allowed him to stay when it was clear that guests felt uncomfortable.

The hotel has a strong floral perfume like smell to all communal areas and bars and restaurants which made me feel physically sick.

Overall I felt that the staff were inexperienced, unprofessional, and quite frankly, not bothered.

I would actively discourage anyone from staying here.

title: NoMo
text: Loved it.  The view from the high floor corner room was great.  Great value.  I also recommend the West Village food tour.  The guide was hilarious and the food was delicious.  I need twenty more characters before I can post this review.

title: A bit pricy, but the view is amazing
text:
Conveniently located in SE corner of Soho, this hotel has an amazing view and pretty nice rooms.
The hotel price is in line with the hotel of the same quality in the area, but it has a view that none of them can give you. You will never turn on the TV, you will always look at outside the window, there is the best show!

title: Good location, bad service
text:
In the middle of Soho. But very small rooms. Upgrade to bigger ones unable to make as staff is not able to overview bookings. Plus they want a 60 dollar „tip“ to confirm a higher floor. 
No security, everybody can enter Hotel an room elevator at all times. 
Bar closes early at 11 pm, but you get literally thrown out or not let in by 10.45. 
Final bill was 160 dollars overpriced (as on booking.com contract), took me 45 Minute to get it corrected. 
Maybe a hotel manager should take his work serious and train staff.

title: Fabulous experience
text:
very pleased! a very lovely place. Loved the fragrance. We were upgraded and the room was amazing. They gave us the PH with magnificent views.

Great bathroom products. Very helpful staff. Cool milieu. A+

title: Splendido... nient’altro
text:
Gentilezza fa da padrona in questo splendido hotel a 5 stelle.
Ci hanno dato la stanza al 23* piano con vista sulla city.
Pulizia perfetta, stanze con panorama pazzesco visto che due lati su 4 sono di vetro.
Unico hotel in America a darti il cellulare gratis .... che ti permette di non avere problemi durante la tua vacanza.
Consigliato.. anzi ritornerò li.

title: Good comfort and location
text:
Overall good stay but TV wasn't working, fitness room was dark... some improvements to be done
When arriving I felt that I needed to find my bedroom on my own, the reception was welcoming but not really personalized

title: Super Hotel chic et branché
text:
Super Hôtel chic et branché
très bien placé par rapport au métro
Super vue des chambres (j'ai eu de la chance d'^tre au 20ème étage)
Chambres un peu petite mais très confortable
J'ai rarement aussi bien dormi dans un hotel
clientèle jeune chic et branchée

title: Great location
text: Stayed for a week and found the hotel to be very comfortable and conveniently located. The restaurant was a little noisy at times but the food was delicious and we were well looked after. The view from our room on level 23 was spectacular for July 4 fireworks.

title: Trendy Beutiful Hotel!
text: This hotel was absolutely gorgeous.  From the entry way of vine covered archways and topiaries- it was a breath of fresh air with greenery!  PLUS it LITERALLY was a breath of fresh air- the hotel lobby smelled gorgeous! The rooms are smaller - but that is expected- but gorgeous! Bar area is awesome - outside feel with a greenhouse type open windows everywhere!  I would definitely come back.  also - quaint French café ,Toloache, across the street is a must!  Must try! Close to shops!

title: The VIEWS! Will return.
text:
Fun boutique hotel in perfect location to explore NYC. Rooms are well appointed, high floors with absolutely AMAZING views that will make you feel part of the big city, very highly recommended.
Bathrooms are good, water pressure excellent. Cleaning service very good.
Food is very tasty and room service managed to deliver dinner within the promised 30 minutes wait, despite a very busy and full hotel.
Front desk Staff, more hit and miss, some very efficient and friendly, welcoming, others totally amateur and uninterested. A shame.
Andrew, at the front desk management makes the NOMO Soho customer service proud and delivers, Well done Andrew, make sure other team members learn from your impeccable manners and service, A truly welcoming New York host.
Will return with the family as the overall experience was very good.

title: Excelente ubicación, estancia agridulce
text:
Lo mejor del NOMO es su ubicación. En pleno Soho, es un lugar tranquilo y con estilo, con cómodas y espaciosas habitaciones.

Hasta aquí lo bueno. Quitando a Israel en el frontdesk y a algunos chicos botones, el trato con el personal es distabte y frío con el cliente. Tuve un problema con el aire acondicionado de mi habitación y al intentar explicarlo, ni me dejaron acabar. Me enviaron al "engineer" y lo hicieron tan bien que a la 5a noche solicité otra habitación porque la mía era insoportable.

Mención aparte el personal del restaurante: falto de simpatía, seco y lento. Uno de los días tardamos en desayunar 1h 30' de lo que tardaron en servir.

Si dan calidez a la atención, será un hotel perfecto. Si no, dependerá de la suerte de quién te atienda. Una lástima, no creo que me alojara por mi cuenta allí después de mi experiencia.

title: VERY COOL
text:
Super 5 stelle per questo hotel che si trova a Soho, uno dei quartieri più belli. L’ hotel é molto pulito, personale disponibile. La metro è vicina ed è un quartiere dove si può fare di tutto....
Ci tornerò presto ❤️

title: Quaint boutique hotel
text: From the entrance to the lobby to the rooms, this hotel surprised you every step of the way. This is my favorite New York find. The rooms have windows that cover the length of the room. We had a beautiful view of the water and skyline from our floor. Watching the sunset from our bed was breathtaking. Additionally, the room decor is stunning.

title: Not worth the money
text: The room  was filthy when we moved the chairs in the living area, it was disgusting, the couch in living area was brokenThe door going out to balcony was broken. Air conditioner in room was very loud could not sleep. VERY DISAPPOINTING

title: Fabulous stay in Crosby Suite at NOMO SOHO
text:
I was traveling with my 25 yo daughter and my 22 yo son and his girlfriend.  I decided to have us all share the Crosby Suite because it had two beds AND two bathrooms and cheaper than booking two separate rooms.  We were very happy with our room!  They are a bit small, but that is typical for NYC.  Basically the Crosby Suite is just two rooms put together - but the second room has a couch that pulls out into a bed - it is definitely not a queen size, and maybe even a bit smaller than a full - so probably best for kids, but son and gf are both smaller and they were fine with it.  My daughter and I had a Queen bed in the other room.  Each room had its own closet.  The showers are a bit larger than a typical small hotel room, and the sink was outside of the bathroom so someone could easily get ready while someone else is in the shower.
We found the service to be excellent, particularly the guy at the front desk who helped us checkin after a red-eye flight and then taking the AirTrain/subway from JFK - it was nice to have a helpful and happy front desk person (wish I could remember his name - I think it was Isaiah or Israel).  Also, we arrived about 9am and our room was ready for us to check into which was very appreciated.
The restaurant is in a cool space covered like a sunroom and we had good service for drinks and breakfast one morning.  
Bellman was particularly helpful when we had him store our luggage after checking out, but then had to keep coming back to add something or take something away.  He was extremely patient with us.
Excellent location - we have stayed in 2-3 different hotels in Soho over the years, and I think this had the best location near a lot of subway stops.

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text: We stayed two nights at the Nomo and loved every minute! Upon arrival at 9am, our room happened to be ready and we stepped into a very beautiful, NYC-style space! Although small (they are all small in NYC), it was very functional and we had a view of the Empire State Building in our bathroom! The location is ideal - two short blocks to the closest subway (Canal St.), shops/restaurants right outside your doorstep, the service was excellent! Can't wait to come back!

title: Great Soho Hotel
text: The regular room is too small. Thus, two people with two big bags and two small bags will not have space in the room. also the light in the room coming out from the window during the early morning is huge.

title: Amazing Place
text: My now fiance had our best meal in NYC at the NoMo Kitchen when we were first dating. We got engaged this weekend and I booked a room at NoMo and also made a request to the Kitchen for the same meal we had on our first date since the menu changed. They weren't able to get the exact meal but brought us our favorite dessert which wasn't on the new menu and didn't even charge us for it. Also the new meal we had was amazing. We had a complimentary bottle of champagne as well and we were upgraded to a suite with an amazing view. They went above and beyond what I expected. I would definitely recommend staying/eating here. The whole place also smells really nice. Great Job NoMo.

title: Fantastico Hotel!!!
text:
Sono appena tornata da una vacanza di un settimana a NY dove ho alloggiato con la mia famiglia al NoMo Soho.
Hotel stupendo! 
Avevamo una camera al PH1 - 25° piano , con terrazzo con vista su tutta Manhattan .
Hotel molto pulito , camera spaziosa con zona giorno separata con ampio divano letto per mio figlio. 
Bagno stupendo, ampio con doccia con vetrata con vista sulla città.
Lo consiglio anche perché è situato in uno dei quartieri più belli di New York.
Molto deludente e soprattutto costosa la colazione .
Meglio uscire perché nei dintorni ci sono molti backery dove poter prendere cappuccino e croissant.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Nomo SoHo Hotel is a very nice hotel in SoHo, New York. Very good location, very clean rooms and friendly staff. It’s ideal to stay in this very nice hotel to be in the middle of everything in the city.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: Nomo Soho is a really luxurious hotel in an amazing neighborhood. The hotel has a great bar and restaurant downstairs and the rooms are all incredibly well designed and classy. The bed is super comfortable and the hotel itself is very elegant. I would highly recommend this hotel to people that aren't on a budget.

title: No Mo’ Nomo
text:
Andy Warhol who defined NY hip half a century ago remains the presiding saint of this elegantly designed but distractedly staffed hotel. 

The hotel has style and the rooms are pretty if also pretty small. The view we had was brilliant NY skyline. The entry way to hotel under a giant trellis was gorgeous and brings a smile. Our room was sparkling clean with excellent housekeeping. That said- we were happy to be leaving after two days.

Our hotel bill contained a room service charge although we did not have any room service. Odd. The charge was removed immediately when we questioned it. 

We booked through hotel.com which is apparently the same as Expedia. Our confirmation said “amount to pay at hotel in the local currency” and gave a price and then said “total to be charged by hotel” and gave the same price. But that’s not the actual amount the hotel charged. In addition to various taxes (ok) 
it charges an amenity fee of some $27.50 per night for the gym, basic internet, and the cucumber infused water in the lobby. According to the manager this is disclosed somewhere on its website and on hotel.com info. But it is inconsistent with the statement on the confirmation “total to be charged by hotel.” 

The manager simply ignored me when I pointed this language out and it’s plain meaning. He said  “this is not the confirmation statement” because I had cut and pasted it into a word document. He repeated that the fee was disclosed somewhere and he’d investigate where and get back to me. In short, he was really more interested in proving that the hotel had the right to charge me the extra fee rather than in the fact that my confirmation had given me misleading information on the “total to be charged by hotel” which did not include the extra “amenity” fees.

Fine. Disclosed elsewhere or not, I found true  statements on the confirmation to be misleading. And I now find so have many other guests who have similarly surprised by this fee.

So if price matters to you, call the hotel and ask for the total fee for all charges for all purposes whatsoever and then hopefully you will get an accurate all in price.

As for the affiliated restaurant, we had one dinner there. The vibe was great, the chef is excellent and the food elegant. 

But: this morning we sat down at 9am at a time when things were not especially busy and were completely totally 100% ignored for 15 minutes by the staff until we walked out. Not so much as a glass of water let alone the opportunity to order. Service was not poor - we were treated as non persons. I told the greeter who had seated us 20 minutes before. She asked me where we were seated. Since she had been the one who selected the spot and seated us, this was not the response I expected.

We went to a nearby old fashioned diner on Grand Street and had a great experience with waiters who paid attention to us.

For us, no mo’ Nomo. I guess we weren’t hip enough. Back to AirBnB where we found a gorgeous room in midtown with many more amenities and a host who cares about her guests at a fully disclosed price.

title: Horrible night managers
text: Arrived 1am off of a long flight fro SFO.  Wanted a good night’s sleep so I called ahead this afternoon to request a quiet room.  Arrived to receive a room on the second lowest floor, facing the street and next to not just the elevator but three service rooms.  Was reared extremely rudely by Owen the manager, and Chris at the night desk.  Dirty and tired hotel, cheap beds.  Do yourself a favor and run don’t walk the other way.

title: No roof top☹️
text:
Nice hotel nice location NO roof top is a bummer especially being I was told there was one!!!! 
Location is good for soho, little Italy and. China town...nice size room with the queen suite...
Pricey but nice! Views from room was beautiful!

title: Make sure you are cool
text: The bartenders were more interested in talking to their friends and providing theatrics than serving patrons. It appears you need to be accepted into their high-society prior to arrival if you want to have a drink? Not sure if there is an application process, or they just know cool when they see it. Another recommendation would be to over tip, even if you do not get served. I know this because after another couple at the bar left the bartender proceeded to tell us about the terrible tip they left.  Classy.

title: Amazing hotel in Soho
text: the hotel is new, has a great location, beautiful views. Is very modern and well decorated. I stayed in the 19th floor. the room and the bathroom were perfectly clean and nice. the staff was very friendly and helpfull. the hotel is close to the subway station, and there are many nice shops in the area as well

title: Absolute favorite hotel in NYC!
text: My favorite hotel in NYC. Excellent and friendly staff, amazing location in soho, great room with a comfortable bed! Everyone made me feel very welcome and i was completely satisfied with my stay. Loved the Molton Brown bathroom products!! I definitely recommend it this hotel.

title: A month at the nomo
text:
Best housekeeping service ever!  Appreciated this as we were there for a month. Rooms are beautiful and clean and food climate control. Awesome location. 
Brunch at restaurant was a let down - wouldn’t go back to it

title: Awesome location, great staff!
text: Can't beat this location for shopping and dining around Soho, Little Italy, Chinatown, NoLiTa etc. Close to several subway lines too. The staff were all very welcoming and helpful.  Cameron at the concierge desk went out of his way to help us with a last minute dinner reservation, even though he had just gone off duty.  The room was quiet and clean, and very comfortable.  We went for a girls get-away and booked the Crosby suite with one bedroom and separate sitting area with sofa bed, which was also very comfortable.

title: Cool Hotel
text: Loving the hotel, found a free handy smart phone in my room. Was amazing, free calls outside the hotel and cool tips. Great restaurant also, cool vibe, service was top. Can't wait to come back soon!!!

title: Weekend in NY
text: Very good location and service, very clean and good value for money. However, very surprised that water was not complimentary, never seen a hotel that charged for water - given the size of NY we walked a lot and needed water. Concierge doesn't work on weekends which is very unusual - so the doorman helped us out with recommendations.

title: Great SoHo Experience!
text: Great hotel in SoHo, chic vibe, great staff, awesome location. Right in the heart of SoHo and everything you need within a few minutes walk. Rooms are bright, clean, and spacious. Ask for a high-level for great views. Restaurant downstairs is great for dinner or just drinks.

title: Hotel bien situé
text: Tres bonne situation dans manhattan. Personnel assez incompétent. Chambre petite mais tres confortable. Douche atypique avec grande baie vitré sur rue sans rideau!!. Petit déjeuner moyen. Rapport qualité prix moyen. Hotel a la mode et pas classique.

title: Great Location
text: Stayed there for 2 weeks and LOVED IT. Excellent property...rooms a tad small but all else perfect. Restaurant was top shelf - Staff wonderful and location suited us. Walked to everything including Time Square, Statue of Liberty etc etc and at Night, a safe walk to plenty of quality Restaurants.

title: absolutely beautiful
text: beautiful hotel, friendly staff, close to shopping and great restaurants. the nomo kitchen was delicious but make sure it make rezo's before arriving for brunch. you definitely feel like your in the heart of New York with the locals. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

title: No Improvement
text:
This is my second time staying here so it can't be all that bad. But to be fair, I chose it for it's location, which is great for me as I like the vibe in Soho, Nolita and China Town. It's also very close to a couple of Metro stations.

Bad points: (1) badly designed shower which results in the bathroom floor being flooded unless you don't mind closing the door and stepping into the shower before turning the water on. If you do that you get a blast of ice cold water on your body for a few seconds!; (2) no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. How hard is it to include a kettle or similar?; and (3) the hotel reception is not on the ground floor so interaction with staff is minimal. They do have staff hanging around the ground floor (sometimes) but I'm not sure what their purpose is because all they ever seemed to do is direct you to the reception!

All in all, if you don't mind the small rooms and impersonal service then this isn't bad.

title: Rooms are tiny
text: Location wise its ok. I feel its not really central if you want to do touristy stuff like central park etc. Food is excellent. Service is also ok. Staff is not very polite and nice. They seem very arrogant. And a standard room is tiny.

title: Re: Jeffrey Urbina
text: I visited Nomo Soho and had the pleasure of meeting Jeffrey Urbina who helped me at front desk/check in. He is beyond amazing. Grrat customer service, such a sweet guy. It was a pleasure staying at Nomo Soho. He made my check in and stay so easy.  There was a bottle of champagne in my room when i got there. He gave me a list of things to do in nyc and the Soho area. I can not explain how nice and helpfull Jeffrey was. I will defiantly be going back to jomo soho only because of the service provided to me by Jeffrey. He gives the hotel 5 stars because of the service he provides. Can’t wait to visit nyc again and will be defianatly staying at Nomo Soho. You guys should visit Jeffrey at Nomo Soho and you will see what i mean. Mever have i had this type service provided to me by someone.

title: Good location if you want to be in trendy Soho
text: This is one of those newish boutique hotels that have sprung up in New York. Like others of the same ilk, it has a unique entrance and for some reason many people come to have their pictures taken there, even if they aren’t guests. The lobby has trendy artwork which in a way reflects the kind of eclectic fashion shops that surround the hotel. The rooms are regular Manhattan size - that is to say only as big as they need to be to contain a king size but very comfortable bed, a cupboard, table, chair etc. no bath but nice walk in shower. Big window with Manhattan view depending which side of the hotel you are on. Staff are friendly and efficient. Very near to many subway stations on Canal Street and lots of eateries everywhere. Close to Little Italy and Chinatown, both very touristy and rather grotty. On the west side high fashion thrives.

title: Excellently situated, but small rooms
text:
The hotel is excellently situated within walking distance of Brooklyn Bridge and many great restaurants. The metro station is also very nearby. 

In terms of the rooms, they are small and clinical, with very overpriced mini bars, but nothing out of the norm for NYC. Rooms were cleaned to a very high standard every day. Had a problem with room service on one day of the trip (took over an hour to arrive), which staff were quick to comp and provide me with a free dish the following evening. 
 
I probably wouldn't stay again as it was a little too clinical for me. There is too much choice elsewhere in the city in the same price range.

title: Most amazing experience!!!!!
text: I had an amazing time during my stay. Everything was perfect. The staff was super friendly and helpful with everything. The location was absolutely incredible. The rooms are gorgeous. I fell in love with this hotel. I can’t wait to be back!

title: Top !
text: Tout était parfait.  Rien a redire.  Plus un surclassement de notre chambre sans l'avoir demandé.  Très propre.  Situation Parfaite.  Métro, China Town, Little Italy.  Je recommande.  Pour un premier voyage a NewYork cela donne envie d'y revenir .

title: Great location
text: A really good base got exploring the city. Wonderful smelling foyer, very arty, trendy, expensive bar but it is the big apple.  The local taxes added an unexpected extra $114 to the bill but rooms lovely and fresh free wifi. And a very popular restaurant

title: Hidden gem
text:
I loved the location, the amenities, and the staff. The restaurant was absolutely dreamy and had a special feel that changed Day to Night. 
I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a “non-chain” experience.

title: Great hotel
text: NOMO SOHO is a great hotel, the room is super clean and fresh, and the beds are comfy. The staff are really friendly and helpful. Besides, the hotel is located in SOHO, which means it's convenient to travel to other places in New York, as well as dining and shopping.

title: Excelente localizacion
text:
Este hotel es muy moderno, la localización es optima y la vista de las habitaciones es muy buena y luminosa. El personal es joven y amable
Soho es un excelente lugar para disfrutar todas las maravillas que ofrece la ciudad de Nueva York

title: Poor Guest relations
text: Not a fan, location was good but other than that nothing was great. Front desk is the rudest I have ever experiences. Not cooperative at all. Not helful at all. Beds were super comfortable and bathroom was clean. Room service could do a better job when I was staying for 10 days!!

title: New York, New York
text:
Il NOMO ti affascina, ti cattura.
Quando guardi le foto pubblicate, ti sembra già di essere in una favola; complice l’ispirazione avuta da “La Bella e La Bestia”.
Le stanze ti danno un senso di relax e freschezza, il blu e il bianco sono state una scelta decisamente ottima. E dopo una giornata frenetica ed estenuante è proprio quello che ci vuole.
Tuttavia, ci sono anche alcuni aspetti migliorabili, come per esempio il lavandino, di dimensioni millimetriche, incassato in un angolino. Dietro al letto avevamo una finestra enorme, dalla quale si sarebbe potuta avere una vista fantastica, ma...le tende non si potevano aprire ☹️.
Per non parlare dei prezzi, davvero alle stelle!
Ultima nota negativa, il ristorante..non andateci! È caro, si mangia poco e non è nemmeno di gran qualità.
Bilancio abbastanza neutro, insomma.
Consiglio: per la colazione, andate da Jubilee su Broadway, non mancheranno sorrisi e parole cordiali ogni mattina!

title: Supposed to be Perfect, but...
text:
We stayed for five nights at The Nomo Soho, I went with my wife to celebrate our anniversary and relax... But the Hotel didn’t want that.

Everyday at 08:00 am the lady’s from the housekeeping was knock hard on the doors and screaming “Housekepping” to every door and we woke up everyday with this loud sound. We put “Do Not Disturb” in our door, but the loudness from knocking on the neighbors wake us up everyday. We tried to the people from the front desk to help us, and he said “they are doing they job” nice answer.

The room it’s real tiny. Just go with two carry on bags and that’s it.

Nobody from the hotel could help us with the luggage. 

We asked room service and they serviced us RAW chicken fingers. 

The restaurant down stairs it’s nice for brunch.

title: Très Années 2000
text: Déco très années 2000 : un peu bling bling, bcp de miroirs, du bleu, ça brille....!  Literie parfaite, propreté impeccable . Au 17eme étage la vue est splendide. Emplacement en plein SoHo. Un peu froid et loin des ambiances lounge-hypster actuellement à la mode !

title: Great location and staff
text: Enjoy this location - there are a wide variety of great restaurants tucked away in corners, fun walkable shopping area with boutiques and larger stores, and a quiet yet hip hotel in Manhattan with a good restaurant. The NOMO SOHO checks all the boxes for me.

title: Great stay in NYC
text: We had a wonderful stay at NoMo for a week. Perfect located for sightseeing. Excellent bar with a sophisticated bar menue. Clean and quiet rooms. The staff is well trained and more than friendly and helpful.

title: Me encanto
text: El hotel esta ubicado en medio del soho, muy bien ambientado, en muy buenas condiciones de mantenimiento, el personal es muy amable y atento, el restaurant muy bueno y muy lindo, el unico problema seria que las habitaciones son un poco pequeñas, y para tener mas espacio habria que subir una categoria y pagar aun mas. Todo me gusto.

title: Great Boutique in heart of Soho
text: One issue with random mini bar charges, had to argue my case at length to reception mngt for $200 even after staying in the hotel for 11 days, that soured my experience a little. But everyone was helpful, friendly and management were generally very accommodating. The rooms are bright and comfortable, even though its a party scene in the lobby and restaurant, the rooms were quiet. Other than that one issue my experience was very positive.

title: Ideal
text:
Fuimos con amigas. La atención del hotel es excelente. Son muy amables y gentiles. Siempre con buen humor y tratando de solucionar. 
Está muy bien ubicado. Excelente! 
Sirven té y café para llevar por la mañana. 
La vista de las habitaciones es hermosa, las camas excelentes, el mobiliario divino. Habitaciones chicas pero normal en New York. 
El restaurante es muy lindo y rico. Solo hicimos brunch. 
No cobran por paquetes recibidos y no tuvimos ningún problema. 
Muy buena experiencia.

title: Wonderful stay at NOMO
text: I just want to thank NOMO for the wonderful surprise upgrade to our room. WOW... what a treat it was to stay in PH1. And the view!!! You made our annual mother daughter trip to NY even more special. We look forward to returning to your very cool hotel next year.

title: A real Downtown experience!
text: I have stayed at the NOMO SOHO for 8 days and just adored it again. The location on Crosby street puts you in the heart of the Soho and the whole vibe and soul of the hotel translate very well the cool chicness with a bohemian touch and the energy of this fantastic district of NYC. Staff is extremely helpful and nice. The restaurant is great as well as food. The whole hotel is decorated with taste being comfortable and very nice to look at everywhere. Loved the breakfast and the gym is pretty decent (just a bit too dark). Standard rooms are a bit small for two people, but you know, it is NY city where that happens often. The bed is huge and comfortable. Bathrooms are very good. There is plenty of light and great views. If you can, do not miss the breathtaking view of Manhattan from the Pent House 2. I will definitely recommend and will be back!

title: Great vibe
text: This hotel in Soho was refreshingly vibrant and stylish. Common spaces and room are nicely designed (though my bathroom is very tiny), and you have nice view from the upper floors. The restaurant has a good menu, however pricing is not justified by what you get and the service tends to be quite slow, both during the breakfast and the meals.

title: Un peu déçu
text: L'hôtel est idéalement placé à Soho. Excentré des zones bruyantes. Stations Spring Street ou Canal Street. Les lignes W N Q vous mènent directement à Times Square. Nous y avons passé un semaine. La décor est très sympa. Les chambres propres décorées des tons bleu et blanc. Elles ne sont pas très grandes (ex 713) mais confortables. Dommage nous étions deux et un seul peignoir de prévu et une seule paire de chaussons. Le restaurant est superbe avec sa verrière. Le moins est le restaurant et le petit déjeuner. C'est vraiment cher et ça n'a rien d'exceptionnel voire bas de gamme: pizza sans rien dessus...et plats sans saveur. Le petit déjeuner à 21$ c'est du vol...On a demandé des simples toasts grillés et bien on nous les a facturés car le menu petit déjeuner prévoit des toasts au Nutella et bananes et pas de simples toasts. Quand ils sont arrivés; deux vulgaires triangles de pain même pas bon. Préférer largement le café Paris Baguette à proximité 273 canal street

title: Tutto molto bello ma...
text: Innanzitutto l’hotel è ubicato in una zona molto tranquilla. Si sale al primo piano e qui si trova il desk di accoglienza: prima della nostra partenza avevamo chiesto un alloggio nei piani alti (prenotato una premium king) tenendo conto del tipo di camera e sapendo che questa camera in particolare poteva essere data tra il 12º è il 24º piano. Detto questo ci è stata data una camera al 14º piano senza la possibilità di poter salire oltre. Arrivati in camera abbiamo notato subito la grande pulizia della stessa con la bellissima doccia in marmo, due poltroncine vicino all’ampia vetrata a fondo camera. Prenotando la premium king c’era anche la possibilità di avere un ampia vetrata sopra posta nella parete del letto per sfruttare umpia veduta sui grattacieli di New York.... c’era in quanto la vetrata era coperta da una tenda oscurante bloccata senza la possibilità di poter farla scorrere (si poteva spostare solo a mano, ammirare il panorama è poi richiuderla). Nessun rumore a finestre chiuse, camera insonorizzata ai massimi livelli, sotto questo punto di vista nulla da obiettare. L’unica vera nota stonata secondo noi è stata il ristorante: non abbiamo usufruito della colazione (20$ a testa) ma del ristorante si e, da italiani, abbiamo mangiato veramente male. Prima di tutto il ristorante è molto bello, grandi lampadari di cristallo al soffitto if una tavolata lunga sotto di esso è vari tavoli da 2 quadrati, un paio tondi da 8-10 persone, bancone fornitissimo ed aria condizionata a palla (a New York aria condizionata a palla dappertutto). Seduti ci accoglie la nostra cameriera portandoci il menu ed una bottiglia di acqua naturale sfusa. Menù scarno con poche cose da poter ordinare: 6 antipasti, 6 piatti di pasta e 6 o 7 secondi (entree). Io decido per un pollo con verdure (c’era scritto che verdure fossero ma non ricordo) mia moglie per una bistecca ai ferri con germogli di soja patate al forno in più da bere una media per me. All’arrivo dei piatti (dopo circa un’ora al freddo e senza nulla da sgranocchiare) sono rimasto basito in quanto il mio piatto consistena in 2 cosce, un’ala e mezza schiena (no petto) di un pollo che se fosse pesato 200gr da vivo era dir tanto, a mia moglie sono arrivati dei bocconcini di carne stracotti (richiesta una cottura media) che erano praticamente chewingum. Totale del conto 96$ con la mancia, quando i giorni prima avevamo cenato in giro egregiamente con 40$. Nel complesso bell’hotel ma non mangiateci, c’è di meglio fuori

title: Excellent!
text: Great location that is away from the tourist attractions and perfect for SOHO shopping and dining.  Stylish decor, large open lobby with a great restaurant.  Cool blue rooms, great showers, perfect for business or just visiting.

title: Really good spot
text:
Quietful place & perfect location.
The price what a little bit expensive for what we get but you're assured to be rested after your stay.
Safe area, lot of cool shops, restaurants and bars around. Perfect to visit Manhattan and Brooklyn.

title: Modern hotel, great service
text: Highly recommended for people who prefer contemporary, modern, urban hotels as opposed to traditional luxury hotels. The staff service was particularly good and the design of the front entry and restaurant areas was very cool.

title: NOMO Soho Rating
text:
Amazing service , friendly staff and a beautiful lobby /garden restaurant .. over all A unique hotel with an amazingly hip vibe!
I would sure go again and recommend to friends..
Loved the blue lighting theme  of the rooms and corridors

title: Stilig hotel med bra beliggenhet! Lite rom.
text:
Dette hotellet er først og frems fancy og har veldig bra beliggenhet.

Vårt rom var kingsize bed, med skyvedør til wc/dusj, med vasken på rommet. Ganske lite, altså. Og rommet var ganske mye mindre fancy enn selve hotellet. 

I 13. etasje hadde vi god utsikt, men det er forskjell på utsikten etter himmelretning. 

Frokostene er ganske små, også til den prisen. Særlig spennende er den heller ikke.

Den eneste som smilte til oss av de ansatte, var hovmesteren ved frokosten og av og til portieren.

Hotellet er ikke mye bedre enn hva man kan vente til prisen man betaler.

title: Séjour réussi
text: Hôtel très bien situé au cœur du quartier qui bouge. proche du métro avec des chambres confortables et calmes. Ambiance jeune et branchée. Personnel sympathique. Une semaine en famille réussie. Un seul bémol une chambre double deluxe un peu petite.

title: Coo Modern feel
text: Decent sized room for NY. Clean tasteful design. A little hidden which is nice away from the hustle & noise. Breakfast prices were decent. Had a little prob with temperature in the room and it was taken care of promptly.

title: Room was fantastic Good 3.5 stars
text: I stayed at the Nomo 5X and completely delighted with this hotel room - super trendy in a super trendy neighborhood but nonetheless great room - the first time checking in was a little troublesome (located on 2nd floor), no help from doorman, but check in staff very good and room was always clean - wifi good and easy to get around all in all i would stay again

title: Good location, bad rooms and evne worse service
text: After eating at the NOMO kitchen and enjoying the public spaces a few times, I decided to give the hotel a try when I needed it during my apartment's renovations. The experience was honestly among the worst at any hotel (including Marriotts, four points sheraton, mid-tier vegas hotels,etc.)  I've had. The location(i.e. a the hotel isn't itself responsible for) is great and convenient, but the rooms are extremely small, poorly decorated, have virtually no amenities to speak of (expensive, rarely stocked mini bar is about it) and the service is genuinely terrible. Room service took at least 45 minutes to bring me a tea, and then forgot a spoon when I specifically asked for it about three times. All of the room service arrives with plastic wrap they don't remove, and the milk for the coffee comes in a dixie cup. Considering its >$350 a night, and the hotel tacks on extra "amenity/resort" charges, they treat you like you spent about $50. I'm glad I live in NYC because it gives me literally no reason to stay here ever again.

title: Amazing view.
text:
What can I say. An amazing hotel, clean modern and fashion orientated.  The best thing is that i was on the 21st Floor with a breath taking view of Manhattan.  

You are near china town and little italy.  

The best hotel in New York!

title: Disappointment
text: Great location but very arrogant staff. The hotel is modern and in good shape, but the rooms are extremely small and their comfort is not sufficient (air con did not work.). Finally it is noisy (easy to hear what people in the next room say).

title: Very thougtfull and welcoming people
text: Very clean and comfortable room. Excellent service. Great location. Atmosphere is ideal for millenium people. pretty expensive though. but the location is really great! Make sure your room is not among the small ones...

title: Overall good in the heart of SoHo
text: The hotel is very beautiful and placed in a great location but we had not been informed about some services and additional costs. Rooms are little but they are very clean. Overall a quite good experience.

title: Lovely hotel Great location
text: We had a wonderful 3 night stay. The hotel is neat and clean, service was great,location was just what we wanted. We felt safe walking around SoHo and sitting outside at night on the deck. Spacious rooms and comfortable beds.

Fire the receptionist! He's unfriendly, unwelcoming, curt and unpleasant.
Please train the housekeeping team to check and see if coffee pods need to be replenished. If they were used that morning, then more pods need to be provided for the next day!

title: Magnifique
text: Nous avons séjourné 4 jours dans cet hôtel, les chambres sont spacieuses, la décoration est soignée et originale, le bar restaurant génial et le personnel vraiment a l'écoute et sympathique. Merci pour tout et pour les découvertes de cocktails ! Implantation dans le quartier idéale.

title: Great Location!
text:
Great location! Entrances to all the major subway lines are only a few blocks away and you’re on the border of Little Italy and Chinatown. Lots to see and great bars/restaurants nearby.

I stayed in a King Suite on the 23rd floor. Beautiful view. Even from the shower stall which boasted a large window in one entire wall overlooking the city. There was no curtain but the front desk assured me that it was one-way glass. I could see out but nobody could see inside. My two room suite was very quiet, comfortable, and immaculate.

They offer free internet access and invite you to upgrade to a higher speed for $10 per day. I had no problem with the speed level of the free version. However, I must ask why this internet access service is unsecured. Every time I logged in, I got a dire warning that my session was “unsecured”. I wish the Nomo Soho management would tighten that up. Why no password security?

Don’t ask for directions to their business center because they don’t have one. This was disappointing but the front desk was able to check me into my flight and printed my boarding pass.

A minor problem with my bill when I checked out. New York City occupancy tax is $2.00 per day. I was surprised to be charged double that rate. When I asked for an explanation, the desk clerk explained that I had stayed in a suite that could have accommodated 4 people Hence the $4.00 per day charge. Not only is this weird logic but also, there was only one king bed in my suite and the couch was NOT a sleeper sofa. Four people in one king bed? I think not. The amount per day was minimal but I feel like they tried to rip me off. Eventually the double charge was removed. 

In spite of these few bumps in the road, I would not hesitate to return to this hotel again and I highly recommend it to anybody who wants to avoid the midtown tourist trap and experience a real New York neighborhood.

title: Say YES to NoMo
text: I took the advice of my travel agent reluctantly and booked my stay here.  Than goodness I did!.  Location, ambiance, vibe...NoMo SoHo has it all!  This is the first time (of many stays) I have stayed somewhere other than the theater district.  I am so glad I ventured outside of my comfort zone!!

title: Pour sa situation
text:
Idéalement placé dans le quartier de Soho à quelques mètres de Canal Street, de Lafayette street et de Broadway
Chambre très propre bénéficiant d'une très belle vue avec lit king size
Douche et toilettes à part
En revanche éviter le petit-déjeuner sans intérêt
Climatisation efficace sans être trop bruyante
Rideau pas assez occultant pour masquer la lumière matinale 
Beaucoup de passage, accueil inexistant, aucune complaisance ni reconnaissance malgré un sejour de plus d'une semaine
Mais bon c'est peut être un peu comme cela se passe dans un endroit branché !!!

title: Great, fun hotel!
text: We had a really good time in NYC and the hotel was in an excellent location, perfect for all sightseeing, restaurants etc. The hotel is fun and modern, staff are very friendly and NoMo kitchen did excellent food and has a good bar and lounge area if you just want to have a drink. The room was spotless and we couldn’t fault the cleanliness. Great hotel and would come back if we returned to NY.
